REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful waterfront park with restaurants and beautiful views of the Singapore skylights!! Very popular place!
I guess you have to do this free activity considering it's a Singapore icon. We did the family pictures from different angles as did the rest of the crowd. Get's pretty crowded on a weekend.
Everything was worth it. Wonderful experience and highly recommend if you want to visit here. If you want to relax don’t forget to come to this place and enjoy it.
Best place to visit in the sunset timing and evening suitable for all ages have places around amazing pictures will have for sure

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. Great place for river cruise and the Business district, Marina Bay Sands and Clarke Quay. Ride costs around 25 dollars. In the e evening you can see the special laser show for free....

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting.., but not a lot of shade
REVIEW_BODY: Not sure if I'd go out of my way to see it. But if you are nearby.. Night time would be better as the skyline is better at night that and you would avoid the full sun.

REVIEW_TITLE: Symbolic of Singapore; visit for an hour and then take a stroll to Marina Bay Sands or Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion (cross of Mermaid and Lion) is a symbol strongly associated with Singapore. This is a good place to get a view of the Marina Bay area - an area built on reclaimed land. With the iconic Fullerton Bay Hotel and CBD (Central Business District) skyscrapers in the background, you can take some great photos for your Facebook account!!

After soaking in the atmosphere for about an hour, you can walk over to Marina Bay Sands and the Gardens by the Bay. It would be a 20 min walk. You could also consider going to the Marina Barrage for a wonderful view of Singapore’s CBD.
Very beautiful skyline n the photos look v nice because of e lightings. Many people gather n e vibes r generally positive. Many instagrammable photos.... just up to ur imagination.
A must see while in Singapore. Lovely walk around and plenty to see. The art in Singapore is truly amazing

Merlion Park is very good place to hang out with friends, family and partner. Merlion is Singapore's symbol and you can enjoy surround with good cafes, Cold bubble tea, fruit juice and coffee by seeing stunning infrastructure.
Very well maintained park with Mermaid Lion stand still to make you easy photo, what else you'd asked for?

The famous Merlion spot in the Singapore. Hardly a 10-15 mins spending spot. However, one can tak e a 25$ boat ride which is for about 40 Mins. The boat ride covers important places around the water body along with well timed audio n video documentary. It's worth a ride.

An amazing attraction that draws thousands of tourists daily. Can be very busy and people tripping over each other to get the best shot. Choose a good weather day if you can. Spectacular views of the bay and Marina Bay Sands hotel.
Great place for pics only if not raining. It pulls crowd so limits photo opportunity time. Great walking place and is very close to Durian- art museum.
My sister and I visited this place because this is the icon of Singapore. Like a must to see. We went there 8:30 in the morning and shocked to see how many people there. It was too crowded
We reached in the afternoon. It's worth the visit being synonym with Singapore. There are lot of photo opportunities. Feel that it will look better in the morning hours because of the Sun position
Lots of tourist here. Quite crowded as this is one of Singapore's iconic place. This place is also nice for a morning walk or a jog or even just for a stroll after all that hawker food 😉
Had been to the park and the beauty of it mesmerizes. Must visit in Singapore with family and friends.

Half-fish and half-lion, the iconic Merlion resides at the Merlion Park waterfront. Merlion's body symbolises Singapore's humble beginnings as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which comes from the same root as the word tasek ('lake' in Malay).

Its head represents Singapore’s original name, Singapura, or ‘lion city’ in Malay.

Today, you can glimpse this legend at Merlion Park. Spouting water from its mouth, the Merlion statue stands tall at 8.6 metres and weighs 70 tonnes. #marinabaysands #MerlionPark #Singapore2019

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth visiting when downtown around the Marina
REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit since it's right across from MBS. Dusk is best time so you can see MBS as sky is turning blue (they call it Blue Hour). Perfect for photos, and you can see many semi-pro photographers getting their cameras set up around this time. The park itself is not much of a park (when you think of green area). It consists of a concrete area around the Merlion at the end of the walking bridge. Would love to see more grass area.
The original Merlion at Promenade is a nice to visit, although not a must sea. The bigger ons on Sentosa is more entertaining ans host a light show at night.

REVIEW_TITLE: Get Best skyline of Singapore here !
REVIEW_BODY: Catch the fireworks during Singapore National day celebration. It is also a pleasant morning or evening walk starting from fullerton hotel, cross the underpass to Clifford pier and towards merlion park.
While here at Singapore....a centrally located hub of ornamental and aesthetic value! Must or rather will visit when going to any of the attractions!

Visited the iconic Merlion park. Situated opposite to the Marina bay, the place has its fair share of visitors through out the day.

There are two Merlion statues, one pewi g water into the bay and the other miniature version directly behind it.

A place with lovely view of the landmarks of Singapore

A must visit place

REVIEW_TITLE: Seeing you off before you say goodbye!
REVIEW_BODY: Panic started to kick in when we heard that the Merlion, Singapore's emblem, will be taken down and will be replaced of something we don't know what. Our visit was timely because we were able to say hello and goodbye to this mighty representation of Singapore. It's true to what most people say, it's majestic, surreal and a lot of people who's trying to take a shower or drink the water from it haha!

REVIEW_TITLE: OK for a stop, watch out for selfie sticks and posers
REVIEW_BODY: OK to walk around, have a look at this singapore icon. Can’t enjoy any quiet time/peace -crowded with selfie stick, people looking for perfect insta shot, and weird posers
Why is everyone standing with the quite small statue and taking selfies? Bit of a downer but a nice walk around the harbour

REVIEW_TITLE: Best Place -A Depiction of Name " Singapore".
REVIEW_BODY: We have been to this place in a taxi from Alexandra Road where we were staying. In the evening there was a lot of rush of joggers, tourists taking pictures here and there. There were cane juice and sweet corn kiosks, tea was also available at nearby hotels. Tea tasted just like Malaysian tea. There were many beautiful and colourful lights were added to enhance its beauty more. We stayed there for attending a live musical concert. It was a nice experience.
Iconic symbol of Singapore. Located near the harbor road it demands a visit once. A good photo point showing your Singapore presence ;-)
Nice place to visit in singapore marina bay area must be visiting in singapore it regarding as landmark in singapore and I visit it at night

Merlion park is located at the heart of Singapore. Place for clicking million photos. Lot of attractions and restaurants near by. Go by 6.00 pm, so that you can take photos with natural lighting and later with night mode.

It is singapore's natonal icon and it is spouting water from its mouth it is located in a beautiful atmosphere we could take many snaps in different angles it is a place to be enjoyed.Of course it is crowded place but it a place surely to be watched for.

A nice open park. Good place to relax after walking around Bay Area for almost 3 kms. Merlion statue has a significant importance for Singapore. There is another one at Sentosa island little bigger than this one. But this one looks better especially during night with lights on. Nice place to hangout with family or friends and take photographs.

A tourist spot that was very crowded. Lovely getting up close to a Singapore icon. Wonderful picture opportunities, plenty of eating places nearby. Also can walk to Fullerton hotel from here. Easy walk from the Esplanade MRT station also.

Travel Diary: Singapore 2019

Merlion Park : Singapore landmark, a major tourist attraction and a super hit picture on almost all the magnets and souvenirs found in Singapore is Merlion Park. It depicts a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish. It’s wide courtyard just like the Manhattan’s courtyard near the river where almost everyone including me get their picture clicked with there hands folded, begging for the water to fall from its wide open mouth on once hand is really a nice place to be when you are in Singapore.

#travelblogger #singapore @travelseewrite @travelandleisure #singaporelove #traveltips #travelphotography #travelbloggers #ilovetravelling #travelaroundtheworld

The Merlion is an iconic national symbol of Singapore and is incredibly beautiful.

The statue has a large amount of cultural and historical significance with the discovery of Singapore and the reason it’s known as the ‘lion city’

Whilst there isn’t a lot to this attraction, it’s definitely worth a visit to take great pictures and to see a part of Singapore’s history. There are also many restaurants to eat around the Merlion and enjoy the marina bay views.

If you go to Singapore, I’d definitely recommend visiting the Merlion as it’s importance to the people of Singapore is similar the Eiffel Tower to the people of France.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must if you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore you need to visit this Merlion. Nice spot to take photos. Not much shadow so better to go early.

REVIEW_TITLE: only for clicking pics with Merlion statue
REVIEW_BODY: This place is actually overated nothing like this on visiting it. This place is not only for clicking pics with merlion statue looks like lion face from where water comes out from the mouth. Suitable only for abt half hr photography. Nothing special about this place

After dinner we went for an evening walk down the Fullerton Road. The lake, waterfront, the fountain and the evening breeze made it an extra ordinary experience. Kids love it. A must visit while in Singapore.

Known as must visit place if you travel to Singapore. This place located near Fullerton hotel. Closest MRT station is Raffles place. You can choose exit G near UOB bulding. Then walk beside the river. Don't forget to capture some picture here.
This tourist attraction is a must-visit site while in Singapore. Perfect for photo ops. You're not in Singapore if you haven't been here.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and the statue in Marina Bay is an Iconic Image of Singapore but that's about it. It's a fun place to get some pictures and selfies there a few bars and restaurants around. It gets crazy busy during the day with many tourists flocking to get pictures. It's the kind of thing you do at least once.

Very time I come to Singapore always go for a visit to the Merlion.
Very busy during the day, filled with tourists and very had to get close to the attraction. A night time visit is less crowded with good night time shots.
Also some good shots of Marina bay sands from across the river
Nothing much else to see in this area though
There is nothing except the merlion statue here. In day it's hot & humid out here,sun will make you sweat a lot. Good for photoshoot. Enjoy

REVIEW_TITLE: very good to see at night
REVIEW_BODY:
if you want to see this park dramatically lit without the crowd and UV rays, visit it a couple of hours after sunset. we appreciated the place better without jostling through the melee just to have a very nice shot of the merlion and the marina bay.

they say you haven't truly been in singapore without taking a posterity shot in this corner of the city. it's free to come here and you can stay without any time limit.

A very picturesque place and popular among tourist. One must try to visit in day time as well as evening time when lights are put on. Singapore's iconic place. Not to be missed.very neat and clean place. Also there is juice stall nearby which serves juices of many fruits.

The Merlion Park is nice during the daytime but spectacular at night. To get here just take a taxi or Grab car to 1, Fullerton and walk down to the waterfront and head left. The Park is actually quite small and there are several restaurants here as well as a Starbucks Coffee. You can also make your way to parts of Singapore River too.

The Merlion has been the most iconic symbol of Singapore for decades, perhaps now taken over by the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. However, it is still extremely popular and in the evening time very crowded with both tourists and locals who come here to wander around the Marina Bay area.

Just beside the Merlion you can join boat rides in the bay and into Singapore River. Also at night time you can get the most spectacular views from Merlion Park of the tall skyscrapers of the financial district and across the Bay towards Marina Bay Sands.

So when visiting the Marina Bay area then Merlion Park is a good place to start.

For those who want to take picture of Singapore Flyer, Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands hotel and of course the Merlion this is your spot. You can take picture all of above with ease and there is no building blocking the way. Location near Fullerton Hotel, you can also take picture of Fullerton Hotel, which was a post office. Very time effective to stand in a place and get all the photo in one time

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view of Marina Bay Sands
REVIEW_BODY: It’s a nice park with many different photo opportunities. The fountain was beautiful. It can be a bit crowded, because the fountain is in a small corner like area.
A good for pictures with Marina bays samds in the background. Currently the Merlin status is covered for renovation and maintenance. There are other materials miniature status to click pictures.

The merlion park is fantastic. the place is fill with tourist. the merlion statue is overlooking the marina bay sands, so it offers some fantastic views. It is a short walk to the floating stadium and the helix bridge. I would recommend coming here near the late afternoon when the weather gets a bit cooler, great place to sit down and have an ice cream and just see the world go by.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Place to visit at Night
REVIEW_BODY: A place to visit at night when you're in Singapore. You haven't been to Singapore when you haven't seen the Merlion. In this area, you can already see the Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Flyer. The Fullerton Hotel is also nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: View from it is all good.
REVIEW_BODY: The view of Skypark Hotel looks amazing u can catch full view but when we went to Merlion park lion was in maintaince for new few weeks it will be so sadly we were not able to get snaps as well felt so much disappointed.
You cannot say you went to singapore without your picture taken at the merlion park. A must see. Thats why eventhougj it was raining hard, we had our picture taken here.

After searching for the Merlion, we found it was under construction and all of its structures covered which could not be seen. There should be some notification that it cannot be viewed. However, the bay is a nice place to take a stroll. There is a boat that you can take across the bay and restaurants along the waterfront.

REVIEW_TITLE: Hidden behind construction materials not able to be seen!
REVIEW_BODY: After searching for the Merlion we found it.....under construction and hidden behind construction walls not able to be seen....:(
Nothing to see here, the Merlion was being repaired. That is it nothing else and it is a small statue , you could easily skip this .
I don't what the big deal about this statue Some of the attraction here get blown out of proportion. Any how the big statute is under renovation, and my feeling weren't hurt much. C U Around

REVIEW_TITLE: Take a photo with this iconic statue...
REVIEW_BODY:
...and combine it with dinner at one of the many restaurants in the area, an evening waterfront stroll along the waterfront, and then an ice cream while you watch the laser light show.
This was the perfect amount of walking, resting and entertainment for our three children—8 yo twins and 10 yo.
Enjoy 😉 nice walking 🚶‍♂️ along are side being in heart of the city. Many attraction around to visit or just having rest in the park

I visited it just 3 days ago (today is April 7th) and it was under construction. From little sight seeing platform next to the Merlion Statue (that was under construction) you could see the beautiful view of the lake and the hotel across. During the night the hotel will have 'light performances'; it will shine all over the city. There is hotels nearby; grab a drink and look over the buildings of Singapore. I liked the show very much (bring your camera) though the fact that it was under renovation was very disappointing. It is a very short visit ranging from 30 minutes - 1 hour.

The reason for renovation is because the statue moved places in Singapore.
We went early in the morning but it was already hot and lot of people mostly tourist like me.Stayed only a couple of minutes,take pictures and went to other places.
Sadly we r not able to see the Merlion as it is under renovation. And we were exited for the water fountains too.. we waited at 8pm.. no show and we waited till 9pm still no show... 😰

Such a Nice Place to Visit,

A must see if you are going to Singapore, you should not forget to put this on your list, i think this is a very must place to visit, its a national symbol and seeing this icon once in a while is so worth it!

Its is famous park and it is a Singapore landmark and major tourist attraction, located near One Fullerton, Singapore, near the Central Business District, The Merlion is a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish.There are two statues in the park. It unique symbol of Singapore you must see it and take some photos.
Sad to say we haven't seen the statue due to renovation. Gladly, we enjoyed the surroundings and the cleanliness of the place.

There is nothing much to do except getting a few selfies for your instagram posts however since it's an iconic landmark in Singapore paying one visit is must. The riverfront where merlion park is situated is beautiful and the view of skyscrapers in the backdrop is mesmerizing besides it's a good spot to meet new people.
Been there many times and still loves the place. Now under renovation till may. Restaurant nearby are awesome

Unfortunately this was all covered over. I had really wanted to see this and we searched for ages wondering how we could miss it, to find it all covered up having repairs done. Was disappointed. Surrounding area is very nice.
This is the 3rd time we visited singapore and out of 3 visits, 2 times where Merlion statue is under renovation. A bit disappointed. But really cant do anything.
Merlion Park in is one of the major tourist attractions in Singapore. This park is located at Raffles place (EW14 &NS26)

REVIEW_TITLE: Best View of city golden area
REVIEW_BODY: Go here for a long walk, do not rush, take time to enjoy the breathtaking view around you. Start from merlion park, go to esplanade, take helix bridge, walk to cashino - amazing experience...

because merlion is visited by millions of tourists, its very tricky to take a decent selfie with this famous singapore landmark. a singaporean local tip is to visit the park very early to avoid the tourist mob or very late when the the statue is on spotlight. have fun doing this selfie chalenge and good luck :)

"If you did not visit this place, you did not go to Singapore." This is the usual line I hear from other people, or read from magazines whenever Singapore will be brought into topic. Now I know the reason behind that line: Because this is what SG is most commonly known; this is its symbol.

Of course, you have to visit this place when you go to Singapore since this is one of your tour/trip's highlight. No entrance fee required. Wear a cap/hat/bandana, sunglass, and put sunblock lotion since Mr. Sunshine or Mr. Rain will unexpectedly say hello once in a while. You're lucky if it is cloudy since it will be good for a perfect photo (base on my opinion).

The only dilemma you will encouter: lots of people/tourists will always be there so have fun posting for a picture.
A statue of a famous sign of Singapore. When there by mrt and walk to the park, enjoy an ice cream on hot weather while walking around and enjoying the view there
The best time is to go at 8 when there aren't too many people and the heat is still bearable. Grab an ice cream cone at one of the local stands and enjoy your walk!

REVIEW_TITLE: Beatiful Park and Magnificent Symbol of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
It'll be a good idea to visit the Merlion Park with a combined package of river cruise. I highly recommend taking the cruise first so you'll get the overall important landmarks along the river.
The park itself was very beautoful with 2 merlion statues at the front and the back (baby merlion).
On a bright sunny day we can have beautiful photo shoots! Great visit!

The park is very clean and no entrance ticket to get here,nice view surrounded the park. The most favorite place visit in singapore and can go by train or taxi,easy to find place. I will come back next month

An iconic tourist spot in Singapore, the Merlion park is located in Fullerton square near the central business district. There is a statue of Merlion, which is a mythical creature having lions head and body of a fish. The statue is a national symbol and spouts water from its mouth. The Merlion park is close by the mouth of Singapore river across the Esplanade bridge. The Raffles place MRT station can be used for accessing this location.
A central attraction in the city, a very photogenic location.

REVIEW_TITLE: You have to take the photo drinking the water
REVIEW_BODY: This iconic symbol of Singapore is right on the waters edge and is spectacular both during the day and at night. Smaller than the one on Sentosa Island, you can position yourself for a photo drinking the water from the Merlions mouth.
This place is cheap and free, so why not go look at a sea lion with water in its mouth! It's such a grand statue to be proud of!!

Merlion is world famous symbol of Singapore. Walking from the bridge to merlion fountain we see marina bay hotel , Singapore theatres, flyer,central bank area and Singapore river all together which looks beautiful. It’s a busy place with lots of tourist taking pictures. Some small cages are around where you can sit back to enjoy the view. Around 30-4o minutes will be enough.

This is one must visit in Singapore, been here a couple of times and every time it gets better. Evening is best time here with all the beautiful lightnings and fountains and lots of live music playing around and so much happiness in one place.
Merlion is the mascot of Singapore, in this place lot of tourists come to take pics, some cafés around. It's okay for a quick stop, but it is a little bit underwhelming. Just a fountain at the end.

A photo here really proves setting your foot at SG!

The view from Merlion is so mesmerizing. However, due to lots of people taking photos every now and then, you really need to have fast feet to get through and capture quick instagrammable photo. Two thumbs up!
It's a must-see national icon of Singapore. Beautiful at day time or night with the Esplanade, Makansutra and Marina Bay not too far by foot. You visit Singapore without visiting this landmark
Very lovely place for outing. Even solo visit would make you feel so enjoyful. Especially world class coconut ice cream i found there in some kiosk.

REVIEW_TITLE: Unusual amount of continuous crowd size
REVIEW_BODY: Because the Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore and befitting it is now located in front of the Fullerton Hotel looking across the waters toward Marina Bay Sands, it attracts a continuous crowd seeking to take selfies and admit-tingly, some most photogenic proof of "I was there" shots.

REVIEW_TITLE: Finally we take a picture with this Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: After several time visit Singapore, we don't have a chance to take a picture here. So, this time, I told my kids that we have to go here only to take picture.
One of the tourist attractions you have to do when in Singapore. Loads of people there so make sure you go early. Tip-go to Starbucks,they have a awesome view from their cafe.

REVIEW_TITLE: Statue on the bay with a water feature
REVIEW_BODY: This is situated in the open bay area which is really a Statue of Merion the symbol of Singapore with water gushing from it mouth.. Surrounded by restaurants and stalls.. But actually not much to do. Just hang out so can prove to be quite hit in the day

Surprisingly, my husband and kids hadn't visited the Merlion Park any of the almost 20 times we've been in Singapore. We finally decided to see the Merlion up close after Crazy Rich Asians came out. We went at night so it wasn't very hot and there weren't too many people around.

The Merlion is obviously cool to see, being the symbol of Singapore. Great photo ops at night.

If you are also looking for the locations where Crazy Rich Asians was filmed, there are quite a few within walking distance of the Merlion!

REVIEW_TITLE: A morning stroll at sun rise is awesome
REVIEW_BODY: The visit to Merlion Park in the morning at sunrise is awesome. You get a good view of the Merlion and also the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. A good place to jog and capture beautiful photographs of Merlion

You can't get a more iconic attraction than this but it really only serve just one purpose during the day, for tourists to take the iconic photos and move on. It is really too hot (acres of concrete) and exposed to stay for long. If you want a relaxing stroll, come late in the evening when the heat of the day has eased and the light of the city is more mesmerising than the harsh lines of the day.
View and picture opp. Nice way of having dinner there with your loved ones. Boating can be fun too. For me, it was average as it was quite sunny and crowded.

Always wanted to visit this area, some nice photos to be taken here. The Merlion was not as big as we thought (not as big as the Merlion on Sentosa Island) but still very much worth a visit.
Great views of the other local tourist attractions from this point, also food, drink stalls and toilets right near the viewing deck.
Very much worth your time to have a look.
Completely invested for tourism, this ridiculous statue lords over a nice water-side park. Good place for photos.
An underwhelming fountain, ok to see from a distance. Nice harbour views. I wouldn't make a special trip to visit this.

REVIEW_TITLE: My son loves to see the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: It is a must visit place when u are in singapore. The view from the park is great. Lots of cafes & restaurants around.
The light show on the Merlion once it gets dark is amazing. You can stand there mesmerized for ages as it rotated through different designs.
My visit was very quick .. the area was crowded .. however .. it is worth to visit .. worth to go and see the area ..

Iconic statue which needs to be photographed with during the Singapore trip. The place can get crowded and it may be difficult to manage a clear shot with nobody else in the background. Also the place can get really hot.
Half-fish and half-lion, the Merlion is iconic to Singapore and resides at the waterfront Merlion Park located opposite to the Marina bay Sands. Very nice statue but quite over-crowded.

The Merlion Park is located on the marina sands bay. It’s a short walk and has lots of destabilise in the statue. The statue is half lion half mermaid, the top half is lion whereas the bottom half is a mermaids tail. There is also a bigger version on Sentosa island just by Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Crowded but the magic still works !
REVIEW_BODY: This is the first time my kids visited this park as we don’t really like huge crowd. The view from this park which just across MBS is breath taking, especially so that we were there sunset time. We love the milkshakes and sliders offered by restaurants around the area. Mind you , a bit pricey . For three milkshakes, 2 french fries and 4 tiny sliders we paid Sgd 76. Well sitting there watching the view and feeling so at Peace is worth more than 76Sgd . ❤️❤️

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool park with great views of the city
REVIEW_BODY: Really cool park with great views of the city and the merliom monument. Great to take pictures here. Go in the early morning to avoid large crowds of tourists

REVIEW_TITLE: A beautiful place with amazing view
REVIEW_BODY: A must visit place when you are in Singapore. We went there around 5 in the evening.It was crowded. But after clicking some photos, we stayed there for more than 2 hours. In the evening when all lights are on it is really an amazing view from the park. There is a baby merlion in the park, dont miss that.

It is impossible to visit singapore without visiting this place. Because i've skipped this place in my visit before, i wouldn't miss this place this time. With grab we're easily dropped to this place from our hotel. Not much to say because we come here in the afternoon,before our flight. We should come here in the night for the light show. Maybe next time.
Whilst it has gr8 pictures to be taken of Marina Bay Sands, Ferris wheel & the river, it would be nice to have more shady area as I find it really hot & couldn’t hang around for too long.
lots of tourist lining up to have a picture of the merlion, your singapore experience will not be complete wirhout visiting the place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Symbol of Singapore - a sight to behold
REVIEW_BODY:
The place is called Merlion Park for it is not the site of only one, but two Merlions (derived from the French words Mer and Lion). One is quite big, while the other is small, both facing opposite directions.

A visit to Singapore is incomplete without visiting Merlion. Since we missed the chance to visit Sentosa Merlion, we decided to walk up to Merlion Park from Sands Skypark Observation Deck entrance located at Hotel Tower 3 of the MBS Hotel.

It is a bit crowded, but it is natural to expect a crowd, for it offers a very good photo opportunity. People take photos, cupping their hands together and making it appear in the photos that the water is falling straight into the cupped hands.

Worth visiting, but don't specially plan to visit it solely. Club it with one of the major attractions - like Sands Skypark, Gardens by the Bay, Little India, Chinatown, etc.

I think everybody who come to Singapore always go to this place to take picture of it. You also can see MBS and take picture as well. Overall you can have your morning walk around this area and it was nice surroundings

All tourists of Singapore should have a photo here. It's a symbol of Singapore. The only thing I dislike is the climate. It's so hot in this place. Thank God, there are some benches where we can sit under some trees. Don't forget to bring an umbrella when you come here. Food here is quite expensive.

REVIEW_TITLE: Statue of White Merlion, in the Heart of City
REVIEW_BODY:
No Singapore tour is complete without visiting it. Nice photography location near the Singapore River. From here one can take the ride of River also costing $35 per person.
It is during site seeing tour. Again your travel agent will not include the river safari cost, so ask your travel agent to add this also in package

REVIEW_TITLE: Take a photo and move on
REVIEW_BODY: Not really much more to say. Good for bragging photo opportunity and not much else. Especially with jaded teen boy in tow.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit place in Singapore! Best time evening
REVIEW_BODY:
The best time to visit this place is evening so you should have a walk near a park and there are so many good restaurants near to this place

Having some crazy pics .. and then the people can do boat rides
Before you smoke there is a only a place to do so ..

having a walk near by this place is amazing .. the Singapore parliament, Supreme Court and other important Govt buildings near by ..
Careful with the kids - not so easy to make one’s way here with a stroller under the scorching sun & among herds of tourists!
A small statue by the sea and a lot of tourists. Must see - well... Very nice scenery though. Singapore’s most well known place I think.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for a photo opportunity, and not much else
REVIEW_BODY: With great views of Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer, this is a great place to go for that iconic Singapore holiday photos opportunity. Unfortunately there isn’t much to do in the area. There’s an expensive ice cream shop. Starbucks is closed until later on in the month. There’s a couple of expensive food places. And that’s it. Not a lot of shaded areas, and therefore little reprieve from the Singaporean weather.

Must place to visit if come to Singapore. It is better to wear comfortable clothes since it is hot and packed with people. Better to bring water. For muslim traveller, bring empty bottle since there is no pipe in the toilet.

Go visit the Merlion Park at night and you will not be disappointed! You will be in awe not only at the majestic Merlion statue but also at the dazzling shimmer of the Singapore River and skyline at night. Don’t miss the laser lights show starting at 8pm!

Will be on the list of all tour operators but I think there are better options to spend time in Singapore, but if u have time on hand then you could just go and spend time with some restaurants around get a view of the bay and just relax.

Many people at all time at this iconic spot of Singapore, the pedestrian bridge expands more views to the Merlion and surrounding skyline of the city, along with nice harbour view and the famous Marina Bay Sands (MBS) and Singapore Flyer at the opposite.

The late afternoon to early evening visit should yield the picturesque views of this nice place. Pictures of twilight dark blue sky with the lighting up Merlion and surrounding area would be visitor rewards, and just keep waiting a bit more to get the light show of the MBS as a bonus
This attraction basically tours u in boat in the lake way of Singapore telling about the history. Basically to see Singapore three ways are there 1. Water 2. Road 3. Metro. Enjoy this three ways
Beautiful Tourist spot. Way too crowded as this is a busy tourist spot. Nice place to snap some pictures.

Worth a quick stop to take a photo, but it's often overrun with tourists. Very beautiful area, perfect for photos and walking. The statue itself is ok, but it's the surrounding views that make the visit worth it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Day & Night view is so beautiful !!
REVIEW_BODY: Every time when i visit Merlion Park, the view from here always surprise me :) walking around from Merlion Park to marina bay sands hotel during the windy night is so great!
This is a beautiful park to visit in Singapore. The place has great options to spend time for family, kids. There is a walking path for other attractions near. Good to spend around 1-2 hours here.
the evening view is perfect... the light shows and the view on the fullerton and the merlion is a must have for singapore stop over.

Merlion park houses the symbol of Singapore - The Merlion. Good place to take some family photos with the mythic creature in the background.

Feasting on an ice cream and soaking the atmosphere around it makes it worthwhile. View of high rise buildings and marina bay sands is quite nice.

There is an option to take a bum-boat ride from the pier. However, they were accepting only cash so decided against it.

Most recognised sculpture in the city, this place is quite cramped with tourists since it is probably best spot to take photo of SIngapore cityscapes. There are also many restaurants and cafes along the sidewalk nearby the park.
You can’t miss this photo location if you are in Singapore. The view of the bay is amazing from this location and even better if you go at night. Children love it
I always bring my visitors here. You get good pics of Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer from here. Also they love the ‘drinking from the Merlion’s mouth pics).

This is the best known landmark of Singapore. And obviously, you have to get a picture clicked here to prove you've been to Singapore 😂 It's a nice place to spend your time and relax. There are cafe's and shacks nearby. Summing up, it's picturesque.
Got off at Raffels Place and walked over. Note an underpass next to the Fullerton. Great photo opportunity and view across to Marina Bay. Worth the trip. Expect it would look great at night.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore.

The Merlion statue in Merlion Park is about nine metres high. It fronts Marina Bay. The statue has a head of a lion and a body of a fish. It was relocated to its present location in 2002 from its previous location at the mouth of Singapore River. The park is by One Fullerton - another landmark place.

The park is a very popular place - and there are lots of visitors trying to take photos of the statue. I recommend a visit - and if you want to avoid the crowds - go around noon time as it is quite hot - but at least the number of visitors is small.
An architectural wonder with perfection style and beauty. A must visit. The surroundings are well maintained and view from the top is panoramic
A MUST visit hotspot in Singapore! The waterfall lion is just small but yet that’s the main attraction there and the main reason tourist are there for.
This place is so lovely. Too crowded but it's a big wow. Visited it after the lights show near Marina Bay Sands
This park has an awesome view of Singapore beside the famous Merlion Statue. Come early so you will find this place isn't too crowded.
When we got there, we thought the real merlion was a bit smaller than the one we had imagined. Apart from that, it was awesome.
We went at night to see the Merlion. The walk along the river is a beautiful experience. Glad we went to see it. It offers great views of the city and we got the best photos in Singapore.
Your Singapore tour isn't complete without a visit to this park and a photo with the Merlion tower. Beautiful views over the river. Very relaxing places. spend time here. Enjoy

Whooooo what is this place man.. this place really struck my mind and heart instantly the moment I reached this place.. such thing happened every rarely to me and m glad this happened with me and with this beautiful merlion park .. v went to this place in the evening post finishing our Singapore flyer experience and v took bus till here as v has Singapore pass which allows us to travel unlimited in MRT LRT AND BUS .. u pass through jubilee bridge which gives u a panoramic view of entries park including siting flyer, gardens by the bay, marina bay sands hotel and merlion park.. this park is very photogenic and gives u a very beautiful feeling genuinely.. it has something special.. post finishing jubilee bridge u reach to the lion head statue which is symbol of Singapore. It also has many corporate and financial offices too like many big bank offices in the surrounding along with some good cages and hotels nearby where u can chill and have beer .. it gets beautiful in the evening post sun sets it’s even more beautiful with the lights. In the evening they also have a light and sound show which I really don’t like much it was ok.. better version is super tree grove’s light and sound show it’s worth and beautiful too plus free.. both are free in a way but v liked super tree grove more..
actually nothing special, just because of it is Singapore icon, so if you don't come to this place then you haven't been to Singapore. so crowded.

I came here with my 2 y.o child and took Raffles Place MRT station as our destination from Bugis.. Because we brought stroller, we looked for lift.. From lift exit, it was very very hard to find where this place's location.. I found nothing about direction.. So I had to ask some people..

After getting direction, we also have to walk about 15 mins to reach this place.. Again, there were no clear information about this location.. We depended on asking people..

This place is a Singapore's icon.. It's a good place to get some photos.. This place seems to be crowded all the day.. Just find the best spot to take your pictures.
Its a must visit when in Singapore preferably during evening hours especially when travelling with family.
This is the most important place to visit in Singapore. Without this your visit is not complete. Very nice structure in a waterfront.

Merlion is like the face of Singapore so your trip remains incomplete without visting the same. You can visit at night time, enjoy the place and there are so many Cafe nearby so you can sip coffee with your loved one.

When you think Singapore you think Merlion. This mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish - represents Singapore to tourists. It's good for a short visit maybe about 15 minutes. Get yourself clicked with the Merlion if you can find some space in between the flooding of tourists at this spot.
This is an iconic place that I’d recommend all tourist to go. early morning or late afternoon would be best timing to avoid crowds and heat.
Amazing day out,everything is so organised at the venue and extremely clean we really enjoyed the laser show
Can have a good view of Marina Bay Sand, the Esplanade and waterfront view from the Merlion Park. And also to take a photo of the Merlion at the park.

You must go to the Merlion if you ever go to Singapore, and I am gonna tell you why. It is the mascot of Singapore, and there is a very good view from there of the rest of Marina Bay. Also you get to take THE picture with the fountain.

The tour of Singapore is incomplete without visiting the Merlion Park which probably most famous landmark. The location is excellent overlooking the waterfront & Marina Bay sand hotel & surrounded by many eateries etc. Great picturesque view for clicking shots!

Me and my family took a taxi here from our hotel in Bencoolen, and as soon as we got off, there were tourists everywhere. We walked around for a bit, enjoyed the views, had ice-cream and took photos. I don't know what else to add that has not been already said before. Just incredible.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion is cool, Park is average
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion itself is pretty cool. We liked it a lot, despite the masses of people who also wanted to see it. Remember that culture is different in Asia than in Western countries; don’t assume that others will avoid touching you or will stand in line. There’s very little personal space and if someone can squeeze in front of you, they probably will. That’s not rudeness, that’s simply how it’s done...don’t get upset. Do be aware, however, that you’ll have to spend some time waiting to get that perfect photo.

Gift shops in the immediate area are obscenely expensive. A small wood Merlion statue was $88; you can get a similar one in almost any tourist store for less than $10. There’s very little to do at Merlion park apart from checking out the Merlion and enjoying the small flower gardens, but it’s nice to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Get there early before the crowds of cruise ship passengers
REVIEW_BODY: We would definitely recommend visiting Merlion Park rather than seeing it from a far distance and definitely visit early in the morning before all the crowds.

I have no hesitation in saying that this is the best attraction of Singapore. The area of Merlion park and surroundings is the only area in Singapore which is full of tourists everytime of the day. Other parts of Singapore like the downtown and local areas are not so good.. this is the place where most people visit on their trip to Singapore.

First time i went to singapore. Merlion detination is last day and at night. It was so many people visit merlion. I think it must be so famous or maybe because of summer vacation. Surprised that night has a firework event. So beautiful scenery. I can see flyer, flower dorm, garden by the bay, marina bay sand, museum with unique building, many more and of course merlion. To go there. Better stop in mrt station esplanade. And walk to park. Anyway it was great experience in Singapore. The event was on 28/07/18

REVIEW_TITLE: Too many people in any time of the day
REVIEW_BODY:
It is a landmark in Singapore but there are too many people that visit it and it’s hard to get a decent photo because of the line.

If you want touristy place, this is it! I would recommend if you come only during early morning where there are lesser people!

We came here to see the legendary Merlion . We thought it was simply an open space . Yes but surrounding it are multiple restaurants and store for Cold drinks . Opposite the Merlion Park is the Marina Bay Sands . I have seen people having mats and picnic stuff with them , so I guess it is really a park. We didn’t spent a lot of time here due to the time ( past noon) and my kids are sweaty and of course complaining about the weather ( hot ) .

REVIEW_TITLE: The landmark of Marina Bay and Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
CYC+CG ( 18.07.14 )
This statue was the landmark of Singapore, so we visited this area for watching it and view of this area. The statue was simple, but the view of Marina bay was very good. It was inconvenient to enjoy because of too many people, but it was worth to visit and enjoy. The view of night was very good to us.
Here's a chance to snap a photo with this very popular landmark, enjoying the surrounding scenery around the bay.

Merlion Park is one of 'must-visit place' when you visit Singapore. You can see the Icon of Singapore, Merlion (half mermaid half lion). There are two Merlions that you can see, one is big and one is small.

Don't forget to take a picture while you are here.

Lots of people, best seen from the water on river cruise. Some nice restaurants in the close vicinity and easy public transport access. Gorgeous at night when you can see the laser show at Marina Sands also. Another Merlion also seen on Sentosa

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit place if you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Now I was in Singapore for a good seven days, and out of 7 days I visited this place at least three times, I was in love with the location. I will keep it crisp and short, if you are with your partner or family then visit around 6 PM and stay till the time you want. The place is full of some excellent dining restaurant with a beautiful view of Marina Bay Sands. Of course the area is trendy amongst the tourists so expect a good crowd, but still, you will find your personal space for sure. Don't miss the sound & light show with laser lights. The show lasts for 10-15 minutes and is showcased at 8 PM and another one at 9:30 PM. Enjoy the dinner and just walk around the bay area till Marina Bay Sands and If you want to Photograph (for serious photographers only) the beauty of Marina Bay Sands then won't recommend you evening because of the crowd. Shoot it in the morning, if you can manage early morning before sunrise then let me tell you in case the weather is ok you may encounter one of the best sunrises you might have ever seen from a photography point of view.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Merlion Park - Face of Lion, Body of a Fish!
REVIEW_BODY:
Who has not seen this iconic place, whether in person or in media, the world famous and most recognisable and prominent face of Singapore, known as its mascot - The Merlion – a large sculpted statue with a lion’s face and with a body of a fish – spouting a long jet-stream of water from its mouth.

The place is known as The Merlion Park and is quite popular among the visitors; in fact, visit to Singapore is incomplete without posing for a picture with the Merlion in the background. Tourist throng to this park and get themselves clicked, especially in trick poses, from the viewing deck in front of the statue – it appears in the picture as if the spouted water is falling straight into one’s open mouth.

We too had clicked many such happy pictures, tricked ones and otherwise, with Merlion, and also with three-towered Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the cityscape in the background. The park also offers boat-ride over the Singapore river and also houses several high-end restaurants and eateries to dine-in.

Anil Bisht
anilbisht@rediffmail.com

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to sit and relax
REVIEW_BODY:
Hi I had visited this with my daughter and wife in the evening
It got really beautiful once it gets dark
There is nothing much to see other than the iconic Merlion and the bay sands behind.
The view at night is really beautiful
You can spend upto 1-2 hours here not more according to me.

The surrounding area itself gives the atmosphere of wanting to be there with a happy mood even though the body and mind maybe tired. A good place to be with family while enjoying the scenic views of Singapore.

We took our 2 small children to the Merlion. It was extremely busy with apparent bus loads of tourists arriving, but open enough not to be oppressive. It is an iconic site, heaps of photo opportunities and quite a few shops in close vicinity. No Singapore trip is complete without the Merlion photo and posing to “drink” the water spraying out the merlion’s mouth. Kids loved it.
One of Singapore icon. A must place to go for tourist. Bring along your camera, as there will be lots of pictures to be taken.

Merlion Park is good place to go in the evening. There are many restaurants to have dinner. We enjoyed our Starbucks coffee in outside. We were lucky that defence forces were practicing for their national day. We enjoyed aerial activities by fighter planes and Singapore flag by helicopters. Weather can be enjoyed here.
I think the merlion itself is pretty underwhelming but the area around it is lovely to have a wander.
We parked our car at basement and walk to Merlion Park. We have walked quite short distance and it was too crowded.
There is nothing great except of its history yet we visited the place. No enterance fees. We completed the corum of visiting this place. Worth for some fun
Iconic statue of Singapore. It's good after years this still attracts tourists and visitors. Would say the walk towards this attraction along the riverside is best.

As a kid all I knew was the Merlion represented Singapore. But it’s beautiful when you climb up the Merlion! The view is amazing. You get to see view of the Sentosa island.

There’s also a lot of souvenirs. It’s colourful and beautiful! You can either take the elevator or walk up the stairs.

Visit the Famed Merlion Park for some cool and stunning photographs. The whole area is a treat for the eyes, especially at night with the towering sky scrapers, Singapore river , Marina Bay Sands Hotel , all illuminated with bright lights.

REVIEW_TITLE: Always a good place to spend an evening
REVIEW_BODY: Going to Merlion park is always a pleasure. The Singapore emblem is top on the river, so we spent an hour watching the surroundings. In the evening the Merlion statue came into life with lights. If going there do not miss the laser show from Marina Bay Sands happening daily at 8 and 9 PM.
Hi guys. Im really happy with this view in the middle night and many food street in here. If you want to take relax, you can buy some ice cream and other else.
Walked to the Merlion from the Pan Pacific Hotel. It was an easy walk and we saw a few things we had missed in the area. The Merlion was fun to see and there are lots of chances to take pictures.
Your visit in Singapore will not be complete if you will miss the Merlion and take the mandatory selfie.
It's the symbol of Singapore identity and once you reach there it's feel so wonderful and unutterable words that defines this place beauty , a must must must visit with family !

Went to merlion park during our city tour. It is one of the most prominent symbolic of Singapore. The place was located such that there was an open area from where people can click pictures of merlion and can sit and relax. However when we visited it started raining so couldn't spend much time. But Overall nice

The merlion is a magnificent monument - the half fish I think symbolises the sea and the lion is what was seen by a sumatran prince when he visited singapura as formally known. Singa also means lion in sanskrit and malay. The place has a great photo opportunity

I think there is no need to describe it. Only i will share my experience.
I visited here in March 2018. Very nice place.
The view around the Merlion is very scenic, carry good camera to capture. I visited here in evening time, so i could see a light and sound show.
I love the place.
No need to say i would recommend this to all.
A must visit in S'pore, due to its name; Mermaid-Lion. It would be a magical moment when you may find a spacious spot for photo taking. So reachable from Rafles Place, about 15 min
A tourist attraction that you must visit. From here you can walk to the shopping centre, the wheel and other tourist hot spots.
Singapore has come a long way from merlion being one of the most important tourist attraction. It’s good to go if you want an open view, lots of tourist and that ‘I was in Singapore’ pic.
The visit to Singapore is incomplete without visiting this place. Taking pics by posing u r drinking water which is flowing from the lions mouth. The view is great and it’s must visit
Lovely little park with the famous Merlion statue. Great views of the Marina Bay Sands. It's full of tourists, but that's to be expected. Worth seeing once or twice.

As mentioned it represent Singapore due to Stamford Raffles. Is nice to take a photograph and also along the park you are able to see the most talk about Marina Bay and in the evening at 7pm , one can see light up from the top of Marina Bay.
You can find variety of food along the park - local cuisine, seafood restaurant, Japanese restaurant etc....

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice view but not a must visit
REVIEW_BODY: It is a nice place but only worth a visit if you have covered everything else. You will also see the Merlion in sentosa so can skip this as well.

Well my tittle says its all Half Fish and Half Lion is Merlion park. The best time to visit this place is in night in after its quite hot and humid. Well it was really crowded and people from all over the world come to visit this beautiful iconic masterpiece.
This is really best one and sit and have sip of beer in near by restaurant and enjoy with his family and friends.

REVIEW_TITLE: Half Fish - Half Lion - Iconic Merlion
REVIEW_BODY:
It's fun to see Merilon, half mermaid & half lion, proudly standing, it's one of the world's famous landmark. It's huge, a major tourist attraction & overlooks mighty Marina Bay sands & it's located in front of Grand Fullerton Hotel...it's a landmark, it's iconic, you'll find huge crowd clicking slefies, taking photos all the time, its quite a fun & it's open all the time for visitors.....no tickets required.
Kids will enjoy a lot. Food & drinks are available nearby.

There were a lot of tourists when we arrived at Merlion Park even if it was high noon, so getting a photo exclusively with the Merlion is almost not possible. But it was a pleasant experience. I would definitely come back. Just do not bring small kids when you plan to go at noon and in the Summer.

This is a place you should visit. This must be the most photographed Merlion in the world. Heaps of people around just snapping away.

Great view of the skyline and Marina Bay Sands. Get a coffee and sit and watch the water for awhile. Very relaxing place to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion - Signature and Symbol of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park - The Signature and Symbol of Singapore. No better place to enjoy amazing Singapore skyline, beautiful waterfront and astonishing views of the the Marina Bay Sands and the Gardens by the Bay. Holiday Trip to Singapore is incomplete without the customary visit to the Merlion Park. It gets more and more beautiful as the evening sets in. TRULY SINGAPORE
The park is modest but the monument is worth a visit to admire. It’s hot and worm around but enjoyable and worth a visit

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion - best to go Early Evening
REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the Merlion park at 12 noon. The heat was too much for us. However there are really delicious natural mango and durian icy poles. These icy poles are expensive but well worth the price.

I’d recommend to visit in the early evening when the sun has set to enjoy the Merlion and lovely scenery at its best!

The Merlion park, is right opposite the 1 Fullerton hotel. Its also a place where you will find a ton of tourist taking photos of the iconic Singapore Merlion. There are a lot of restaurants here, so you can chill out over a meal or a few beers.
It was a great experience I would recommend it if you have a day available as so many activities to do at each stop

REVIEW_TITLE: Go first thing in the A.M. to miss crowds
REVIEW_BODY: Had to see it as it is the mascot of Singapore, but was a quick take a picture and look around type thing. Just a statue near the water, so kids will get antsy to hang around. I went super early and it was empty, but it fills up as the day starts. I hear it can be quite crowded, so if you want to miss that, do it first thing and move on!

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to snap a few pics
REVIEW_BODY: Usually very crowded a lot of tourists but it’s a nice place to take a stroll take a few pictures. Loads of restaurants and bars at night the place looks really beautiful with the lights. If it’s your first time worth a couple of hours as it close to many other attractions.
This place is usually crowded beacuse it is one of the standard tourist must-have photo in Singapore. Visit early in the morning if you want to have more tine to take photos without too much crowd
The walk in this area is very nice lots of restaurants around. The view on the buildings is lovely. Very touristic

REVIEW_TITLE: Great photo op with Marina Bay Sands
REVIEW_BODY: Lots of restaurant surrounding the area. You can get great photo of the Marina Bay Sands from here. Not too far walking from bus station.
Small place to attract million people every year. It is nice and clean and you can see the view of all the whole Singapore.

My fourth visit to Singapore now with 2 teenagers in the mix. Lots of.changes on shentosa and getting information from staff about directions, good packages and just good old directions.was.frustating. staff didn't know, there seemed.to be certain amount prejudice. With the island now.bigger with its pdfeeing wouldn't hurt to get some information kios around the place to give information and.directions.to.people.
This spot is where you'll be able to snap your Singapore postcard photo. Also a nice place to hangout for a drink or lunch/dinner.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion park is awesome place to visit
REVIEW_BODY: Very nicely maintained the famous merlion statue the icon of singapore. From childhood i have seen the photos of this place. Very satisfying to be there. A must place to visit.

The Merlion was one of our stops on our Friday night walk from The Fountain of wealth (Suntec City) to Fort Canning MRT station. We arrived at 20.00 just in time to see the Spectra light & water show across the water at Marina bay sands.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit place in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: one of the most popular landmark in Singapore. I prefer to visit and bring my tourist friends here after we tried eating local foods at makan sutra which is few meters away to Merlion park. Best time to visit is during night time where you can avpid the heat in the morning and can experience the magnificent light in Singapore.
The Merlion Park is one of Singapore's tourist attraction, located near the Central Business District. Quite busy but with plenty of restaurants around the area to relax.
Merlin park is literally just the big Merlion and baby merlion together. If that's what you want to see than its fine but it does give you a good view of Marian bay and the surroundings.
My cousin brought me, my sister, and my niece there after dinner. The place is packed and the view was really nice. Wonderful breeze to go with the wonderful view.
Iconic of Singapore! Before i think its not too big, but after put off my legs at the location, i think that i'm so wrong, its big enough.

We came there on sunny day - it was crowed and only see Lion status. Not much to see around but came back at night, it was great when they showed light art festive there - lion turned on different colours and you can see light art of opposite building. Highly recommend to come there at night
It’s not much to see really, the statue is pretty small but still something you have to see when in Singapore. Lots of tourists so come early! Nice area though!

REVIEW_TITLE: Its Singapore's symbol so got to visit
REVIEW_BODY:
Its the Merlion. Different from Sentosa as it emits water from its mouth. Also its Singapore symbol so you have got to see it. There are two - One the big one emitting water directly into Marina bay and a small one made inside a small area nearby the big Merlion.
There are good eateries nearby and you can see the famous Marina bay sands from here. Gardens by the bay are also nearby so combine with that trip.
Must visit place for tourist, an iconic for Singapore. Very crowded when holiday season but worth to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Every one love to visit Merlion during Singapore trip
REVIEW_BODY: Who doesn’t want to visit Merlion in Singapore trip..that too in the night it’s superb with lightning. Been there for 2 hrs in the night during my SG trip. Nice lighting show on the Merlion. Over the riverside nice location to spend in the evening with lots of restaurants, boat riding and palaces to sit.. overall very good time pass

Merlion Park fronts the Marina Bay. It is in the downtown area of Singapore. The iconic Merlion statue stands 8.6 metres high and weighs 70 tonnes. It has a lion’s head and a fish’s body.
The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore.
Its name combines "mer", meaning the sea, and "lion". The fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which means "sea town" in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore's original name—Singapura—meaning "lion city" or "kota singa".
With plush hotels, theatres and facilities of boating and walking by the bayside Merlion Park is a major tourist attraction. The light show in the evening is very impressive.

Santosa island has lot of things to do.
You can do the Merlion walk from universal place downwards or climb it up.
we choose the upwords trail and enjoied it most.
we took lots of pictures which means you gave a lot to see. Musaic sculptures, curved mirrors, metal plants and ofcourse Merlion.
Dont miss it.

There are lots of things to do when visiting Singapore . From visiting Universal Studios and Sentosa , shopping to your hearts content , a food trip of different cultures, to accessing multiple attractions. A visit to Merlion Park is highly recommended since it represents the country’s icon . An added bonus is having photo ops to surrounding important sites, such as Marina Bay Sands, the Fullerton , Singapore Flyer , Esplanade and the Art Science Museum. With the Merlion you can do several poses , but be ready to navigate throngs of people/ tourists. Better yet , come early to have the many different photo experimentation all to yourself .

REVIEW_TITLE: Mesmerizing Place & Breathtaking Views of Marina Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
Must place for all tourist where the Merlion status is situated and get a wonderful view of Marina Sands Bay, Singapore Flyer, Singapore Financial District.

We were lucky to get rains which change the climate awesome.

It depends on tourist whether to take boat ride of marina bay, worth giving a miss as you can enjoy neat the shore with all pics and views.
we took the metro to Raffles Place MRT stop and walked to Merlion Park. From the Merlion Park you get a great view of the Marina Bay Sands across the river.

A bit of a ride to get here, but I don't regret coming here. Everything was nice except the humid weather. The place was already very crowded and add in the weather, I got a bit cranky in the end. I liked seeing the merlion though. So big!

I went here on last month holiday with friends and family. a must go place when in Singapore. The place is always busy with people. not the first time to Singapore but still the special place always need to go.
As a symbol of Singapore, a must visit place. Beautiful and majestic. Just walked around on the bay to sky tower. Totally scenic on a evening

We went first thing in the morning and it was already busy and very hot. Took some amazing pictures and had an ice cream in the shade under the bridge. The kids had fun trying to get their ice creams using a claw from a vending machine.

If you go to singapore and dont click a picture infront of merlion then your trip is incomplete i guess. It is located just opposite to the fullerton hotel. You can take a cab and reach there. You can chill in starbucks too.

The merlion is the symbol of Singapore, so come here and take a picture of the giant Merlion statue overlooking the bay. Obviously very popular with tourists. They have built a small pier into the bay so you can take better photos of the statue with the skyline in the background, so that was nice of them. Worthwhile of a 10-minute stop in your exploration of the city.

REVIEW_TITLE: A place you shouldn't missed in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This place is absolutely amazing there are so many different things to see both day time and night time. You have go at the day time you can take a clear picture of Merlion which is represented Singapore and during night time they also have shows starts from 7:30pm a show which you shouldn't missed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very quick trip up the Merlion!
REVIEW_BODY: To go up the merlion is pretty pricy for a quick ten mins trip! We got it for free after winning a ticket but wouldn’t pay the price for it otherwise. Nice to see the view but not that amazing.
It is a place for you to take a photo. but nothing speical for me...the city is boring and not a big fans for me

It’s the icon of Singapore and must visit while you are there , the view was fantastic especially in the evening when all the light is on .. very busy with tourist and be ready with extra camera for selfie
Nice place and quite green fresh parks , it has fabulous view over the marina , but still nothing to see rather than the lion statue !
We thought this was a bit over rated, not that you need to spend much time here. The food outlets around were plain & overpriced, Not much atmosphere in this area
Come at evening time when there are light shows displayed on the merlion, very beautiful and great for photo taking

REVIEW_TITLE: Everybody who visits Singapore must have a picture with this Merlion!
REVIEW_BODY: A long walk if you really want to enjoy walking before reaching this place but if you just want to have a picture, take a bus or taxi and you will be there in few minutes time.

The statue was under maintenance, sadly, when we went there early February. So we ended walking around the park, chasing pigeons and taking photos with the view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.
There are places for you to sit as well as drink/snack, if you just want to relax.
The statue of Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. It's a pity that the statue was under renovation when we visited the park. However, you may enjoy the bay view and the famous Marina Bay Sands.
The walk from the mall round to look at the Merlion was lovely,the weather was just great and it was an opportunity for exercise,the whole place was just lovely,love the water,the walk. Just great

We came here at night and noon. Its better at night since they have the color lights switched on. When you are new to Singapore, this is a must visit.
BEWARE of a stand in the 2nd floor who has parrots to showcase and ask you to touch them for free but they tricked you to be photographed and force you to pay! When I asked how much, the chinese lady kept on avoiding me and put the pic on the bag while asking for $50 for 4 pics. I said I just need one, and it costs me $25 a piece. What a ripped off! Its nothing special and its expensive.

Our timing to visit this iconic symbol of Singapore was poor as it was under a scaffolding and being repaired. The views of marina bay and the light show were nice but it was disappointing to miss the merlion itself
Merlion is symbolic of Singapore. Great place for lot of photo opportunities and provide good views of Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer and Welcoming Hand of Singapore's Lotus

REVIEW_TITLE: Normal place to sit and relax
REVIEW_BODY:
We went there in the afternoon. Since it was sunny and humid we couldn’t do much over there.

It has few cafes with chairs where you can sit. Can even take a boat ride to old city guided tour which lasts for 30 minutes.

Overall it is simple nothing extraordinary.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. We visited during Christmas time. It as crowded for sure but we took plenty of pictures. It has awesome views around with sea, marina bay sands and good restaurants around.
You can never go unvisited this place when you are in Singapore.
Walking in the park which is landmark of SG was very Good enjoyed it This is one must see landmark , walking along the side of the waterfront was also a great experience

A very nice location in the center of the city. One could take a 45 min boat ride in this place. Unfortunately we could not because of shortage of time. There are nice restaurants surrounding this place . A must see place in singapore.
Yeah wouldve been heaps better had it not been covered in tarps and scaffolding haha..Merlion Cub is all good and locale is pretty nice in general.

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconic....but only nice in the early morning or evening
REVIEW_BODY: It is one of the iconic items in Singapore that you have to see, but the problem is everybody knows that and it gets at times so crowed that it is really no fun. I can recommend early early morning, noon when it is hot or late evening.

REVIEW_TITLE: Free park but Merlion under renovation again
REVIEW_BODY:
Just went yesterday with friends visiting and it was all covered up for renovation. Best to check the website to see if it is open.

Regardless it is a free park and nice to talk around from there all the way passing esplanade and towards, marina bay, sands where you can take a train, bus or taxi back :)

Not recommended if it's raining as there is no shelter! Take an umbrella in case of RAIN!

SINGAPORE is "blessed" with showers that come and go quickly!
This park has located near the Marina Bay. There is a small Merlion figure in this small park. If you want to see bigger one you can find it in Sentosa.
Great attraction to see in Sentosa. Enter the lion to watch a short video and then take a elevator up! The views are amazing

REVIEW_TITLE: No water from the Merlion when I visited
REVIEW_BODY: Disappointed that the Merlion was under maintenance when I visited - no water sprouting out. They should have advertised this so as to avoid disappointment. Otherwise a good place to get beautiful background photos of MBS etc.

This is the symbol of Singapore and so it's a must do activity when you visit this country. The beautiful and clean park was very crowded almost all the time. It's a great place to relax and to take a few pictures of the face of Singapore, its surrounding skylight, and the harbor.

We spent our last night here and what an amazing way to end this trip. Be there around 8.30pm so you have enough time to enjoy the amazing Merlion and surrounding buildings -in their glory. At 9pm make sure you are positioned to get a good view of Marina Bay as the awesome laser show will entrall you..

On our recent trip to Singapore we visited the park and appreciate it for its cleanliness and view.
My teenage daughters loved the small waterfall and the stairs through which they were able to have a view of surroundings.
The zigzag water fountain was also the star attraction.
Travelling to Singapore is incomplete without a visitng Merion Park The iconic Merlion and the view of Marina Bay sand is perfect.
The merlion is one of the most famous landmarks of Singapore. This is one of my favorite attractions in Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Go to get a good view of MBS
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park is famous for Merlion who is the symbol of Singapore. The park was packed on the rainy day we were there, but that didn’t bother us. About a 20 minute walk from Marina Bay Sands or a quick taxi ride (less than 10 SGD) go for the pics. Theres a number of food joints in that area and it’s close to mall.
You can ride boat from merlion park... Free place to go and take photos... Foto dari Merlion Park bisa dapat background Marina Bay Sands dan Esplanade.

As one of Singapore key landmark it is obvious that people from all over the world would come, see and take pictures. It's a public place and basically managing the visitors flow would be a challenge probably recommendation on best time of visit to spread out the visiting time

Never leave Singapore without snapping a photo of the Merlion. There are no exact directions to the park, but a quick hint: once you see The Fullerton Hotel take its grand underpass to emerge on the One Fullerton Bay. A few steps left and you would see the huge Merlion spouting water, with a smaller version of the Merlion righ behind. Come here night and day to enjoy the scenic views of Marina Bay Sands!
Beautiful scenery with a full bay view of Singapore. Lots of tourists, place must go when visit Singapore
People be patient and capture good shots and you get very good food. There are many other events. Don't miss LUGE it's the best spend some time fruitfully in it you will enjoy a lot 👌👌😎
The Singapore Merlion is a "must see" attraction and a great favourite with the "selfie crowd" with great views close by.
A trip to Singapore is incomplete without visiting the merlion park.great location to take pictures.try to visit both day and evening time.good place to sit relax and enjoy the view.

Loved everything about today

Cable car ride to Sentosa from Mount Faber to Sentosa .. fantastic riding high over the harbour was specular .,

First stop the Aquarium .. World standard .. not only for kids I loved the experience of getting close and personal to massive hammer heads sharks and a school of other fish ..

Universal Studio you must go early and avoid the weekend .. nothing to rave about ., but my son wanted to go .

Lovely to take a breather and have a snack and beer on the beach area of Sentosa at one of the bars ., a little pricey but it’s holidays after all .
A little difficult to catch a Uber on the way back as could not get wifi but the taxi ride back to the Hyatt was only 12 Sing Dollars

REVIEW_TITLE: Take some photos and remember for life,
REVIEW_BODY: Very crowed at any time you Go. People only come here for taking photos for memory nice view and good place to be .
Took a taxi which dropped us off at a loop type taxi stand. Really busy but worth the view. Loads of restaurants and was easy to get a taxi to our next destination.

Lion is beautiful. It is a bit if a missuon to even try and get a picture if only the lion never mind the lion with you and your family. Hundreds trying the same thing. Parts where still barricaded off even 2 days after new years. Better to view lion from one of the boat rides. Much better for photos.
Great opportunity to take a photo. This is the main highlight of your trip to Singapore and it should not be missed. You can visit this place anytime of the day.
It is an icon statue. A lot of tourists but worth visiting. The area there is nice to walk around. A the promenade you can have a nice view of the Marine Sands Bay.
You can not miss the place while walking around the bay as this is probably the place where you meet plenty of people no matter what time you go there.

REVIEW_TITLE: One tourist spot which should not be missed!
REVIEW_BODY: Conveniently located, this is one tourist spot which should not be missed. I could not resist myself getting captured against Merlion, the mythical creature with a lion’s head and the body of a fish that is widely used as a mascot and national personification of Singapore.

Great photo opportunity. Moreover, a second smaller Merlion is just behind. Best pictures are taken from the walkway above the water, with the Merlion just in front and the Singapore skyline just behind. During the summer, you may refresh yourself from the fountain spray at the Merlion's base.
amazing park with the huge structure of Merlin. glittering, scintillating and thrilling. what a colourful show in the evening. spectacular.

REVIEW_TITLE: More than a sculpture! Don't miss the views
REVIEW_BODY:
Tip: try to plan your trip to the Merlion Park with your visit to Marina Bay, they are within walking distance and can be enjoyed as a whole.

The Merlion Park is one than a sculpture of the Merlion which in itself is magnificent and iconic. Take the time to enjoy the surrounding views as well especially Marina Bay and Marina Bay Sands right across. These views are especially breath taking at night with the Merlion elegantly lighted up. Think about this, just a little over 4 decades ago, when the Merlion was erected, there was no Marina Bay as it exists today, no tall skyscrapers behind, where Marina Bay Sands now stand was just reclaimed land. The Merlion would be proud of the progress it sees over time which is now made available for all to enjoy.

If you can spend an afternoon to an evening at Marina Bay, start at the Helix Bridge and walk towards Marina Bay Sands, then keep walking all the way to the Merlion Park, it will be one of the most unforgettable and enjoyable strolls you will ever have. Plenty of photo opportunities.

When you are going to Singapore , Taking a picture in the Merlion is a must. and of course this makes the place a tourist magnet where people strangely post in order to get a nice picture. The merlion is an invitation to the "Singapore Culture" but I suggest on going to Sentosa's merlion because you will really know the culture from their.
This was a great place to visit lots of crowds so we didn’t stay for very long just the customary tourist photos and wandered along checking out the beautiful buildings in the area

REVIEW_TITLE: Oldest point in Singapore - standing still strong
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is part of all tours of Singapore, you can see it while travelling or include it in the itinerary. Time required is 10 minutes and also you can take a cruise from nearby point.

REVIEW_TITLE: The symbol of Singapore and a must visit site
REVIEW_BODY:
You cannot claim to have been to Singapore unless you have a photo of you taken in front of the Merlion.
Just be aware, with so many tourists visiting this site, you are unlikely to get a photo of just you and the Merlion.
Lovely views from the area and plenty of eateries.

This is the Merlion (mermaid - aquatic, fish type woman, merlion - aquatic lion). Singapore gets its name from the lion. If you are visiting Singapore, you must visit here.
There is no charge/fee for visiting this place. You can view the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and all skyscrapers of Singapore from here. There are boats rides starting from here. Lots of free space and sitting space available. Restaurants are available for snacks or meals.
