Sure, you’ve got a get a pic a Merlion Park because it just screams Singapore but get the pic and run. It’s a tourist trap with no shade, surrounded by massively overpriced restaurants.
Great views from the Merlion park of the city & if coming to Singapore a must see st least once. We got a Hippo jump on & off bus pass which most of the routes take you to this area.
Was really great to see . The views on the harbour are really lovely. Was very busy when we went . Hard to get pictures . Lovely walk along the bay .

REVIEW_TITLE: A fun place and a perfect place for some cool pictures
REVIEW_BODY: The sweeping views from the Merlion Park across the expansive Marina Bay area are unmissable. Marvel at the collection of architectural icons that dot the impressive skyline.
So its beautiful, its free! Check out night and day views both are awesome! Clicks your pics enjoy the site!!
Get ready to fight the selfie sticks and tourists to get a good shot. You will be lucky to get one without anybody else in the way.
You haven't visit singapore if you haven't been here before. But the view was beautiful and clean. Don't forget to bring umbrella or wear a hat.The place is opened and hot.
Singapore is what we all think of when we see the Merlion. Lovely creation near Fullerton n next to bay is a must visit place
nice lions show at night,. with lighting enjoy music going on here plus show so not a bad idea to go in the evening and enjoy.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the famous spots in Singapore!!
REVIEW_BODY: I would call it as a little more than Average place.. as the only thing you have is a Merlion statue on the bank of huge water body a view of Marina Bay sands. This place is very crowded and cant't be listed to spend some long time here. You may spend a little time clicking pictures and move on to some other place.

This is one of the mandatory spot to take picture in Singapore. You aren't in Singapore if there is none of the pic here, though nowadays this place is not so popular anymore. Merlion Park located at Esplanade Drive, near the Fullerton Hotel, other office buildings and Esplanade, you can also see Marina Bay Sands from here. Overall, this place is an iconic place to take selfie.
We went there with my family to take a few pictures. The place is very nice lots of restaurant to dine.
nice view, and nice place to stay at night. A top hotel behind ...Fullerton, very classic and good aspect.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit attraction in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion Park is a must visit attraction in Singapore. Its a very well known place and attracts a lot of tourists.

REVIEW_TITLE: check it off your list, other than that...
REVIEW_BODY: nothing special. the merlion sits at the end of a promenade extendeing down from The Fullerton hotel. it wasn't that crowded when i was there (a thursday night in early december). my wife and i were able to slip in find a good spot and take a selfie. i think the best thing about this "park" is the views of the Marina Bay Sands hotel.
It was good once upon a time. But right now its very hot and very crowded. So may tourists flocking and clicking selfies. Avoid

The Merlion is nice to look at. After 5 minutes, you've seen it and will move on. It is on the other side of the water from Marina Bay Sands Hotel which gives you a perfect photo opportunity of the hotel.
You can visit the park to see the symbol of Singapore. Its a park where people come to sit and relax. Students come to study.

The Merlion Statue is right on Marina Bay, across from the Marina Bay Sands hotel. It is a classic symbol of the city and also serves as a fountain shooting water into the bay. It is a major tourist attraction, and is usually quite busy. We visited and night and during the day, which gives a different feeling with the lighting. Definitely worth a visit, but be prepared for crowds. There is a larger Merlion statue on Sentosa Island which is also fun to visit. This is the one that most tourists go to see. The Sentosa version although bigger does not have the water feature coming out of the mouth.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must go attraction in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We came to the Merlion Park in evening. You will be able to see all the lighting on the building around and across the harbour (the Sands) and the Singapore Flyer etc. It is the symbol of Singapore and a nice place to chill out after dinner.

Because this is one of the singapore tourist destination so everyone thinking that they need to come here to completed their visit in Singapore because it is Singapore landmark.
Maybe better you visit after dark because in the afternoon or morning it is very hot because it is an opening area. It is not a good decision to come here in the rainy season.

November is really wet and rain season so it would bea good idea to tuck in an umbrella or raincoat. Still this iconic Singaporean symbol is the place to go, with which includes a spectacular 360 view of Marina bay. The attractions around are pretty much interconnected and mostly free.

When you see Merlion,you can tell that it's Singapore,because it's a well-known marketing icon. It's near other known attractions,and can be accessed easily by walk and SMRT. There are lots of restaurants and coffee shops in the park,and most people come to enjoy them in the evening. The pictures you will see in common of people taking photos of Merlion,is opening mouths receiving spouting water from it. You can see the attractions nearby such as Singapore Flyer, Esplanade theater and Marina bay sand.
It s my 4th visit in Singapore and I never miss visiting Merlion Statue. The place was still crowded though it was 10pm

REVIEW_TITLE: See two of seven official Merlion statutes
REVIEW_BODY: Always crowded and busy, the Merlion is the official mascot of Singapore based on an old tale. There is a Merlion cub statue located in the park behind the real statue.

Obviously it was packed!!! It is Singapore! We walked to merlion from MBS to take some quick selfies, but didn't go into the park area as it was about to storm. It is definitely one of those things you MUST visit on your first trip to Singapore, but probably your one and only time. If walking from MBS way, make sure to grab a coconut ice cream from the little kiosk on your way

Overcrowded with tons of Chinese tourists with their selfie hands in your faces. Waste of time waste of stone waste of space ugly to look at. It's a weird creature puking some dirty water in a brown Bay. Disappointed... DO NOT GO.

The Merlion is the national symbol. The park in itself isn’t much to to. Walk around take in the views and get the mandatory photograph with the Merlion. 😊 It’s now forms and an absolutely must do photo on every tourist visitors checklist.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great shot from the boat tour
REVIEW_BODY: If you do the harbour boat tour you go right up to the Merloin so you can take close up shots it is a lovely sight to see

REVIEW_TITLE: Great scenery in the heart of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Great place for taking pictures and do some activities such as jogging. Strategically located nearby other tourist attractions. Singapore trademark.
Iconic Merlion is a must visit to have harbour view and also beautiful sky line of Singapore view. It has nerby good class restaurants and place for excellent photoshoot. Must Visit.

Singapore is very famous for its merlion statue, if a vacation to singapore must capture the image in front of the Marlion statue. Marlion park can be reached by using MRT, MRT which is close to merlion park is MRT Raffles

There isn't much special about this place. Its just a fountain in the shape of a half lion half fish. A rather crowded place with tourists taking selfies and blocking the view. If you visit early in the morning it may be a bit less crowded. Entry to the park is free.
You have to visit this place if you're in Singapore. Very iconic. It is certainly a picturesque location. Try visiting in the morning. As there is less crowd and the weather is also good.
very good location for a timepass. nice place to pose for photos. worth a visit during sunset as the whole area becomes cool
Merlion Park is a must visit to see the symbol of Singapore. its crowed during the weekends and best to visit in the weekday.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cant miss the Merlion when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion park is another must see when in singapore. You just cannot mis this one. You can spend an hour or 2 at this place and click good pictures around this with the skyline .
It’s very good spot opposite to Marina Bay. View is very good. Merlion is symbol of Singapore City. It is must visit place during Singapore visit
Good place to visit, part of standard city tour itinerary. It was good place to have photos as a memory for Singapore trip.

Supposed to represent the animal that the person who discovered Singapore saw when he first came to Singa Pura as he called it it’s a lovely place to visit with the family and pose for some amazing photographs especially with the water flowing out of the mouth of the structure.
Walking around in Singapore we walked through this park. A really touristic attraction. By night really nice to see.

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconic place and a must visit
REVIEW_BODY: Go to this place only because of it's iconic stature. This is a must visit while in Singapore as the merlion is inextricably associated with the name "Singapore". So go there and take a few pics with the merlion in the background.

To anyone visiting Singapore one land mark should definitely be the Merlion park. Though the history says there were no lions in the land the merlion sure belongs here. With world class hotels giving access to public to access the park the place has an air of elegance and splendour
Merlion worth a visit id you're in Sentosa. Didn't go into statue as it was closed when we were there.

REVIEW_TITLE: EXCELLENT MONUMET - Must See (Multiple Visitor) when in Singapore! 8.6 Mts TALL (70 Ton), a Photographic Excitement!
REVIEW_BODY:
NOTE: The MER-LION was a marketing icon of Singapore - A mythical creature with a lion's head and a fish's body, the Logo of Tourism!
Started in 1972, by Prime Minister Lee Kuan, the original Merlion statue used to be at the mouth of the Singapore River, with Anderson Bridge as its background. On 25 April, 1997, it was relocated to the current Merlion Park, near the Marina Bay.

.. Very Busy Place
.. Very Well Maintained
.. Excellent for different types of photography, day & night!, including SELFIES, Panorama, etc.
.. The Breeze and the surrounding atmosphere takes anybody out of this world!!

It is must visit place if one is visiting Singapore...It is located at Marina Bay Sands...From Singapore Flyer it is walking distance...Don't miss it if one is in Singapore...It is easily accessible by local transport...The place offers marvelous view ..

The area around the Merlion, walking along the river bank is stunning, especially at night where crowds gather to eat and drink at the many restaurants. Keep in mind kitchens close around 2.30pm and re open at 6pm. But you can always buy a drink and enjoy the view across the bay of Marina Bay Sands and the Iconic 57 story high hotel.
If you are wanting to indulge, a drink at the roof top garden of the Fullerton Bay Hotel gives you almost 360 degree views. A cocktail costs around $26.
My daughter and I rented electric scooters from behind The Merlion Sculture. $39 each for an hour, but well worth it! They were so much fun and you are allowed to go anywhere! We scooted around the entire bay at night. It was spectacular!

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see attraction of Singapoore,,, nothing much
REVIEW_BODY: It is a place not to be missed during singapore trip, as it is considered to be their national pride. The place is crowded. We cannot even take a clear photograph of Merlion. Go, watch it, get a picture, walk for a while and just come back to relax,,, Not much to do here,,,

It's for the first time visitor, for the mandatory selfie with the Merlion statue symbolic of Singapore. Walking distance from Gardens By the Bay and Marina Bay Sands. So no need to plan a visit separately.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best places in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit. If you can afford, spend at least half a day here. A lot to explore on foot. Well connected with SMRT and taxis. If you miss doing this and nearby places, you have actually missed one of the best locations in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Symbol of Singapore to the world
REVIEW_BODY: Enlighten to read the significance of Merlion.. Interested to find mention of Indian demi-gods. Good place to walk around and take some selfie, crazy selfies by tourists
At any day, this place is buzzing with tourists. The area in itself is pretty small and nothing exciting! A photo click since its the symbol for Singapore :)
A great evening out watching the view over the bay and enjoying an ice cream. The Merlion delivers spectacular photos in the evening.

REVIEW_TITLE: One has to see the symbol of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Of course no trip to Singapore is complete without visiting the merlon. However, this is also what ALL tourists think, so the place is absolutely packed with tourist buses and huge crowds, which does take away a bit of the fun. However, worth the visit for a few quick snapshots.

REVIEW_TITLE: Early morning visit - great photos at 7am
REVIEW_BODY: We arrived in Singapore at 4am and so on first morning walked from hotel to Merlion Park. Got lovely photos of sun rising with Merlion in foreground and Marina Bay Sands hotel in background. Nice spot to watch the sun come up - not crowded.

REVIEW_TITLE: This is what Singapore is Famour for.
REVIEW_BODY: People everywhere and hard to get a photo without someone else in it. People used to know Singapore by the Merlion before the Marina by the Bay was built. There are a few restaurant's near by. Its nice to just sit there and people watch or watch the boats. You can get on and do a harbour boat cruise from there which is 40 mins. To be honest its nothing spectacular but it is a must see even if your do a cruise by on a boat cruise just to say you say it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Have to see if in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: You have to go to Merlion Park if you are in Singapore. We have young kids and they enjoyed the area. There are a couple of nice little shops there, icecreams etc...There is a very nice view of the harbour also and boat rides available...

Lion is the national animal of Singapore and hence this park is honour of it. This park doesn't have parking but since it is on the bay it is lined with several restaurants. There is a Japanese cuisine restaurant too and people can enjoy the view and bay. On the other side of the bay is the famed Marina bay sands hotel. The nearest metro seems to be Raffles place, but looks like it is on one of the main roads of the city without parking. Summers can be hot while rainy season could be really wet. Carry a small umbrella is adviced. Like every place it's always better to carry a selfie stick which comes handy for taking pictures.

Amidst beautiful riverside views, this park is fun. Kids enjoy and its clean nice and full of tourists. One can see marina bay sands, beautiful pink flower bed alongside bridge, good restaurants like Pelican. Fun clean nice place.
Lovely weather in September. Ice cream and a little walkie around the lake was just perfect for our little girl....

The park contains a good size statue of Merlion - half mermaid and half lion.This is the only merlion with water coming out of its mouth. Soothing to look at. One can have a walk on the bridge on the opposite side of the merlion too.
for surw it isn t one of the best place to see but the position in the panoramic walk is really really nice. beat9ful the view on marina bay sands. tge statue nothing special
Nice place to roam around, click photographs , nice skyline of the city can be seen. worth a visit and good.

For the icon of Singapore, you have to see this at least once during your visit! Wouldn't say you would need to visit this more than once, but it's still a nice area to walk around if you do end up here :)

You must visit the Merlion Park when you go to Singapore. I visited twice and i found that if you visit around 7.30am there's practically no one around so you can take as many photos in as many poses as you wish. Generally later on in the day it gets very crowded.

We visited the marina area in the evening which was delightful with all the surrounding lights and a lovely breeze coming off the water after a warm walk from our hotel.
The Merlion water feature is very striking and placed well in regard to the Anniversary Bridge, the Fullarton Hotels, the Marina Bay Sands and the Gardens by the Bay domes.
First time i came here, and it's adorable. Great view. Minus point is only distance station MRT (for MRT users). It takes so far for stations.

A bit hard to get to with Grand Prix preparations underway but it was nice to see. Of course there is the merlion but there is s nice plaza area, the cleanest public toilets and a range of eateries. A Singapore must do.
This is a symbol of Singapore. This is a attractive sight for all tourists. This is a must see place in Singapore.
Definitely a tourist place. There's a big Merlion by the riverside with buildings from the central business district as the background. Come here early to get a good selfie with the Merlion.

I guess this is one of the most visited attractions in Singapore! Its a Free of Charge attraction You can experience a river cruise on a "Bum Boat" from the Merlion Park Recommended for families with Children!
The Mer-Lion. One of the many things which you should do is visiting this place. Few snaps of this beautiful piece of art will make your trip memorable.
We love this place after sunset very nice background with the tall lighted buildings.The place is very relaxing

A must see, since its the emblem of the city. There is a smaller one next to it, there is also one in sentosa island, but this one got view towards the bay and the marina bay sands... In the end, its just a piece of concrete that spits water..
The Merlin park is really nice with the Merlion statue and the view of Marina Bay Sands, etc. but it is really really crowded.

Singapore was named after the lion. So the Singapore tour will not complete if you don't visit this place. This is the main thing of The city. This is the center of Singapore the merlion park in marina bay and just walking distance from this place you can go to gardens by the bay or Singapore flyer. So you can do the all the tour in just Day on this area.

This is our first visit to Singapore and Merlion Park is a must visit. It's a $6 ride with taxi from our hotel in Aliwal street. We came to the park twice. Once in the night time and once in the morning. At Both night and morning time, the park is packed with tourist but it is more beautiful in the night time as you can see the lights from surrounding buildings. You can find few expensive restaurants around the park.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to spend few hours.
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion park is a happening place where tourist as well as residents come to spend time and click pics. Not more than an hour can be spent here though. Area around is mostly commercial and houses offices and banks.

They narrate the story how Singapore came into existence. They allow you to go to the top of Merlion and that's just crazy. The view from top is awesome. Entire Singapore is visible and looks beautiful by the sea.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit to see the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion Park is. Historic place so one must visit, and as per today's prevailing standards take a selfie with Merlion! Additionally, the park and the surrounding area is a must visit with numerous wonderful attractions all within walking distance - Marina Bay Sands and its Shoppes, Marina Bay Gardens and Foray Grove, ArtScience Museum as well as Cloud Forest.

Must visit tourist spot but also wonderful attractions.

A must for those wanting to document there travel with a picture. The surrounding walk around the marina is near parks and gardens but with the other dining and shopping options a distance away along Orchard road there is limited other activities to recommend visiting for any period of time.
Visit both in the day and in the evening. Always lively. few food options, can be more. Mostly walking.

This place is very beautiful. And yes its FREE. No tickets required.

Its a must visit if you want to just walk and click pictures and have a great time. I went during evening and it was lovely view. You need to have a picture with the merlion statue. Coming Singapore and no pic with that is a loss. You can have sea food there also japanese food available. No indian food. Must visit

Of cause, this is the landmark of Singapore. I would say, it's the must to come. Night time is nice, light display and beautiful laser shows. There are many restaurants around the bay. After enjoying the show you can walk around and find a good street food near by.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you are there you must take photo with Singapore icon
REVIEW_BODY: If you are there you must take photo with Singapore icon Nice view and place but need to take care of the wheather as it is hot some time and not suiting children

REVIEW_TITLE: You get to see a nicely kept symbol of the Lion City
REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to visit during the day or in the evening. You can take the lift up inside the Merlion to get a view through its giant mouth. Quite an exciting place for kids!!

As this is an iconic statue of the country, it attracts both tourists and locals to take photographs there. It is impossible to take a shot with the Merlion without being photobombed so be mentally prepared. Some tourists will try to "catch" the spewing water into the mouth standing strategically with the photographer helping with the alignment.
A mascot and national personification of Singapore ..Having fun trying out various posed to bmtake with Merlion 😆

I have to be honest, I didn't get what all the fuss was about a statue of a lion spitting out water. Once I arrived it all made sense why people flock to this location. It is beautiful. The entire area has restaurants and bars right in the water. At night time, the place is even more spectacular. I highly recommend anyone going to Singapore stop by this place, especially at night.
Nothing much to say but the symbol of Singapore. Take your time out to click photos as the background buildings are very nice. Gets very crowded though.

A must visit place in Singapore. A perfect place to take pic of Marina Bay Sands. Take a rest, read a book and have coffee. It was quite crowded and full of tourists taking pic. It is very hard to find a good spot as everyone occupied every corner. I suggest everyone to go in the early morning, 8-9am.
Great for taking pictures. Just don't forget to bring a wide hat or an umbrella and to put some sunscreen for protection.
Strategic location for must-have-photo when pay a visit to Singapore. Too crowded during weekend. Kids can easily get bored. The activity is just taking photo and watching people taking photo.
If you have come to Singapore and not visited merlion park you've seen nothing. Beautiful place and good for clicking lots of pictures. Must Visit

REVIEW_TITLE: Too touristy and hot hot hot
REVIEW_BODY: If you want to be a typical tourist you definitely need to come here. It's full of tourists taking selfies in the noise and the heat. Merlion statue is quite small comparing to what we see on pictures. Great views, but you can have the same great view in many other places in beautiful Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Just a place for selfie fans
REVIEW_BODY: Had a good view of the marina bay sand hotel. They have a night show over there. The perk had a wooden places where u can wait and enjoy the river. The cruise service is there and will be a great idea to have a ride.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit to this landmark of singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
This is the place which identifies you with the visit of the country.. So make sure you pay a visit.
In the midst of all the awesome buildings, lake and the bridges, this park is an easy place to reach. And ten minutes walk from the nearest metro station.
A good number of photographs is a must with the merlion in background.
By the way, a bigger version of merlion awaits you at the santosa island..

REVIEW_TITLE: A must go place in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We started our walk from Clarke Quay. We enjoyed the view of the promenade. You can see Marina Bay Sands and take best picture of it from the Merlion. If you want to have a walk at the promenade, better start early in the morning before 9 or after 5 pm. It is really too exhausting to walk around the bay in a sunny day especially if you have young kids.
The Merlion park is the simple of Singapore, it is located in sentosa and you should definitely go and see it.
This is a must see attraction in Singapore. Man made but well architected. You can take poics from the mouth of the lion as well as its head. The 4 teeth correspond to the 4 cultures in the city

Merlion Park is a great place to spend the evening in Singapore. The iconic statue of Merlion is a popular place for all the tourists wising for taking back unique photos representing Singapore. There also many restaurants facing the waterfront to have a bite. Overall a good place where a lot of locals also come to spend the evening.

One must not leave Singapore without having their pictures taken at the famous Merlion. The place is just located near the bay where you can rest, stroll or have your photos taken as a sort of a memorabilia for your visit to Singapore.
Saw it on a boat tour down the river wouldn't have gone out of my way to visit. Was a good sight to see and take a few photos

This is one of the most famous photo spots in Singapore. Overlooking the Marina Bay, it has gorgeous skylines and beautifully lighted at night. The Merlion throwing water is the famous pic everyone clicks.

You are not going to be alone here, but nevertheless, this is a must when in Singapore.

The Merlion itself is nice, but taking in the whole Marina Bay Area is fantastic at night ... the skyline, Fullerton, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and the Esplanade Theaters ... captivating!

REVIEW_TITLE: It is cool and silent place with Big merlion and 1 small
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion is identity of Singapore. Half fish and half lion.. mermaid + lion = merlion Place is cool and quite.. u can see Singapore flyer and marina by the way from here. Selfie with Merlion is must to prove that u visited singapore.
There is a big Merlion statue. That is the Singapore City Symbol. Cool, travelers must to visit this merlion and take a photo with that.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit for your picture album!
REVIEW_BODY: This is the place to go in the evening for that picture perfect shot of the Marina Bay Sands hotel, and of course the Merlion itself!

REVIEW_TITLE: Super awesome view. The best of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Place visited by all. Capture the best of the selfie moments with meri lion in the background. The view at sunset and when it gets dark is even more awesome. Walking distance away from Clarke Quay the ever happening place in Singapore with its bars and pubs for you to indulge into the wines and spirits. For the ones like me with special interest in history plenty to discover. Can go to Esplanade also near by if you are an art lover. Can spend half day at meri lion and near by areas. Also have adequate memory in your camera you won't be tired clicking some quality pics.

Can't miss this landmark. Little difficult to find but MRT helps. Basically heads to Battery road and find Fullerton hotel (was Post Office once). This place is opp. hotel. Nice spot where you can see Merlion, Sands bay and Sing Eye. Best time to go is just before Sunset. Take pics during light and then in the dark when its lit. Weekend would be good time to go.

Certainly an exciting place to stroll around and relax before you do the more touristy things and shopping. The Merlion is so iconic, so if you are a first-timer to Singapore, put it on the list, you won't be disappointed.

My husband, 2 year old and I walked here one evening to see the merlion. Well worth seeing and brought back memories of the little mermaid in Copenhagen. Well worth a visit as that area is very nice and bustling at night.
For sure you have to be there once if you are in Singapore for the first time, it is iconic place and you will surely like the view around it and a click makes sense here.
It's my first time on Singapore. And everything is so clean and i love clean place, i am just go there with my friends and everything is so funny ini here, i don't know why 😁😅😂😂

REVIEW_TITLE: Boat tour is best way to see the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: When in Singapore you have to see the Merlion. We took a boat from the quay and were able to get the best views and pictures of the Merlion and the park. Rather than fight the crowds, I suggest the boat trip.

If you want to have an instagrammable spot for free in singapore, this place is definitely the right one. You can take a famous merlion background here. Also the famous marina bay sand building with beautiful color in the night.
This place is easily reach using mrt though.
It's Singapore Pride But Tourists have calculated time and time is expensive . May visit , if plenty if time in hand

REVIEW_TITLE: Good to see if you're sight seeing but hot!
REVIEW_BODY: We spent a little bit of time at Merlion park. We are glad we went and took our kids ages 2, 8 and 9) but it was hot and pretty crowded. People love taking pictures with the statue so it was very crowded on the best picture-taking spot. We spent a little bit of time, got some ice cream and then headed somewhere more exciting for our kids ages 2, 8 and 9.
You have to try and cram everything in..... it's worth a visit. The heat got to me so take lots of water in your backpack. Take your camera to.

A night view of the Singapore sky line can be done here. Or a good view of the greenish Singapore river. Merlion Statue is ordinary despite its size. Nice pubs and restaurants around. Don't visit during day.

Nice place to visit. But not at day time.
One has t visit after 4 o clock because it is very hot in morning time.
Its a place where Merlion statue, the symbol of Singapore is there. Can get pics with family or near ones.

We visited here in city tour and we got only 15 mins to see this and get pictures.
Very nice place. Good to be at afternoon. Can enjoy Singapore cityscape. Good photo taking place. Young children enjoy a lot.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion, well known attraction in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Well-know attraction in Singapore. Nothing much to do there, only for photo taking. Also manage to take the photo of marina bay as background.

This spot.. You can take a lot of foto.. With marina bay as the background... Singapore flyer.. The beautiful esplanade building... Also the merlion...

Of you walk near the Starbucks ... You can also.. Some heritage building...

For you who came to Singapore for the first time... This is the most favourite place to take photos...
Merlion park is very popular tourist destination.its photogenic destination.and another side of Singapore.good and pleasant atmosphere.
It was totally worth the cable ride. To experience such a beautiful park. The view from top is mesmerising.
Strolling around... beautiful view. You can get esplanade, marina bay sand and art science museum, singapore flyer and also merlion as a background.

We took a nice walk around Marina Bay and Merlion Park. You must visit to get up close to the symbol of Singapore. There is a lot of activity in the area, as it is a popular tourist area, especially at night. I recommend being there in the evening to watch the famous light show across the water at the the Marina Bay Sands. There are two nightly shows during the weekday (8:00pm and 9:00pm).

The experience at merlion park was not as per our expectation. The size of merlion was not very big and intact we have bigger Hindu idols like hanuman ji and shiv ji in India. The merlion made in sentosa island is bigger and more attractive. Must still a nice place to go once. And the view is amazing. You can see sky crappers and marina bay hotel.

picture perfect, need to stop in this area for your remembrance pictures. it's too humid so need to bring extra clothes for my baby, best time to visit at night time you'll see marina bay, singapore flyers etc.:)
It a landmark place which one can go and see for a few minutes just because you are in Singapore as that is a icon created which is the face of Singapore
A walk from Esplanade can take you there to Merlion Park. Its suitable for a brief stop over as there are too many people jostling there with each other for their views with the icon of Singapore.
Visit Merlion Park Esplanade at night to get a better view of the scenery. We went here on a Monday night and the park still got a crowd.
This is the most iconic symbol of Singapore in my own opinion, others are just a copy cat and a new marketing strategy.
Lots of tourist around. But beautiful place overlooking the bay. Just hang around look at the view or take a cruise of the river and bay area.

Not a very promising place, but has a good feeler when you are at this place. There is a cool breeze, peaceful, offers you a cruise ride. Being a nation symbol for Singapore, its a nice place to take some clicks here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Insanely busy on a Sunday afternoon
REVIEW_BODY: Came here today with my 3 year old son after visiting the nearby Asian Civilisations Museum. Being a Sunday it was just insanely busy with people everywhere snapping pictures. Yes it's a symbol of Singapore, but I'm not sure it's anything really spectacular. I recommend visiting early in the day to avoid the crowds.

REVIEW_TITLE: It feels nice to be here.
REVIEW_BODY: Very nice, its a tourism icone of Singapore. Nice to click pics here as you will be able to see many things from here.
This is a mandatory visit in Singapore. You have not been to Singapore unless you have visited this and taken a selfi here. Nice view of skyline, sea, high rises from here.

It is a fountain. It was in the middle of the day when we visited this place. It was hot, and there were a lot of people taking pictures in front of the Merlion fountain. It is beautiful, but I think I will enjoy it better if I went there late in the afternoon or the evening.

REVIEW_TITLE: One thing you should not miss!
REVIEW_BODY: This place is very iconic and you should never skip this on your tour in Singapore! Take a lot of pictures and remember to buy some souvenirs!

REVIEW_TITLE: See it by all means (but don't go out of your way).
REVIEW_BODY: I think the title says it all really. See it by all means (but don't go out of your way). The Merlin is a recently created (1940s) symbol of Singapore representing a sea serpent (tail) and lion (head).

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit in Singapore best time is around 4-8 pm
REVIEW_BODY:
Best time is 4-8 pm you can spend some time clicking pictures having a walk around the park , there are nice bars and restaurants near the place
U can take a boat ride and take a walk to the central Singapore , the main market and the financial district is near by

The best of Singapore for trip which includes Children. Lots of rides and shows. The place was super clean with lots of restaurants around . Sky train Around the place made it very easy to travel around. Must visit
This is a must see in Singapore, we went here in The evening and the merlion is nicely lit up. Plenty of space so it's not crowded.
A lion park with waterfall from her mouth and it's a good photo taking place and thier are good restaurants

Probably a "must-do' to visit this place with the famous "half lion/half fish statue". However the place is always very busy, as everyone wants a picture with the Merlion. Good spot to take pictures from Marina bay. Restaurants and bars in this area are very expensive as you pay for the view.
Merlion means Mermaid-Lion. Very good place to visit during evening. You will get wonderful of laser show from MBS. Boating in the river is another attraction in this place.

Was a windy day with live band. Kids enjoy with the cruise during the sunset. The cruise driver is very good hospitality to allow my kids trying on driving the cruise for photo taking. The cruise is playing the video to show the history of Singapore and the place that we pass by in the cruises.my daugther start doing her sketching and remark in the scene she see. The whole cruise taking about 40min with SGD 15 for kids, SGD 25 for adults.
Good place and strongly recommend for family with young children.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit place in SG
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion park is the centre of attractions in Singapore. The place is well maintained with clean roads and loads of restaurants and shopping centres. Views offering the Marina bay sands hotel is fantastic. Quiet and beautiful place. A must visit place in SG.
This place is very much popular for breath taking photos and the park is one of kind where the statues is half lion and mermaid which has to be surely visited to know the history behind it
We went to Merlion Park twice. This was the second visit. Many tourists took picture here. We came here around 5pm ( the best time ).

Merlion Park offers the best view of the Marina Bay Sands thier where various resturants and cafe however we did not eat them. Also when crossing the Merlion Bridge you get a great view of the Tall buildings of Metrpolitan Singapore recommend visisting their for photos or dineing !

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore Visit incomplete without this one!
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion Statue is the iconic landmark of Singapore and your Singapore vacay is definitely incomplete if you don't come here... The place is extremely crowded both during the day and at night, quite obvious as it is THE photo stop for every other tourist! A must visit though you may choose to spend less than an hour over here!

From the Marina Bay Sands, you can see the small Merlion Figure, walking through the river side took about 1 hour walking with strollers and kids while enjoying the view of tall buildings, hotels, and commercial properties, and the river.

The Merlion is the best spot to see how bounty the place.. with collaboration famous names in the world brands and perfectly advertised companies...

The Sg Pride!
Amazing!
You can't visit Singapore without taking a few holiday pictures with the statue of the merlion in the distance.This is also a great spot to walk around and take in the sights of the city.

No doubt a popular tourist site as that's how lion city historically originated. Can be crowded as all jostle for position to take photos. It is a nice place to stroll along the esplanade and view the skyline on this part of Singapore. After that you can follow the path through the helix bridge to Marina Bay.

A more of a tick in the box sight seeing in Singapore, Merlion being the signature icon here.

Walk around the Fullerton Hotel is awesome and one would enjoy taking pictures there for sure. Can go for a river cruise if you want spend $25. Having snacks at the food stalls is not a bad idea.

Would recommend to go in the evening.

Visiting the Merlion Park is a must for travelers to Singapore. It is always a nice spot for souvenir photos. However, one may have to chance a time where there are less tourists.

Always nice to visit the Park. Marina Bay Sands, The Esplanade and SIngapore Flyer can be seen from the deck. A few steps away is a souvenir shop and above it a Starbucks Coffee for weary travelers.

Go to Merlion Park & you get to see some beautiful human creations.

The Singapore Flyer; similar but better to London Eye, it rotates inwards bringing wealth to this beautiful country.

The containing palm which is the business center where the palm holds Singapore 's wealth, near the Marina Bay Sands in shape of a "Wealth Containing Palm".

The Marina Bay Sands curving along as the adjacent coast curves.

Ladies can have a view & visit to Loui Vuitton outlet there.

Singapore in a beautiful country with strict rules.

I think no trip to Singapore is complete without a Merlion shot. This Merlion Park, I think, is the most accessible. You can walk to take good pictures, and you'll pass by the area via most bus tours too.

The whole scene here is super fun. Yes it is a little crazy with all the selfies going on, but it's worth it to see such an icon. The whole scene is great especially towards the end of the day. You can see the cityscape, the marina bay hotel across the bay, the flyer (ferris wheel), and the esplanade theatre, walk on the new jubilee bridge, and see the sun setting behind you and the lights come on the Helex bridge and the buildings etc. It's also easy to get to if you ride to the Esplanade MRT and is a short walk for the kids. Only con is that everything around there to eat is really really expensive. You might want to just get something along the way and enjoy it while you sit on the steps.
Its nice to take photo graph to memory in Singapore visit don forget to take photograph with your own creation

We visited the Merlion Park both in the night and day. We took a walk all the way to Marina Bay Sands in the night under lights and it was a really beautiful scene. We were there on a Saturday night and there was a live band performing too, This place is a must visit after 8 pm to see it under lights

Must place to click your picture with the merlion 😜 Its just an photoshop for all tourist. You will see all people around you would be busy with different pose to capture the picture with water falling from the mouth of merlion.

Every tourist I think pass by this park. This is a good jump point for Marina Bay. Can get very crowded as pack of tourist seems to all come here.
There are two Merlion, a smaller one can be found at the side of the park.
and the most pictured statue is the one facing Marina Bay.
another Merlion can also be found in Sentosa.

Visited Merlion Park with family on my 5 year old daughter's birthday. She had an amazing time seeing the Merlion. One can get a great view of Marina Bay Sands from here. One can also take a bumboat river cruise your from here. Truly a wonderful experience.
Good place to click photos, know the history of merlion and you will love the place. Great view of Marina and financial town.

I suggest you to go there in the morning to avoid too many tourists taking photos. This is the landmark of Singapore, if Merlion park was not included in your itinerary, you've never been to Singapore 😊
I'm pretty sure everyone knows the Merlion before they ever travel to Singapore so just like my father, he had to come here to take the photo and enjoy the view to Marina bay.
If you go to Singapore and don't visit the Merlion park, then you really haven't been to Singapore. It's the country's symbol. It's a fish! It's a lion! It's a big cat with fish tail <3
Wow what a structure. Do visit this place in the evening as it has lots of cleaned place where you can sit and enjoy the cool breeze and stunning view of the skyscrapers of Singapore
One of the must visit place while touring singapore. Good for clicking selfies and stroll in the evening.
The iconic statue that represented Singapore. The statue is combine with Lion Head and Body with Fish tail.

This is very popular for photo opportunities. There are great views across to Marina Bay hotel & Singapore Flyer. Opposite Fullerton Hotel and about 5 minutes from MRT. There are also Harbour cruises available and a few cafes and food/drink stalls. As it is very hot you will need to keep hydrated.

REVIEW_TITLE: Probably The Most Famous Attraction In Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: If you made it to Singapore, go see the famous Merlion. Always busy with lots of people so just take the picture with everybody else. Situated on the bay also gives you a great view of the entire bay. If you are an adventurist, you can go seek out the other Merlions scattered in Singapore.

The Merlion being the symbol of Singapore is situated at a historic location. It is a spot to appreciate the history of Singapore and te view the Marina Sands Complex and skyline of the city. It hard to believe that this area was the coast before the reclamation took place. Clarke Quay is just a short walk from here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit only in Night
REVIEW_BODY: This is situated right on the Riverfront Bay Area. This place needs to be visited in the Night will the whole SIngapore Bay Front lit up. You can also take a River Cruise ride which give you a wonderful view of the City Bay Front.
The perfect spot to click a picture to say you have been to Singapore!! And also a lovely view of the Marina Bay hotel.
The country symbol place is crowded but beautiful. If climate is open and clear, you may have nice time over there.
The merlion symbol of singapore is located at such a nice location. The view of marina bay sands in the background combined with the river boat ride was excellent .
Nice place for some fotoshooting around the bay, seems like everybody visiting Singapore comes here from around the world

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice views but too touristy for my liking
REVIEW_BODY: Great unobstructed views of some of Singapore's iconic buildings. The Merlion was nice but not something I'd go out of my way to see again. If anything watching the tourists pose around it make for a more entertaining time.
So many people for just a nice water fountain, yes nice but too crowded in the morning when we went. May get better latter when the buses are gone.
Very interesting part of the harbor area to visit especially if you young children. Lots of tourist in this part of the city. Short. Walk from the MRT and various other sites.
visited the place, it was awesome, the famous lion of Singapore, lots of tourist in this part of singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Dont need a trip for this.
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is very symbolic of Singapore but you need not spend a trip to visit. If you are somewhere around Marina Bay, you can view the Merlion from a distance. To avoid the crowd and the heat in the day, it is better to visit in the evening.
A must see to all visitors/tourist of singapore. It is nice, you can see the view of Marina Bay Sands, Flower Dome, Flyer and one and only the Merlion 👍🏼👍🏼

REVIEW_TITLE: The Merlion an Icon of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is probably an icon of Singapore, you have to visit, the park has great views of Singapore Skyline. It is a great spot for photos.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view of SG Skyline and Marine bay
REVIEW_BODY: A must visit place. Strongly suggest to go in the evening to enjoy the dusk views, lighting around the skyline and Marina bay.

This place was part of our city tour in the morning but we passed by already the night before because we were told that its more beautiful at night with all the lights, true enough, it really was beautiful!

The merlion itself is very cool and there are some great photo ops. This whole area is nice to walk around and we even walked across via the underpass to the Fullerton Hotel (beautiful).
However, it is very crowded and we found the tour groups to be very rude and constantly pushing in front of us. I know they are probably on a schedule, but there is no need to be so inconsiderate. I got really sick of this and it dampened the experience.
Great views of Marina Bay Sands and a must see even with the crazy groups.
On our recent trip to Singapore thru Make My Trip we went to Merlion Park.. A must visit photo stop for all visitors. Icon of Singapore..

This Merlion Park is where the iconic Merlion statue located.
Good location to take your pictures with you family or your selfies.

Its an ideal location to watch the sun goes down. It is a must visit location if you visited Singapore, albeit it's always crowded.

The location is within proximity to One Fullerton which has many dining option. Also you can start your Singapore Rivercruise from this area.

Basically this is fish's body with lion which is the symbol of singapore so when you visit singapore one must stop at this there is beautiful view opposite to it.
there are many small shops close by when you walk from main road to this point.
and there is a Starbucks too at the main road.

one must visit this if you visit singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nothing great, but one mandatory visit
REVIEW_BODY:
Every city has one iconic landmark, this is the one for Singapore. Avoid visiting it during day time as it gets very hot. Try it during evening. Though we visited it in day time only, and it was Sunday, so good number of people were there.

It has some nice restaurants and coffee shops around. You can visit and then have a relaxing coffee break in air conditioner :). Only thing to do here is clicking pictures, which everyone was doing. So lots of crowd around it.

There is also a river ride, you can avoid that, nothing much about it, just some rounds in the boat.
Merlion Park- you have to hydrate, blobs of sunblock and use an umbrella! Tourists everywhere so pick your own special photo op with the Merlion- half dragon half fish.

merlion park is a must for people who visit singapore. Take picture there, its an icon for singapore. You can find also Merlion statue at Sentosa Island.. Every new year, this place always crowded full with people who want to celebrate NY

We visited this place after universal studio and the place is really nice and relaxing and seat there for a while and then take the ferry from there take round of the river and either get down at Clark quay for dinner or come back and have dinner near merlion
We walked here from the Hippo bus stop. Had a photo and and ice cream then that was it. Nice by the river but not much to do.

REVIEW_TITLE: symbol of singapore a must visit
REVIEW_BODY: a very busy place with tourists , a must visit to get a glimpse of the singapore lion . easy acess via public transport

As they say you haven't been to SIngapore if you haven't seen the Merlion.Did it alright but expected the view to be bigger. Very crowded. To compensate however was the great view of the surroundings and the bay. Best place to relax after a tiring day of walking. Be there around late afternoon to see the transition of lights to night time and of course the light show.

Must visit place...you get to see amazing view of Singapore...best time to visit is during evening so that you can enjoy the lights as well...because during afternoon sun is too hot...there are small food outlets nearby you can enjoy snacks there....you can sit and relax a bit there...also there is one shop nearby where you can buy souvenirs, but its bit costly...nice place...
One of popular landmark of Singapore, so crowed because many tourists would like to take picture with Merlion

We could see the famous Merlion from our hotel and decided to walk to it. It was a pleasant walk through a mall and then through the performance art center to a large promenade around the marina bay area to the Merlion. The place was crawling with tourists everywhere so we took our obligatory picture and continued the walk around the bay.

Easily accessible from around Marina Bay and a worthwhile stop if you are in the area.
Situated in sentosa Merlin park offer some shade and fresh area ( below the trees and close to the waterfalls. Sometimes true garden was decorated by some sculptures etc , nice place
This is a nice place to spend few hours with the family and take some nice pictures from Singapore. It is a lovely spot for picnics.

This trademark of Singapore has a half mermaid and a half lion figure on the edge of the water body. I found it over rated and is quite painful and tiring to visit during the day... Especially with parking which is far away.
A lot of tourists but it wouldn't be a Singapore trip without a photo op with this guy. Although crowded, just have a good angle and all will be great.

It's a nice spot to have a bwutiful view from this spot. Better to go early morning to beat the heat. Gets crowded during weekends. There are big tour groups and very difficult to walk around. It's a good place to go by cycle also. There are also nice place to eat. Gardens by the Bay is very near to this place. You can just walk around.
Should be in your list for Singapore. A place for taking some snaps with the Merlion statue. The place also offers a great view of the river and high rises.

REVIEW_TITLE: A good 30 minute stopover. Take pictures and move along.
REVIEW_BODY: It was part of our day trip in sentosa. We came from Beach using cable car and took a monorail for our next attraction. We spent about 30 minutes. It was very hot though. Goto the lions mouth.

The park is wide and beautiful with the Merlion statue. There is a huge number of visitors in the morning (but I'm not sure whether it is crowded at night). The park is near Raffles Place MRT Station just around 7-minute walk.

REVIEW_TITLE: An amazing structure showing the origins of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is an amazing sculpture which joins up both worlds which make Singapore up: the sea of trade and the land of value. It was well worth a visit as it is even more amazing in real life. If you have time get a chance to walk around a section of the big lake in the bay through the helix bridge to get amazing shots during sunrise/sunset of the city from different points of view.

Merlion Park is a must see attraction and should be in the top 3 things to do in Singapore. The iconic Merlion of Singapore sits there spewing water and so many landmarks can be captured with the Merlion in the background like the flyer, helix bridge, marina bay, marina bay sands etc, to name a few. Come in the day around 12 when it will be quite hot but people will be less so you can calmly pose with the Merlion. Dont forget to do the famous "Drinking from the Merlion" pose which many people forget.

Also visit it in the twilight from where you can get a boat ride for around 25 SGD and visit the entire sights of Singapore as evening settles and day changes to night to get so many wonderful images.

Also, the Merlion will start changing color and some iconic shots can be got if you are smart.

Must visit. No compromises here whatsoever.

This iconic site of Singapore should be on your list of places to visit while you are there. This venue by the water and you have a gorgeous view of Singapore from here. Very crowded on weekend but that's expected from a tourist attraction site.

If you don't like the heat then don't go here in the middle of the day when the sun is beating down on you.

Well went in the afternoon of March and was very hot. There are lot of ways to reach Merlion. We chose the bus and taxi though. Nice to see variety of restaurants at the surroundings of Merlion. A nice experience.
Great for taking pictures. They've added a light show, so there are more tourists at night. Enjoyable.
very crowded during any part of the day. it was very dark near by when we visited in June last year.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good views of Marina bay, (an almost) must visit icon
REVIEW_BODY: This is a bit like what Statue of Liberty is to people visiting New York. A must see, as it has become a kind of an icon, and hence (nearly)a must see place. You get great views of Marina Bay Sands, The Flyer, Gardens by the bay etc. Good to spend an hour at the most. The views though are less spectacular than the one you see in your Statue of Liberty cruise.
My family paved a visit to Singapore last week. So we went around the country. This Merlion is a must-see when you're here. Since its near other tourist spots too. Its pretty convenient to come here.

First time in Singapore, and seeing the Merlion was our first stop. It is truly an amazing sight. The Merlion is really a must see when in Singapore, I feel.
We went in the evening when it was still light, to be able to take good photos, but also it is so worth it to stay until the light show right around 7-8pm ish. We took the train which was easy enough to follow. Also admission is free, no tickets required.
10/10 would return.
Really the beauty of Singapore, place you can spend lot of time for the stunning 360 degree view around the place with sea & marina bay sands hotel.

Merlion park is the landmark place of Singapore. One must visit and click a photo which guarantees that the traveler has visited Singapore. its a happening place. One can spend couple of hours during the evening time at this place.
After hearing a lot about how this is the must visit place, I was pretty disappointed to see a very small merlion. Merlion in the Sentosa park is way bigger.
Incase you are for a short duration in Singapore, if your flight is at late evening then you can visit this place during afternoon. its a nice clean place not to be missed.
Just be ready for the crowds. but with some patience you can still get a decent photo. A River cruise is a nicer way of seeing merlion
My daughter insisted we get a photo with the Merlion - glad she did. Great little spot. Got there via the Hop on Hop off bus.

Well this is the symbol of Singapore so you must go, seriously. Night viewing is the best as they put on a light show on the surface of the Merlion and that is very nice for photos. This is worth the visit. Advice: don't eat around this area as they are very expensive as they aim for the tourists.
We find Merlion park is a must visit in Singapore. This is the most iconic place. The symbol of Singapore.

Aside from taking memorable shots with the iconic Merlion statues, the Merlion Park also offers the prime position for photography opportunities of Singapore’s famous skyline. Some examples of famous architecture visible from here include the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, the Fullerton Hotel and the Esplanade. It's better to visit this place in the evening as it can get very crowded during the day.
Really enjoyed this. The icon of Singapore. Great photo opp with Marina Bay Sands in the background. Enjoy.

One of the best attraction and iconic symbol that you must visit in SG. You can sit and relax and enjoy the view of Marina Bay and best place for taking photos. We visited it at night (to avoid getting tanned) and the weather is good so we stay here for 3 hrs.and luckily ended up watching fireworks display at 9pm I guess.After a long walk you can go and dine at night market on the other side and choose what to eat/drink with a friendly price and enjoy the music and vibe of the place.

We have been there on a Sunday afternoon and loved it. The entrance is from One Fullerton and it has a lot of nice cafes which is good. The Merlion was very crowded, lots of tourists taking photos but that is Ok. We took a 40 min boat tour which I highly recommend. Eating is not allowed on the boat. A must see attraction in Singapore. You can see all beautiful silhouttes of Singapore.
It is difficult to rate this park as it has scaffolding around it. It was in the process of "getting a shower" per the sign. There wasn't that much to see here other than the one sculpture.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful place to relax and enjoy a good dinner.
REVIEW_BODY: This is a beautiful marina. It got busy when we went because it's close to Formula 1. We walked around and had dinner at one of he restaurants there. Loved the sunsets.

As they said, it does not justify your stay in Singapore unless you visited The Merlion..
Me and my nephews enjoyed an hour here.. it was packed with a lot of people from different races taking their best pictures with the merlion and to add with the view is the Marina Bay sands..
A lot of restaurants to choose from to enjoy your moment.
Its more fun to visit this place at 5pm..

Sad we didint get a chance to take a picture, because it was for construction or something. The note says Merlion is taking a bath. So people to tend to take pictures in the small merlion fountain. There is also a good spot for taking picture over viewing the Marina Bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: The merlion was not there, he was taking a bath
REVIEW_BODY: We really wanted to have a pic with the merlion, unfortunately it was not available when we went there, the sign said he was taking a bath. This is really a nice place. This symbolises what Singapore is all about.

Signature place to be in at Merlion park. once at Singapore a photograph without the Merlion at the side or back is not complete. Nice place to be in for some time. on a sunny day it's hot and sunglasses are a must.
One of the must go places in singapore. Good view of Marina Bay Sands and Esplanade. Excellent for photo shots and selfies.
a very good landmark to show the symbol of Singapore. Part of your itinerary and truly show case Singapore.
It's The Main Icon On Which The Singapore City Is Name After It's In A Shape Of Half Lion And Hall Fish From Which The City Gets Its Name Great Place To Visit Excellent Place

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the places to visit.
REVIEW_BODY: This is normally one of the main attractions to see in Singapore but unfortunately during our visit it was covered with scaffolding and plastic so it was a bit of a disappointment on this occasion. Not sure how long the intended work is going to last.

Went there on Feb 10th, and the Merlion was "taking a shower"!! (Under renovation). What a bummer. It was not mentioned at all on any websites. At least the view of the esplanade & marina bay sands was great.

I visited Singapore in July 2012 and Feb 2017 and both times they had the Merlion Singapore's most iconic monument coved for maintenance!! Really??? Closed for 3 weeks! They should find another way to do the maintenance.
If you are in Singapore and haven't visited Merlion Park means you haven't seen Singapore 🇸🇬. Superbly recommended place for family and friends.
Twas a very nice spot to take pictures by the sea. You can capture a very nice view of the marina bay sands, esplanade and more. An attraction worth visiting.
A must for in your SG trip. SG visit would not be completed without Merlion Park This is one of Singapore Iconic places worth visiting for.
It was easy to reach it via MRT. You can see the MBS and part of the esplanade. The small merlion was hit to kids & people with young at heart.

Merlion Park is one of the main attraction of Singapore. It is very hot there. Don't forget your sunglasses, hat, cap and water. Water is very expensive in that area. Take Singapore River Cruise if you want to see Merlion from front.
Merlion park is the absolute place to be in Singapore. People come from all over just to see this place. Enjoy the stroll down the boardwalk, there's plenty to look at.

This park near marina bay is popular with all tourists who love clicking pics with the iconic merlion. The river cruise from the park is equally enjoyable with many historical areas covered.Lots of restaurants near the park as well.
Merlion is the Singapore's national animal. It throws water relentlessly 24 * 7 into the river!! Quite a site ... wonderful. Do take a boat ride in the night ...worth it!

I have always associated Singapore with this iconic sculpture and it was one of the things that everyone visiting Singapore has to see and get that selfie with. There is a couple of places around to grab a bite to eat or something to drink.
It's hot and a bit smelly. too bad when I came there the merlion fountain is not working. Can't take mandatory picture with the merlion :(
The whole complex which includes this attraction is great at night as you will see SG glimmer and glitter in lights. Besides it's also cooler at night to hang out.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must See if you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see place, it gives you ample opportunities to take pictures with the Merlion and the Marina Bay Sands hotel in the background. Evening dont miss the laser show
i visited evening around 7.30 , the sky scarpers lights view were excellent . Enjoyed whole evening with my family at this beautiful location .

The Merlion park is perhaps a must visit if you are in Singapore. There are several attractions - The rotary lifts for a 360 degree view, the Madame Tussaud museum and so many other attractions that requires more than a day. Very enjoyable with family.
Iconic, Futurictic, Cool. everything looks great, clean and make the visitors want to come back to this place. Great!

The kids thoroughly enjoyed getting photos of the Merlion by doing funny poses making it look like they were drinking the water or collecting the water in their hats or drink bottles. Very busy with lots of tourists trying to do the same thing so have to be patient.

Singapore's version of the mermaid except it aint no maiden here!

U can call it the male mermaid cos its got a giant lion head and a fish tail

This park is a MUST see not only becos of the statuesque merlion sprouting water but u have the best view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel from here (that banana boatie architecture)

Go b4 noon before it gets too hot

My advice - if u drive - google Esplanade theatre parking then walk over cos there is NO PARKING whatsoever elsewhere!

Grab a starbucks at the gate cos the rest of the F&B inside the park sucks! And go straight pass the gift shop its a waste of time
It was good place to get your photos clicked. it was very crowed the day we went. from there we walked down to marina bay mall thru helix breeze. lovely walk that was.
Merlion shouts Singapore. nice place to spend time, to take selfie or just to sit n chat with other visitors.

This tourist attraction is strategically located as being here gives an awesome view of The Fullerton, Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade and other nearby landmarks. This is also locates near restaurants. Expect this area to be almost always crowded.

It is pointless to attempt to review Merlion Park from an artistic sense - it is much bigger than that. The Merlion is at the very heart of Singaporean history & culture and we tourists ought to visit it for this reason alone. As it happens, it's also a very beautiful and peaceful place.
We went here to view the light show and it was a very good spot to watch the laser lights. There were numerous eating places along the water front.

you can't visit singapore without visiting merlion. one of the most recognisable sights in singapore and rightly so. we started our walk at raffles and went over cavenagh bridge before arriving here. after seeing merlion we continued onto the gardens on the bay
Absolute must see!! This site is characteristic of Singapore and a tourists mecca. Wonderful spot to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best location to capture that iconic shot of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Built in 1972, the Merlion statue was relocated from the mouth of Singapore River to its current site in 2002. The location is ideal for photo shot, with Fullerton hotel as its backdrop. (BTW, the Fullerton building, completed in 1928 once houses the Singapore General Post Office). Shot by day or by night, the pictures will turn out perfect.
From the Merlion park, it's an easy stroll to the Esplanade, Marina Square, Boat Quay, Clifford Pier and Lau Pa Sat (Satay Club). Just let your feel takes you to where your heart desires :)

The most famous landmark in Singapore. The walk to the Merlion is quite fun, especially in a sunny bright day. The Merlion itself is busy full of tourists taking pictures but this was expected. Near the area, there are a couple of cafes and a few expensive restaurants.
Seeing the Merlion is a must, however be prepared to see it with thousands of others. It is difficult to get an uninterrupted view however it is worth a visit.
If you plan to visit Singapore, do not forget to put in your plan, you can enjoy nice places around and very clean.

REVIEW_TITLE: stay till evening for light show
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park is one of the major tourist attractions in Singapore. spend 1-2 hour there and have some nice photo. must bring your camera.
Watch the show from the Lion's head statue. It lasted about 10 mins. Good time to stroll as it is not that hot and there was a gentle breeze.

REVIEW_TITLE: No improvement since last visit in 2010
REVIEW_BODY: I've been here on 2010 and my hubby is persistent to bring the kids to see the merlion. We go with MRT and walk from Raffles Place. It is quite a walk but the weather is nice. No further improvement of this place and even very little access for stroller or difable access. We had to pick up the stroller thru stairs. No new restaurant. We grab a bite at the small singaporean toast under the bridge. Nothing special.

Visiting the Merlion is a must see attraction on your visit to Singapore. Nice viewing area overlooking the waterfront and Marina Bay Sands. Looks particularly lovely at night when the statue and the city are lit up.
You don't go to Singapore if you don't visit Merlion Park :) a-must-visit place. Suggest time to visit: sunset time or night.

This is a free attraction which means that it gets extremely busy during peak tourist periods. If you wish to visit the park then it is advisable to do so with a guide who will be able to impart his knowledge of the history and thereby improve the overall experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: Most important landmark and is a must visit
REVIEW_BODY: This was our very first attraction in Singapore, This attraction is in the core of downtown, one requires around 1 hour for this attraction and this attraction is free. There are lot of people at this attraction

From my childhood hundreds of time I have seen the photograph of this statue. So, I didn't want to miss it when I was there. An amazing view more than it was on my mind. Though lots of crowd was there but I think no one should miss this icon of Singapore. Also you can enjoy the breathtaking views of the Marina Bay, Singapore flyer, art science museum from here.
I remember when this was really on the waters edge but it is now a little way in land. It is the cultural symbol of Singapore and really worth a visit - it's easy to get to by walking too
this is one of the best spot to take photo, especially creative photos, nice surrounding, nice view, best for jogging, or just walking with your own pace

REVIEW_TITLE: How can you go past this photo opportunity?
REVIEW_BODY: Apart from being surrounded by iconic things, no visit to Singapore is complete without a visit to the Merlion. Your younger children may wonder what the fuss is all about, but judging by the crowds, the Merlion remains very popular and well worth a short visit.

Enjoyed afternoon by marina bay and took few picks by the Merlion. Off cause the place is crowded but everyone seems to be enjoying the space and it doesn't ruin the experience, it actually adds to it. You can also grab an icecream nearby and enjoy it on a hot Singaporean day, which is everyday.
on the waterfront amid beautiful architecture, hotels and shops, the Merlion spews water into the bay. THere's also a baby Merlion a little more removed from the waterfront.
One of the greatest place to visit. We went noon so it was hot, i think it is better to come at night or early morning. You can see the buildings left and right.

REVIEW_TITLE: Honestly, what's all the hype about?
REVIEW_BODY: By all means, go and see the Merlion if you're dying to see this Singapore icon, although I really don't get it - a half mermaid/half lion spouting water into the bay. The surrounding cafes are sooo overpriced, simply there to rort tourists. $6.90 for a simple ice block?? No thanks

Great New Years Eve, the fire works were spectacular. Great environment close to major shopping centres, taxis are easy to access from a number of points around the park. Great place to grab a bite to eat and enjoy the view.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to spent a evening
REVIEW_BODY: Its a Nice place to spent a evening. Well known place for taking pictures, should not miss if you are going to singapore.
This is the most photographed area of Singapore where tourists are swamped. You can see the various structures around the city by visiting here; but that's just it.
Your trip to Singapore is not complete until you visit this Merlion which symbolizes Singapore. It is better to visit during dusk. You can also see complete skyline of Singapore financial district.

It's definetely #1 spot to see. U ain't gone to Singapore if not coming here yet. Surrounded with skyscrapers and across the legendary FULLERTON HOTEL & FULLERTON BAY HOTEL. Also resto and quicky food booth available. It's a free attraction. OK-5
Nice, clean yet very busy tourist attraction, great scenery of the city , recommended for family visits

This is one of the major tourist attractions here, located at One Fullerton, a must see because of the iconic association to Singapore. Good photo ops as it has nice view of the bay and skyline. It is recommended to go during weekdays as it can be too crowded during weekends. Better bring along a bottle of mineral water to keep you hydrated as well, it is quite a long walk if you are the adventurous type who would do some explorations on the nearby areas (from Esplanade, Marina Square, Makansutra Glutton's Bay, The Float, Helix Bridge, to The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands).
the symbol of singapore and the place every tourist goes to take a picture . you cant miss this one out.

I was here as a part of the half day city tour. The stop here is not a long one and u get abt half hr or so to visit if ur part of a group. But it has merely 2 merlions( half mermaid half lion) here..the mother and kid.the mother has the fountain flowing from its mouth which is a good picture taking spot.the father merlion is situated in the sentosa island.although no fountain from his or the kids mouth. Overall a good visit.

It is almost a must for tourist to take a picture at Merlion Park. However there is no car park near this small park by the water front so be prepare to walk a little. It can also get quite crowded when big tour groups arrive at the same time. There isn't shade so just a short visit for the views and to take some pictures is good enough especially if the weather is hot.

Singapore means Land of Singh (lions). There are 3 merlions (Mamma Pappa & Baby). This symbol has great significance for Singaporeans. Mamma & Baby are at this point. Pappa is at Santosa. Nice place. You can see Singapore City line from here. Despite the fact that there is nothing great here, u can not miss this point, if u are a tourist.
a must see because of it's iconic association to Singapore. Nice views of the bay and skyline. go early and not in a weekend and you can get nice pix
Lovely place to cruise the river, grab a snack or simple sit and soak up the views. We stayed for the evenings light show - amazing!

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to see Singapore sky line
REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to stroll at evening. You will have good views of Marina Bay Sands and the financial district.
The park has good view but if the sun very bright so difficult to "hide", the background of merlion statue has good landscape, any café in these area too, the place easy to find.

Although Merlion is imaginary, the figurine located beautifully among marina bay sands on one side and the bank street on the other. Suggest going there after sunset and if you are luxky you can also see the laser show displayed from Marina Bay Sands. Must see if you plan a trip to singapore. There are pubs n restaurants in close vicinity so great to enjoy a drink sitting close to the Merlion.

I really looked forward to go to Merlion Park when I was looking at my Travel Map but it showed lots of mistakes that could be fixed.

1) Limit amount of people in the area
2) Use some more realistic way of pumping water out of the Merlion
3) Put Photo areas

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice View of town and Marina Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Nice picture/photo location as you can take the landmark (Merlion), town view pictures and Marina Bay and Singapore Flyer all from one single place.
A Must visit. Amazing view of the Merlion, the Flyer, Marina Sands and Marina bay and the Esplanade.

REVIEW_TITLE: clean with a good view of the river
REVIEW_BODY: This is a good location to see Singapore's famous Merlion. going to the park provided us the chance to walk along Esplanade and Raffles, making us see the other tourist spots near it.

Iconic Singapore. Pretty touristy, but it really is a beautiful spot to be a tourist. Marina Bay Sands on one side and the Singapore skyline on the other. I would definitely recommend visiting at night when the lights are out. Definitely can’t leave Singapore without a quick snap here!

My wife and I visited Merlion Park on a beautiful sunny day while strolling along the waterfront esplanade hand in hand. It was a romantic outing and an excellent opportunity for photos of the cityscape from multiple angles. The statue is right on the water, with the Marina Bay Sands in the background, so it presents stunning photo ops

i really love my trip in here with my beloved friends, have a great view and nice place. no rubbish even in every corner.
orang Indo bilang "gak afdol ke Singapura jika belum mengunjungi Merlion Park."
If u're in Singapore, you must provide ur time to visit here, even though 5minutes only :)
Have a nice trip fellow.!

Located near Marina Bay, this park is home to the Merlion, a half fish with a head of a lion. This mythical creature symbolizes Singapore's humble beginnings as a fishing village. Views here are breathtaking and a good place for photographs.

Lovely walking along the mosaic water feature down to the beachside. Lots of flowers to see along the way. Kids, and adults, can also have fun looking at themselves in the 'crazy mirrors' along the path.
A nice place to take your picture. Although the restaurant or food stalls sell drinking water at a very high price. 😂 limited choices for restaurants tho marina bay is just near the area.
I went there at night and the view was amazing! The city lights and the beautiful waters were awesome sights! Spent 3 hours taking pictures, strolling and even sat down and had a long talk!
The mythical Merlion with the head of a lion and the body of a fish is Singapore's national icon. A must see especially at night..
If you went to Singapore and never went to see the Merlion then you didn't really went to Singapore 😅

REVIEW_TITLE: I suppose it is the place you have to say you have been to
REVIEW_BODY: It clean and it is the place that everyone says they have been to in Singapore its worth it just to say you have been there

The most photographed symbol of Singapore is the Merlion a the Merlion park..A photograph or a selfie with the same will not complete your trip.

The park in itself is quite busy. There is a promenade that is lined with great restaurants. the ferry pick up point adds to the charm. The best sighting for the sound and light show also happens to be here.

So, be here. Especially in the evenings..the weather is slightly better

We were told this is a must visit place before we traveled so we were eagerly waiting to see this famous sculpture. We were not disappointed. The sight of it made us being in awe. Then we were even more surprised when we saw the baby merlion nearby which is not mentioned very often. The old hotel previously a post office is behind it and the famous Marina Bay Sands Hotel is on the other side of the bay. It makes the site very photogenic.
Its near so many atractions and activities so you will go there anyway. Great photos and breeze. And the veiw is great. Read about it before getting there that way its more impressive.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see symbol of Singapore and its Free to visit!!!
REVIEW_BODY: Its free to walk to the Merlion (half lion head and mermaid tail). You can take a bus, subway or taxi or uber to this place to admire the symbol of Singapore.
