REVIEW_TITLE: What's a Trip to Singapore Without Visiting the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is one of those things that you have to see when visiting Singapore, even if you go there every year. Depending on where you are positioned next to the Merlion, you could take some nice photos with Marina Bay Sands or the Singapore Flyer as the backdrop.
Nice view towards Marina Bay. But quite crowded as it's still one of Singapore icon. Would be nice if completed with reasonable amount of light on the park.

REVIEW_TITLE: A good place to cool down in the evening
REVIEW_BODY: My family and I visited here recently in the evening. We rode the MTR which was very convenient. This park is very nice at night with Pleasant lights and cool breezes. It is a good place to hang out and watch people. I also recommend walking around the Bayfront see what's happening.

I have visited this place a few years ago before. The surrounding area is really change now. It looks nicer with a lot of restaurants in the surrounding area. It's located close to the Fullerton hotel. It's a good place to visit.

If you are in Singapore, this is a must do! A trip to Singapore without a signature pic with Merlion is not complete.
Merlion is combination of Lion's Head and body that of Fish, in simple words.

Time: It would not require much time. You can stop by, click with Merlion and move on with some other activity. But it is good place to sit, relax, view the Skyline, Merlion, stroll around.
Many restaurants are also near by. So you can plan for a evening and then go to a restaurants.
Anytime is good time. Though evenings are beautiful!

It is open for public and no fee is required.
Raffles Place Station is the closest MRT stop.

I personally love this place and spent lot of hours. You can walk around and see the Esplanade domes, Art and Science Meusem, Flyer, Helix bridge, MBS Hotel, Fullerton Hotel among other things!

REVIEW_TITLE: just a land mark to photograph with
REVIEW_BODY: a place that everyone who goes to Singapore visits for sure, Nothing great about it just a photos taking spot to prove you went to singapore

What a great statue, must come visit and take some tourist pictures! Other things around to see, ice cream shops, cafes and gift wares. Great views of other famous landmarks like Marina Bay sands. We walked from the station took around 15 min.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good to spend 15 minutes for a picture with Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: Located by the Marina Bay, the Merlion is synonymous with Singapore (aka Lion city). I see lots of your buses making stops here too so that tourist get a memorable picture. This venue has a great view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel too. Definitely worth a visit on your maiden trip to Singapore.
its' consider as symbol of the city, good photo stop , has two status , boating options are available

REVIEW_TITLE: Seeing the difference between day and night
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is a big part of Singapore's history and also a beatiful work of art. The caption of my review must have caught your attention and I can say that the park is beatiful in the day but more beautiful at night the perfect mix of colors and the water fountain highlights the statue itself which makes it best to take creative shots that a tourist or traveller wants. Before you reach the park, if you pass by the bridge through walking you will be able to see the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands and all the other buildings with the pretty lights (perfect for panorama shots or any pic you want).

The picture-ready Merlion is just awesome. From the park, you can see the picture perfect view of Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Flyer on the opposite side, with esplanade theater to your left. And of course the view of Singapore river that tells its history and culture.

One of those attractions for the first time traveler to Singapore Locacted city side of the bay and close to old town the merlion attracts tourist from around the world Great free activity which the kids will love

Merlion is a landmark near the Central Business District (CBD). It is a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish and it is the symbol of Singapore. It is an outdoor attraction, if it is sunny it is going to be too hot and if it rains you will get wet! A couple of expensive restaurant can be found around the area. You can even get a boat through the river.
It has been always my dream to see the merlion and I made it a point that it will be my top priority during our visit. 😍

I went to Merlion Park in Singapore in the afternoon and it makes me feel hot and humid. It is a landmark of Singapore, which attracts many tourists’ visit. Lots of people are going there to have photos taken with Merlion. I raise my head and then open my mouth as if I am catching the water spurted from Merlion while standing away from it. A wonderful picture is done! I think it is a better choice to go walking in evening. The waterfront is alive with lights and buzzing people around during night time. It is also comfortable in the evening when you are walking along the bay and enjoy the cool breeze. There are some performances and entertainments in bleachers as well. You can go shopping and eating nearby when getting exhausted.
I had a great view of the city in Merlion, which is a choice for family trips. Well worth a visit.
Excellent Area. Very nice view for Photos. Good Place of amazing Photos and experience the overall views. Must watch place

Of course you have to see merlion if you are in singapore! However the walk from mrt station through fullerton, raffles, riverside is simply amazing. the view of marina bay from merlion is breathtaking. visit in evening for the best view.
It's a famous spot in Singapore, and you can walk beside the lake to the other famous hotel- Marina bay sands. It's worth to take a walk here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Snapping pictures with the iconic Merlion!
REVIEW_BODY: Was lucky enough to visit when it wasn't filed with tourists yet. After getting pictures of the Merlion, there's varietal choices of restaurants and cafes close by to freshen up yourself after a long walk under the sun! :)
Nice view and great for pictures. With a park nearby and a museum, and the river. Great for looking back at Singapore's history. Nice walk.

Like every attractions in singapore this is a 'must visit' place. We had a really great time. This place has plenty to offer; plenty restaurants and ice- cream parlour. You can enjoy the scenic view along with a bottleof chilled beer.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not so much activity but definitely not worth a miss
REVIEW_BODY: A very rare thing about this place is that it is one of the very few attractions which are free. There nothing much to do here other than take good pictures with the merlion and Singapore Flyer in the background. Also theres a good skyline of large buildings that can be a good picture background. But This is the emblem of Singapore so donot miss it, just club it with your visit to Gardens by the bay, which is nearby (just 6 SGD by UBER).

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Place - Merlion Park in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: It's a well known Tourist attraction in Singapore and it's Home to an 8.6 metres tall Water Spouting Merlion with the Head of a Lion and the Body of a Fish really it's awesome one must visit this place.

What a great experience! Even though we've been to this place too hot in the afternoon, we still manage to have a big smile on our faces. That very huge statue of Mermaid-Lion (Merlion) in that area will be a great place to remember. Now, we have had some experience/adventure to share in our friends, relatives and more, that we've been to that place and we have had our footprints leave there with a great experience. Very much terrific!
Excellent Views Of Modern Singapore. A nice tourist spot. A Must See if in Singapore. A Symbol for Singapore.

It was a nice view. Of course I had to bring my family here because a Singapore trip is not complete if you did not see the Merlion. It was a sunny day and there was a lot of tourist so we had a hard time taking great photos.

A night visit at the Merlion Park one of the signature places that should visit while in Singapore. We enjoy the walk going there from our hotel. It's a 5 to 10 minutes walk from Mandarin Oriental Singapore. A lot of people are going there to have a photo taken at the Merlion. Near or far with artistic touch and imagination, Voila! Having Fun!
Of course it's a must have shot on your photo album in Singapore. Not much else to do around it though, but it is a must! Great attraction for kids.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place for your Evening stroll
REVIEW_BODY:
You could enjoy nice relaxing evening stroll in Merlion park area. Good scope for testing your night photography skill. Nearest MRT is Raffles place.
From Merlion park, one could walk up to Esplanade mall and through Singapore river bridge. Very nice place for evening walk( even run). Watching High rise building , which are nicely lit and enjoy the breeze of Singapore river. Don't miss this place and walk around and end your evening with good meal near river front.
How else do you show that you were in Singapore? The must go place to take selfies when in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Quick view of iconic merlion for photo
REVIEW_BODY: Lots of people taking selfies at Merlion. Good views across the bay and a series of bars and restaurants along promenade..most not open until lunchtime. Most tourists find it difficult to find access across road network to reach it. We wouldn't rate it a "must see".

This is the most popular place in Singapore. You can reach by multiple way, boat, bus, cab. there are many photo shoot points. one side is Singapore Flyer, and gardens by the bay, other side Museum, art gallery, and Sky scrappers. Enjoy yourself by coffee and sea food.

REVIEW_TITLE: Swarming with Tourist wanting to click a pic
REVIEW_BODY: Highly overrated tourist spot. But guess anyone going to Singapore wants a pic in front of Merlions - the Symbol of Singapore. Other than that nothing much to write about. On the other side you can find the Singapore skyline with the 'Singapore Flyer' & 'Gardens of the Bay'. Go there only if you are a tourist dying for a pic to post on FB.

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconoic , should go to relax in the evening
REVIEW_BODY: Its Singapore's symbol and is a place worth the visit in the evening . Do the board walk to reach the Merlion park , take some photos , chill in the coffee shops along the way
This is symbolic place of Singapore the mer lion park and it's a very nice place from wherein you can see marina bay.
Love this place as always everytime visit Singapore Never get bored You can see all the beautiful Singapore from here

REVIEW_TITLE: Good views but nothing much to do
REVIEW_BODY: We wanted to go to Marina Bay Sands Observation deck for sunset, so decided to visit Merlion Park before that. We reached around 4:30pm and had enough time to kill after photography session. It was too hot too, so could not stay for long. Its not a park as such..dunno why it is called so. There are some eateries closeby so we had some sandwiches etc there and then walked to the Marina Bay Sands hotel. Its good to visit if you are in Singapore for the first time because Merlion is their national symbol, but otherwise nothing to do.
This is a great place to visit during evening or night to see the show but not day time. They are too crowded and hot. A great view of Marina Bay.

A must see location when visiting Singapore. Walk along the river and bays edge and take in the sights including the iconic merlion. Take a snap and grab a cold drink or ice cream from one of the many nearby establishments.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice to Walk Around or take a Boat
REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion Pak, located by the Marina Bay across Fullerton Hotel and connected to Esplanade Theatre by a pedestrian bridge, is a small paved park housing Merlion, the 8.6 m tall half fish half lion white statue sprouting water from its mouth. It symbolizes Singapore's humble start as a fishing town while also representing the country's original name, Singapura, which in Malay means lion city.
The park is not big with nothing much to see and is often crowded with people wanting to take photos of Merlion. There's however a lovely view of the bay with boats passing by and the unique looking Marina Bay Sands hotel across.
It's nice to walk around. You can cross the pedestrian bridge towards the Esplanade Theatre where you can watch shows, relax on the open platform by the bay, eat at the restaurants or hawkers foodcourt nearby (Makan Sutra).
You can also cross the street towards the Fullerton Hotel, walk on the historic Cavenagh Bridge to the Asian Civilisation Museum or take a boat around the Singapore River or to Clarke Quay for dinner.
At night the area is especially awesome when lighted and on special occasions such as New Year we can watch cool fireworks.

REVIEW_TITLE: just tourist icon with not surprise
REVIEW_BODY: clean surrounding and well plan area made this iconic Merlion still be magnet for all tourists. should visit in the evening and walk to the Esplanade or Helix bridge for sunset scene.
Singapore Tour will never be complete going to this park. It can get crowded as it is not just popular to tourist but also for locals. Free of charge, it basically an open park.
The Merlion statue in Merlion park lies on the bank of the river Singapore. One can take photos and walk along the river trail. There is also a cruise in the river. Nice to spend the evening time.
Cann't avoid the merlion statue during singapore visit.The walk on the quay side of the river & the photography will be the main attarction here. The lazer show during the night will pull the crowd.

Its a very crowded tourist spot. It has easy access, just a 5mins walk from the nearest MRT station. Do use your sunscreen, wear hats / bring an umbrella, its really hot here, there are lots of shops nearby selling drinks and ice cream.

A free tourist spot and must visit of Singapore. You may need prepare your own umbrella. There are huge amount of tourists. I guess the only time where the place is less visitors are the mid-noon which is so hot with sun right up above your head.
The setting of the Merlion in the water is lovely and a good photo opportunity. There are some little cafes and candy stores nearby though they are very expensive
Nice little tourist attraction, the whole family loved it, they even give you a good luck coin, kids thought that was great, plus there are two great lookouts for photo's

It's a must see for new visitor or if this is the only time you visit Singapore. Otherwise just skip it as there are too many tourists here (or it's just me I'm not into crowd place perhaps)
Small park compares to others; few attracted points (like the orchid walk) but I would rather go visit the Orchid garden instead

Must visit photo stop in Singapore, your Singapore's visit can't be complete without it. you will experience a good view of marina bay sands hotel, Singapore flyer and area around it. Must visit this place !!
You should visit to Merlion Park. It's near Esplanade bridge. A lot of people visit here. It's hard to take selfie.
My visit happened to coincide with the national day and it was full. The visit was easy however using the cable car from fabre hills. would recommend though we didn't go in the merlion.
One of the most visited places. Good sourroundings agood restaurants around enjoy the evening with good food and drinks
Beside the sea, the Merlions stand. With a mermaid tail and a lion head, the biggest Merlion looks extremely beautiful. The true landmark of singapore!

Singapore's signature postal photo with Merlion on it is a must have in your tour photo op album

Except for the fact that it is an iconic statue..the significance of a creation with lion's head and mermaid's tail is on account of Singapore being a lion city built on a fish village

The walk around it is beautiful..with some nice cafes on the bay

Visited this place in December 2015. There are two Merlion Lions in Singapore. One is located in the Merlion Park and the other one being in Sentosa Island. Make sure one visits both. the one in the Merlion Park is the actual one. Its awesome. One can have the full glimpse of the Marina Bay Sands while standing on the Merlion Park. Enjoy the beauty of the place. The true sense of Singapore city with the high rise buildings and the walk by the side of the river can be felt at the Merlion Park. Visit it. If possible, visit it more than once. you would just fall in love with the place.
You must come to here when visit Singapore. Love the night view, really great and beautiful place to come. You can get your dinner here..

You would see Merlion picture on many brochures. It gives good view of buildings at Marina Bay and Water Front. Basically it is close to Promenade and Esplanade. Take lot of pictures and see lights, water and find music also.
Its nice to be, but if you can better during the evening as in the morning it will be hot and humid if you have to, dont forgot to bring an umbrella hat and water to drink.
Merlion Status Is just monument. Just to watch that & take a picture . For roaming around not more than 10 minutes . Starbucks coffee place is there.
offers good photo taking background, breezy place, can catch a boat ride along the Singapore river and cafes nearby.
We are family of four with kids 12 n 8 and we enjoy this place.. The Lion looks awesome when it reflects with colors. Beautiful scenery. Must visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: See the Merlion the signature of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Visited Merlion Park in the afternoon, was ideal in terms of the crowd rush. A place to spend some good time amongst flocking foreign tourists and lot of photo op for all family.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to walk around and explore.
REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion park is a landmark so it's a must visit when you're in Singapore. Other than taking photos with the Merlion you can have lunch or dinner at one of the restaurants.

As we had other plans after taking lots of pictures with the Merlion we walked to the other side via Jubilee bridge and walked on the path to Helix bridge which connects to the Marina Bay Sands shopping centre.

The coconut ice cream is great, you will see a stall on the way. They put a scoop of coconut ice cream in half a coconut shell and also offer a free glass of coconut water.

After a little walk you'll get to the helix bridge where you can enjoy ice cream sandwiches made at the spot by an old man. It's quite famous and yummy. You have great views from the helix bridge; you'll be able to see a lotus shaped building which is the science museum, marina bay sands building, Merlion, the financial hub. If you go around 6:30 - 7pm you'll be able to experience the magical lights on the bridge.

REVIEW_TITLE: Go for the Merlion, stay for the tourists.
REVIEW_BODY: Whilst the main attraction is supposed to be the Merlion statue it wont hold your attention very long. You can spend far longer watching the tourists taking their souvenir photos - tres entertainment!
The view is fantastic. Fancy restaurants and crowd are what we always find here. Listed as the first thing to visit if you have not gone to Spore.

REVIEW_TITLE: crowded but a landmark you could not miss
REVIEW_BODY: A landmark for Singapore and a landmark for tourists visiting Singapore to take a picture with. Got hot during the day, but luckily there are many stalls selling refershments in the area.

Free & around Marina Bay Area, found it much busier in the evening and lots of people taking pics around Merlion. Water starts at 7am, not sure when water is shut off... walked by close to midnight and was still shooting water.
This is a great place to visit. For photoshot, for boating and for some good food at nearby restaurants.

Iconic place in Singapore to take photos. Lots of tourists. We took a boat around the harbour too which worked well as you could get the merlion from a different angle and it gave you lots at history and info about the local area. There are a few places to eat/drink/icecream around the statues. They are very expensive. Even water was triple what we had been paying elsewhere. Toilets were nice and clean though. We walked to the Gardens by the Bay from here which took about 25 mins across the Helix bridge.

Great view of Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore skyline. Definitely a must to take a picture with the water spewing half lion half fish Singapore icon. Other than that, nothing much to do around there.
Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore so its worth a visit to Merlion park. Its a free attraction which is hard to find in Singapore. Some good time can be spent there.

Great place for a photo shoot ops. Free entry and lot of food and drink options. Great place to see the marina sands hotel and merlion statue national symbol of Singapore
Worst thing is no proper seating arrangements. You have to buy something to get a chair (especially for Elders )
This is a must see attraction for every tourist visiting Singapore A picture clicked at this place is a must have
Symbol of singapore ! One must go there in evening to get good photos around ! & in night the view is awesome ! Highly recommended !! ++ =)
A best spot to say "i visited singapore" is by selfie with the merlion behind you.. So you can see a lot of people took their photo there with a lot of style.. :)
A quick stop here to see the Merlion. This was very busy, but a must if you come to Singapore. We also saw a group of otters in the water making alot of noise.
This the mecca of photo spots. You get some of the best pictures here. Other than that the Merlion itself is quite modest and unassuming.

The park, overlooking the bay with the Flyer and Marina Bay Sands hotel is a tourist magnet. It houses two of the Merlions the mum and son.
The father is located on Sentosa island and is well worth a look as are these two. A must for some great photos and remember to bring your selfie stick.
The park was busy but you could still get some great photos.
Top tip.
DO NOT BUY FOOD or DRINK FROM THIS AREA.
3 ice lollies and a bottle of water was £14.00

Top tip,
Take a river cruise from Clarke's Quay to get great photos from the water of the Merlions.

Its a statue of a lion to symbolise Singapore
Not many ppl know the history ,so didn't get to know much more about it and its more of a tourist attraction its worth a visit, if you don't have much time just take snaps and go but if you have time
There are fish in the river and restaurants and bars too ,a nice way to while away a few hours

Within walking distance of the Helix bridge and other attractions

Its the merlion which stands tall in the waters..it is an animal with a lions head and fish tail.
Basically its a fountain.
At night the lion is extremely colourful with lights..
The place is good is clicking some memorable pictures.
Take a walk on the shores....

While we enjoyed the waterfront promenade/marina, the Merlion by itself was just ok. Good to get in the sight and click a few pictures (try one where the water appears to spout out of your mouth) but nothing much more than a typical tourist spot.

The Merlion park is located near the famous Fullerton Hotel and the Esplanade, with magnificent views of the stunning Marina Bay area.The mythical Merlion is the major Iconic statue of Singapore with the body of a fish & head of a lion, spouting water from its mouth. This is located near Marina Bay, it is a major tourist attraction in Singapore.There is also a smaller Merlion statue in the park, known as the ‘Merlion cub’. A must see for tourist visiting Singapore.
Lovely island of sentosa, lots to see and do. Good restaraunts, interesting and informative. Cable car there and back reasonably priced. Avoid universal studios though

This place is great to be at as from sunset and night. Because you are able to see the beautiful lights and laser performance that they have from across at Marina Bay Sands. We took a nice walk all along there passing the Esplanade bridge to the other side where you see lots of bars and cafes.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very Nice Place for A Photo
REVIEW_BODY: I visited Singapore in June 2016 on business. My wife, son and daughter joined me. You can walk to Merlion Park from Raffles Place by passing through the Fullerton Hotel and the underground moving sidewalks. The Merlion is a famous statue, You can take many photos of the Merlion and also the skyline and the Marina Bay Sands. Near the Merlion Park is where you can get the Singapore River boat ride.

This place is hot, warm and sunny during the day time. very pleasant place to spend your evening till late. Good food and drink available around. Photographers need to have a tripod. In August the moon rises right behind the Marina Bay Sands which is a very pretty scene to enjoy.
Great located between Marina Bay and the skyline of Singapore. There are a lot of tourist....it's a must to see about the view
Visit this place in the evening, a bit crowded. But nice/ enjoying taking photos with Merlion and Marina bay Sands including Esplanade. Seem that everyone loved it

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place for hangout at afternoon
REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to Waiting for laser show. Great view and the boat to cruise the river very nice. The light from Singapore flyer give more attractive view

When I first came to Singapore in the 60's. the Merlion was an outstanding feature. Now poor Merlion is dwarfed by all the skyscrapers, but on a Sunday, or any day really, it is still there. You just have to look!
Nice photo spot, but a little bit crowded , i'm going here in the morning but the people has already here too, nice place, great scenery , singapore landmark

Alight at Raffles place MRT and turn on your location and reach the merlion park. Just 5 min walk from MRT.. While on the way you can experience scenic view of river quay and high storey modern buildings. Once you reach the park you can see this majestic animal standing tall. This place has great view of marina bay sands tower and other modern buildings... Must visit place.

been here a couple of times, my 6 yr old grandson loves it, great gardens and plenty to see, the view from the top of the merlion is great, its free around the gardens but costs to go up on top of merlion
From what we could sort of see through the scaffolding the Merlion is a lovely statue. We went back the next day hoping for a better view. It was covered with a tarp.
Love the screen display and the party atmosphere.Added fun to the holiday with the music and the various displays

We took one of the duck tours by the Merlion and was glad we did- the crowds around the Merlion statue were thick. Whether by foot or boat, you should stop by and see this iconic symbol. It's impressive in person. They have a viewing area built out to see the bay as well as get a good selfie with the statue. You a,so get a great view of marina bay sands hotel and the art science museum and the double helix bridge. There are several restaurants along the promenade where you could spend some time relaxing. The Merlion was under refurbishment when we got close, but I'm sure it looks great now.

Visiting the Merlion Park has been the highlight of our trip in Singapore. This landmark represents the beauty of Singapore. My family and I visited this place on our third day in Singapore and we found this place so crowded with tourists and it's almost impossible to get a clear shot of the Merlion statue. The location is superb with a lovely view of the Marina Bay Sands in the background. The park is quite a long walk from Raffles Place MRT station but nevertheless we enjoyed the walk along the river. It would be best to visit this place first thing in the morning to avoid the crowd.
The Merlion has just been refurbished and it looks fabulous. Everything all around this area is very attractive, perfect location for tourist snaps and watching the world go by. Very nice

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful place for an evening outing
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion Park with the iconic Merlion with water gushing from its mouth is a wonderful place for any time of the day, though I prefer in the evening with a beautiful view of the Marina Bay and Marina Bay Sands across the Singapore River. There are innumerable eating joints serving variety of cuisine.
Sitting on the steps at the foot of the Merlion watching the lights come on across the bay is a beautiful experience. One may take a cruise on the Singapore River going past Clarke Quay and Boat Quayand then return to watch a ten minutes laser show in Marina Bay.
Not to be mussed at all when in Singapore.
Iconic symbol of Singapore. Of course, the Merlion is the picture of Singapore. You have to come here when you visit Singapore. The place is well maintained.

Don't get me wrong, the Merlion statue is something that you HAVE TO DO when you're in Singapore. However, the crowds of tourists make it a dreadful experience. We happened to get there at the same time as two tour buses of people. The selfies, pictures like your holding the Merlion, catching the water... Annoying. I don't think any of them saw the Merlion because they were too busy taking wacky pictures.
Honestly, you have to go, but the Merlion on Sentosa is much better.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great photos on a clear day
REVIEW_BODY:
Basically went to take photos, weren't disappointed with the backdrop of the marina bay sands across the bay. Didn't see a lot in the way of food outlets around the big Lion at Merlion which was disappointing. Did see hordes of other photo seeking tourists on a Sunday afternoon, hard to find a clear spot for a photo in this peak time. Probably better to pick a quieter time like the morning.
Not much to do for kids by the way, ours found it a bit boring coz not really into nice backgrounds and photos.

REVIEW_TITLE: An historic and central part of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The merlion looks much smaller than imagined but it proudly sits central to the marina bay and singapore river area. Worth coming to have a look and savour the area.

If you are in Singapore, this is a must visit. As the symbol of the city state, it attracts a lot of tourists all around the day. There's some "competition" to get a position for good photo shots; some of the tourists are quite pushy.

I am actually quite fond of the smaller Merlion in the park. It's a cute statute, just about the human size.

The Fullerton Hotel, a former central post office, gives a nice touch to the area. There are some nice sculptures by the hotel that you see on the way from the Raffles Place MRT station.
Merlion park is great. We were there early in the morning and it was busy. I think it's busy all the time. Great view of Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Eye.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit in the Garden City of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park is a must visit attraction when in Singapore as it is a significant icon of the Lion City and a legend as well. Walk around the Fullerton Bay area as well as across the Jubilee Bridge to visit the Iconic Esplanade as well.

This popular site is best visited early morning or around sunset as at these times you are more likely to get the best photos and it is usually less crowded. Furthermore, you will avoid the searing heat of the day.
Don't forget to take a hat as there is little shade about and make sure you apply plenty of sunscreen if visiting late morning or early afternoon.
A walk along the adjacent Marina Bay is well worth while.
The symbol of Singapore.. Great to visit place during sunset to see the light effect on it. Nice to walk along Marina Bay. Lots of activities around. Love to visit again:)

The icon of Singapore Merlion is locatef in this harbour side park. The place is more beautiful in the night with full illuminated Singapore skyline unwonding before you. The place is full of tourists and locals and is a vey popular eveninv hsngout. You have all cafes ans seafood eateries around. Real happening plsce and must visit in Singapore.

The Merlion (a mermaid with lion's head) has somehow become symbolic representation of Singapore. It's a 8.6 m tall statue with water spouting from it's mouth. As such there is nothing else at the Merlion Park but as the sun sets and lights are put on the view becomes breathtaking. The Marina Bay Hotel & Singapore Flyer on the other side, Esplanade just a short distance away, and boats floating in the Singapore river, present a view that make a lasting image. And if you happen to be there when the laser show starts at Marina Hotel, its a bonus.

Don't forget to carry your camera along and there is no entry ticket.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Very Nice Place for an Urban Walk
REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore is mostly about enjoying urban life and marveling at architectural wonders. The Merlion Park is not an exception.

It is basically a place where there is a large fountain with the figure of a "Merlion" where people flock in to take photographs and to take lively strolls around the area.

We enjoyed our walk and took a lot of photographs; time well spent.

I'm super duper exhausted when i'm arrived at night (it's around 10pm) So i just sit at the stairs and enjoy the scenery. (I'm taking some photos but because "the exhausted" it end up sooo bad. So i won't upload hehe)

Great view of the Harbour and the Marina Hotel and Shoppes. The view is spectacular and would even say is more beautiful on this side as you can see the skyline and marina from the Eaplanade. Loved it. Marina lights and laser show is different from this side. Great as well.

Its a beautiful park with the lion standing tall. Place is well maintained and there lot of coffee shops and restaurants around to experience. Must place to visit for the beauty of the lion and make sure to take your camera to click.
Worth visiting and you can take some creative photos alongside the merlion which has water spouting from its mouth.
You must visit it (in fact there are other 3 ones in the city, but this is the most famous lion). Take as much pictures as you can. They will be nice.

The views of this place alone were amazing, but then to go up the top of the Merlion and learn of the history of Singapore was something else to behold. Was one of the highlights of our trip to Singapore.

It's not difficult to reach this park. It's walking distance to Raffles Station. The park is always crowded. It's challenging to take a good shot without a photobomber. But if you go to Singapore, Merlion park is a must. Even a few hours before your flight, you can drop by here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting place to go. Very fast attraction.
REVIEW_BODY: The park is right across from the Marina Bay. From there you can see Singapore's skyline and the bay area. Take some nice pictures and in 15-20 minutes you are ready to go to the next one.
Even though it is always crowded it is an absolute must to go there and take a photo with the Merlion, the symbol of Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Place to see if you are passing by
REVIEW_BODY: i recommend the Boat Cruise in Marina Bay, and when you do it you will cover almost all the attractions around Marina Bay and this is one of them. otherwise it is super crowded , but a National Symbol of Singapore.

The merlion park is not extremely beautiful or breath taking. There is nothing special to do there. But visitors throng the small area. WHY? there are a few valid reasons, For one, it is one of the few places where entry is free. The merlion is a historical monument . Further , the view of the city especially after sunset is breathtaking. Go ahead and click a few photographs with the merlion and the city line in the background. Nice place to spend an evening!

We visited the place sometime after the sunset. We found it was brimming with people. The view was awesome with the Singapore coastline. You can see other iconic buidlings here. Its quite well maintained and offers a great evening experience1

REVIEW_TITLE: The place was nice and crowded too
REVIEW_BODY: The place was nice,lovely so crowded full of tourist,the route to there by Mrt just take the EW line then go down at Raffles Place then take Exit H,turn right the Merlion place is accross the Fullorton Hotel

REVIEW_TITLE: Superb place with a great view
REVIEW_BODY: It is right by the water and offers great views of the city. It is mostly crowded with tourists and locals but very well maintained nevertheless.
One of the beautiful landmarks of the Singapore. Well maintained and well illuminated at night. Must visit in day and night to enjoy the beauty of the Merlion Park.

This statue is famous to Singapore. So, if you are in Singapore I think it's a must see. During peak hours it gets very crowded. You can get some great pictures of not only the Merlion but other unique buildings of Singapore. There is a souvenir shop and places to eat there. Also, the Fullerton is across the street,
It's a great park when we visited in 1978.it's an awesome fountain in those days.try to go there in the evening to enjoy a lot. You can watch wonderful view.

I dont know if its because its peak season when we visit Singapore or there are really too many people now in Singapore. Thats why we didnt enjoy much the Merlion Park because there are a lot of people.

Singapore, it was a small country but really disciplined And that's really amazing!! My sister and I took a tour package from the airport for like $85 each, (it comes with the city tour, boat ride and the Singapore zoo entrance ticket as well, and a train card each) not knowing that its a walking tour, I was just shocked,coz we're a bit tired of walking, coming from our place to go anywhere, bus here, and ride a train then transfer to another and another train again (and I've never try to have a walking tour :) ) And every place we go, the tour guide will just give us 10 mins to take picture and then move to another destination! So yeah, 10 minutes won't be enough for you not just to take pictures but to appreciate and roam around a bit on that certain place. and the thing is, its hard to find room to have a picture in front of the Merlion! it took us around 5 mins to get a good spot! ''long queue'' seriously! :) and there was an old man (his Chinese) while my sister is taking my photo he just get near of me and touch my arm and tell me to move! because he wants to take lots of photos again! (knowing we waited for them to finished first) and my camera is a Polaroid what a waste of film!, he did it like thrice :) but we just ignored him and then leave! We need to hurry coz we we're the only missing from our group and proceed to the boat ride! and that's he best part of the tour!
The Tour Guide is really nice tho,

But yeah, I suggest if you'll come to SG just search where you wanna go! Coz as I said, its a small country so, and all the train stations are connected and usually downstairs there'll be a bus station, you just need to check the number, coz each number travels different ways, and yeah, before I forget better visit SG on 2020 coz when we went there last June (2016) and there are a lot of road works there, and he said that those road workers are planned to be tunnels, for train, coz the gov't. wants to make a train that would bring their people home in just 7 mins, in other words they'll have train station near their houses. Amazing aye?! Hope we can go there again! So we can see the difference
All in all, it was really nice experience, but I think, its kinda pricey there, but my sister and I are good with budgeting our money, so yeah, we usually eat in the food stands in train station to save money! For just like $2.5-$4 each we got rice and dish already its yummy and healthy! and we're full! Rather than eating in fast foods and restos which is way expensive! Coz we once ate in burger king and we spent $25.

REVIEW_TITLE: Just Awesome. I have no other words
REVIEW_BODY: Take your family with you when you visit. A lot of tourists there but there is enough room to enjoy the park. Very refreshing and breathtaking view.

This was the very last thing we did in Singapore and my daughter loved it. Of course she posed as if she were drinking the water just like everyone else but we had to do it! The park is clean and neat and beautifully lit at night. Next time we will see it during the day!
GO there when in the morning or evening so you will not be toasted in the hot humid weather. Get that best shot for your instagram post.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice Cool evening walk, enjoy the sigt of singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Cool walk, may be even sip few drinks by the various restaurants and bars. Iconic place in Singapore. very good city views and most photogenic place
If you visit Singapore for first time I think it's good to have city tour and 100% they will take you to Merlion Park with guide tour who will tell you the story of lions land and so on ! ...
5 star for the picture...other than that, there's nothing else to do here. The merlion with water out of it's mouth looks like he's upchucking :)

REVIEW_TITLE: Good places to get few pictures
REVIEW_BODY: Its a nice place to visit for getting some pictures clicked. You can have singapore skyline, marina bay and ofcourse merlion in the background. They have few restaurants around here too.

was here last July 15, 2016 with my family. i was expecting to see a lot of historical stuff but was disappointed to see that it didn't have much. although the top of the merlion gave a wonderful 360 degrees view of the whole sentosa island but that was about it. its a good option but i would not really recommend it being in the must-see attractions in Singapore.

It will be blazing hot. And if you are bringing younger kids with pram or wheel chair, and you are taking mrt, please exit from esplenade station. Even though raffles place station is closer, but the ramp is only accessible from esplenade.
SG Landmark in front SG river. In this area there are lots of good backgrounds and awesome backdrop for photoshoot.

You need to be here if you visit Singapore. Travelling to Singapore and getting your photo with the Merlion in the background is a must. Hot and stuffy in the afternoon, so be there early morning or late in the evening on in the nights.

The Merloin was great and a lot larger than I expected. Good setup in the park area with lots of seating and clean too. Get a river cruise from near the Merlion and it explains a lot about the origin of this mythical creature.
This is a must do while in Singapore Great location, great holiday snaps and sums up Singapore nicely.
The iconic Merlion is worth a look, but the park is overrun by people doing the same! You can catch water tours from here as well if you're keen.

REVIEW_TITLE: Spend evening and see light show
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion park is iconic place to visit. Get some coffee and sit on the bank to ser sun set. When we went it was crowded and was bit humid. Still we had good time seeing light show. One can take Ferry during light show. Nearby mall had some music concert going on. Plan for a evening covering Flyer, Merlion and light show.
We thought we were in the wrong place as the statue is rather small. We took the mandatory photo and left because there isn't much to see or do there.

The best time to stroll around is at night where the glittering lights appear. If you want a long walk to enjoy the view you can start from Marina bay, it's too far for me Raffles and Esplanade are the nearest. Try to find the baby merlion within thw area it's kinda cute. If already tired and hungry fo straight to makansutra.Wait until 8-9pm and see the spectacular light show of the marina.
suggest to go at morning or evening time because it is very hot you can take the picture at the bridge

Whenever I visit Singapore, I love to go to this place! Usually I take MRT to Raffles Place exit H, cross the Cavenagh Bridge then head towards Merlion Park, it's quite a long way but really has a nice view.
You will have a great photo-shoot time in this place! It's just beautiful!

After 4 visits to Singapore in the last 4 years we finally decided to visit Merlion Park after having gone past it a few times on the bum boats.

In short - it was fun - because everyone there was having fun, posing for photos with the water pouring into their mouths/cupped hands etc.

We walked from Raffles place MRT station (about 5 minutes) & then back to Clarke Quay (where we were staying - which was a casual 1km+ along the river).

The whole walk gives you a really good idea re how easy it is to get to things & around Singapore.

Tip: make the river walk & Merlion Park part of your Singapore experience - it's a great orientation exercise.

The iconic landmark that defines Singapore. This park is the host to the "Mamma" Merlion along with the "Baby" Merlion. Water squirting Mamma Merlion provides a great backdrop for taking pictures. The photo collection is incomplete without a picture of this place.

The walk toward the Merlion was enjoyable as the view of the river and the buildings was great. There were a lot of people there so getting a good shot would be tricky. I suggest getting up on one of the seats to get a less crowded shot of the sights.
You can also enjoy your afternoon tea in one of the restaurants.
There is not much to see there. Its nice to get a picture of the merlions, but nothing else really to do.
The Merlion - one of Singapore's famous landmarks. A must photo op when in Singapore.. Don't forget to take a snap of the "Mercub" just behind his dad... 😋

Loved the Merlions. I know maintenance must be done sometime but too bad it was the day I was there so didn't see water coming out the Merlion mouth. The park and surrounding area is beautiful though. I looked in many places in Singapore trying to find a Merlion charm for my charm bracelet and never found one ---
Been to Merilion park with family!! Awesome tourist attraction!! They maintain it so well. A must visit!!
Its worth the visit at Singapore.. Kids can explore the merlion close and it's ideal for photo shoots. Best to go in the mornings.

Great Place ! Its surrounded by the best of skyscrapers, lovely walk on the creek. People are loving the MERLION surrounded by the ambience. Yes, I recommend all the visitors who tour SINGAPORE. This is a great place to see. Amazing.

I accepted it to be different. How? Not too sure.

There were about 2 buses of Chinese tourists when we arrived at 10 am in the morning making it crowded to try and get that photo opportunity. But we persisted and we got a good photo.
highlight of singapore is this merlion. nice place to click pictures.view is amazing.always crowded by tourists.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit if you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This place is a must visit if you are in Singapore and want to take back a souvenir picture. This is situated next to marina bay which makes it an idealistic spot for late evening acivity

If it's a nice day or night out, make a visit to this park! With plenty of open space for walking around, the views at this park is pretty nice. Not only do you have a good view of the water with Marina Bay Sands Hotel in the background, you can also see part of the city as well.

The park itself is clean and pretty well maintained. I visited this place both during the day and at night and the views are equally pleasing.

If it's near the holidays (like New Years Eve), this place can get pretty packed quickly. Overall, I recommend coming here at night if you're pressed for time since the views are prettier when the city is lit up.

When we hear the name singapore, the first thing come to mind is merlion park.the place is more for taking pictures.nothing else to do there.i visited in afternoon.it was so hot and sunny.better time to visit might be after 5.30pm
Merlion is a must see, and it's only opposite the famous garden and marina's bay! So you should definitely visit the merlion and take pictures with it!

The merlion park is awesome. There are two merlion statue there, mother and baby merlion. We can take many photo there, but it was many people during weekend.
Evening is the good time for visiting this park, considering the weather is very hot at day and the evening many light on buildings surrounding the park are turn on. It was a beautiful place to visit in singapore.
Been to singapore many times, i hardly skip this venue. Always fascinating, both at noon or night. Superb view to the Marina Bay Sands, the Merlion Statue, Esplanade, and Singapore Flyers.

It is a unique statue of Merlion . He brings wealth who holds him in his palm. After shifting Merlion from the original position to a new one across flyover resulting Singapore economy in downward mode & is not growing.

The Merilon Park is part of a large walking complex. From here you can go along Marina Bay seashore. The place is nothing really special. The merlion looks strange, but it is still good as a background for your photo. Not many your friends will have a photo with such strange creature :-)
Merlion Park is one of the iconic places of Singapore. It is a very scenic spot, and good for photo session.
We approached Merlion Park from water while on the DuckTour. It looks as beautiful, from new prospective , away from crowds . We recommend.

REVIEW_TITLE: A trademark of Singapore overlooking at the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Must visit location, accesible from several directions within the city of Singapore. Dining options at short walking distance and point of departure for a number of tours and river cruises.

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely spot on a lovely day
REVIEW_BODY: What a lovely place, the Merlion is a true icon in Singapore and this statue is a good photo opportunity. Across from Marina Bay Sands it allows you to get great photos across the harbor. There is always a lot of people around so it may take some time to get a good pic. Be careful of those selfie sticks – they are everywhere

The Merlion is the mythical symbol of Singapore, situated at the Merlion Park at Marina Bay. The statue is a creature that is a cross between a fish and a lion, spouting water out from the mouth into the river. This famous imaginary beast attracts over a million visitors per year. The park itself has a nice setting with terraced seating offering great views of Singapore's city skyline and landmarks as well as scenic waterfront. Nearby there are lots of shops selling souvenirs, especially of Merlion icons such as refrigerator magnets, T-shirts, key chains and photo frames.
I was looking forward to the famed Merlion. As my luck would have it the place was undergoing renovation. We took a few selfies after our Bum boat ride on the Singapore River.

While in Singapore, do visit one of these two ( Merlion Park boat cruise / Singapore Flyer ). ( check out my review on Singapore Flyer ).
The Merlion is an icon of Singapore and has the head of a lion and the tail of a fish and its essentially a trading port. The Merlion Park has the original Merlion Statue ( the other one being in Sentosa ) overlooking the Singapore River. Its where you take a history tour of some of the iconic buildings in and around Singapore on a boat. Its a guided boat cruise and you get to see some of the well known buildings during the cruise ( like the Fullerton hotel ). You may stroll around the park , but don't miss out the fantastic view of the Marina Bay sands hotel from the Park and do enjoy your boat ride !

Amazing Hotel... We had a 4 days stay at the hotel, service was excellent , location is the best, accessible to train station without going out on a hot days, Marina Bay Shoppes is superb, within walking distance from most attractions restaurants everywhere close by staff are excellent and no problem on anything, Infinity pool is the best Experience so far, will definitely come back for a longer stay... Overall visit in Singapore is a pleasant experience, we've been in many countries and places but SG is the most of everything... Transportation specially... No worries of going late anywhere you go....specially catching a flight..⚡️
From long time The Merlion has been the Iconic landmark for singapore. Beautiful view of Marina bay sands.

REVIEW_TITLE: Too touristy and overcrowded but synonymous with Singapore visit
REVIEW_BODY: When you say Singapore ,the Merlion Park comes into your mind with fraction of seconds ! We visited this place amidst full house( packed with people and taking the humidity to next level).The view view from this park is amazing ,you can see the Marine Bay and you also have the option to take small boat rides which are not very expensive!!
Here..we can see the country symbol (icon) from singapore. And the park is also beautiful and clean.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion is Singapore and Singapore Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore, you have to be at the Merlion. A photo with the Merlion can become your profile pic. Though crowded, this place near the Fullerton Hotel provides ample photo ops using a selfie stick. Please note: Without a Selfie stick you may not be able to click a perfect pic with the Merlion. The Merlion park as it is called offers photo ops from many angles including one on top of the hanging bridge nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: The signature place to be for tourists.
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place and view. A lot of people here taking pictures. Its hard to have a clear solo picture since its a crowded place. Anyway its free so no complains. A must see for travellers like me.

REVIEW_TITLE: It's OK but a bit of a travel cliche
REVIEW_BODY: The good thing about this attraction is that you can get your photo taken next to the Merlion. The bad things are that's about all you can do. Overall, there are many more interesting places that you can visit in Singapore (for example, the Singapore Flyer is close by and much more fun).
good view and the merlion still not change. i hope at nite more have attractive light so more colourfull and pretty.. cheers..
This is a beautiful place to visit. The Merlion is the famous statue of Singapore. You get a scenic view of the skyline. It is worth visiting.

Situated centrally at Singapore waterfront this park provides photo taking area with the famous water throwing Merlion Statue in thr background.
There are many cafes, restaurants and.bars adjacent to the park and the Fullerton Hotel is just opposite the park.
Area is easily accessiblr by Train. Taxi and buses.
Recommend to visit in the late afternoon and evening when the sun id not do hot.

REVIEW_TITLE: Your visit is incomplete without seeing MERLION!
REVIEW_BODY: Day, Night, Down or dusk. Doesn't matter. One of the best attractions of SG. STUNNING views in any direction and in any time of the day! If r visitor then this attraction is a must & your visit is incomplete without seeing MERLION! 🌟⭐️🌟⭐️🌟

You haven't been in Singapore if you are not here yet, but its an outside activity so not so good while raining and will be a little bit hard for you to took a good picture because a lot of people there
We stayed here in the afternoon while waiting for our next tour to see the wings of time.Interesting and relaxing place to see.
There are two merlions and IMO the sentosa merlion is better. The park is a good place for the kids to play around.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion the iconic structure of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is star attraction, the river cruise is around Merlion and old Singapore is worthwhile to see historical monuments and travel back in time.
its a good place to take photos and relax and cool a little with the water spray coming from the statue
We enjoyed our walk around the small inland bay and ended up in this park that gives a nice view in evening of Singapore by night
Merlion Park the symbol of Singapore allows great photo opportunity for the visitors, try visit in the night time
Just a nice and place for photography... place is always crowded with visitors, but a must place to visit during your trip

This was an amazing place.We went on the river boat which told you all about the history of Singapore.The place is stunning at night when it is a lit up. Lovely art pieces everywhere.The merlion is a must see.Lovely places to eat & drink. Loved it here.
Merlion park is actually a symbol of Singapore. I interpret it as Singapore's symbol because it is also like Singapore: Calm like a Mermaid and strong like a lion.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view of the river and City..
REVIEW_BODY: From here you can get a great view of the Singapore and also enjoy a small boat ride which is really nice and relaxing. The place also offers some great dining opportunities and fast food cafe's which has some great food to offer.
Kids loved this and the story behind the mermaid lion. Beautiful to see and well worth the visit. One of Singapore must see attractions.

If you think Singapore, you think Merlion. Half lion, half mermaid..Chinese believe water means wealth and hence Merlion always spills water for prosperity. You can enjoy this place any time of the day. Mainly sight seeing place. Not much to do just sit and relax and click loads of selfies.

REVIEW_TITLE: Its just that. Just that statue.
REVIEW_BODY: Totally skippable but if you want to prove you were there, then please go visit. But its just that, just that statue spewing water. Its just off a very important road, so make sure you have organized your transport before getting there.

The Merlion Park is a good place for photo taking with Marina Bays Sands as the backdrop.

There is a smaller Merlion a couple of meters away from the Big Merlion.

After photos taking, you may visit one of the many eateries at Fullerton. They served food from all over the world.

After dinner, you may want to walk along Singapore River towards Boat Quay or Clarke Quay for drinks. There are many eateries there too.

If you want across the Singapore River, you may visit Esplanade, Marina Square, Suntec and Millennium Walk. Many shops to shop.

At the back of Merlion Park is the Fulllerton Hotel which used to be the Singapore General Post Office.
There is a historical significance to this structure which makes it more interesting. Avoid the afternoon visit. It is hot as hell. Lots of eateries available. Good for photo freaks!

I guess you shouldn't visit Singapore without seeing the national figure - the Merlion. But, apart from taking the obligatory photo of the Merlion spitting water into your own mouth, the best reason to visit is the uninterrupted view of Marina Bay.

Be patient, and you will get great photos.

And, cool off after in the Starbucks store across the street (cross under the bridge!).

If you like take photo with good view, so you must going to Marlion Park.. Not enough for Marlion statue, so you also can take picture with Singapore Flyer and Sandbay view from far, its so beautiful..

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit for first timers
REVIEW_BODY: For first timers, I suggest to ride a cab even though the mrt stations are in walking distance. As the weather usually pretty hot and you will need to walk a bit without any shades (for both mrt stations). Well, it might work if you don't traveling with a toddler though. But if you are traveling with kids, that's a bit mood downer.

More that the Singapore flyer, marina bay sands or sentosa, the Merlion really represents Singapore. It can easily be recognizable.

Singapore being a hot and humid country, it may be quite challenging to visit this place during the day but the beauty of this place really shines through under sunlight. There are tons of plants nearby which I think helps in making the place a little less humid. A must to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Selfies and pics remain incomplete without being there
REVIEW_BODY: Go go go.... Walk n enjoy. Also enjoy the river cruise next to it. Also at the back of this is a miniature of the lion from whose mouth the water keeps pouring.

REVIEW_TITLE: a must see attraction for 1st time visitors
REVIEW_BODY: travelling to singapore one must come and see the merlion. from there you can see the marina bay sands and the museum. dont forget to bring water if coming mid day

At the end of my visit to Singapore my family decided to visit the place. The recommended time to visit is in the morning around 9 am. But since we arrive there around 3 - 4 pm the place was too crowded so we decide to take a picture from the bridge connector. Luckily the weather was perfect.

You can't get enough to visit this panoramic landmark just once! Yap this place will lead you to enjoy every corner of your vision.
There you can see beautiful architectures of Singapore. It begins with Bank, Hotel even you can see Marina Bay Sands. Or you can see somekind of boat that across from the rive if you get lucky.
However you must be patient because thousands of people will get into there every time. Don't worry, I got fabulous photos in the middle of the crowd. So enjoy it!

REVIEW_TITLE: not as good as i thought
REVIEW_BODY: its just a statue.. its was bright sunny day in summer.. cant stand there for much time.. only photos can be taken
Our gracious host for the day told us that you are not in Singapore unless you visited the Merlion! Lots of tourist, expats & locals as well taking photo ops. Iconic!
- you will have a great view in here - great place for taking picture - the souvenir shop is pretty good but expensive - rain is your enemy
We were there at night, the view was amazing around the Marina Bay. There were people everywhere taking photos.

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconic Place to visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Iconic Place to visit in Singapore... This talks about the emblem of Singapore and must click of photos for everyone... Will be crowded as usual as it is the one of the top visit in Singapore. Back-drop is wonderful Marina Bay Sands... Picture perfect

REVIEW_TITLE: Your trip isn't complete without this!
REVIEW_BODY: The Iconic Merlion and the view from the park is priceless. Your trip isn't complete without a picture taken here!

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic Photo point by Singapore River
REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion Park is best Photo point by Singapore river. Merlion is half lion with body of fish. It is believed that it brings luck to Singapore.
For best photo stand on the side and take photo while you are facing sun. Best time to take photo is by 10 am.
A great place to view MBS and the Marina Bay Area, the Merlion is not a mythical creature worth any acknowledgement but an invention of the Singapore tourism board in the 1960's, cheesy!

White lion/fish head spitting out water in the middle of a jetty. I have visited this couple of times but on all occasions weather was very hot and humid. My advice is to visit this place at cooler times of the day.

REVIEW_TITLE: Hot, Crowded, Must visit of 1st time in sg
REVIEW_BODY: A lot of tourists flock here even at the peak of the sun. It is no wonder since the merlion in action (water sprouting at its mouth) looks cool. Make sure to wear strong and breathable sunblock if going here.

Singapore visit is in vain if you not visit Merlion park,Home to Merlion,pride of the Singapore.It Gives Opportunity to view Singapore river,Theatres on bay (Esplanade). Also, One can visit Marina Bay sands Here.

Of course a visit to Singapore would not be complete if you didn't see the Singapore famous Merlion. We went there for a quick picture taking. The views around it is very beautiful and it is a good place to chat with different tourists from different parts of the world.

If there is something unique and iconic in Singapore, it is the big Merlion spouting water in the Merlion park; Great location in the middle of lots of restaurants; Great people watching; Enjoy the evening.
Doesn't matter how tired you are the park and the Merlion will get that silly grin on your face. The water sprinkling on everyone and a number of tourist posing with the lion
Once you come to singapore, please and please go to Merlion Park in front of Fullerton Hotel. The best view is at night with lights. Take some pics and u are already in Singapore.

It's a park where you can find a statue of a lion with fishtail called Merlion as in Mermaid (maiden with fishtail) about 9-10 meter high, that spits out water from its mouth.

How to get there:
Take the MRT (subway) it's the easiest and cheapest is you are travelling less than 4 people, more than 4 people taxi is cheaper. By MRT you stop at Raffles Place Station exit door G, once you're exited, walk to Fullerton Hotel, cross to One Fullerton Building and you can find Merlion not far.
The view and structure of this Merlion is breathtaking especially at night. We went there on a Friday.
Get a close view of the iconic Singapore Merlion. Take some selfies. Click some picture, late night you can watch laser shoe from here. Best of all its Free.

Its a must visit place if you are in Singapore. Symbolically represents Singapore. You can see how beautifully land is been reclaimed and build few buildings on top of it.
Cruise ride starts from this place one can go for nice scenic cruise ride for 30 mins.

We had a great visit and tried several of the activities, from water sliding to snorkeling. All good fun and water was nice and cool, well needed on a +30 day in Singapore. Can recommend it to families w kids.
this is one of the main attraction of singapore. lots of people come here just to click a photo with the merlion. you can get to see MBS from there.

The whole Marina Bay larea is fairly spectacular however the Merlion Park section is nothing special. If you have never been there before it is good for taking happy snaps n watching the light show, but that's about it.
Lots of people everyday so be patient in taking pictures. Many loud people from different country. No other recommended down time.
I really expected the lion to be more bigger in size. There is a small lion also behind the big one. Avoid noon time as it's very hot, mornings and evenings would be much better time to visit.

The Merlion park has a vast view of Singapore with an immense statue of a the iconic mascot of Singapore, the Merlion.

The view of all the beautiful and tall buildings around the Fullerton Road.
The Singapore parliament.
The stadiums and the beautifully architecture theatres.
The Esplanade Bridge which gives an even better view of the bay.
Of course the extremely beautiful Marina Bay sands and the Flier.

Tip: Do visit it at the dusk so that you can get a view of both daylight and nightlights.

This is a must visit for all first time visitors.
Visited this place as must when you visit Singapore . You can have lots of memorable photos with family, inclining marina bay sands. Nice walk and few ice creams to taste

A must visit place as this is an iconic place in Singapore. You take photos (even though the place is bit crowded) and enjoy the view while eating an ice-cream. It is very easy to come to this place via MRT. The nearest MRT is the Raffles place. There are sign boards on the MRT also where it directs to exit. Once you have got out of the MRT, turn right to Fullerton Hotel side. It’s okay to walk beside the hotel cafe dining. Then after walking straight you will meet the highway. Look for the intersection that can be seen not far from there. At junctions, it sure looks writings One Fullerton building on the opposite side of the road. street toward the direction of One Fullerton, then go down to the bottom of the stairs of the bridge. Down from the stairs you will definitely look Merlion statue.

Once you have visited the Merlion statue, you can walk to Esplanade theater over the bridge which is located on the left side.

There is another large Merlion statue in Sentosa island. But the merlion statue on the main island is the original Merlion statue.
I get here using MRT. Its walking distance from MRT Raffles Place subway station. Very nice place. From here you can also enjoy the light and sound show by Marina bay sands in the evening.
The place was very crowdy. May be because we visited there on a Sunday. The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and place has very good views for good photo shoots.
Nothing much to see except that it is a Landmark site - synonymous with Singapore. Okay if you have free time. Better to visit after 5 pm and from there explore on feet the Helix Bridge.
Good but a disappointing visit as they were cleaning the Merloin and it has scaffolding around some of it.

Any one who visits Singapore takes a photo in front of Merlion and probably this can be considered as the mascot.
If you expect a huge statue or great views you may be disappointed. During the day, it is quite hot and sunny to be here. During the evening it is quite crowded. We visited on a weekday and around 5pm and hence the crowd was not too bad. Was able to take a lot of photos..

What you see is what you get. It is the ideal place to be to get an overview of what Singapore has to offer. On one side you can see the city skyscrapers while on the other you get a good look of Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer. Just don't expect to get a decent photo without photobombers because the place is packed with people! Though I think it is best if you visit around sunset and wait until dark so you see the transformation of the view from architectural marvels to twinkling jewels at night.

I love the feeling of being in this iconic place that I only see in pictures before. I was so amazed to see a lot of people and everyone wants a picture with Singapore's symbol up close. The merlion is so majestic.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion statue of a lion's head and fish body so amazing
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion statue of a lion's head and fish body so amazing. Beautiful architecture designs . My kids like the beautiful view of the Sands hotel.

One's visit to Singapore isn't complete without a photo stop at the Merlion park.
It is funny more that people taking funny photos at the park.
The area is very clean and nice.
We visited the park through a river cruise from Clarke Quay.
The merlion also has a cub in the park.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to walk specially at night
REVIEW_BODY: After waking in Clark quay and drink beer and have some food it is recommended to walk in Merlion park at late night . The symbol of Singapore is also there .

Well, who could resist having a picture with the Merlion when visiting Singapore, right? So, this place is crowded with people making all kinds of gestures in front of that statue. It was even more fun looking at the people and how silly they were! Anyway, this is a must stop spot for visitors and with the sights of the Marina Bay, you can't go wrong coming here. Just have to find the right moment to snap a photo with nobody else in there but you. The little merlion in the park was very cute too!

The place so crowded , when I'm there I think I see half of the world because from every country come to take picture. You need patient to take picture with good spot. I like the place because you can enjoy your afternoon sitting and see the view. You also can take many spot of picture like marina bay sand and the river. And of course proved that you have been in Singapore after you come and take picture here....
Why of why I went there, i'm not sure. It didn't cost anything so I suppose that is a treat for Singapore.
Well if you go to Singapore, make sure you see the Merlion as it's is the symbol of being in Singapore. No tourist tro would be compete without a visit to it.

I was told this is a nice place to visit but I am afraid I disappointed at what's there. You do have the Merlin fountain and you can pick up a river boat tour from here but apart from that, there's not much here.
The food outlets here are very expensive. So unless you really want to eat here, avoid.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gotta see the iconic white Merlion fountain
REVIEW_BODY:
Something you have to see when you're in Singapore: the iconic white Merlion fountain figure.

Highlights:
- Intriguing statue
- Beautiful view of the Sands hotel
- Snacks close by like the famous ice cream sandwich in rainbow bread

Lowlights:
- More of a take your picture and go type of thing and need to dodge the big tour groups all trying to do the same thing.

It's cool but think once you see it once, you're good

So many tourist that it will be a bit hard to take a photo without any photobombers. But then what is a trip to Singapore without a picture with the Merlion? So it might be worth a visit. A good place to have a full view of Marina Bay as well. Go early morning or around 4pm as it can be too hot in the area.
This is an excellent area. Nice view to see Marina bay hotel, Merlion statue, many high building and people.

REVIEW_TITLE: This is probably the most photo'd spot in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion is Singapore's Icon. It would be hard to say you've finished a trip to Singapore without coming here and taking a couple of photo's. My recommendation is to see the Merlion while you walk around Marina Bay and just enjoy the sights. It's such a beautiful area.

Special mention to the Ice Cream shop next to the Merlion. It's pretty good on a hot day.

We got up a bit early (6:00am) took the SMRT down to Merlion to catch the sunrise. Took some photos along the way at twilight as we walked toward the park and once we got there we found a spot and set our time lapse cameras up and enjoyed the view. It was a great way to see the sunrise.
This place has always been the most memorable place for me and wife. We have spent many of memories around the place before we are married.

REVIEW_TITLE: visit this spot is a must
REVIEW_BODY: Many spots, Many people if you come here in the morning. but too hot at afternoon. You have to come here at least twice, day and evening.
You might have seen that merlion in every commercial or photos of Singapore. Because it's the symbol of Singapore. Whosoever visits Singapore also visits the merlion

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore icon which always attract tourists
REVIEW_BODY: Every time my friends or my relatives came to singapore for the first time, they always asked me to bring them here. You can go by MRT and get off at esplanade if you want to go direct to merlion park. The view very great with singapore high buildings background, include MBS and esplanade. One that i always hate here is the weather. It is so hot at the afternoon, so i prefer go there after at least 15.00 p.m. It was great if it is the first time you visit singapore, but you won't interested visit this place many times.
Always full of tourist.. because u can say that u already visited singapore before u took a pic with this iconic merlion.. :)

Merlion Park located in downtown city near Esplanade. Although more small size than Merlion in Sentosa Island, but for photo shoot it is more awesome because its surrounding another landmark of Singapore such as Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Helix Bridge, Esplanade. So on one frame picture you can get all the landmark of Singapore. The best time to take of picture around 6 PM - 7 PM when sun goes down and the light is up. AWESOME!!!
Great city view ... Awesome photo places .. Crowded in the evenings .. Especially during the Weekends !! The new bridge connector is great..

REVIEW_TITLE: The symbol of progress and harmony
REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion seems to be guarding the opening of Marina Bay. It has been the mascot or symbol of Singapore. For me, it symbolizes the harmonious relationship between the different races that live in Singapore. It also signifies progress while the City-State continues to strive. A lot of photo opportunities await here. The Merlion, the Mini Merlion, the cafe's nearby, the esplanade and Marina Bay Sands from afar, and the Marina Bay waters, boats and the skyline/CBD.

This park should be missed when you visit Singapore. You are not in SG, or you didn't go to SG if you don't have a photo with it :-)
if you travel to singapore you have to take photo with merlion in merlion park you can go here is easy just use MRT to raffles place and after that exit fullerton hotel merlion is back this hotel
Nothing special but if you are near you can go and take few pictures there. A lot of tourists there to see a statue that is not even special in eny way. I did not get what was so exciting about it?
I'd recommend you go at night or when the sun is about to set as it can get extremely hot in the morning! That or bring an umbrella.

REVIEW_TITLE: The biggest attraction of my children
REVIEW_BODY: We visited Singapore just because of the Merlion Park as my daughter was dreaming about being there someday. It was a great experience visiting there enjoying with family and friends. My Daughter was extremely happy there. A must visit tourist spot in Singapore.

This outdoor park on the Marina Bay is a nice relaxing place at the very heart of the hustling & busting of the Singapore city. The place is free for entry and you can just sit and relax the glittering night view of the entire Marina Bay Business district. There are some good restaurants at the park, who serve quality food – bit expensive though. Overall, we enjoy this place and would recommend this place for a relaxing time.

lots of tourist buses and lots of tourist, it was hard to get a decent photo without tons of other people in it. Not sure would be the best time of day to visit to avoid this. But id been to Singapore 3 times before i got around to visiting this.
Holy cow what an awesome place. Every angle, every level what magnificent views. There are so many unique buildings on the the skyline. Very clean surroundings.

REVIEW_TITLE: Icon on Singapore and no one could miss it!
REVIEW_BODY: If you are visiting Singapore, you will never be able to tell anyone that you did, without having a picture with Merlion! Go there and spend sometime in this very busy place.

Merlion park is a great place for taking pictures or selfies. Merlion statue and Marina Bay Sands, these 2 iconic landmarks can be captured by camera at once. Best time to take pictures is at afternoon.

This is the main attraction and symbolizes Singapore. In the evening at around 8pm, there is a light and laser show from the Marina Bay Hotel which should not be missed. We get a spectacular view from the Merlion.
You can read the history about the statue slated there. The place was too crowded I would say but yes it is beautiful
A good view of surrounding architecture, spend some time for photographs. But tough if it's a sunny day since there is no shade nearby...

Merlion Park is a popular place in Singapore. It is located in Teluk Marina. The situation of this place is very crowded. Many tourist or citizen spend their time there with their family. Most of them stay there just for taking picture with Merlion Statue and Marina Bay Sands as an angle. Actually in the afternoon, the view just so so. But, in the night the view is very amazing! We can see the lights from Marina Bay Sands and from other building around this place. I suggest you to visit Merlion Park because it is an icon of Singapore.
Excellent place to visit with exciting statue and copy of it and have a great time there and enjoy with statue of the lion.

The Merlion statue is a Singapore symbol. It is half a lion, which a Siamese king allegedly saw there while visiting and half a fish depicting the old Singapore as a fishing village which it was before the economic boom.
It is right by the Marina shore with the absolutely best views of the new Singapore landmark - the Marina Sands hotel. Best time to be there is at dusk and at night, specially at the time of the sound and light show (9 PM I think).
This is a very popular location for all tourist. you get to see the Famous Merlion. It also has a good park and location where you can spend a nice evening.

This Merlion is the symbol of singapore. So mostly people who visit singapore would like to take picture here with the merlion background. Or we can take picture with the Marina Bay Sands background.
