Here there are one Starbucks caffee shop below the bridge. Very nice place to have relax and enjoy the view.
you can't avoid people here as everybody wants to take pictures in all angles. But a must visit if you are in Singapore
What time does Merlion stop spitting water in the night? I attempted to take pictures after USS only to find out there's no water coming out of its mouth. Thanks in advance!

This is an easy and fun activity, although it can get very hot as the dock is uncovered and it gets really crowded. After taking your obligatory picture with the Merlion venture under the bridge and cool off with some $10 ice treats. The taxi stand is back up the stairs then down the walkway a bit until you see a Starbucks. It's hard to find but it's the fastest way to get out of there!
Or so I heard a small child say when I was there! Hilarious! Grab some stunning photos at sunset and in the evening as the light show begins from MBS.
I didn't find it too enchanting, i had a glimpse of it and it was okayish. water flowing out of merilion.

REVIEW_TITLE: A big lion fish that is the symbol of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
it is worth walking to merlion park.
if you stay at the Fairmont hotel or swissHotel Stamford, Rafles or other of the multitude of Hotels in singapore then the merlion is pretty well within walking distance either over land or past the multitude of underground shopping enroute to the MRT [mass rapid transit] system. [read train].
the Merlion park is always crowded. I ahve been there a couple of times now and other than very late at night or early in the morning it alwasy has people and cameras. Include merlion Park on your walk around the Boardwalk cirumnavigation of the singapore river mouth (bay?). the distance is about 4 k and takes about an hour. stopping at the Merlion, the Helix bridge and the Marina Bay Shopping complex makes the trip take a bit longer and providies points of interest to make the walk worthwhile. Just past the Merlion is one of cultural arts centres so another destinatio on the same journey.
The park is nice for spending afternoon or for meeting point. You can alight for Singapore river tour. Stroll along the riverside from UOB plaza if you are using Raffles Place MRT
The place is very crowded, as expected. But a short photoshoot stop is okay. It is walking distance to Marina Bay Sands.
So, when in Singapore, this is just a must do. It's very much a photographed icon of the area, and Singapore. People gather here all day, and night for fun.
a must see you can walk but by boat at night is a far better option its so clean and special to look at a great spectacle
Merlion park,I think is a symbol of singapore.it is very interesting and exiting.I recommended to all of people who go to singapore,should visit MERLION PARK.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see just to see the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: Great place to take the kids was just passing through but the gardens are lovely and it has a great atmosphere! Go up the Merlion to see the harbour just lovely

The first day we arrived at Singapore we were just looking at the Merlion from across the river on One Esplanade but before heading back to our country we went to the Merlion Park itself. there were so many people which came from different places, it was a good thing that you don't need to fall in line or there is no gates or fees before you can get in. it was really a park (for those who are not aware). the Merlion was really big and the park has a very nice spot for taking photos. views here are very scenic.
The Merlion Park is a nice place to relax coz you have a wide view of the river with Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer in the background. Come befote before dusk so it wont be very humid!

The Merlion is probably the most famous icon associated with Singapore and I couldn´t think of a better place to take a stroll on a warm and balmy evening in this beautiful city. The views of the Marina Bay Sands and the light shows are spectacular, the backdrop of the Singapore skyline is out of this world and of course who could resist having their photo taken with the world famous Merlion shining brightly for all to see. Can get very crowded but well worth the visit.

Good for urban night photography or an evening stroll. Nothing much if you are looking for nature photography or activities . The food along the walk can get expensive. Food at Millenia Walk/Suntec City was better priced.
Merlion park is famous long time ago. At this park we can see marina bay. Rest at this park and see a beatiful merlion

You gotta go there because you are in singapore and need some selfies to post on your facebook... Its not whats in there thats impressive but what you can see from there... you can a beautiful singapore from there...
This is a must visited place if you go to Singapore, the iconic Merlion Statue with an exquisite view of the landscape around it. You can also take a picture of Marina Bay Sands from this area.

Even though this Merlion looked much smaller compared with the one in Sentosa, for me personally, it's by far a more reachable and iconic place in Singapore. Maybe it is because the water sprayer that come out of its mouth. We reach this place by taking MRT to Rafles Place Station, and a little walk through Fullerton Street. You can take photograph from any angle with various exciting background while the Merlion still at the center of it. However, you should prepare a cap or umbrella because it is so hot here, especially if you visit it around 10am to 2pm.

REVIEW_TITLE: Place where you can see the iconic buildings in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Here, you can see many things that are iconic to Singapore, such as the Merlion statue itself, Marina Bay Sands and Esplanade (the durian shaped building). A new bridge called Jubilee bridge connects Merlion park to Esplanade, so you can commute easily between those places. It's recommended to go there around morning to see the sunrise and exercise, or evening to see the lights from the buildings. This is also a good place to watch the firework (during National Day and New Year).
The park is a small piece of real estate, but the surrounding buildings make the park attractive. This place is always filled with tourist.

When in Singapore, you need to come to this place. It is because of this place you recognise Singapore...Merlion....Mermaid+Lion. Amazing view, Great river ride, Great look all around and must visit place

REVIEW_TITLE: Much spoken about and hence must visit!
REVIEW_BODY: Everyone talks about the Merlion, so yes, It is a visit to be completed! Looks a lot better at night, and a nice place to click a lot of snaps!
The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and it is a great experience to visit it. There's heaps of tourists taking cliche photos of them spitting out water, but all that adds to the atmosphere.
If you love Art you may gain more from the experience. i'm not a big art lover. its very nice but dont expect anything more that a statue of lion

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit to take your photo against the iconic Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: Easy enough to get to and crowded (since a lot of tourist buses stop here) but people are pretty good about getting the photo done and move away. Few benches and food stalls to enjoy the park - if you can handle the heat.

We can spend hours and hours of time just strolling around the park experiencing the beauty of this wonderful place, we went there and enjoyed the evening sunset, took some wonderful photos and videos to cherish for our entire lifetime.

The Majestic Merlion standing tall and handsome was an absolute treat to our eyes, there is everything for everyone including a fabulous boat ride to enjoy the brilliance of Singapore.

Must visit for all age groups when we are in Singapore, especially children will enjoy a lot and why not? elders will also enjoy this marvelous park, the park attracts visitors with its sheer beauty.

I love to walk around the bay.. seeing SG at night with a nice weather. Merlion is one of my favourite. It is better to see the merlion at night. But somehow, my camera can't be focus to take a merlion picture. But I still love to seeing around. What a lovely night !

Great place to visit during sunset and evening .
It's better to get a taxi to the merlion park . From China town mrt it's around 10sgd . While returning one can search for the mrt sign on the other side of the road and follow the sign to reach the mrt which is at a walkable distance .

Its iconic statue situated in the middle of the city. There are many places nearby and those are at walk-able distance like Singapore Flyer. There is breathtaking view all around. In the night, there are laser show which adds more attraction !!

Loved it when I visited with family in late december 2015.
It is the place to take your picture but a lot of tourists with busses coming non stop. Just take you picture and walk to other areas with much less tourists.

Best place to hang out to watch the spectacular view of Singapore's sunrise and sunset.

Before I travel, I would make sure that I have taken note of the entrance fees prior to our arrival. There are online travel sites that indicate tour charges at Merlion Park per person (which I thought were entrance fee charges since it was not clearly stated). I was pleasantly surprised when we got there to see that they do NOT charge entrance fees. And that the best way to reach Merlion Park is through a cab (especially if you're traveling with your family/children).

Check out the weather should you wish to visit there. It is always best to be there on a perfect hot weather.

There are also available boat rides should you wish to complete your Singapore experience. Rates are very reasonable.

No Singapore trip would be complete without the Merlion experience!
The iconic merlon is a must. It was easy to get to, we walked over after lunch at the Fullerton.One can also hop on to the water taxi.
Really the main thing about this attraction is that it makes a great picture. When I went it wasn't too busy (early morning). Apart from that nothing too special.

We decided to visitthe merlion as itvwas supposed to be shuttered for renovation after the first weekbof january. We went in the evening. You can taxi and its a two minute stroll. Behind the merlion is the cub merlion.
Other option is to catch the giant merlion. However this one is the iconic. You can then stroll to espalanade area for a quick bite at the hawker style eating area or one of the many resturants
Nice walk around the bay, clean and there is a good view of the momument + marina bay hotel. Very nice to take photo's
yes. i already enter visit in merlion park... i like place in singapore nice <3 beautiful nice.. i love singapore <3

Walk from Downtown MRT - around 15 min; nice view along the river. Crowded, everybody looking for best spot for trick eye photo. Going back thru Esplanade MRT. Recommended to come around after sunset - 6-7pm where the light at Bay Sands already shine; nice view.

Was extremely tired searching it out.... the nice photo shoot location but was completely drained.... preferable time to visit is daytime... nothing else to offer other than the Merlion.... however, the view around of the surrounding incl. Marina Bay Sands is wonderful.
We missed this place five years ago. So we decided to visit the Merlion on the first day of the year 2016. So crowded with people but we were happy
It is a good place to spend 30-45 minutes of time. Can click nice pics, have some food - nothing else to do here.

A nice place to walk around and spend an evening. It has good views of the Singapore skyline, an evening Light show, a ferry ride (we missed the latter two) and a few restaurants (over priced) in the park..
The Merlion statue itself isn't very impressive... Even the spray from the mouth was missing on the evening that we visited.
The place is overrun with tourists amidst a photo op!I
My take - Its a place that you read / hear so much about that not going there is almost scandalous. Go there, spend an evening, take photos and tick it off your list.
I won't be drawn to it again and I doubt you would too!

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion Park and Tower on Sentosa Island great to visit night or day
REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion Park is small but very interesting. It has a small movie theatre located inside the Merlion Tower which screens the history of Singapore presented beautifully catering to adults and children of all ages. The tour to the top of the tower is very good and quick but presented so well with special effects and more surprises.
The park itself has a beautiful mosaic sculpture display reflective of the sea similar to Gaudi Park in Spain.

I know the merlion is a big attraction, but it just didn't do much for me. It was extremely busy with many tourists and we got our obligatory photo with the merlion, but I wouldn't go out of my way to see it.

Wow what an amazing and spectacular fireworks display. Get there early because there are huge crowds. Amazing spot to view and it's beautiful with the bay and good architecture and on the side of the merlion fountain is where to be. Good security and crowds are polite. 8 minutes of amazing art. Would definately come back again.

Cool lookout over the Marina bay. It has an observation pier for good photo options. It seemed a little convoluted for us to get there because we had to do a lot of crossings and underpass especially due to the barricades put up for New Year's, but it was worth it after we arrived.

The Merlion is the symbolic sculpture of Singapore, and it is centrally located in the City.

It is around a 10 minute walk from the Esplanade, across Esplanade bridge, and it offers great views of Marina Bay.

The sculpture is also a water feature and it's a great place to get some good photos. It is also free to visit.

I'd recommend spending no more than 20 minutes here, as it can get quite busy and it is mainly a photo spot.

Overall, it is a nice symbolic feature of Singapore and I would recommend a brief visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: You Haven’t Been To Singapore If...
REVIEW_BODY:
There are a couple things that people will tell you must be seen/done if you visit Singapore, and that you haven’t really been there if you miss it. Merlion Park is one of those things.

The statue itself is quite beautiful and impressive, and locals will tell you that it brings good fortune to Singapore (at least that’s what they told us!). You will need to be patient and well-positioned if you want to get good pictures, so take your time, and enjoy the people watching! You will see countless people lining up shots to catch the Merlion’s water in their mouth, hands, coffee cup...the pinnacle of tourist photos akin to holding up the leaning tower of Pisa.

There are a lot of nice views of the skyline in the area, and plenty of places to grab a quick bite or coffee nearby. As with essentially anywhere you go in Singapore, Merlion Park is very well maintained, safe and extremely clean.

We came here one evening and admired the waterfront / marina from this point whilst taking in the peculiar but iconic merlion statue. Half mermaid, half lion... Best point for views for of MBS laser light and water show

Went along here with my wife one evening after we had been out for a nice meal.
Got some great photos with the Merlion and the amazing Singapore skyline around the marina bay area.
The boardwalk is great to walk along and you feel very safe.
People are friendly with tourists mixing well with locals.
There are a range of shops and restaurants around the park.
Remember to take your camera as its a photographers dream!
Nothing great or spectacular. See it when taking the river cruise. Dont waste time going to the park.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merloin Park should be the very last thing on your list for a Singapore Visit
REVIEW_BODY: Its a figures of a Lion that has water from its mouth. Its highly overated and not really of any great specific interest other than based on an older (not ancient) myth. There are so many things to do that this item should be the very last on any sightseeing trip in Singapore.
Nice pics, fresh air and some great memories to make here. It's a really nice tourist spot but can be busy at peak periods.

Thousands of people come here every day. The day and night view is very different. Come here and enjoy the walk and view of Marina Bay Sands light show in the evening, take a picture with Merlion, catch the water in your hands :)
One of the top ten attractions in Singapore. I suggest a night visit as well to take some nice pictures from this area.

We went here on a Friday morning. Lots and lots of people all jostling for a bit of space to take photos. To be honest I have seen it many times and i don't think that it is that impressive however when in singapore it is a must see. Symbol of the sea.

Worth a visit but it was always busy no matter what time we had gone down there, although it’s packed people normally move out of the way after taking photos so you’ll be able to take some decent snaps.
The views are ok but not much to do unless you take a river boat and then you will have better pictures of the Merlion
Merlion park stands opposite the marina sands hotel. Great photo opportunities, especially at night. Worth a visit.
Day or night this place provides some pretty good views and opportunities for photo op. Recommend for first timers.
The park itself is not so impressive, meaning the grounds. However, the merlion is what makes it special and is uniquely Singapore.
With all things in singapore you have to go see the Merlion. We went past on the bumboat ride. It's always hot in Singapore.... It's quite open here so hydrate!

A beautiful 2-hour walk around the bay
We had a beautiful walk around the Bay. We got out at the MRT station and walked counter clockwise around the bay. At the start, you could see the white Merlion statue across the bay. There is food available along the way, mostly at the end of the counter clockwise walk. It can be very hot, so be sure to bring umbrellas or hats. After the walk, continue heading straight ahead to the Fullerton Hotel. There is also a business building that has wonderful sculpture. Don’t bother with the Red Dot Museum. See my review on that. I think it’s a waste of time. If you like this review or other reviews that I have written for Bangkok, Ho Chi Minh City, Cities in Australia and New Zealand, cities in South America, and cities in Italy, please feel free to give me a thumbs up.

The famous Merlion is surpisingly small and, while easily photographed, rather disappointing. Even the souvenir shops nearby were disappointing, mostly selling drinks and fruit. Stop in if passing by. But not worth a special trip, with so much else to see and do in Singapore.
We arrived just at sunrise. The photos were stunning. There were several photographers there as well. The lion was not spitting water so that was a little disappointing.

A crowded spot but quite easy to get a photo opportunity. People move and flow quickly, worth the effort and a lovely breeze on a hot day. It’s quite popular with tourist groups and buses, some nice ice cream and drinks a few metres away.
Not so easy to get too and over crowded. Ok to take some photos but much nicer to discover the sculptures along the river and note some of the old buildings.

Very hot if you come after 9 AM because there's no shelter around the photo spot. U can get the view of Marina Bay Sands from here too. There are fruit stalls that sell cold drinks too under the bridge, to run away from the hot sunlight. U can eat fruit or drinks some cold beverage under the bridge while enjoying the river and Merlion scenery.

Merlion park centred on the north bank of the marina reservoir must be witnessed at night when the famous statue/fountain of the merlion comes alive with colour. take a walk along the jubilee bridge for alternative view.
This is a must visit place of Singapore, there is also a baby Merlion behind the main one, busy place but a must for photos!!!

Most cities have an iconic building or structure you need to visit - this is the one in Singapore (among with a few others!). It has a great position on the water front and provides a great place to appreciate all the Marina Bay Area.

The statue and fountain aren’t as dramatic as I was expecting but it was good to visit just the same.
Iconic statue great place to get a picture ! Have you been to Singapore if you haven’t visited the merlion? 😂

Great views of bay and Marina Bay Sands property in backdrop. It does get crowded but there are many angles to pick from. Venture under the bridge across the street to purchase local fruit or chilled coconut water from refrigerated displays. Well worth it and affordable and shaded!

Visited Merlion park opposite the Fullerton Hotel it is a must see place but is very busy and you have to be prepared to take time to get the best view and photo opportunity but well worth it and it’s free to see
In a great location for pictures and videos. Can get busy at certain times of day specially when the sun is shining
Glad I saw it... wasn’t that exciting though. Very crowded ... we didn’t stay around long. It’s worth a quick photo stop and then move on.
A trip to Singapore would not be complete without a trip to see Merlion. It's fun and free and doesn't take up too much of the day.

We were there when the Merlion was getting "spruced up" for a big event. But the park was lovely. They had a much smaller Merlion in a fountain, which everybody took pics of! It was a nice place to sit & take in the view of the bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the beautiful place to visit in Sing
REVIEW_BODY: We got a very big fun when we visit this place. Bridge connect to Bridge, river connect to river. Everything here make a big spot and a great architecture. From this place you also can easy see the Marina Bayfront. Amazing
Icon of Singapore. Gives you a great view of bay area and marina bay sands hotel. Lot of pictures op.

It was an amazing experience. We went there in the night, view was amazing. There are food outlets near the park you can enjoy mouth watering food. Food is not that cheap but it's reasonable.lovely place to visit.
Take the time to see this beautiful aspect of the bay and lion. Great spot for photos of the bay and high rise buildings.

We visited Merlion park on 30th aug 19 around 6pm. Not too much crowded as expected, we still can get a spot for taking photos. We reached by bus at Concorde station and walked about 5-8 minutes. The view on the bridge towards Merlion status is fantastic. You can feel the windy and nice marina bay sands view on the left. We stayed until sunset and the entire view is changed with the lights on. We managed to find a place to sit while enjoying the live band from theater by the bay overlooking marina bay sands and Singapore flyer. We waited till 8pm to enjoy spectra light show. It was amazing to watch the show from the other end which we had watched at the main theatre.

Merlion Park is a must visit while you are in Singapore.
Since my last visit to Singapore over 30 year's ago the Merlion has been moved not far from it's original spot.
Many tourists taking photos but wait your time to get that perfect snap.
Worth a visit at night also get a water taxi for a great view.
We walked to this park from the Marina Bay Sands which was nice. We saw the lion but not sure what else there was to see.

No matter what time of the day or night we passed this attraction there was always a huge amount of people there taking photos and learning about the story of the Merlion and why it stands at the mouth of the Singapore River. Even with lots of people there it was still possible to get up close and take a good photo and like everywhere else in Singapore, the area was clean and well kept. We also took a river cruise which gave a great view of the Merlion along with a number of other attractions.

This is the Landmark of Singapore and one should not miss to visit. You will get very nice view of Marina Bay Sands from the Park and the best thing is there is no fee to visit the park. You can click nice pictutes snd spend some time.

Always a great photo opportunity and with Marina Sands in background plus other great architectural structures you are bound to get an awesome photo.
Downside It's super crowded most of the day. If you dont mind loads of pushing and shoving it's a great memory photo.

I’m not sure of the story behind the Singapore Merlion but it is located in an incredible spot on Singapore Marina, opposite Marina Bay Sands, with a back drip of the financial district.

It is free to access the Merlion and despite the large number of people around the statue, there was plenty of space and time to take some great tourist pictures.

It is well worth continuing on a walk from
The Merlion all the way around the Bay - great views of one of the truly iconic city skylines of the world...

I missed this iconic item last trip. I was not disappointed. It was a lovely walk beside the river to turn a bend and see the magical Merlion presiding over the river. Lots of photo opportunities take your time. We had fun, other tourists gave help to each other and we did too taking photos and then we would watch all the different ways to get photo of Merlion. You can line it up and have your palms up “catching” the water. One lady even got it to look like it was going into her mouth. Whilst there the public are encouraged to walk through the Fullerton hotel, it is 5 star and photos are welcomed in the walk through under the chandelier there is dining available there too.
I think yhis was one of the best spot for a night photography. You can also take the river cruise from there.
Nice place for photos but there are just too many people there. Seems like all the tourists visiting singapore are brought to this place. You can see Marina Bay Sands from this place.

From Garden by the bay we went there directly,we entered marina bay hotel and shoping stores passing through the Helix bridge its great experience even I'm kinda tired. Many people also visit this site. Bring some water to drink 💦
Merlion Park and the actual Merlion is a great place to visit. Located conveniently close to MRT for transportation. Gift shop available as well.
This a a nice central place to enjoy the Merlion statue and get a beautiful view of Marina Bay. There are various food vendirs surrounding as well. Can become crowded, but not overwhelmingly so.

If you walk around the waterfront you can get some great views of Marina Bay Sands hotel and well as the Merlion.
Its busy and a photo stop but worth seeing if in the area.
For a cheaper coffee stop head to Starbucks! Great place to take in the views.

Merlion- part Lion part fish(mermaid) statue and fountain..the symbol of Singapore, A huge attraction of Singapore gives a picturesque view of Singapore skyline and its famous attractions like Marina Bay Sands Hotel..Flyer.. A must visit for tourists...
Nice but again overly crowded. People taking photos everywhere. Good for a short walk around the area.

When you see the Merlion right on the harbour front you know you are looking at an icon of Singapore.

Looking towards the water the Merlion is illuminated during the hours of darkness and always spouts water into the harbour. The harbour boats pass close to it so you can take a photo ....... urs also known as a meeting point.

There are a selection of restaurants behind the Merlion which offer outdoor eating day or evening and from there you will have a great view of Marina Bay Sands and even the fair that is in town in February.

See the Merlion ...... it's free!!
The Merlion statue is an icon for Singapore. It is located right on the water in the Colonial area and offers wonderful photos that must end up in you album of Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views on a clear day
REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion Park is a must. If you are in Singapore for even just a quick stopover, go and see it. There are amazing views to be seen from the park itself so it offers more than just the Merlion itself.

What does it represent? Allow Wikipedia to explain:

"The fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which means "sea town" in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore's original name—Singapura—meaning "lion city" or "kota singa"."

People get upset about the amount of visitors who might spoil your photo of the Merlion itself, but really it is not that bad. There may be a lot of people there at any one time, but not more than you would find at any iconic tourist attraction. This place is sleepy compared to the Louvre.
I’d recommend visiting the park and seeing the iconic Merlion statue at least once. It’s a busy area full of people trying to get a selfie with the Merlion.

It is practically an obligation for any newcomer to Singapore to visit the iconic Merlion Park. The walkways are shady and leafy affording one the opportunity of snapping shots of the iconic statue from different directions and perspectives.

Good place for Singapore people and people around thee world ..

The location of This parl in the Middle of City. and getcthere for free 55555. .. we love it.

from this point u can see all in Singapore and from here around 07.00 p. they have water fall and Fountain in front marina bay sand building. it good. for sightseeing and rest around there

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice views - lion status spraying water out
REVIEW_BODY: Very nice view of the harbour, the merlion statue kind of small and alot of people taking pictures. Nice walk on bridge.
Nice area to see the bay area and statue. Can catch River boat trip 25 SGD per person. Marina bay hotel on opposite side of the bay.
Cool spot to visit. A lot of good picture taking opportunities. We enjoyed, good for a one time thing not repeating.
Beautiful spot of the city. Visit it by the sunset for nice pictures. A lot of option to grab a coffee around here.
A bit of a stretch to call this a park, however worth having a look on your way to other attractions and a good location to view the city and Marina Bat Sands from.

The statue was undergoing renovation when we visited, but it is still worthwhile to visit for the views. We were there twice – once in the evening because we were having dinner in the area, and again during the day. We felt it was more beautiful at night.
Great view of the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Lots of restaurants to choose from. You can take a great picture Of the scenic view!
Unfortunately the big Merlion (half fish / half lion) statue was under wraps and under repair so we had to be content with the little one! Oh well!

Word of warning the Merlion is being renovated so cant be seen as covered in scaffolding. You may decide not to visit here with this in mind. Thd surrounds are great though so its worth a visit ho walk around the area.

We came to Singapore 25yrs ago and we're eager to see the large Merlion again, however it was covered as having a facelift do we had to be content with the smaller version. Park was clean and tidy. You must see the Merlion when you visit Singapore.
Singapore is a bit like New York or Hong Kong: very busy with tall buildings, so it is nice to have this park by the bay to stroll, rest, admire the view on the tall Marina Sands.
I didn't see the big deal about this one. In my opinion I would rather go and see the Merlion out at Sentosa Island which is far more impressive, plus this was closed for renovations.
Merlion. Symbol of the city of Singapore. Mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish.
You can see the big Merlion and little Merlion from the park. The little one is cute, but potentially not worth it if crowds annoy you, gets pretty packed in the park
Nice place... Fun place with good crowd. Can get the view of flyer, port and other places of singapore.
The Merlion statue is covered under renovation. Don’t know until when. Nonetheless the Merlion Bay Area is definitely worth a look, sans Merlion statue.
unfortunately, the Merlion was under construction when we go there. so sad! they say it might be re opened on July. They move the Merlion in the mid of the sea near the harbour.
As of late March the renovations were ongoing so no view other than a small replica, not working, close by
We got to the park because we wanted to take pictures here and it is closed for renovation. They have a little merlion on the dide so we got a picture.

We wanted to visit Chinatown, Merlion Park and Garden by the Bay in that sequence for our last full day in Singapore.
It was quite a 15 minute walk in the humid conditions mid afternoon after coming out from Raffles MTR Station. Actually the walk was less than 12 minutes, waiting for traffic light to change added the extra time. We thought next time, probably better to catch one of the air conditioned buses and get off at the stop on the Merlion side of the Raffles Quay Road.
When we got to the Park, the giant statute was under wraps for renovation. Still the area and view of the bay is nice. Plenty of tourist were taking photos of the small statute. We waited five minutes for our turn to do the same and had a nice walk along the shore looking for the bus to take us to our next stop.
We love to Go to Aer Mancur Merlion, Hehe... That was her bucket list and i'm happy to bring her in, as long as she happy i'm happy!!!

REVIEW_TITLE: The iconic Merlion was under wraps
REVIEW_BODY:
It was rather disappointing to see the iconic symbol of Singapore all wrapped up. It has been taken for renovation.
We saw the smaller Merlion in the park but it was not the same.
It was very hot in the afternoon and so we quickly took some photos and left.
Bit of a disappointment as had been looking forward to seeing. But instead we were greeted with a boxed off canopy. Not to worry just another excuse for us to come back to Singapore

Merlion Park houses the famous Merlion of Singapore (smaller version than the one in Sentosa). It has a nice overall feel to it by the water, not much to do here. We just clicked a few pics and moved away to enjoy the overall scenery.

REVIEW_TITLE: absolutely beautiful area especially at night time.
REVIEW_BODY: is nice to visit the place in the evening with the beautiful lights and fireworks.when you finish there can go for a few beers or dinner at the area near by where the bar streets are

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for photo opportunities of Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: We visited Merlion Park during a tour with Lion City Bike Tours on our first day in Singapore. It was the perfect place for pics with the clear & up close views of Marina Bay Sands & the Singapore Flyer. The iconic symbol of Singapore the Merlion was in its full glory and gaining lots of attention. But ther were still plenty of good photo opportunities.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit if first time in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Iconic statue of Singapore. Wildly overcrowded with inconsiderate tourist but worth seeing first hand. Expect people to be inconsiderate while there and area restaurants to be overpriced in the area. Still, visit the waterfront park and see the statue.

Beautiful park! Amazing view by Singapore river. The big original statue undergoing construction currently but you can take some great picture with the smaller Merlion just behind the big one in the park!
Good to see another culture and the story. Views are amazing and well worth the climb. Staff friendly and helpful
The Merlion itself is covered in scaffolding and is not operating (March 2019). No mention of this beforehand on any travel sites. The park , restaurants around it are ok.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and can't be left out on a Singapore visit. But this Sunday it was very busy here; it seemed that most tourist groups had converged on the Merlion at the same time. Anyhow we could approach the statue for a picture after elbowing through throngs of tourists. Furthermore, most cafes and restaurants on the riverside walk have become a bit upmarket, or are just fast food and drink counters. The time you could settle down at the "Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf" with a nice view on the Merlion is long gone.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see attraction while in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: My wife and I visited the Merlion park while in Singapore. It’s a fantastic location to take some great iconic photos and if you’re looking for a place to grab a bite to eat or a refreshing drink, there’s lots to do in the area. Certainly within walking distance to most other attractions in Singapore’s downtown core
If you’re walking around Marina area the Merlion is worth a trip and on route. Definitely picturesque.
What a breathtaking view of the city of Singapore. Coming at night you can see a light show from the Marina Sands towers.
You should go there at night. See the Merlion changing color and Marina Bay Resort water and light show. Helix bridge lighted up. Boat rides going up and down the river. Lots of places to eat too.
We visited merlion park,very beautiful place with stunning view.The park is very clean.Iconic tourist place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Really Interesting History behind this sculpture!!
REVIEW_BODY:
This very "popular/iconic sculpture" of the mythical "part lion and part fish" [from the sea or "mer" in French- hence "MERLION] is almost 30 feet tall and weighs about 70 tons! It was originally located at the mouth of the River... but, then moved to its current location in the 1/2 acre park [with marvellous views}... The Statues of the "Merlions" also include a smaller [about 7 feet tall] "baby". The views of the Bay and City are wonderful-- especially at night. The "Merlion" has been awarded TripAdvisors' " Travellers' Choice" designation. Nearby, one can also find a refreshing ice cream cone... Its a definite "Must See" when visiting Singapore.

I hope that this Review has been helpful.
While the statue is very crowded, you can still find a place to take selfies and pics. There are steps to sit on under the Merlion to enjoy the view. It took about 30 minutes to walk from the MBS.
Stunning views of marina bay sands and the surrounding areas. Clean and picturesque park. The merlion is truly a sight to see!
Perfect for a wander around in the sunshine and a cheap beer at the beach. The cable car was fun. We had an enjoyable day.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best view of the entire bay
REVIEW_BODY: Very nice view. Fantastic concept of urban and civil lifestyles. The walk from the garden through the museum and the marina shopping Centre is a must of all. Singapore is a great place to relax in armory!
Merlion Park was really nice. Good views from the Statue. There was a lot of stairs there. I couldn’t find a way up if one was handicapped

It’s a great sight, which everybody wants to see, but serious problems for the disabled, accessibility is really difficult. Others describe it in detail, so I’m concentrating on the problems I faced.
Took a bus to Fullerton Square, that was the easy bit. Now we had to cross the road. There’s an underpass from the Fullerton, but there’s no elevator for the disabled, just escalators. We walked some distance to find a suitable surface road crossing. 2 sets of traffic lights, so it took some time.
Now we were faced with flights of steps to get to the viewing area. My wife found, after a goodly walk, one smaller flight of steps, with a wheelchair lift (you have to phone to get the staff to help). In the end, we had to walk half across the river and back again on a different bridge to avoid steps.
By now we needed the toilet. Full marks, there are two disabled toilets, but oh dear they’re not suitable for many disabled people, because there are no handrails around the toilet.
Things were worse than normal when we visited, because there were a lot of ramps to get over power leads for the New Year Display. At least that’s only temporary.
The final problem is the many tourists walking around not watching where they are, looking for that perfect picture. It just made things more difficult.
Be alert for some steps which are very difficult to spot. No warnings bumps in the pavement for the blind, and no obvious yellow paint to show the edges.
If you’re disabled, there are so many good places to visit in Singapore, I think it’s best to give this one a miss. See the Merlion from across the river, or from other places around the Marina.

An excellent place to catch views of the Marina Bay sands. The famous fountain is also very nice with the Singapore skyline in the background. Gets pretty busy around the fountain but being patient you can still get the pictures that you want. From there it's a very pleasant walk around the bay to the Marina Bay Sands.
Merlion Park gets very busy with tourist but there is lots to see around here. Loved the lion statue and got some great pics around here

Been past in a Bum boat at night,great veiws of the city skyline all lit up,
Been out for dinner and decided to go for a walk and this is around 11-30 at night when we walked past the merlion statue and still quite a few people around just relaxing, chilling taking pictures ,selfies etc.Great spot to get a pic with the Marina Bay Sands Hotel as backdrop....
Stunning with all the lights....recomend at night as it is cooler and photos turn out amazing

It had been years since I visited the Merlion Park, complete with the original Merlion statue - a strong symbol of Singapore.

Much has changed in the area around the park, significantly from the ongoing land reclamation process that has seen this city-state grow its physical size by more than 30%.

Yes there are tourists everywhere, but there’s nothing wrong with that.

Great views and photo ops along with a lot of history - for the few that are interested.

This is a lovey area of the city, lots of people just exploring and chilling on the tiered banking. Great place just to chill and take in marina bay. A few good bars etc just along marina bay right near the park

This fountain has water coming from the mouth of a mythical creature comprising the body of a fish and the head of a lion. The creature is the mascot of Singapore and is believed to protect the prosperity of Singapore. It is part of the promenade overlooking Marina Bay and is the most popular attraction in Singapore. The area around it, particularly the viewing platform can get quite crowded. Best time to visit is early morning and at night.

We went here, and we also tried to understand what is the attraction behind Sentosa Island in general, but utterly failed to understand. The whole island looks like a run down resort from 70’s in Easter Europe. They have some water park and the universal studios, but otherwise we felt like the only suckers who got fooled by going to this place
Merlin Park is also attractive place for tourists to walk over. Visitors of Santosa enjoy photography and walk through this area.
We came we saw we selfied, not a great deal to see, but of course you need to visit as it is an iconic landmark statue.

Since we were not staying nearby, we got off the Hop On, hop off bus to visit here and we were glad we did. What a great location right on the marina in front of the Fullerton and with the fantastic Marina Bay Sands across the water. This would be the spot to be to see the laser light show at night!
A must to go to. The bay of this city. Nice view. Sometimes really crowded with tourist. You are never alone when you stop here.

So it’s just a statue of a half lion - half mermaid and is ALWAYS full of tourists trying to take that icon shot. There’s really not much to see around it, and the one time it actually looks good is at night but then that picture you always wanted cannot be taken then. Honestly the statue isn’t even of a big size or anything. Just take a look if you really want to else skip it coz it ain’t that much
You should take a walk around the Merlion during the day and at night as well, the view to skyscrapers and marina hotel are great you can enjoy a drink in coffees and restaurants nearby

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion! What a great symbol for Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: During my visit we walked around the park numerous times and enjoyed a summer evening fireworks show with music. I am pretty sure those events are available year-round given Singapore's climate. They also have a great ice-cream stand. :)

It has to be on your list of things to see when in Singapore.

It's a great location, with good views but you won't be alone, it feels as though every tourist in Singapore goes there but as long as you're prepared for it to be busy you'll be OK.
I’ve been living in Singapore for a few months and I walk through merlion park every time I’m nearby. It’s always lively and pleasant and I’m always happier for the visit.
The Merlion is a very popular tourist attraction in Singapore, so it was a must on our places to visit while in Singapore. Have in mind this place is always packed with people!
One of the must see sights of singapore. Always people there though so would be pretty tough to get a photo by yourself. Worth a visit
Nice place to walk around and get nice view of the city. Ythe ou can take nice pictures of the merlion and the city buildings.

I guess it is a must do in Singapore but not much to see. Other than view across to marinavbay sands. Would be good for evening light show but probably packs out as was busy in the morning with busloads
Took a mid morning walk from hotel to the Merlion and then onto Clarke Quay. Lots and lots of tourists. Good experience and worth seeing but may take a while to get that perfect photo
Its a work of imagination.Great mind with great imagination. Its a marvel to contemplate the beauty of the place with people all round...

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun if you like crowds and touristy stuff
REVIEW_BODY:
As a local, this myth was probably due to poor eyesight. Lions and fish don't breed well, so maybe this was a lionfish? Anyway, it just spits water and tour buses come here so it's crowded most days.

Personally, I'd avoid unless you're visiting the casino, Esplanade theatre or Fullerton Hotel anyway. Don't go out of your way, the biggest version is on Sentosa Island.
Its just a park where you can see the Merlion and in the back drop is Marina Bay Sands. the views are amazing and good photo opportunity

REVIEW_TITLE: Not sure what all the hype is about?!
REVIEW_BODY: So busy and touristy! Good views of the bay and finance district but you can see this from anywhere around the area and marina.
A good place for photography and a leisurely walk. Try scooter rides for more fun . Can be crowded at times and taking pictures becomes uneasy but its worth all this for a photo with merlion.

I love my parks in the UK but from the moment you see the stone lions at the entrance you knew this would be a treat.
Lots for children to do and play on. There are areas where people play marjon and yoga. Fountains , flower and trees. Eating places and benches. Very influenced by Victorian life styles.
Free to get in and lots of locals and many will talk to you on English.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of Singapore’s Iconic Landmarks You Should Not Miss!
REVIEW_BODY: We’ve been to Singapore countless times already but only got to see the Merlion Park now. The merlion itself is a sight to behold. The view of the Marina Bay area from the park was also amazing.
A commanding statue in the Marina Bay Area near the Fullerton Hotel. Half lion and half mermaid/man this statue stands proud in brilliant white.

A great statue (half fish, half lion) with a fountain that makes for multiple photo ops. Of course, the main one is to stand so it looks like the water is landing in your mouth and you are drinking from the fountain! It was a little crowded but it was easy to get a good photo. The place was clean and I felt safe.
Interesting to visit but not really a park as such, we walked to it over the Jubilee Bridge as part of a round the Marina walk.
We passed the Merlin on the way home to our hotel via the marina bay. Lovely fountain in a very clean area.
It’s okay for a quick stop. Star bucks and few bars cafes nearby over looking the water. Good view of the three tower building. Was fairly popular but a little bit underwhelming.
One is the famous Merlon . Get ready for your camara many beatiful building all around walk down to the street will get a lot of beautiful pictures!
Sweet place to take photos and enjoy the sights seeing surrounded by back water and top 50 global baking complex.
Visit to have view of Singapore masterpiece and Marina bay sands. Visit at 8.00 pm or 9.00 pm to watch the laser light show. Everyone visiting Singapore should not miss the show

This place was very busy at around 10am. Lots of people trying to take photos as you can get a good photo of the Marine Bay Sands hotel from there too. Good spot to watch the nightly water and light show.

REVIEW_TITLE: Tourist spot for sure but there is a reason!
REVIEW_BODY: Great views and probably the most iconic spot in Singapore, always packed with tourists doing the tourist thing but if you are visiting this then you are probably one too - so soak it up and enjoy it! Wonderful spot.

The Merlion is the icon of Singapore and it beautiful to see in person.

Unfortunately we arrived around 11am and there already a lot of people there taking photos. It difficulty to get a good shot with the amount of people around and to add on top of that, it outdoor so it can be pretty hot which may cause frustration.

Overall Beautiful View, highly recommend check it out!

This is a great area to walk around either during the day or even better at night when the whole area is lit up. There are loads of bars and restaurants to choose from and at least when we were there, free open air entertainment.

If you wish to get a close up photo of the Merlion, you will have to brave the hordes of Chinese tourists and be prepared to push your way through; 10.30am and the area was crowded. We decided to venture elsewhere and were happy with our photo opportunities from the calm of the cruise boat later in the day. Lovely statue with the head of a lion and the body of a fish, perched proudly on a wave with water streaming from it's mouth.

REVIEW_TITLE: It's a statue with a great view
REVIEW_BODY:
There are a lot of strange mythical animals around the world. I am sure you have heard of centaurs, unicorns, dragons and even phoenixes before. In Singapore, we have our very own mythical creature too and it's none other than the Merlion!

Born with the head of a lion and the body of a mermaid (don't ask me how that happened, we're still trying to figure that out), the Merlion is the tourism ambassador of Singapore. The official Merlion can be found at the centre of the city-state, between the Marina Bay tourist area.

It guards the entrance to the Singapore river, overlooking popular tourist destinations like the Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade, Singapore Flyer and is within a short walk away from the Fullerton Hotel and the National Gallery Singapore.

The Merlion enjoys spewing water out from its mouth most of the day, for reasons we are also still unsure of. Maybe it's because of all the partying nights. Legends say that in the night, the Merlion will quietly slip to Clarke Quay, Singapore's premier clubbing and drinking district to wind down after a tough day of being a tourist attraction.

Clarke Quay is also not that far too, only around 1-kilometre walk along the river.

Jokes aside, if you are considering to visit the Merlion, bear in mind that it's only a statue overlooking the Marina Bay area. There are some cafes nearby for you to sit down and enjoy the view, or you can choose to sit near the steps of the Merlion, but there's not much else to do here other than to take photos and enjoy the view.

If you fully want to enjoy the Marina Bay experience and see the Merlion from a different angle, I suggest taking the river cruise that allows you to tour the different landmarks along Singapore River. If I remember correctly, you can also embark and disembark at different pickup points. But check with the counter first.

Or if you're feeling adventurous and don't mind a little walking, you can choose to walk along the bay area and visit several landmarks at one go. There's the Esplanade, Singapore Flyer, the Art Science Museum and Marina Bay Sands all within walking distance. Might take you half a day to one full day to cover everything.

Singapore's weather can get quite hot or rainy so bring an umbrella just in case.

Though we were tired (flew in (17.5 hrs) from LAX to SIN) earlier in the morning, we decided to continue our sightseeing. This evening’s stop was Merlion Park overlooking Marina Bay Sands Hotel, as we eagerly waited for the light/laser show. I recommend sitting on one of the stairs leading to the water (next go Merlion) as it provided a clear view of the Hotel, Singapore Flyer & the bridge. I recommend getting here an hour before the show & enjoy the area (& food).
If you are in SG you need a picture with the Merlion and that’s about it. Go there take a picture and leave

Across the water from Marina Bay Sands hotel is Merloin Park which is a must see while in Singapore,it's a free attraction but has the tendency to be very crowded due to not only the merlion but also the myriad of restaurants along the waterfront,take you're camera as there are a lot of photo opportunities

During our 12 hours transit in Singapore on our way back to Dhaka from the Maldives, the first thing we did was to pay a visit to the Merlion Park. This is truly the icon of Singapore and a photo with it would be a cherished one during your visit here. The place is full of people almost all day long and we had to struggle for a good photo for a while. Fortunately, we had a few good clicks and would love to spend some more time around the area if we happen to make a visit again to Singapore!!!

You can't really visit Singapore without going to see the Merlion. Busy area with lots of tourists all doing thier selfie shots but still found a little spot to take mine. Also worth visiting the area for the great views

This is much more than a retail park. It has all sorts of recreational offerings. You can shop, enjoy a beer, some food, a stroll in the park or simply take in the view over the Bay. The famous Merlion spouting water into the bay is legendary.
This is a really nice area to just walk around Singapore in general is a very clean and safe place to be. Lots of tourists flock to see the Merlion statue just choose your time wisely.
To appreciate this attraction it helps to understand the story behind the merlion. That said it is a popular attraction in Singapore and often quite crowded
This was another attraction i was looking forward to seeing, very busy of cousre but a great advantage to see the wheel and other landmarks as well,worth seeing

REVIEW_TITLE: A Crowded Place To See An Average Sculpture
REVIEW_BODY:
One of the reasons we decided to go into the city and leave Changi airport was because of the Merlion. I’d seen so many pictures of this creature all over the airport on postcards, cookies, and more. It seems like such an important part of this cities identity. Certainly we wanted to see other parts of the city, but this was one I couldn’t miss... or so I thought.

I can’t tell you what I was expecting, but I can say that I was disappointed. It’s a very crowded waterfront park with a large cement sculpture spitting water. The sculpture isn’t overly detailed or that impressive. There’s no information about what it represents or why it’s ever there. The one nice feature is that there’s a slightly nicer, smaller version of the sculpture behind the large Merlion that’s worth seeing. I’m convinced that some marketing company is behind the popularity of this strange phenomenon. There are amazing things to see in Singapore, much more interesting than this.

Large fountain basically. Loads of tourists there. It is somewhere to visit as part of a larger visit to Marina Bay area. We preferred it at night time when we saw the laser show off the Marina Bay Sands hotel.
The icon of Singapore. The mandatory place for the first timer. Good view but it was super hot when we visited it.

This is the signature spot of Singapore. Day and night views are different. We went there in evening and enjoyed a lot. No entry fee and any limitation up there. Take some good snaps for the momeries.
A nice day down by the bay. The Merlion is the symbol of modern Singapore. Nice walk and great background available.

very amazing, it was my first time and always on my bucket list now its happen , Me and my hubby had long stop over so we decided to stay and book a hotel which is closest to merlion park , We really enjoyed our stay the view in the bay and of course the light that turn on at night so amazing really love it and the whole place so clean , love to comeback there one day.

REVIEW_TITLE: A snapshot of what Singapore is
REVIEW_BODY: Everytime i go to Singapore, i never fail to drop by the Merlion Park. It has an exhilarating view of what is to be an urban haven. It seems that the Merlion is always looking at the view surrounding him, from the Esplanade to the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, and the tall skyscrapers. It also gives a good view of the clean Singapore River.
It was good to return to Merlion Park. I previously visited here 6 years ago and was good to see the changes to Singapore skyline. Easy to get to (metro) and a pleasant walk around the bay.
Neat little spot to get some iconic pictures of Singapore. Lots of tourists and not much cover from the sun. Quick walk away from our hotel past the Durrian buildings.

The Merlion Park at One Fullerton near the waterfront at Marina bay is famous for its Merlion statue, a half fish half lion statue which is regarded as a symbol of Singapore. It has a fountain of water spurting out from its mouth into the Marina Bay waters. I did not go by land but passed through it via a Singapore river cruise so avoided the crowd that is always there to pay their pilgrimage. Easier to capture a shot of it from various angles from the cruise boat too.

You cannot go to Singapore and not have your photo taken here. The views over the bay both day and night are wonderful. But I have to say Ioved it a night when the light show from the Marina Bay, could be seen.

Also its was good to get a slight spray during the heat.

Be warned it was packed due to the amount of tourist, but we found it got quieter around lunchtime and dinner. There are lots of places to eat and drink, but you will pay a higher price due to the view and location. But if you go just behind these hotels, who can get some great offers on food and 241 on drinks
Lovely views of the city great to see the iconic symbol of Singapore. A nice are for a stroll. If I was to visit again I think I would personally hire a bike for getting around and viewing this area.

A short visit is really all that is needed to snap a few pictures of this iconic statue.

There are also a few other items in the area (all within 30 minutes walking distance) which you can visit all within a short morning, such as the Fullerton hotel, etc. Must visit for first time visitors/tourists.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to have an evening outing
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore’s iconic Merlion statue is situated here and your trip to Singapore is kind of incomplete without taking a picture here with marina bay sands as the background. Recommended to visit here during night time. You can also enjoy the spectra laser show over the Singapore river from here. It can be overly crowded sometimes but definitely worth a visit. It’s one of few attractions in Singapore which has free entry.
Hurray, the Merlion was uncovered this time- it was covered up for maintenance last time we were there. Got my traditional 'drinking' photo, along with hundreds of others. Now, I'm happy.
Merlon Park is in the heart of marina bay Nice place to walk or take around by boat Many nice views and many shops and restaurants around
It is one of the tourist destination to visit, as the park has restaurants and with the great view of Singapore iconic statue of Merlion and the best view of marina bay sands.
Merlion Park on the waterfront is a nice bit very crowded spot. Both large and small Merlions on show. Great views of the stunning marina architecture a bonus.

The Merlion used to be the most popular land mark of Singapore. Now, it’s the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. But it continues to draw huge crowds from all over the world. Very instagramable indeed. It’s beautiful.

It was really a nice place beside the sea which can offer you memorable photos. Nice sea view and of course crowded but still relaxing point to sit down and enjoy the scenery of Merlion , city and sea. But the restaurants were too expensive. I bought two small bottles of water from a restaurant for 7.5 singapore dollars which was much more expensive than other parts of the city! Except for this one , everything was all right.

REVIEW_TITLE: An absolute must do in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is one place you have to visit. In truth it’s a little underwhelming, but if you don’t come your visit isn’t complete. It’s always busy, which shows its popularity in Singapore. Make sure you visit!!

REVIEW_TITLE: The first icon of Singapore and still is everyone’s soft spot
REVIEW_BODY: It is the legendary Merlion. Doesn’t matter that now Singapore has established a lot more iconic places this is still the one you have to see and snap a creative selfie with. Enjoy the amount of people being there to try to be creative. It’s entertaining.
A nice spot to visit and some good places to eat and drink. We enjoyed the American place - Overeasy. Good food and service.

Merlion park is very nice place to walk around and see the beauty of Singapore this is best way to spend time in evening and the lion statue is looking awesome front of lion statue Marina Bay hotel are also looking great

REVIEW_TITLE: The ancient & new symbol of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
This statue doesn't recall only the fusion between the ancient fishermen village with the old Sanskrit name of Singapura Reign, it represents still nowadays the strong and valid spirit of integration that You can breathe in each single corner of Singapore.
Enjoy its view, discovering how & why Singapore is a really unique & successful melting pot!
Very busy but great views all around. We hired an electric scooter to go around Marina Bay Sands.... I recommend.
Been here before it was Renovated and still the place takes my breath away! We had so much fun trying to act as if we are drinking from the throwing GIGANTIC LION..a must place to visit.

There are some stunning photos on the net and it was good to see, but if you are tight for time, don’t panic if you miss it.
However, if you combine seeing the Merlion Statue with the light show on Marina Bay (most nights at 8pm and 9pm - 15 minute show) ...then it’s well worth it!
We arrived around 6.30 pm, had dinner at a top place called Over Easy then saw the show at 8. perfect!

a singapore icon a must see in singapore

we actually went here on our bike tour of the city which was a great way to visit and take photos the boardwalk gets very busy with tourists but its still not that bad that yoh can’t move. very nice spot in singapore
We finished our river cruise here and had to wade through other tourists to get photos of the Merlion

I feel like merlion is definitely one of the landmarks of Singapore. Be prepare for the crowd though. We went in the morning around 10-11am and there were already a lot of people. It’s hard to get a good picture tbh. We walked from Conrad to the park, not too bad of a walk. Best of all, it’s free :) plus, you get a nice view of marina bay hotel from the park.
This is one of the most famost place to visit in singapore. And more beautiful in night time. And u can take the boat go around to see the statue will very very special

Most people who visit Singapore want to see the Merlion. As a result it is always busy, early morning, afternoon and evening. There are ways to where you can take photos without too many people in the shot. Just be patient and enjoy the bustle.
We came upon the merlion when we first arrived to the city while taking a walk. Very cool but its always super busy.
A majestic Merlion (lion head with mermaid tail) at the waterfront.. Beautiful relaxing place.. This is a landmark of Singapore and it is worth a visit.
Seriously, in the scheme of things, visiting this monument was questionable, so many crowds of tourists to get through and in the end I really had no idea what the point was

The Merlion park has two Merlion statues: the big 8.6 m Merlion statue (that everyone wants to take picture with) and the small 2 m cub statue (that is mostly ignored by tourists). None the less the Merlion statue is the icon and symbol of Singapore. This is the place where all the tourists seem to flock to take pictures and selfies.

The place is the best spot to get pictures of the iconic Marina bay Sands and Singapore Skyline. The park is also the perfect spot to just sit down at the steps and enjoy the laser and spectra water show in the evening.
Not a bad way to spend an hour or two. We walked over from our hotel to get a sense of the whole experience. I enjoyed it far better than my partner so I might not be for everyone.
Walked down to Merlins park on our first night in Singapore and took some good pictures area however was very full with lots people taking pictures

REVIEW_TITLE: Must-see and iconic, but too crowded
REVIEW_BODY:
You should expect a lot of people/other tourists if you plan to see the Merlion. It will also be difficult to queue up for good spots to take photos.

The restaurants around offer expensive food and drinks. You might as well bring your own snacks if you plan to stay a bit longer to wait for the sunset.
There are 2 merlions. You try to take pictures with the big one pouring water on you. Also walk around there to find nice bars and restaurants.

Anybody visiting Singapore the Merlion Park
Is a must visit . It’s fairly quiet during the day but it’s all lit up at night and a real spectacle all lit up . There are plenty of restaurants and bars around to people watch afterwards . Great photo opportunity
It was a nice attraction and quick to visit. Definitely good to tick of the views from the top are lovely.
merlion is a landmark of singapore itself. you have not been to singapore if you have not taken pictures here. lies the marina bay sands. many ways to come here. more beautiful when the night

Took a walk from MBS over the Helix Bridge to have a look at Merlion Park. Took a couple of photos of the statue and then walked back. Great views of the river and MBS. Its free so worth the visit. Only stayed for 5 mins though. Don't bother paying for a tour to take you there. Its easily accessible.
Go to Clarke Quay and go on a river cruise...you can get fantastic photos from there...then jump off @ Marina Bay and check out the shopping!

We visited Merlion Park in January and we walked quite a long way from the train station to find out that the statue was covered for maintenance. It was ashamed but the view around the area was nice. Too crowded though.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must Visit to the Singaporean Symbol
REVIEW_BODY: A must visit if you visit Singapore as Merlion is a symbol there. A deck has also been created to watch the sculpture well. The atmosphere is also excellent with the views of Marina Bay Sands and science center. There are also places to get food nearby, so that you could have food while having a rest.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit to the Singapore's famous Merlion
REVIEW_BODY:
My wife and I have recently travelled to Singapore, our first time visit to this beautiful country.

Before we left home, friends suggested we visit Merlion Park and as the name suggests the famous Merlion is located on Marina Bay. The Merlion lion represents a half fish and half lion.

Merlion Park is easy to get to and we travelled there and back via the Hippo hop on and hop off bus which stops across the road from the park. The park is very popular with tourists and with crowds of people trying to photos with this statue. You can also see the Merlion by taking one of the boat tours of which the main pier/booking office is only situated about 50 metres away. We were fortunate to do both and got some great photos.

This is a free attraction and definitely worth a visit.

Cheers, Paul.

Merlion Park considered as the main attraction of the Singapore and it is also known as the identity of the Singapore. Your trip remains incomplete if you have no plan to visit this place. Access to the location is free for everyone and it is centrally located. The view from the Merlion Park is just awesome. You can see the High Rise Buildings, Iconic marina bay sans, Singapore Eye etc. You can also have a look on Baby Merlion which is located near Merlion Statue only. Various main attractions are also near to this place. To visit here, you can plan your trip easily and club with other attractions like, Singapore Eye, Skypark, Graden by the Bay etc. The place remains crowded in evening. 30 Mins stay is more than sufficient. Must visit place for everyone.

REVIEW_TITLE: Night time is the best time
REVIEW_BODY: I'm so glad we went at night. There was a breeze and we could see the light show at the Marina Bay Sands. It was so beautiful to the Merlion at night. Enjoy some ice cream, and a seat on the steps and relax.

As with statues such as the little mermaid, this is what says you have been to Singapore. Althoughth the city was relatively quiet when we were ther, the statue was teeming with tourists, trying to get the best snaps... me included.. Nice area to sit around and have a beer, and people watch

This glorious statue was all by itself on my first visit to Singapore - 40 years ago. Now, all around its space is reclaimed by pathways, bridges and buildings. I am sure Merlion feels encroached in, just like thx lions in Africa,

Yet, getting up close to this magnificent statue, makes you feel like it has become a close friend.

Please come closer and take a selfie with it, and pray, you will come back one day.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very nice place to spend your evening
REVIEW_BODY: I highly recommend this place as a must go place in Singapore. I suggest every one to visit there in evening time. Very nice place to relax after a tired day.
Stanning Park. Very clean and full of things to see and do. You can use the cable car to go to the 4 part of the park. The view is incredible! Make sure to have water and wear comfortable clothes.
Nic small park with the Merlion statue over the bay. Just "should visit and take a selfie" :-). Very nice view on Marina Bay Sands and other futuristic buildings.

REVIEW_TITLE: Park here for a while Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion is the truest icon of Singapore We visited on a very shiny and hot day We travelled by the river to reach and we spent a great time watching the city scale the sculpture as well as the sea
A must to see. Singapore's famous merlion status is the symbol of Singapore. The water spray from the spout was refreshing in the Singapore heat.
Merlin park is very close to the waterfront and gives you a very good look across the bay. Plenty of restaurants and small shops. Close to financial district.

The half-lion, half-mermaid statue facing Marina Bay is something you must get a photograph of during your visit to Singapore. Iconic, spurting water and proudly standing in front of the grand Fullerton Hotel and Marina Bay Sands, there is always a large crowd of people taking snapshots of the area. Merlion Park is a short walk from the Central Business District and other major attractions.
This is the iconic Singapore Merlion, a mystical being that is lion and mermaid. Tourists from all over the world come to take a photo with it as the background, somewhat like the Copenhagen mermaid.

We got a river cruise to Merlion Park , from Clarke Quay, then we spent about 3 hours wondering around the Fullerton area, then crossed the bridge to try and see the F1 track( couldn’t really) . We really liked it around the Merlion Park and think it should be given a higher rate on the things to do in Singapore . We really enjoyed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Starting to get a little dated.
REVIEW_BODY: This is the iconic tourist spot to visit; and whilst still incredibly popular it is starting to get a little dated when compared to the new tourist attractions. Perhaps in need of an update - but I am sure it will always be popular. Worth a ‘selfie shot’ with some good views across the Bay.

The Merlion has a lot of historical importance to Singapore and as such has been set in a really nice place. Next to the bay is the perfect place for this beauty. But there is a problem. Singapore is always hot and as such you will not be able to enjoy the view unless you time it well. I suggest evening boat ride. Yellow light from the sun is perfect. The breeze will keep you cool. The boat ride will show you all the major attractions from the bay. Don’t forget to take a seat on the open boat. Sitting inside is no fun. Grab a cold one if you can. Will really help.

Was hoping the Merlion represents something special for Singapore, but research indicates the Merlion was first used in Singapore as the logo for the tourism board.and is the unofficial mascot of Singapore.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore, hence seeing this is compulsory. Situated right in front of 1 Fullerton, it has a picturesque location. Do visit in evening for the best effect. Visiting this is free of cost.
Really enjoyed the park and could have done with much more time than we had. Would like to go back and spend more time there.
Merlion is the symbol and god of Singapore. That’s because there’re too many tourists here, it’s so difficult to take photos except other people. But the statue is very scenic.
Merlion Park is full of tourists and selfy sticks - you’ll have that. It’s very pretty and you can get a great view of the skyline and city. Many bars and restaurants near by.

Almost every other tourist has, one time or another, has a photo taken of or with the Merlion whether near or afar. We went as near as we can get via Fullerton Hotel, where a nearby MRT is located. There were close to a hundred other tourists in the area taking clever pics with the famed Merlion. We spent more time in the area (early dinner at One Fullerton) but otherwise, this is a 15 minute attraction.
Very busy day or night but worth seeing. Capture your fun photographs and superb people watching! You can walk all the way around the Marina and plenty photograph opportunities. Enjoy! ⭐️👌🇸🇬

One of the iconic sights to see in Singapore, you really cannot miss this.
You can either walk to Marina Bay or visit on a river cruise (we did both).
Very popular place but plenty of seating on the steps to chill and take in all the buildings around.

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore icon on a rainy day
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion was a must see on our recent trip to Singapore, but we didn’t get an opportunity to visit until the last day. The Merlion visit was not dampened by the storm and we enjoyed the iconic Merlion statue. The Merlion needs to be ticked off on your attraction list for Singapore. Recommended despite the torrential rain. Bring an umbrella.

This place is very cozy to be with you love or friends!

The area have an awesome viewpoint over the marina bay and you have a lot of restaurants and cafes here.

A tips, find Starbucks there you have free WiFi and a stunning view! + great coffee!

The popular attraction have a lot of people there pretty much all the time but if you want some alone time with the tiger just sit down and wait until the wave if people have take the photos the you can do some funny shots!

Let me know if you want me to visit something else in Singapore.
If you want to see more pictures from my trips please check out my Instagram/whaatzzupp

Thanks for reading,
Until next time see you soon!

Location: ****
Photo friendly: *****
Tourists: *****
You have to visit As it s a symbol of Singapore. It s beautiful. There is a restroom and it s really clean!
National symbol of Singapore..if u rvisiting singapore dont forget to take a piture here at night..with all the city lights.must visit.

Kind of a must to visit here for stunning night view. Being here, The Gardens by The Bay shines at night and serves as a great background to take photos together with the Merlion.

There are so many different spots to take photos with the Merlion and at the surrounding, there are lots of restaurants too. We had a drinks at the hotel rootfop bar and that was nice!

All who visit Singapore the Merlion Park near SBS is a must visit site. It is amazing to see people from all over the world there. A very clean and well maintained place. You must rry the sandwich ice cream and dumplings sold at the hawker center around the Bay. You can take a good walk around and visit the science museum, the formula one track, the marina Bay sand, where you can go up to the view point and take an airel view of Singapore. The gardens by the Bay. The views are just breathtaking. You can plan a day and night visit to enjoy the lights at night too.
So crowded here, so much people want to take unique n funny picture.. And we can relax in this place just sit down and feel the wind.. so nicee and recommended place..

After dinner we went to experience the Merlion; the light show was unique and displayed the speciality of this stature. The surroundings were well lit up and the cleanliness is par excellence. Extremely serene place to have a good date.

REVIEW_TITLE: A bit too crowded, but a must see
REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the must see in Singapore of course, but it can be a bit too crowded. You only need to spend about 30 minutes here. The Merlion is the iconic mascot of Singapore.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and represents the founding of Singapore. Legend has it that a prince landed on the island and saw a lion (which he had never seen before) so he decided to name the island Singapura, which in Sanskrit means Lion City.
The fish tail is a nod to the fishing villages that used to call the island home. This is a large area that overlooks Marina Bay. Lots of tourists - including us! If you're in Singapore, how can you not go see the Merlion?

REVIEW_TITLE: The Merlion is the Iconic symbol of Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: The park is a great location to visit and take some beautiful and fun pictures of Singapore. Make sure you go out on the overwater walk way, to take some excellent photos of the Merlion, with the Fullerton Hotel in the background.

The Merlion of course is a symbol of Singapore. Don’t go out of your way to get here but if you’re nearby it’s certainly worth taking a look at, especially if it’s not too crowded. Large statue spewing a lot of water every minute.

REVIEW_TITLE: A lovely walk around the marina and river
REVIEW_BODY: We walked along the river from Clarke Quay which was very pleasant. The Merlion Park area itself was very well maintained and a pleasure to visit. I highly recommend a walk around this area.
Great place to stretch you legs following a long flight. Plenty of places to eat catch a coffee albeit food can be expensive
Centrally located. Great stop for photos and its always busy with tourists. Cafes around for food and drink. Boat rides available nearby too. Its a lovely fountain and close to the CBD.
The area around the Merlion Park comes to life a at night with the many bars and restaurants. Seeing the Merlion illuminated is quite spectacular. Also worth seeing from the river by boat trip.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit the icon for a photo
