REVIEW_BODY: Not really much here but on the rim of Marina Bay so worth a visit for the obligatory iconic holiday pic. Easy to get to and quite busy with tourists. Plenty of room though to move around. There are restaurants and cafes in the vicinity

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place but timings should not be Noon
REVIEW_BODY: As per our itienary we visited this place during afternoon, the time when sun was at its peak and therefore it was diffcult to stay there for a long. However the place is quite good offering a lot of spots for photography, and enjoying.
I'm so happy cause it's a nice place for traveller. Every travellers first come to Singapore and see that's . And travellers satisfy about his travel. I hope. I'm so happy.
Take a walk from the MRT station & you'll find the Merlion park. It is so beautiful late in the evening. Don't miss the light show!

It is nearly 9 foot tall structure with head of lion and body of fish. Located in Bay Area, close to Fullerton hotel. Provides good view of Marina Bay, Financial district and Singapore Flyer. Nice place to click pictures. Can get bit crowded but a fun place overall!

We sat here after completing the 3,5 km walk around Marina Bay it was a nice place to watch the light show at 8,15pm and to see all the Illumi lights across the bay.
The merlion is awesome, free to look at and a nice way to end the walk of the bay
Lovely area to view the Merlion and to enjoy people watching. Merlion is beautiful and so fun. You can see it on two sizes and take great photos.
Simple park type atmosphere with a lion statue/fountain. Was told that it's a famous landmark so I guess it's worth a stopover if you're nearby anyways...couple of eatery options nearby.

Great place to get a photo with the Marina Bay Sands in the background and is apparently a great spot for sunrise, we missed out due to the weather being pretty crappy unfortunately. Gets very busy though so try and get in early to beat the mass crowds.

Got here at 8.30am and it was already VERY crowded as everybody wants to take photo at that particular spot where you can see the Merlion and MBS. Suggest to go way earlier before tourist flocks into the area!!

Other than photo worthy it’s really nothing spectacular at all. Nice view, nevertheless.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful views of the icons that is Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Chicago has the Bean, Seattle the Needle, SF the Golden Gates, and Singapore the Merlion. What I love about Merlion Park is the visitors it draws, showcasing the diversity that is Singapore and those who visit. It is a great place to take in the dramatic skyline of the Marina Bay, Art and Science Museum, Helix Bridge and of course the symbol of this beautiful city. Yes it can be crowded, sure it's "touristy" as those in the first line of this review....but there's something about this park and what it symbolizes here. One visit is enough, but the memories will last for a lifetime.
Definitely worth seeing to gain an in sight into their culture as this the lion is the symbol of Singapore
An iconic statue which represents the place. Very busy with tourists all wanting the shot of the Marina Bay.
A lot of tourists but nice to walk around and enjoy the beautiful park. Visit after the sunset for a great view towards the city.

So, for those needing information, a merlion is a head of a lion and the tail of a mermaid. This merlion is perched facing the Convention Centre on the opposite side of the bay. It is a nice destination point to visit when walking around the bay. However, after seeing it, there is not much to do there but continue the walk.

Excellent place to spend some 1 hour . The main attraction of the visitors is to be photographed by the side of the Lion, the symbol of Singapore Government.
The place was being renovated for a Festival. The place was crowded and people had to wait for their turn to take selfies and photos.

This is my second time in Singapore and this time with my husband. I took him to Merlion Park. I think Merlion Park is best to visit at least one time during daytime and one time at night. Take a goofy picture like you are drinking the water during daytime. In the evening wait for the show across from the Marina and you will get a SPECTACULAR view. While at the park, go visit the popsicle/ice cream shop. It is kind of expensive but I tell you it’s worth it specially on a hot day. Well, Singapore is always hot.

This Merlion sits guarding the entrance to Singapore Harbourfront on Sentosa Island.

We saw it from the cable car at dusk and it looked so majestic all lit up and huge. It is the oldest and biggest Merlion – which is half lion, half fish, in Singapore. The lights are programmed to change colour every few seconds so it is great to get up close and personal. I believe you can also climb it although we did not have time, but it was great to say we had been there. The other Merlion spouts water and is set at Marina Bay - a perfect picture opportunity.

REVIEW_TITLE: a must do at least once !
REVIEW_BODY: Visiting the Merlion and seeing it spout water is a must do iconic activity when visiting Singapore. The experience is tantamount to visiting the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco, or the Great Wall new Beijing. The only problem with visiting the Merlion is that after 15 minutes of taking photos there's really not much else to do. Therefore, this activity alone wouldn't be worth it if is wasn't so close to Clark Quay or the iconic Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The Merlion is perfect brief activity while strolling on to other parts of the area. And for this reason alone, it shouldn't be missed. I would not recommend visiting here if it was 'out of the way' which it is not.
People every where but you get very good views on the statue and the marina sands. Good picture opportunity as you can stand out on little jetty

REVIEW_TITLE: First stop for visiting Sentosa Island
REVIEW_BODY: We went during Chinese New Year celebration and the place was well decorated with Snoopy,beautiful flower all over,lot of fun activities and being weekend and holiday time,the place had lot of visitors!Its a landmark and water coming out from lions mouth is actually symbol of abundance. It represents Singapore..so a must on list.
A very small statue but it is interesting to see. Come here night and day to enjoy the scenic views of Marina Bay Sands!

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a look as part of visiting the area of Marine bay
REVIEW_BODY: Full of people with selfie sticks and lots of people taking photos of other people making "V" signs. Its part of the bay so things change here over time - displays and exhibitions.
A spectacular fountain in the heart of the harbour area, the statue is well worth seeing and a nice area to walk round.

Merlion Park is nice and represent an iconic part of Singapore, though in reality, this is not the original Merlion Park, as it was relocated when the adjacent road was buit, cutting it off from it's prominent position.

The problem is that people have a habit of stopping walking suddenly or hanging around and blocking the path to take photographs. In reality it has become a place to take photos rather than something to look at and admire.

REVIEW_TITLE: Have to see the Merlion when visiting Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is the unofficial mascot of Singapore, and was used in their Marketing until 1997. This large statue spouts water out of its mouth and is part lion and part Mermaid. The area itself is a nice waterfront location to walk around, and there are plenty of outdoor things to do nearby.

Great ice cream shops there, beautiful statue facing the Singapore River, plus there is a small replica behind it called the Baby Merlin. Conveniently located within walking distance from the Fullerton Hotel.

The Merlion was created for making image of the Country and stands tall on the Singapore water front welcoming people travelling by waterways. It is the biggest attraction of visitors to the Town. There are c=facilities of all kind, eating relaxing, cruise etc. There is a large one air theater very close to it. From the park one can go to the Marina Bay sands side through the Helix Bridge or even one can walk to the Singapore Flyer.
I'm looking forward to this place because of course as a tourist this is one of the place trademark so we were so disappointed that during our trip its under maintenance/renovation.
We arrived to find Merlion all covered up for renovations, bummer. The park is nice and we took a boat ride down the river and listened to all the history. Boats were very comfortable as well.

REVIEW_TITLE: I loved seeing the famous Merlion!
REVIEW_BODY: It was so fun seeing this iconic sculpture while in Singapore! And since I am an Artist/Sculptor by trade, it made it even more special for me. We recommend going!!!

If you are in Singapore, and have not been to this place, then you never been to Singapore! The most iconic place of all times! And best time to visit is late afternoon! There you have a lots of things to do! Can spend an hour with good food with a view! Or without spending much, hanging around, walking all over the place, but best not to miss a small cruise! By 8 pm there is a fountain and light show at marina bay, if you aren’t there you can enjoy a part of it from merlion park as well. And one must not miss it!
Busy little park with lots of people taking photos. Ice cream vendors nearby. Handy to Clarke Quay. The mosaic walk however is at the other Merlion at Sentosa Island.
Singapore's icon, a must see! Not much of a "park", more just a statue with walkways around it. A short visit is enough.
this is a icon from this country, yeaaaay singapore, beautyful country, but this place so many people visited, but if u take a picture no prob, u can, by the way many people take a picture so uniq
The Merlion - Mermaid and Lion - is a landmark of Singapore. It has come to symbolise Singapore. And, as such finds a pride of place in all things connected with Singapore.
If you are in Singapore you have to make the trip to see the Merlion. Good place to take pictures of the Impressive Marina Sands.
This is a beautiful monumental statue, don't take the river cruise instead walk along the river side full of beautiful sights all along ,
Its nice to walk in the bridge going to merlion. We did this for a souvenir photo. We had fun taking pictures here.

'Singapore' or 'Singapura' as I understood is Malay word for Singa (Lion). Pura (city). So this Merlion has a special meaning for Singapore such as the 'The Little Mermaid statue' in Copenhagen, Denmark

We walked our way to this place instead of taking a boat ride.. the structure was under maintenance and closed so we were unable to take any pics for memories.. this made the visit a little disappointment.. so before you go just inquire once..
Singapore is so clean and the walk along the river has sights to see, restaurants and vendors and feels safe.

This is situated at a very picturesque spot by the quay. Nice place to spend the evening. This place has a great vibe in the evenings. Lovely lights and good place to get some really cool pictures . Some very good restaurants around here too .
What is supposed to be? A giant tiger shrimp with a lion face? It looks like an object from a cinema set. The park is nothing special.
Took a picture from a distance and that was ok with me. This was not a must see on my list but I got a picture !
The mythical symbol of Singapore, it’s a tourist attraction but quickly viewed. Best seen at night. Not much to say really, it's a statue.
Entrance is $12, you only get to take a pic in the lions mouth and head. I wouldn’t recommend it for the price paid.
Great image. I have seen this before but this time it was covered in scaffolding during some repair work.

REVIEW_TITLE: Picturesque Riverside Park with the Creature of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Very popular, and sometimes crowded park with a great view of Marina Bay. The symbol of Singapore stands proudly at the end of the park spewing water from its mouth. Worth a visit. Catch the river tour boat here.
This was a spot we could have skipped. Although it is nice to see the Merlion, the park was really crowded, making it difficult to take pictures or enjoy the experience.

Great views of the Merlion from a variety of angles for the photographer and of other city sights including the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. We had a bit of difficulty finding it as you must traverse a main highway using the tunnel which is accessible in the basement of the Fullerton Hotel.
Good place to hang out and amazing view of Marina Bay Sands. But please be noted that the big Merlion statue is currently under maintenance.

This place has a great vibe in the evenings . The night we visited this place the weather was great which made our visit even better . Lovely lights and good place to get some really cool pictures . Some very good restaurants around here too .
Definitely a must visit when in Singapore.
Too bad I didn't have a chance to see the statue,it was due maitenence.The park itself is worth seeing and gives you good views.

It seems a must to see. Most people stand on their side with their
mouth opened to make out you are having a drink from the water spurting out of its mouth into yours. Nice area to walk round and you can sit down relax with a drink or a ice cream. The Merlion Lion is a nationl icon and looks over the bay as protectio6. On sentosa island you can limb up the top i believe. Sentosa island is a must to visit as well plenty to see and do.

A visit to Singapore must entail seeing the famous MerLions not far from Clarke Quay and facing the famous landmark Marina Bay Sands.

We’ve seen the MerLions on our very first visit to Singapore and the area has altered quite a bit with the development of the bay.

Half lion, half mermaid they are most unusual - it was very crowded with tourists sitting on steps and on the ground that it appears to be an area to congregate as a meeting point or to stop for a sit down and a packed lunch!

It’s spectacular and a must just for a photo if you can get near from the tourists.
It looks nice and tasteful, well worth walking over to se it - but best seen from one of the bumboats.

What has the head of a lion and the body of a fish? Answer: Merlion, the national icon of Singapore. Merlion can be seen spouting water from its location in a park that bears its name. This mythical statue’s body is said to symbolize Singapore’s beginnings as a fishing village and the head represents Singapore’s original name “lion city”. Originally, the statue was located at the mouth of the Singapore River but it was moved to its present location in 2002 to allow it to be viewed from the waterfront away from the bridge that was blocking the view. It was created in the 1990’s around the time Singapore was not longer a British colony. Merlion is a “must see”
Good place to hangout. Excellent view and photo opportunities. Nicely cleaned and maintained place. Must visit, good for walk.
The Merlion is one of the main attractions in SGP but it essentially is an average sized sculpture on the waterfront. Tourists flock around this place and click pictures with the Merlion.

This park is easily reached using the SMRT. Use Raffles Place or Marina stations. The park is very close to a harbour side walk round the Marina. There are lovely views and close to the Merlion statue itself there is a row of harbourside bars and restaurants with a wide choice of dining options. There is a modest premium on prices because of the attractive location. Also nearby are Raffles Hotel for that iconic Singapore sling, the Customs House and Fullerton’s Hotel. There are boat trips round the Marina. There are also some interesting statues nearby. See if you can find Sir Henry Raffles himself seated in discussion with two other figures or the bronze of small children tumbling into the water.
Can't understand why all the fuss. People going there like sheep. Expensive show off waterfront but nowhere to sit for breather. Not for me.
Loved loved loved this day out lots to see and do easily accessible Relaxed atmosphere plenty of refreshments available at regular interval

My friend and I, we happened to walkthrough the park from the Beach station bcs they were too many people to board the train. It was quite a hike but since it was night time, no problem with the heat there
A place which is a compulsory visit when on a singapore tour. The symbol of singapore..a trip to singapore is incomplete without having a picture clicked infront of the merlion
This was a great spot to see and be night and day. Watching the boats on the water. Just watching everything you could do. The lights open up the city at night. Beautiful ..

REVIEW_TITLE: Can’t miss the symbol of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This whole area is interesting to walk around. Gets very busy on weekends so I would advise going on a weekday if possible.
Visited here in February 2017. My partner and I spent a couple of hours walking around. Great photo opportunities, everywhere spotlessly clean. An afternoon well spent.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the most visted Attractions in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: If you have the opportunity to go there in the early morning hours you will have less crowds of tourist group from China and other countries. Also, as it's one of Singapore's Major attractions it is almost busy anytime of the day. In the evening you might enjoy the colourful light show on Merlion and MBS.

REVIEW_TITLE: Take the bum boat for a better view
REVIEW_BODY: Visited when there were not a lot of people around but hard to get a shot with out a person in the pic. a few days latter we did the Bum Boat from Clarke quay and they gave the better view and pics.

The Merlion represents the Spirit of Singapore. The diversity and strength of the people and the ocean at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula. This is the most important port separating the Orient and the Indian Ocean. A great photo opportunity and gathering place.

A visit to Singapore is incomplete without a visit to the Merlion .. A must place to be .. The Merlion is the icon of Singapore .. It is along the riverside ,, very crowded ... nice pics around to be taken .. faces the Marina Bay at some distance ..
Loved to see the Merlion #statue on the memories of Lion #The nearby Gardens by the bay Hotel and lake side view is really mesmerizing #Mutton visit when you in Singapore
Cannot be missed if you are in Singapore so much to do and see you will need at least half a day to take it all in.

This Mermaid-Lion statue is Singapore's Icon. Nice view to take a photo in the morning and the evening. The grand statue with skyscraper building in the background was a great view. Nearest MRT to this place is MRT Raffles Place Station.

We were so lucky we got here just before the storm was about to strike. Some wonderful photos and depending where you stand, you can get some incredible shots like holding the water coming out of his mouth etc - a highlight to our stopover.
One of the main attractions for any visit to Singapore. Lots of tourists but worth a stroll with many restaurants nearby.
Went here as part of a company function and it was a great resting spot. Great for people watching and taking a break. Some restaurants, but nothing special.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nothing too serious, but quite photogenic.
REVIEW_BODY:
Apparently the symbol of Singapore - half lion / half fish.
The impressive 20 foot statue spouts water into the Singapore River, and is situated close to the very impressive Fullerton Hotel.
Nothing too serious, but quite photogenic, also rather fun watching some visitor keen to get that photo by standing beneath the Merlion with an open umbrella...........
This my second time visited merlion after 5years ago. Not only merlion u can see but surrounds there can enjoy and walk to see Marina Bay Sands.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun mini activity nice stroll and view of the water
REVIEW_BODY: Free and worth a visit for a quick picture nice walk along the water and some cafes and restaurants close by too.

REVIEW_TITLE: 年末のマーライオンはスゴイ！
REVIEW_BODY: 今回は、カウントダウンをマンダリンオリエンタルシンガポールで過ごしました。マーライオンパークは、たくさんの観光客で満員です！普段のマーライオンは、ご案内の通り白ですが、年末のマーライオンは、いわゆるプロジェクションマッピング？で豪華にお化粧されています。前泊していたフラトンホテルもレインボーになっていました。 This 2017/2018 countdown, we stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore. Very nice fireworks from the bay view room! The Merlion, usually white color as you know. Countdown Merlion is decorated by means of Projection mapping! Very beautiful!
This is a must see tourist attraction. There are good restaurants around and every tourist needs a picture of the Merlion.
Beautiful statue with smaller version immediately behind it. Great photo opportunities to catch the water pouring from the Merlion's mouth. Be prepared for crowds though!

These statues (there is more than one) are quite the attraction as they draw a large crowd. There is the very visible large Merlion next to the waters edge. There is ample space from which to get good photos.

The Merlion statue is iconic to the city of Singapore and you can see its image on practically everything associated with this country
well this place is right on the Bay and the iconic statue has a fountain flowing out of the mouth of the Merlion
it is a very scenic spot, always full of tourists who are there to etch their photographs in history
this is a must visit place not for something spectacular but just The feel of having been to this beautiful city

You have to have a picture with the Merlion in the background. It used to be a much bigger attraction a couple of years ago, but much more is now available to see.
On Sentosa island, visible from far, the mascot is bound to catch your eye.
It is lit up very well at night and the falling water is serene to just sit next to for a few minutes after a tiring day at Sentosa island.

As the Merlion is Singapore´s landmark it´s a must see when being in Singapore.

From the platform next to the sculpture you have a good view over the bay with Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Singapore Flyer on the other side.
As it get´s quite crowded there it´s sometimes not so easy to take good pictures.
The restaurants, cafés and bars are quite overprized there and typically tourism spots.
Good place for taking photos of famous Singapore Buildings Always crowded Free of charge Light show of Marina Bay Sands in the night is amazing
Amazing touristic attraction a must see in Singapore. It's very vivid, and you can take picture with the symbol of Singapore (Merlion) and with the other significant buildings around.
this is the thing to do if you are first to singapore. take pictures with the icon of this country. merlion. as always this place is always crowded by tourist.

My first visit to merlion statue, it was so hot and a lot of tourist, so you barely can take nice picture without tourist blocking the way but this place is the icon of singapore so its a must-visit place :)

Located across the street from the hotel Fullerton this is where all the tourists get together for a picture. One merlion against hundreds of tourists. All the tour busses stop there. They build a dock so peoples can get almost in front of it. Small crowded place with everyone jockeying for space. Lots of restaurants around. One idea to skip the crowd take the river tour, the boat stop right in front of the merlion.
Pleasant little spot seeing this statue - extremely busy and popular with the selfie takers and other photographers. Only worth it in the sun, I'd say!

Merlion Park should be visited at least once by every visitor to Singapore. The Merlion is the city's symbol and so should feature in all tourists' holiday photo albums.

Next to the Merlion is the fabulous Fullerton Hotel and nearby a very unsual statue of boys playing and in the action of jumping into the Singapore River.
Obviously had to be visited but this landmark was much smaller than expected. A nice walk around the marina and across the jubilee bridge allowed us to see it from different angles.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place, but consider as a must site
REVIEW_BODY:
Nice place, most of the time is overcrowded with people who try to get picture. Recommended to come early in the morning when almost no body there. Walking distance to the Marina Bay, Esplanade, Suntec city mall and the CBD.
Visit time is only a few minutes but quite an effort to get there

REVIEW_TITLE: One to check off the list, but probably not worth any great effort to see
REVIEW_BODY:
We had tried to find the Merlion a couple of nights before we transferred to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, but we got a bit lost. However, it was whilst peering over the edge of the Infinity Pool of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel that we spotted it.

So we resolved to go see it prior to heading to the airport on our final day in Singapore.

Unfortunately, on that final day, it was CHUCKING it down with rain. It was a good few hours (spent wholly at The Shoppes shopping centre at Marina Bay Sands) before the rain died down enough for us to venture out.

We crossed the Helix Bridge (arguably an attraction in it's own right - if you're into bridges and architecture), which took us by various other sights such as The Float (world's largest floating stadium and stage), The Bay Grandstand, The Esplanade Outdoor Theatre, The Waterfront Promenade, and the Esplanade Bridge, before we reached the Merlion situated in Merlion Park.

Now, I've read reviews of how busy the place it, however, we went around lunchtime on a Tuesday, and it wasn't nearly as rammed as I've been led to believe that it could get. We easily took our pictures of and with the Merlion, and helped others take theirs without much bother.

Was it worth waiting out the rain to visit? I want to an emphatic "yes", but I can't. I can't say that its worth spending a great day of time or effort to get to, but that said, I am glad that we went, if only to tick something off our list.

The park itself is quite nice, and you can see some stunning views, but after visiting something like The Garden by the Bay, most other park type areas pale in comparison.
The most popular site in Singapore. The park is very clean and always busy. Photo opp for sure. Check the history of the Merlion which is the name of the statue. What Singapore is all about.
Either day time or night time. Merlion Park is a must to visit. You can enjoy the stunning skyline of Singapore. There are shops and bars nearby as an additional value.
Well if you go to Singapore you must visit Merlion Park. Really nice view of all Singapore center. Nice to walkaround with family, friends or couples.

REVIEW_TITLE: An iconic Singaporean feature worth a look
REVIEW_BODY: A popular place to have your photo taken with this mythical half fish, half lion creature. It stand overlooking the mouth of the Singapore river and has a viewing platform all around so snap shots can be taken from any angle. Lots of opportunity for the trick shots of the water cascading from the Merlion's mouth.
Day and night nice to watch. Made a boot trip and passed by. Very inpressive how it's made. Go see..

Other than Marina Bay the most famous attraction in Singapore is the Merlion Park .. It is the most sought after place in Singapore for tourists .. The famous lion with water flowing through its mouth .. It is a neat and well maintained .. lies next to the Singapore River and is at the walking distance from the Marina .. Must visit for sure .. Most of our souvenirs are the merlion

Took the hop on hop bus to Santosa Island - loved it - even tho hubby and I decided to walk to the beach after going around the place and got lost and walked for at least an hour before we got to the beach lol

A must see when visiting Singapore, the Merlion is a key tourist attraction, known the world over. It is set next to the Singapore River, is kept squeaky clean and provides an excellent venue for memorable photography. There are nice restaurant located within its vicinity for a quick bite or coffee.

One has to at least walk past the Merlion once on their visit to Singapore. After all, Singa Pura means Lion City, and the Merlion has guarded this city since before all that fancy architecture just across the water came into being.

Whether you're staying up the Singapore River, or over in the Marina Bay area, the Merlion is an easy spot to pass by on a walk. It's located very close to many of the Old Singapore buildings too.

A very pleasant spot to stop. Eateries abound there, ferries stop there. Easy to pass by, easy to get to.

It was a very nice experience great view and plenty of vantage points , the status was originally on the other side of the road but removed piece by piece and rebuilt beautifully . There are toilets, it's wheel chair accessible and plenty of places to get a feed , a beer and even an ice cream .
you missed the national symbol the elephant??/ then why did you go to singapore?? go alone not with a hop in/of group you will not enjoy the place

REVIEW_TITLE: AMAZING boat ride a d Merlon view
REVIEW_BODY: It is the most amazing Boat ride that tell you history of the place and various buildings around the sea however the best was meelon view super attraction

We are glad we came to visit this is part of our evening stoll across marina bay at night when all the buildings are surrounding areas are lit up.

I think during the day would not be as impressive. Would definitely visit the statue as part of the wider visit to the marina.

I visited this place in september 2017.It should be visited both during day time and in night for fantastic lighting view of highrises in marina bay area.One can have a fantastic view of marina bay area from this place.You can also take a boat ride from this place .
The landmark structure of singapore is a good photo opportunity. Located in the center of singapore, you can visit this place once.

REVIEW_TITLE: Just a concrete lion fountain spewing water into the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Biggest downside is that it is not very easy to access by public transportation. Significant walking after your get off the bus or MRT, and then back to the transit stop. I suppose it was interesting but not really worth the detour if your are visiting Raffles (which is now mostly closed for renovations). .
Very nice are, especially in the evening. Enjoy a nice walk along the river and enjoy the view and lights of surrounding skyline.
This is a very lovely place to go to take pictures but can get very very crowded so sometimes hard to get that perfect picture. Lots of bars and restaurants for food and drinks
Had a very nice day walking this area. Very beautiful and lots to do there. Plenty of places to get a bite to eat also.

We spent a few hours wandering around the veiw is excellent and the water features are cool we had a great time just walking around great for families and the food at the kiosk is reasonable price not a absolute must see but pretty neat all the same
You cannot visit Singapore and not visit the Merlin. The bay offers some great photographic opportunities.

Merlion is having a head of lion and body of fish..there are two statues..one is the bigger one and other one is smaller cub near the bigger one. It's located near the bridge and it's inside a park as it's name.. beautiful to see it once and tourist take time to visit this place.

A visit to the Merlion is essential to the fabric of any visit to Singapore.

Located in a beautiful little park area, surrounded by restaurants, bars, coffee shops, etc., the Merlion comes to life as people stop to snap a few photos of the city's landmark.

Gotta be there....

Well, yes it is a nice statue but the park is extremely crowded and you can not have a photograph with the statue without an Asian tourist. Let's accept it they are very rude when they travel with groups.
Very touristy spot. Nice to walk around and iconic photo op. Lots of restaurants and nice outlook over Marina Bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must-do but really touristic and average
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion park is the one thing you can't miss when in Singapore. It's crowded here, but watching people can be fun as well :)

I've been to Singapore several times already and I've done the touristy stuff during the first.

This was my first time though to frequent the Merlion. I only took a snap of this from a far off vantage point during the first time.

It was okay though flocked with tourists considering it was halloween.
One of Singapore’s many landmarks this was a fun icon to see and it also has great views of Marina Bay Sands and the harbour front area, it’s a nice walk over the bridge to see the Merlion.

Not particularly something to see in itself. Part of the gorgeous marina which is pure magic at night but this is nothing special just a half mermaid half lion fountain! Nice to see as you walk past but no need to stop

What happens if you add the mermaid and lion then you get Merlion. This is an amazing work and standing tall its wonderful. Another great view if you happen to climb up, even otherwise you get a great glimpse...

A must see whilst in Singapore. Very busy most of the time but it's a bit of fun with a lot of history behind the reason the Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. We walked past most days and it never failed to make us stop and take a few more photos. Trying to capture the water in our mouths photos were great fun.
Nice view. Went afternoon as part of city tour. Wonder how would it look in the night. Especially the boat ride. Don't miss it.

Made the trip to see the Merlion on foot,which took a while but was good exercise. Had to do the mandatory photo of posing in just the right position to give the impression that the fountain is pouring into your mouth. Restaurants and toilets nearby. Gives a good view of the other side of the bay. Worth a trip for a bit of silliness.

We often walked around in the night and one of our favourite places to be after dinner was the Merlion Park. Besides the famous Merlion statues, the park also offers a great place to sit and relax. While there do not forget to try the coconut ice cream served in a coconut shell. It is a must eat.

Not as amazing as many other sites in Singapore but thankfully due to it's location close to other sights it's one of those you must see just so you can say that you did. Good photo opportunities as well

REVIEW_TITLE: This is a must to see on Sentosa Island
REVIEW_BODY: What a brilliant idea, and especially in the evenings when every 30 minutes there is a light and music display which is free of charge. Easily located by the monorail station and this an unique attraction.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice Place to Get a Few Photos
REVIEW_BODY: Good fun getting pictures of the lion from all of the possible angles. There are many tourists striking poses for photos here.

The Merrion Park is a must see when in Signapore. To get there you can take the train then a short taxi ride. The park is on the waterfront with spectacular views of the famous Marina Bay Sands hotel and a museum. There are bars, restaurants and shops close by so there are many things to keep you entertained. This area is absolutely perfect to take pictures (see my pictures).

This is a must see when in Signapore!
Interesting little park with a "Merlion" statue on the bay. Nice area to stroll around on a lazy Sunday afternoon.
This has to be high on the list for places to see in Singapore as it's one of the most well known attractions. The history behind the Merlion is interesting and a great photo opportunity.

A stroll along the Marina will bring you to the Merlion Park, it is generally well patronised so you need to be patient to get a picture. There are some good photo opportunities here there are a number of eateries nearby for a meal.

REVIEW_TITLE: Happening place, nice view and light show
REVIEW_BODY:
Being local, I have not been here since years ago and chance upon it last night while taking a stroll from old parliament house. I think singaporean should visit these places more, the photo op and view are stunning, weather not too hot or cold, lots of tourist and kids running around the park. The view of the merlion is great from many angle, then there's the light show every night I think around 8pm, so pay a visit to the place by yourself, don't need to book a tour, you can walk from cityhall MRT station or Raffles MRT station about 15 minutes.
Lots of pub and eateries along the park so don't need to worry about food or drinks, clean toilets and after the show, take a nice stroll to the singapore Esplanade and eat some local food around there or a quick shopping stop at Marina square.
Great river and harbour walk all through this area. See the Merlion and across to Marina Bay. Great paths but tourist numbers build very early in the morning so come here early.
Whilst in the Bay Area, you must visit and see this important statue. Some great views across the bay, a very vibrant area At Night, with lots of restaurants including street food.

Half-fish and half-lion, the iconic Merlion resides at the waterfront Merlion Park, is a Singapore landmark and major tourist attraction.Nice place & definitely a must visit while in Singapore. The view around the Merlion is also beautiful. You can also see the most spectacular hotel in Singapore " Merina Bay Sand " from this point.

This place is possibly the most touristy of them all. The Lion is there to welcome visitors to Singapore and hundreds of people are there getting selfies with the lion, “drinking” from his waterfall mouth.

Despite this area being so busy, it makes for some great photos and the scenery is really great.

It’s definitely a must visit while in Singapore.
We walked from our hotel to the point where the Merlion is (6km) and were glad that we did , plenty of visitors at about 8.30am (Tour Groups) , my wife is smitten with the ICON of the MERLION.

Good place to view the panorama of the bay... of cours here the main actraction is the lion fountain but also the nearest bridge and the walk around all the bay are amazing...good place to spend couple of hours

This was a good walk along the riverfront in Singapore. Lots of tourist go here so it can get very crowded. Early morning was best, both for crowed and heat. This is also a place to see the Sands Hotel the Cruise Ship on top. You will be close to many of the towns attractions so have your day planned out. Lots of great restaurants in this area also as well as shopping.

REVIEW_TITLE: During the night or/and very early in the morning...
REVIEW_BODY: ...would be the best time to visit Merlion. We stayed at the Fullerton hotel, 5min far away, so we came here 2 times by walk (morning and evening). If you come early in the morning, there are not soo many tourists, so you can take nice pictures of Merlion. In the night the view is a different one, for my taste better (with the lighted Marina Bay Sands in the background). Well it seems like it is a very popular place by the tourists, as it is almost always overcrowded, but it is not the best place in the city...for me nothing special.

No matter if you come here at night or in the day, there is always a nice view awaiting you. Even though it may get a little hot in the day, you can always chill out at the nearby restaurants and admire the view of Marina Bay Sands. At night, come and see the lights opposite of the river

REVIEW_TITLE: You have to get a picture here
REVIEW_BODY: Yes, add this to your agenda. Easy to find and access, great spot for pictures and some great things to see here. If you are not used to the heat, take a hat.

I guess this is one of the places tourists will go to - to see the Merlion. It's just a big statute of a creature that does not exist in real life - and it's spewing water into the sea!

But we all still went there and took photos.

It was quite a nice place and you can see Marina Bay Sands on one side and the Esplanade on the other too.

Of course this is a must visit icon of Singapore! We walked here along the river in the morning and got there at about 8am. The viewing area is very exposed to the sun, and it was already crowded with tourists. Not a big problem because you don't need to hang around too long anyway. Take your photos and move on.
This monument it's only for getting pictures and post them on social APPs. It can get so crowded but those good pics really worth the visit and the wait.
Easy to find this place,near the mrt station,have a wonderful scenery with a marina bay sands and singapore flyer as a background.

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting corner of the bay typically
REVIEW_BODY: Typically of Singapore immaculately kept. Adds to the interest walking around the bay .Good spot for photos

Some lovely night shots to take here. You can walk around in perfect safety, we were there around midnight and still quite a few people taking selfies with the sculpture in the background. Lovely views of Marina Bay as well. We were there days after the GP so the light framework was still in place adding to the atmosphere.
You must see the Merlion - we come and visit each time! There is a nice area to walk around and it is a nice photo too. Always busy but a must see.
Everyone who will visit Singapore must go to this place. Very good attraction for tourists especially who loves taking photos.

REVIEW_TITLE: You Can't Visit Singapore and Not Take a Photo of the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: This is a Singapore icon that you need to take a photo of. Usually pretty crowded but plenty of room to get photos from different angles. Nice to see both during the day and at night when it is light up in different colours. You get a great view of some other classic Singapore attractions as well like the Flyer and Marina Bay Sands.

This is the iconic Singapore Dragon which is a huge water fountain opposite the bay from the Marina Bay Sands hotel. The whole area is accessible on foot but there is SO much to see you need to take comfortable walking shoes and be reasonably fit. The laser light show here at 20.00 each evening is truly amazing - don't miss it!

REVIEW_TITLE: A symbol of Singapore.....worth a look
REVIEW_BODY: I'd not heard of a Merlion before but it's basically a bit like a Mermaid only part lion. To the locals it's a big deal and as well as this park in the centre of the city there is a larger statue on Sentosa. It's very busy with lots of people getting their photos/selfies. Great views of Marina Bay Sands across the water. It's worth 30-60 mins of your time

Our bus dropped us over the road which we very carefully negotiated. There was quite a crowd there but we were still able to clearly approach and see all the lions in the park, and even pose for some typical tourist photos.
I recommend to visit in the evening as than you can see the lights and it becomes very lively here. .

REVIEW_TITLE: Very scenic with great views of the Gardens by the Bay hotel
REVIEW_BODY: We spend a a couple of hours there during the day and then a couple of hours in the evening to see the light show. It's very pleasant place with lots of restaurants, downtown business center around, and riverboat trips. Must see it both during the day and in the evening. The light shows are twice in the evening at 7:30 and 9 pm.
Very busy fito shoot place. Merlion not very impressive but the views over the Bay, of Marina Bay Sand and the business centre certainly are

Your trip to Singapore can still be complete without a visit here. The surrounding views are great, making it easy to get a glimpse of the country's other famous attractions. But truth be it's just a sea lion statue that sprays out water, albeit a very symbolic one that's represented as the national icon. Very tall, very heavy, and very white, giving it a major presence within the park but also completely flooded with tourists which can make private photos with a loved one a bit of a challenge. Lots of nearby restaurants and cafes on the promenade, but on the pricey side with the location being a key factor. No cost, easy access and a paltry 20 mins is all that's needed...

I thought the merlion was nice but ultimately the area as a whole is pleasant. Especially during the evening so you can the city lights and walk along the esplanade. If your hungry there are plenty of restaurants you can choose from. There is a lighting show for you to look at onto which adds a little extra value to your visit.
Nice area to have a walk, plenty of restaurants and cafes and of course the merlion. Great views over to the Bay Sands, the gardens and the flyer
Unless you're in to mermaids or merlions this isn't a big attraction. Good for a quick photo or a 10 minute stay then move on

REVIEW_TITLE: The Lion will wet you but never bite you!
REVIEW_BODY: Just one of those places you have to visit. The Merlion is the icon of Singapore; he's half fish and half lion. Merlion Park is situated in front of the Fullarton Hotel.

There are so many super places to visit in Singapore and the Merlion Park had a lot going for it.
It's free, always warm, mostly sunny and you get superb views walking through the safe clean paths and a bit of exercise will set you up for some afternoon tea in the Fullerton Hotel or other eateries.
There are memorials and statues relating to historical figures and events with plenty of descriptive information. And of course the Merlion!
When we were there they were setting up the gantries and fences for the Grand Prix so we had to skirt round them but it was a small price to pay for a beautiful walk in this amazing city state.

Obviously the Merlion statue resides in this park. You see Merlion, in many different guises, in all the souvenir shops, so you really should take the time to see it in the flesh so to speak; one visit is probably enough though. We first saw it from a Bumboat in the river, probably the best place to get a photo from, but we still decided to visit the area on foot. It is quite crowded but we found that people were friendly and the atmosphere quite festive, lots of smiles, lots of laughter.
I gone there with my wife after riding cable car. Small park. Just near Universal Studio. Nice place to take rest. Otherwise nothing to see

This one of singapore landmark, if u dont take photos here its mean u not go to singapore.
Fish with lion head is the statue where people always take shoot when they go to singapore.
In this area,u can buy a merchandise or pay to seightseeing singapore with boat
must have picture if youre in singapore, tourists always takes a picture of the merlion statue, its evidence that you were in singapore :)

Found this walking the circumference of Marina Bay Area. Very busy here in the evening with tourists flocking to take photos. Nice statue and pleasant area for shops and restaurants around it. This is a unique icon of Singapore - moved to this location in 2002 and sits proud and tall and the water spout working well from its mouth. Great view of Marina Bay Sands from here too.
i come to take a picture because this is the icon of Singapore and so many tourist go there to take a picture. the place was so hot, but lovely place to take a picture
Walked round the promenade. Beautiful part of the bay. Was very hot the day we went but refreshing to be near the water.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion park is nice, but nothing spectacular
REVIEW_BODY: Interesting statues and history, but overall it's just a park/promenade that caters mostly to the tourists. Lots of restaurants/cafes/bars. It's a HUGE tourist draw, so gets pretty crowded around the Merlion. Worth a stop for a few minutes, but nothing more to do around there otherwise.

Loved the experience of Merlion Park. What's nicer than enjoying a nice stroll in lovely weather with all the delightful scenery around. Very relaxed and many tourists just enjoying quality time there.

The most visited place in Singapore. They say you have never been to Singapore if you didn't have a photo taken here. The view is amazing - Marina Bay hotel looking fine across the river as well as the Singapore Flyer. The breeze of the air is refreshing here and it is a sight to behold!

Located along the waterfront, this symbol of Singapore is very impressive. Photo taking is available, people watching is in abundance and the sights of the center of the city unbelievable. Must see activity! This area can be best seen from the water on a sightseeing boat at night!

The bay and its skyscrapers is certainly a beautiful place to visit, but the Merlion really looks like an artificial local monument created to be a soulless tourist trap. If you come to Singapore and don't see the Merlion, you most probably won't miss the attraction. However, do spend time walking around in the area, it's worth it. Amongst other artificial tourist traps in town to be avoided (in my opinion) is the Singapore Sling cocktail rip-off at the Raffles Hotel. There again, prefer walking around or have a room or lunch/brunch/dinner there, the Raffles still remains a very special place in Singapore.
A very nice park with a beautiful view too big. I would suggest that you go to the sun's time and wait until 20.00 for the show with the fountains...!

Merlion Park is one of the major tourist attractions in Singapore. It is home to Singapore’s mythical beast, Merlion, which has the body of a fish and the head of a lion. At night time, the place is well lit; coupled with the gentle breeze and the bright skyline, the beauty of the park is further enhanced. You can even go under the bridge where there are cafés and gift shops to purchase some lovely souvenir items.

To get to Merlion Park, catch the MRT to Raffles Place station on the East West Line. Take the exit towards the United Overseas Bank Plaza and from the middle of the plaza, you’ll see the Fullerton Hotel. Merlion Park is behind the hotel.

Famous country/city monuments are touristy & crowded, how can you not visit Singapore and not have that all important selfie with the Merlion - at least once. It was extremely crowded & overcast & we get that photo.
You can enjoy view of the city here. Very crowded and full of tourists, but still clean. It is one of the most important things to donin Singapore.
Nice little tourist spot on the edge of marina Bay and Clarke quay. I would recommend the river cruise that gives you a bit more insight into the history of the bay
Across the street from The Fullerton Hotel. Beautiful view of the Bay and Marina Sands area. The statue is large and makes a nice photo op. It's close to Boat Quay. See it by riverboat as well.

This is just the pedestrian side of the bay but plenty to see and do. Boat rides circle the bay. Restaurants line the front. Lots of tourists and it's hot ! There are bars and ice cream shops Pretty place but nothing special

When you walk here you are close to the business district with skyscrappers and on the otherside clear view to the Marina bay sands.

The lion/fish statue is the same as the little mermaid in copenhagen harbour: nice but if you missted it..... don't make a big deal about it.
Went at night to see the Merlion. Great photos with the city scape. Worth a 10 min visit to this iconic location.

Visit the Merlion at night time. It could be crowded but very beautiful view at night time. A lot of restaurants on the side but can be pricey. Avoid weekends and try going here on weekdays instead. You can have a better view and pictures with lesser crowd.
We were there midday and it was very crowded. recommend you go early morning. Great views of the harbor area. Basically just a concrete viewing platform.
A must visit to this Singapore National Symbol. Great views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Financial District.
It was very busy near the Merlion. People were jostling each other to get the best photos. Only a very short time needed to visit, but a great view across the bay to Marine Sands hotel.

I just loved this place. When I reached here I was mesmerised by the view and could feel that I am actually in Singpore. You can see theGarden by the bay, Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Flyer from here. There is Merlion statue. This place is excellent for taking pictures. Go at such a time hwen you can see the day vire and night view both.
It's ok for a quick photo but not much else to do around there. Full of tour groups! The merlion itself is ok but not as grand as the one in sentosa.

We saw the Merlion from the water as we took our boat tour of the Bay. It's apparently quite old and famous and a part of Singapore's history. To my mind it's a nice statue, in a pretty part of town, spouting water from its mouth

Yes is can get rather busy. But it really is worth it. The views of the city and across to Marina Bay really are worth it. Merlion Park is one of the things you have to do when you go to Singapore. It is not a far walk from the MRT and there are plenty of places close by to get something to eat or drink. Don't forget to get a picture of the Mini Merlion just behind the big one.
Came across this Merlion while wondering the streets. So big and perfect for a photo op. Could see great views of the harbour and the marina bay sands. Put it on your list of places to visit.
Nice view around the city and Singapore was very hot but close to the river you can have fresh air and feel better

The Merlion is a water spouting mythical creature on the side on a concrete quay - not a park at all! It is crowded with tourists so be prepared. There is little shade except to linger under the bridge. You WILL get wet if you go within a couple of metres of the lion with spray depending on the breeze! It was quite refreshing in the July heat!

REVIEW_TITLE: The number one must in town
REVIEW_BODY: You haven't been in Singapore if you haven't seen the Merlion. It's the most iconic view of Singapore and you get great views of the Marina from here as well. If you want good shots of the Marina Bay Sands hotel, this is the spot to take them from.
The Merlion is an iconic symbol of Singapore. When we see the merlion either on a postcard or a moulded chocolate we are reminded of Singapore. The views at night of and from the merlion are great.
A wonderful day out and plenty to do for all the family make sure you got your camera, the restaurants close by are amazing with great views
It is a must visit area. Take many photos. It is so calm and beautiful.go there at night . And have a drink.
Nice photography. Outdoor. No food available there. Taxi available there. Historical Site. Overlooking Marina Bay Sands
It's a must see attraction but was it an anticlimax. That's going to be down to personal opinion. It's not huge I'll say that. Easy enough to get to so why wouldn't you go?

Came here with my Singaporean friend who gave me a tour of the best spots...he said this was an iconic part of Singapore as it's the only thing that is distinctly theirs. It's packed full of tourists hopping off their day trip coaches, and people doing millions of selfies.
A must for every tourist visiting Singapore. The Merlion is stunning but smaller in real life than expected.
We saw the park on a Sunday afternoon along with a great number of other people. The statue of the Merlion is such an iconic artwork for the people of Singapore,
It is a nice tourist place with good background to click your pics with the merlion which brings prosperity to the land of Singapore

We were in Singapore for a day and decided we must come see the iconic Merlion so we asked to be dropped off at Merlion Park from the airport. It was a quick ride and there are a few vendors and shops along the waterfront. Definitely a good experience that you should see once, but once is enough.
Its great to see Singapore's lion but it was a little too busy which was unfortunate but go place to take photos
This is the cult in Singapore! If you were in Singapore you have to see Merlion statue and take a photo with it :)

For those who visit Singapore for the first time, this is usually a must see and photograph place to visit. Awesome views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the tall buildings of the CBD(Central Business District), along with the opportunity to take a boat cruise of the bay. There are a few spots to eat, but frankly if you visit this famous tourist attraction, that's probably not your number one reason for visiting. This park is easily accessible by MRT, taxi or Uber(cheaper option after the MRT). Probably the best time to visit is in the early morning or late afternoon hours, if you're not a fan of the heat and humidity along with a strong tropical sun. This is one of those places that you will have ample opportunity to get a great picture and enjoy a nice walk along the water while admiring the architecture and the Merlion statues.
A cute merlion statue and a nice view of the bay provide nice backdrops for your photos. What's not to love?

The Merlion is the mascot of Singapore. And your trip would be incomplete if you dont visit the Merlion statue at the bay. Its a beautiful big white statue of half lion and half mermaid/fish. Take a lot of photos here and especially the one with the perspective of the water going in your mouth(instagrammers would know). beautiful sunset views and may get crowded..I went here late night...it was very serene..and less crowd..
If you visit Singapore for the first time, this is a must-go attraction to take some photos with the merlion.
Just a neat spot to take some photos, be sure to time your photos for sunset because the casino across the bay looks great. Its a quick walk to Boat Quay for dinner afterwards.
Gets very busy so difficult to get that exceptional picture. Bigger Merlion on Sentosa island . Good bats and restaurants nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: must visit land mark in singapore
REVIEW_BODY: these are the land marks u must visit at singapore. these are like the mandatories. its just the ico it represents it in the world famous lists. it about hte countries culture. MUST VISIT

If you are in Singapore, this is one thing u will not miss.. seeing the 'Merlion'. The place has brightness and shine to offer during the day but it's soothing and romantic in the evening. You'd love having a stroll there on the long stretch. Would recommend to visit at both times.
Walking around Marina Bay was a nice night activity, and this park is very popular that all tourists normally go to.
It's the national symbol.. it's just that.. nothing apart from the Merlion at that place..it's okay to visit if you find time.

This is not really a park but the name given to the area surrounding the Merlion Singapore’s iconic statue half fish and half lion symbolizing the cities early beginnings which stands looking across Marina Bay towards the sea and said to be ‘welcoming’ visitors to Singapore – always crowded - you can spend an amusing five minutes watching people trying to pose for that special photo! – look out also for a smaller version called the Cub which sits in a pond nearby
Merlion Park is a bustling area after dark with several restuarants and bars that come to life in the evenings.

REVIEW_TITLE: A fun stop along the walk on Marina Bay
REVIEW_BODY: We stopped here on our way to the marina bay boat ride. It's definitely worth the time and a good photo opportunity.

REVIEW_TITLE: Finally got to see the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: Finally got to see the Merlion without having to go to Sentosa. Even though it was overcast and raining, the white statue looked stunning as it poured water into the bay. Would look better on a sunny day, but we were very happy nonethelesss

REVIEW_TITLE: nice for a lazy afternoon stroll
REVIEW_BODY: it's nowt special, its much like any other huge outdoor space with different water features. although to be fair I did enjoy walking around, it's mostly wheelchair friendly and on a nice day pack a picnic and relax.
Hot and busy spot should go early or bring hand fan but can walk along the river to other places Easy to get to MRT Raffles Place station (Exit H) and walk for 5 minutes
Wandered down here early one morning thinking we were going to miss the crowds. How wrong we were. There were hundreds there off cruise ships but we got lots of photos. Nice attraction.

We actually took our photos from the bridge going over the harbour/river as it gave a better and more traditional view. The view from the water would have been excellent. I have always wanted to see the merlion, so that is a tick on my bucket list!

REVIEW_TITLE: Good to see but not a lot going on
REVIEW_BODY: Went as part of our walk round the bay and apart from the Merlion itself there is really nothing else. The restaurants and bars around it are eyewatering £10UK for a bottle of water and a coke! Go and see it but be careful if you sit at the bars as you will pay for it.
Very popular place for tourists, and hot. There is no shade and is surrounded by concrete it becomes a little uncomfortable especially in the afternoon. Worth a visit but go early to beat the heat.

Use sunscreen & bring water, protect yourself, it's very hot and not so many shady place around the Merlion. Not sure what is the good time to come as it always looks busy. There's some cafe around, wide options for snacks.
The symbol of Singapore shines in this magnificent park. The majestic Merlion spouts water from its mouth and is the source of countless photo-ops.
The Merlion is the mascot of Singapore. This is an unimpressive statue of the Merlion with water shooting out of his/her mouth.

REVIEW_TITLE: Symbol of the City with Bay Views
REVIEW_BODY: Very busy with visitors from all over the world and that is part of the attraction - people watching! Just go with the flow, wait your turn for the obligatory photo with the Merlion and make sure you don't get poked in the eye with a selfie stick!

It's the symbol of Singapore and is so easy to get too you should really try to visit!
There's great views available whilst your there,and if the big Merlion is undergoing a cleaning session then there's a smaller baby Merlion statue to see too.
There's plenty of refreshment places around too.
How to get there?
I took the North/South line on the MRT (the red coloured line) and got off at Raffles Place (NS26) then headed straight ahead to the river and turned left towards the Fullerton Hotel (a lovely scenic walk with great photo ops).
The Merlion Park is across the (BIG) road in front of the Fullerton Hotel.

Overall I'm glad I went to see it and get some great pics!

REVIEW_TITLE: A must-see in Singapore - but share it with the world
REVIEW_BODY: The "park" is a small area close by the major throughfare past the Fullerton and the mandatory stop for all sightseing tours of Singapore, so come prepared for a crowd! But it does provide a brilliant view of the bay with Marina Bay Sands as the spectacular backdrop, a view which is not often shown when promoting Singapore in the media. Calling it a park is stretching it a bit as the major green components are the few trees providing much appreciated shade in the midday sun.

I was excited to be here but not as much as I had thought I'd be. Again nice place to visit but nothing like I imagined it to be.. though it's an iconic landmark of singapore but EOD it's a statue spitting water..

But yes you can easily spend a few hours here.. but mind well it's going to be sweaty.. it's crowded and hot there..

But easily accessible through MRT. Reach Raffles Place and then walk across the bank of the river and you'll reach there.. spend a few hours clicking photos and then walk to marina bay sands (long walk but a nice one)..

You can also take a ferry..

I think the Merlion represents the old and new Singapore, but you'd need to fact check.
We saw the statue on foot and by boat, and would recommend getting a night cruise and experiencing it that way. Less crowded and cooler, and really although it's an impressive structure there really isn't a lot to see.
Worth a look, but plan it on the way to somewhere:)

When you first enter this venue you don't immediately realize it's a nice place with full of surprises. As your eyes settle to the dim light inside and you notice sea creatures on display only then it dawns on you the importance of the arrangement. Interestingly enough artifacts on display suddenly come alive on your camera-eye and the pics become illuminated. Then mystery of place unfolds and you get to see the cavern in totally a new perspective. Very pleasing indeed. Next you are taken to a brief documentary which gives you a quick background info before you go up thru lift to tour Merlion mouth from within. Here you can strike the bell and make a wish before entering Merlion's jaws. Afterwards You can also climb stairs all the way up to have a look of Sentosa Island from atop Merlion. Oh I forgot to mention by the Lift you get a golden coin with Merlion face embossed for keepsake. A nice memorabilia!
Merlion park is great spot for photos and enjoying the beautiful climate in Singapore, catch one of the river boats to really highlight the beauty of the park.

Must see in Singapore!

This park is very busy location of taking photos but it was fun.

Many people watching, very crowded with visitors from all the world!

I stopped by here in afternoon, buy in the night time, it's beautiful too.

For sure this iconic and popular landmark not to be missed!

However, do not make the Merlion Park district the only reason to be.
Best views of the marina bay and check out the history of this area when it was the waterfront of the original Singapore

Merlion park which is facing the backwaters and the marina bay sands is situated in the middle of the business hub of the city.. An enchanting place for the nature lovers who can experience the cold breeze with the astonishing buildings around. A good walk from Clarke Quay multifolds the enjoyment...

This place has some great photo opportunities for some of Singapore's attractions - Marina Bay Sands, the flyer, Art Science museum etc. Not worth a special visit but if you're nearby stop by for a few pictures. Very busy for what it is
This is a view and place everybody who comes to Singapore has to visit. Great views and it has a history you gotta learn. There are restaurants and coffee shops around. Price : Sgd 0
Should visit during evening time.. Nice weather + Beautiful scenery. A place you can relax after a long walk.

While in the Marina Bay Area this is one of the main attractions which are all mainly set around the bay. All of these attractions including the gardens and the Marina Bay hotel etc are within 30 / 45 mins walk of one another.

Came here as part of a tour and this is an amazing structure in the Marina Bay Area, lots and lots of tourists grabbing photo opportunities, we also visited as part of a river cruise so you get a different aspect from the front of this half lion half fish statue

i know that the Merlion has become a symbol of Singapore; and i know that the Merlion now has a cub too but braving the hundreds of selfie taking people to be able to see this iconic place takes some fortitude. It is very popular and is very busy. It is worthwhile going tothe park to see the Bay and the areas around it but don't make the Merlion Park the only reason to be there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Drop By This Landmark For A Photo Op
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion Park mainly consists of a statue of the Merlion, which is a half-lion half-fish icon. The spouting water offers a refreshing spray in Singapore's heat. You can take photographs or take a river cruise. While there isn't all that much to do, it's worth popping by if you are in the Marina Bay area, since the Merlion Park is one of the landmarks of Singapore.

The Merlion Park is accessible from the Esplanade via the Jubilee Bridge. The Jubilee Bridge itself is significant as it was opened as part of Singapore's 50th birthday celebrations.

REVIEW_TITLE: Testament to the City-States Past and Future
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park is a must see site for tourists! The site boats beautiful views of Singapore's Central Business District, and also blends the old and the new very well.

A nice enough sculpture and of passing interest. It is featured in all the guide books so as a visitor you are compelled to go and have a look. By all means go and tick it off the list but combine it with a walk across the helix bridge or something else in the vicinity so you don't waste a lot of time.
If your on the bay, you might as well visit the town icon. Loads of tourists will join you in getting just the right photo of the water spewing king of Singapore.

This is a must see place when we come to Singapore. There is a lot of people surrounding the lion statue.
I have to wait for a while to get a good spot for photo taken. I think this place is a lot prettier at night when the merlion's and surroundings lights are on, it's so beautiful.

This is just an ok place. There's nothing here to see except having a selfie with the Merlion. That's it. People come here in sun. Have a selfie with the Merlion and then there's another mini Merlion. That's it.
Visited the MerLion Park at night when the lights of all the surrounding buildings decorated the night sky
We went by boat from Clarke Quay along the Singapore River. This was a great way to see Singapore from a different angle. The Lion was one of many things to see.
The merlion is a fairly new statue located at lakeside of marina bay. Very crowded by mostly Chinese tourists. If you do have spare time go there and take a picture otherwise leave it out.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nothing special for the main city landmark
REVIEW_BODY: Make sure to know the story of the Merlion at least, since the statue and the whole location itself has zero charme.
We went both day and night and the views of the MBS and bay are amazing, also the Merlion fountain is pretty cool, very crowded and lots of tourists but to be expected. Worth a visit

Cool place to take a picture, selfie or just to chill out and enjoy the spectacular view over the marina bay and the the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. What? You don't know the legend of the lion? Ok, no problem, here it is: "In the 14th century, the prince of Sumatra of the hindu Kingdom Sri Vjaya married the princess of the buddhist Kingdom of Mjapahir. Later on he got in trouble because of it and had to flee from Sumatra to Temasek (the city at the sea). On his way, he met a lion in the jungle. He was scared and he was ready to fight him, but after a while staring at themselves, they saw themselves at equal, turned around and passed each other. The prince was so fascinated of that encounter, he decided to rename the city of Temasek to Singapore (Singha = Lion; pura = city). From that moment onwards the landmark of Singapore was the "Merlion", half lion because of his strength and half mermaid to show the closeness to the sea. The mistake in that story would be that at this time there were no lions in this area, so it probably was a tiger!"
Many tourist take picture here. Don't forget to gear up your gadget if you want to take selfie or wefie, not all people willing to help you take a picture 😎
I really enjoyed the Merlion park, from its individuality to where it is located it is such an icon of Singapore.
Always great view. Place so iconic. Photo stop that tells you to everyone you come to Singapore. Must visit event come here many times
If u r gng for 1st time do visit the place... Nice place with cleaniness.. U can view marina bay from thr... Photoshot place... Nice photography...
Very nice location next to the water. Walking distance to the MRT. It has lovely views and a great location of talking pictures
Great place for photos of surrounding waters and buildings top photo shots The story of how Singapore was founded by a person seeing a lion in 1200 and a mermaid hence the name Merloin park
A must go place for tourist to get a photo with the merlion! Good place for a romantic walk at night with your loved ones!

REVIEW_TITLE: Quick visit for photos and city views
REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful area to take panoramic photos from here because you can see all the major landmarks from the Merlion. Also not to busy if there is nothing happening. Lion itself nothing special and I believe the bridge was erected to celebrate 50 year independence.
Must visit to be the real tourist. Great location for a chill out. Great eateries close by. Sat around and people watched for a while

despite of constant crowd visit to this well-known landmark of Singapore, I'm impress that the nearby public toilet was so well-maintained and even easily accessible by those group that needs special care.

Merlion can be viewed close up without the crowds by taking a river boat ride from Clark Quay or duck boat tour which either one will stop directly in front of this icon on the bay....photo moment here .

REVIEW_TITLE: Half Mermaid, half lion......perhaps the most photographed icon in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: It's a MUST! You have to walk around here and take that photo with the Merlion! You haven't been to Singapore if you don't!
A sight that is worthwhile seeing as you pass by but which would not warrant a separate specific journey to see it alone. Suggest it is used as part of a familiarisation walkabout.

REVIEW_TITLE: A very popular focal point of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We passed by (and stopped to take photos) a few times while in Singapore. It's certainly very popular for selfies, and photos generally, and especially so as nightfall approaches. Can get quite crowded, but there's plenty of vantage points.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion Park Great Place for Photos
REVIEW_BODY: This spot is perfect for photos! It was crowded today with what felt like thousands of people taking selfies. Fun high energy everywhere you look.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must stop and see the lion fountain
REVIEW_BODY: If a tourist to Singapore you must see the Merlion fountain which is the national symbol. Nice city and harbor views, good for picture taking.

We came to spend a few hours and had
A great experience by seeing all the attractions. Everything is well set and arranged, super clean and also culinary offers are available. Maybe not for a short visit in Singapore but for sure to spend an extra day

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to relax and enjoy photo taking!
REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed photo taking with statue and surroundings. As we've visited at evening, the weather is pleasant and I think this place should not missed when you visit singapore as it is the iconic symbol of the country. The scene around the statue is nice.
Cruising around the marina we had a lovely view of Merrion park for the cruise. Evening was busy but enjoyable, love guy show was entertaining
Fun iconic Singapore site. Busy on the weekend. Nice views and some shops and restaurants near by. Worth a visit!

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. It is interesting but the best thing about the area is the crowds of people. And I do mean crowds. It was the busiest place we saw. I don't think you should go to Singapore and not see it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Ehh.. go take your pic and move along
REVIEW_BODY: I know it's one of those obligatory places you need to see and will probably see if you're visiting Singapore, but just go there and take the selfie you need with this thing and move along. Not much to see here folks.
Have been here before when the children were young, but still love it. Beautiful sunny day, lots of people enjoying themselves. The Merlion is magic from the ground or viewed from the cable cars.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good spot for pictures of architecture around the bay
REVIEW_BODY: We went during the day and it was very hot. However, if you go to Singapore, it should be on your must do list. There are 2 merlions the "baby" and the "mother" Look around and take some pictures.
Busy at all hours of the day (except when it rains) and great photo opportunity. Must see whilst in Singapore

We had to see the Merlion, symbol of Singapore as long as we were here. We visited this park earlier in the morning when it was mostly just the joggers out which made for a very pleasant walk along the bay with really great views. There were coffee and souvenir shops along the way but everything was a little pricey. So if ever in Singapore do not miss this beautiful landmark.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful view of the entire bay
REVIEW_BODY: With backdrop of the Marina Sand, high rise architectural hotels, museum and concert hall, the symbol of Singapore being 1/2 lion and 1/2 fish stands tall with water coming out of its mouth, surrounded with eateries and boutique shops, a wonderful place to visit, you can spend an afternoon strolling around this beautiful park

You see this first whenever u Google search singapore or even on any singapore tourism advertisement. Merlion is a head of lion with body of fish. This place is a must visit n a pic with the Merlion mandatory.
You must see the Merlin if you go to Singapore. There is one at Marina Bay and a big one on Sentosa Island. Merlin Park is easy to access via foot or boat or train. A must see when in Singapore.
Not sure what the big deal is, it's a big statue spitting water. Of all things to see in Singapore, you should take a pass on this unless you're easily impressed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good spot to visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is the symbol of Singapore - Merlion. Good spot to visit. Good photo point. Generally this spot will be covered in the city tour as a photo stop. But do not take the river ride offered to tourists. Its not worth it.
This is the icon of Singapore. Very clean area, very beautifully lit and nice place to visit. Good for photography as this place has good views.

Stepped off the hop on / hop off bus to take a look at the Merlion and the good views across the water towards the Bay Sands Hotel.

Definately worth stopping off to see if you're passing but don't make a special trek across town to see just this.

Nice jetty juts out which is useful for pictures if you want the Merlion in the background.
Best tourist attraction in Singapore. Quite crowded during the weekends and evenings. Walkable distance from Gardens by the bay.
This is the symbol of Singapore so see if you can. It is near to the Fullerton hotel. There is a large Lion and a small one nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for picture taking and selfies
REVIEW_BODY: Great place for selfies. You can take pictures that have the Merlion poring water on your head. It part of the Marina area, it adds to the charm of the Marina.
a must see in Singapore! spectacular view of the Marina bay! best time to go is near sunset and wait until the city lights up!
Busy area great for photography shots. Straight over the bridge by the marina and opposite the Fullerton hotel. Best atmosphere and ambience at night.
This was a nice places to visit and over look the main attractions of Singapore! I would suggest it as a thing to do if you have time. I would rush to have a look at it if you are pressed for time

Interesting to visit. At the start you get a 5 minute show about the history of the merlion - which is interesting and important to know about the history! Then lift up to the mouth of the merlion to see the views then steps up to the head of the merlion where you come out and see the views. The views are very good.
It opens at 10am so go then before the big crowds start!!!
It was great to visit this Singaporean attraction. The Merlion Park really symbolises Singapore and offers some great snaps of the statue and river. John & Gail Laney
This is one of the most iconic sights in Singapore and has to be visited. Can be very busy at the weekends , Great photo spot so take your camera.
A large open place with a statue of a huge merlion the symbol of Singapore spitting water into the marina. Accessible both by water and road. A nice place to spend an evening
We went ot have a look on a Sunday afternoon so it was very busy. You can still get some pictures if you are patient and persistent as people take their shots and move.
