if you are happy to be surrounded by hoardes of selfie takers this is the place for you. the Merlion itself is a work of art but it's a battle getting close to it!

A stunning 360-degree photo opp area with the Merlion, Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer and city skyline all competing for centre stage. The Merlion stage gets very crowded and busy, so be patient for that perfect photo opp. Handy eats nearby, we loved the ice pops, great flavours!!!
The Merlion stands proud in Singapore. A nice area to walk around and see the sights. Fantastic views across to Marina Bay Sands. Take a boat ride from here and see the sights on the river

REVIEW_TITLE: A trip to Singapore and not go here is strange
REVIEW_BODY: Every visit I always stop by. I guess it is the most famous enough worldwide symbol of Singapore. Great place for pictures. All seem to enjoy spending 15 to 30 minutes here
Another must place to visit. Overlooking the harbour this area has great views of the major waterfront attractions such as Sky Park, Gardens by the Waterfront and the Singapore Flyer.
Must visit place at Singapore.Just had 1 day in Singapore.Also singapore river cruise was great cost me 25 dollar.

One of must place to visit, if you are in singapore.
Spacious places, with merlion statue which become landmark of singapore.
Always crowded, thats make us very hard to enjoyed view.
You must extra patience if you want to take a picture with merlion statue for the background, because everybody want do that like you.

I haven't been to Singapore for more than a year so when I visited Merlion again I got excited. It got a new look. It changes color and dances to the beat of a relaxing underwater music. I think, Tourists and locals alike stay longer at the park just to observe Merlion transition to different theme. Such a positive change for Merlion.
Situated opposite the Fullerton hotel, it was a short walk to visit this site. At night the Merlion was illuminated as part of the ilight show which was on when we visited. It's worth going to see.

The Merlion has always been special for Singaporeans and the park seems to be one of those places close to their hearts. This is especially so for families, or those who want to have a relaxing stroll through the gardens. The statues are beautiful, the fountains beautiful. On a sunny day it can attract quite a lot of people strolling around, but to me, it is worth the visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: It is what you see, nothing more
REVIEW_BODY: Not even worth getting up close and personal with it, just get your zoom out and take a photo from across the bay. Don't worry if you miss it
The Merlion Park we enjoyed very much and the two Cable Cars are a must. There is so much to see I would do it all over again if time wasn't so short. I would love to bring my grandchildren.

You must see the Merlion if you visit Singapore. It is the statue of a legendary half lion half fish and is spectacular walk across the Jubilee Bridge to get the best views. Bridge was opened in 2015 to commemorate 50 years of independence

REVIEW_TITLE: Night light show is not that good.
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion has multi-coloured moving images projected onto it at night making it difficult to make out. However the atmosphere is pleasant. Bar prices are dear.

The metlion itself is smaller than i expected but still mananged to takd lots of photos. Would recommend the boat cruise from the merlion steps to see a lot of singapore central from a different angle!
It's an ok site to visit. Quite boring if you were to visit Merlion park for the whole day. Although you can just jump on the monorail and head to somewhere else with much ease.

REVIEW_TITLE: You havent been to Singapore if you havent visited the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is the most famous icon of Singapore. A must visit to prove you've been to Singapore. During the F1 Grand Prix the Merlion had colours and patterns projected on it - it looked beautiful!
Having being told the story why Singapore got its name we had to go and visit the Merliin. Resplendent against a backdrop of the high rise Banking skyscrapers on a lovely sunny day Well worth a visit

On our visit, the Merlion was covered for restoration and a small substitute had been supplied. Not very impressive and there's really nothing much there, apart from Chinese tourists. A pleasant walk along the waterfront, but that's about it.
Of course one cannot visit Singapore without a visit to the Merlion! The park area is lovely. Take time to walk the esplanade. Just a great time to have a walk.
It is nice to hear the culture and history of Singapore. This iconic figure represents them. Am so happy to hear that SG has become one of the economic giants in asia.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore so a 'must see'. Just expect that everyone else has the same idea. Lots of people, kids and cameras. It was a good place to visit, and a great place to get a feel for the cosmopolitan aspect of this wonderful city.

The icon of Singapore- Merlion. We went here twice, morning and night. During the day, there were a lot of tourists in the area. Everyone was captivated by the beauty of this mystical creature that has a lion's head with a body of a fish.. Though for me, it is better to go here in the evening for tourists to see not only Merlion but also to see the wonderful city lights of Singapore..

When walking through Singapore at night you will probably have a look at Marina Bay. It´s absolutely impressive and when you´ve passed the Art Zoo you stand at the place from where the photo was taken.
Merlion Park is a great place to visit with family and friends. It is one of the most significant sight seeing spots of Singapore.

We must've reached at a really busy time it was very crowded. A significant tourist attraction so people from all over the world. Had a nice stroll around the park lots of different places can be seen from here.

Merlion Park is the original or first in Singapore. It was shifted from the original location at mouth of Singapore River about 100m away to face the Marina Bay. Officially there were 5 Merlions-2 at Merlion park, 1 at Sentosa, 1 at Mount Faber & 1 at STPB.
Merlion is make up of lion head and fish body indicating the history of Singapore when it was called Singapura by Javanese's Prince after seeming a big lion, and a fishing island.
At last in 2017, we can see the Merlion do same fashion show by changing the skin colour. Maybe Singapore tourist promotion board should consider it a permanent performance.

We visited this on a day of 90 degrees and 90 moisture and it was the Chinese New Year weekend. The place was packed with people all with selfies jumping in front to take pictures. We would go back when not so crowded.
Just a water fountain that is a symbol of Singapore. There is a walk way that allows you access to take photos and it is free. It gets crowded particularly with people taking selfies.

It is not satisfied if you visiti singapore without coming to here first, better you go on the evening or on the night when you can seeing the Merlion statue looks very manly with the light around. Also here you can take picture with best view of the Merlion statue and around this area there have some restaurant if you would like to have lunch or dinner. This place little bit crowded due there always have so many peoples only for take pictures and so on specially on the weekend and the long holidays.
Merlion lit up for light festival. Beautiful -- spirit of Singapore. Free tourist attraction. Great location for photos of the bay.

There is no shortage of things to do and see in beautiful Singapore; visiting Merlion Park is yet another place that displays its beauty. Our first visit was on a beautiful Wednesday evening in February. Like most places in Singapore, Merlion Park offers no shortage of places to eat.

This is one of those pass through attractions. Unless you plan on dining there, I recommend staying just long enough to take in the scenery and photo ops, then walk up the road to La Pau Sat for some satay (from 7pm).

You can not really go to Singapore without visiting the Merlion. It was very busy but a great atmosphere with everyone trying to grab the best shot, it helped with the beautiful blue sky as a back drop

This month feature the i light Marina Bay. There are some of the buildings will be having features of lighting. The Merlion definitely will be included. It is a once a year event. Should have glimpse at least.

A lovely free attraction down on the Marina. Expect crowds but everyone keeps moving along once they have had their photo opportunity. You can have fun trying to position yourself for a photo while the merlion sprays the water into your mouth!!! You won't look silly cause everyone is trying to do it. It's a bit of fun.

REVIEW_TITLE: Get a picture with Merlion, or you've not been to Singapore :)
REVIEW_BODY: Here are the tips on when you can take a picture with the iconic landmark of Singapore, The Merlion. Morning, You can get a better picture here since there are not much tourist. For me, don't go during afternoon, its freakin hot! Afternoon is the best time to go or night time if you want to watch the laser light show of Marina Bay Sands from there. As i've mentioned, get a picture with Merlion or you have not been to Singapore at all.
We enjoyed our visit to Merlion Park from the Singapore River Cruise. Best decision if you're not into crowds. Awesome architecture!

REVIEW_TITLE: The Merlion was covered up so we could only see it through gaps in the covering.
REVIEW_BODY: The surrounding area was very nice and I can imagine that it will be worth a visit once renovation is finished.

It's strange how a marketing tool for the Singapore tourist office has now become a symbol of the city.
Our first visit to Singapore saw the statue sitting in a completely different position virtually ignored by tourists. Now with the reclamation of the land from the sea and the building of new bridges meant that the statue had to be moved and it's now found sitting within its own park. At all times of day or night there's a queue of tourists attempting to get selfies with the figure.
a must-see attraction while in Singapore, and best visited during the day. This location is one of those must-have photos to add to your travel collection.

We were unfortunate in our timing and the Merlion was taking a shower while we were visiting. We were told the smaller one behind it would be available for pictures but this too was under-going maintenance and was closed.
Very disappointing that they were both unavailable and I'm not sure why it takes 4 weeks to clean the Merlion... it sits out n the rain so I'm not sure how clean it would be anyway. On our last day the scaffolding was taken off the front but you still couldn't see much and you didn't get the whole effect without the water.
Definitely check the dates of cleaning before you go so you're not disappointed!
this public space is an example of a successful area for the city near the water and with one of the most amazing views the city can offer
It's the symbol of Singapore Nice spot for pictures A spot that every tourist who visited Singapore too a picture
The small Merlion was available the larger one was closed. I had heard so much about it I was expecting more. However the architecture around the area was AMAZING!!
Merlion was having a shower so he was wrapped up but this did not spoil our enjoyment. We went to see another Merlion on Sentosa island

Unfortunately we didnt check this beforehand, the statute was closed for public viewing due to repairs. Although the surroundings are well kept and are a good source of photographic avenues with a great view of Marina bay sand hotel and the water body..
try the hand made coconut ice cream at one of the food cart.

This place is a must visit for tourist and is easy accessible via taxis or buses
Unfortunately the merlion is under construction until next month, wasn't much to see as it was fenced off but you see the harbour.

Tracked down the infamous merlion only to discover he was covered up due to having a clean up. Slightly disappointed but there is a smaller one behind that is suffice, bit of a shame as raffles long bar was also getting work done, but plenty other stuff to see in Singapore

Merlion park is the symbol of Singapore!
This place is a treat to your eyes with a view of Central Business District of Singapore along with a beautiful sunset view of Marina Bay Sands!
A photo at this place is a must for an instant recognition that one had visited Singapore. One can also do a river cruise from Merlion Park (S$ 25) for a whole view of tall glazing towers of business district and Fullerton Hotel.
Merlion Park is a must visit place and mostly flooded with tourists.
A great place to be!!!
visit merlion park and take some picutres. Also take the opportunity to enjoy Singapore river cruise right there.
Very time for travel singapore i like take photo this merlion park. day view and night view i feel relaxed and havr funny
A good thing to visit by the river on something like the Duck tour to get the best view of the Merlion

My fiancé and I were on the way back to the US from Thailand so we decided to have a look at the lion between the flights. Unfortunately the lion was in a shower(under construction. We had a dinner at the restaurant called something easy right next to the lion. We had time to check out the music fountain, per my opinion, the music fountain in front of bellagio in Vegas is way better and fancier.

This area was nicely presented and laid out. The boardwalks are nice and you can avoid steps to get down to see the Lion statue. It is bigger than I thought and was interesting if you could avoid all the selfie takers

The merlion was under repair when we were there, but the area is lovely to walk around anyway. There is the merlion cub right beside him, and other merlions around the city, so it didn't ruin the holiday. A bit nearby, on Cavanagh Bridge near the Fullerton Hotel, we found the 3 bronze cats I'd been wanting to see, so I was still happy.

The famous merlion!! Every time someone visits Singapore, clicks a pic with Merlion! It is a popular spot and even I was excited to click a snap with Merlion..
It was a rainy day but I did it!
It is in mid of all high towers with best of best banks surrounded!

Not a great deal you can say about the Merlion.

Any visit to Singapore will include it, even if only by accident given its central location.

Situated on the waterfront, the term park is perhaps a little misleading. Its more of an attractive plaza with flower beds, rather than acres of fields and tress. Pleasant all the same.

Good viewed by day (if you can put up with having to photo it with everyone standing in front of it), and by boat cruise at night.

Plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops right

Merlion is a very nice landmark of Singapore. Surrounded by a river, the park does offer a very touching view. It is very clean and it is the best point for photo shooting. When we were there the big Merlion didn't produce any water because it has been under the renovation. Anyway, we will go back there again in the near Future.
awesome place, must visit, dont miss it in singapore, family dont miss it, go for it for awesome exp..

Finally the famous Merlion Statue.Not just the statue but the entire area around it is great.Just that it is almost impossible to take a pic with no one around as it is thronged by people most of the time. Great experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visited the Merlion for some great photos.
REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit and easy to get to. Very popular with public so can be quite crowded. Excellent photo opportunity of not only the Merlion but all the other iconic building ie. Marina Bay Sands etc.
Go and spend some time in the park and see the sculpture as it is very interesting. Read about it or take a guided tour through the city as this is a landmark there.
We were walking by Merlion fountain, there were lots of people climbing on it and others being more respectful keeping their distance. great for photos.
We were expecting this to be a great photo and how surprising to see most of it barricaded up for repairs. I believe it should be operating by March 2017

Merlion Park is very accessible. You can walk from the bay and it will take you maybe 10-15mins to go there. It will not bore you because the lights of the hotels around the area are nice in the evening. There are really plenty of tourists there. Make sure that you check with the hotel's concierge if Merlion is open. The first time that we visited singapore, it was closed for maintenance. Lucky that i came back so I managed to have a selfie with the lion!

It is the zero point of Singapore. Its a popular landmark , good for photography. Boat ride in the lake is fantastic. It takes around all landmarks . Keeping the photograph of Merlin in living room with flowing water from lions mouth facing towards inside of room is sign of good omen they believe.

As it is one of the main attractions in Singapore, it is worth a visit. If you like to take selfies with landmarks, then it is definitely a place for you. It is overcrowded at times, so do be warned. The area also offers great views of some of the architecture found in Singapore. It is directly opposite the Marina Bay Sands, so many people will be spotted taking pictures of this attraction too.
Yes it is one of the Singapore main attractions, great spot for pics and see amazing building around the bay. It was pretty hot and uncover so make sure you have sunnies and water handy.

You can not come to Singapore and not visit the iconic merlion. I use watch this famous monument on travel guides and blogs but to see in reality was something else. Overwhelming with people this is a tourist and locals hotspot !!! Everyone wanted to take a perfect picture for instagram and Facebook. But it is beautiful. A lot of eating places nearby and the beautiful view of marina bay sands opposite. In the evening it's a beautiful sight. Grab your best spot as the laser light shows starts by 8pm and this place can get very overcrowded. Highly recommend it.

REVIEW_TITLE: It's free and in the tourist hub, why not?
REVIEW_BODY:
Honestly this one is a no brainer for me. There are many references to Merlion around Singapore and seeing it in the flesh (or so to speak) was a must.

The best part is it's free to go look and take as many photos as you like from the viewing areas.

I will say that there were only a few times we went past that there weren't hoards of tourists there so getting the perfect photo is a challenge.

We also went right by the large Merlion on the night time river cruise. We got to see the Merlion from a different perspective and seeing as we caught a late boat about 9:15pm, there were only a few people onboard. The boat cruise is a paid activity 25$S per person I believe and some counters are cash only.

We got to Merlion Park on bus #10 which stopped just up from the statue, on the esplanade, it was just a short walk from there, but there are several ways to get there via public transport.

My vote, its iconic and free, just do it!
This seems to be one of the most popular tourist spots in the city. Everyone wants a selfie in front of the statue! None the less, it's a must see!
One of the attractions of Singapore. A beautiful place to visit during night as well with light decoration and the city glowing in different colors all around

This is a great area to walk around in the evening. Great atmosphere with all the lights, views and people, including the new boat roofed hotel. Very busy. Beware of some of the seafood restaurants as they are very expensive. You can walk from here along the riverside walk which if you can manage the heat and humidity is great. The famous lion fountain is here. Worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: A popular place to take photos
REVIEW_BODY: A busy spot where all visitors were taking photos and enjoying the views. Worth a quick visit while seeing the other sights in the city
went on a tour and this was included in the tour...we learned about the history and facts about the Merlions and its part of Singapore's history

The Merlion stands on the waterfront and is visible from many different points.
Despite it's iconic status, it is unlikely to take your breath away. That honour will be reserved for the ever present army of selfie stick waving tourists determined to take your eye out with their mobile phone.
Nevertheless, you should take a look as the waterside walk is a pleasant distraction.
We visited this on a Sunday morning at Chinese New Year so it was very crowded but it is on the list of must see before wandering up to Clark Quays by the river where it was pleasant and peaceful

REVIEW_TITLE: Take a River Boat Trip to see it
REVIEW_BODY: The best way to really see this is by one of many boat trips that goes around/past this Icon. Many tourists gather on land to take photos so it can be quite crowed .

REVIEW_TITLE: You have not gone to Singapore if you don't have a photo here
REVIEW_BODY: Just like any country's trademark,the merlion is must-visited attraction. Tendency to be crowded, you may just take turns and quickly finish your photo op.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must photo opportunity when visiting Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Lots of great photo opportunities, particularly in the evening when you can get great shots of the seafront and skyscrapers. Can get busy and you may have to wait your turn for a photo

It is best to schedule a visit to the Merlion Park in the morning, evening or night. The fact is that these watches traditional Singaporean heat recedes, you will be able to comfort and pleasure to walk along the bay. Do not forget to take pictures near both the Merlion, these photos later will give the warmest memories of Singapore. It should also take a small cruise around the bay on a tourist boat, a pier for tours is located right on the park. Especially popular evening boat trips, when turned on full illumination of the surrounding buildings and double-pass laser show with water effects and music.
Nice area to walk in the afternoon and provide great pic opportunities at night. Can get crowded but definitely a buzzing place.

It seems strange that you hear so much about this Merlion afterall it is only a fantasy creature made of concrete with water spouting out its mouth. However in context or maybe out of context with the incredible architecture that surrounds this breath taking site, the Merlion is something the average human can relate to with fondness rather than awe. The contrast is pronounced by the incredible engineering of surrounding structures. A must see tourist site and unavoidable.

The Lion State can't be visited without going to Merlion Park on Marina Bay. This Iconic Statue is just one of the must do sights. The whole area is wonderful to walk around with plenty of things to see and do. From a ride on the Singapore River to high end eating. Go by day and come back at night to see the transformation. Wonderful.
Merlion park is a must see while in singapore. Very easy to get to and you can join the hundreds of other tourists there. But it is worth it.
The merlion is one of the many features of Singapore that people visit. Just behind the large merlion is a smaller one that doesn't shoot water but is just as good. Well worth a visit!
It's worth visiting the Singapore Merlion fountain with great views all around. Has to be seen when visiting Singapore and does not have to take long at all. One to tick off your list.
Lovely views from ground level with lovely surroundings close to cafes. Great as a daytime and nights activity to see contrast between am/pm views.

You can't leave this country without vising the famous merlion. This is the symbol of singapore, we had a walk at night from the MBS going here and it was not really a cool night even if it is January
Excellent walk along the waterfront from OUE to the Merlion. Lots of tourist so good idea to go early.
It s a wounderful place to spend time and on top of the lion is a great view. Great way up to the lion many restaurants coffees and flowers.
great tourist attraction old merlion must have had millions of pic s taken, take a pic at night with all the lights about....
It's a nice park, not necessarily because of the lion but because of the views of the Singapore skyline

The Merlion Statue is a must see for tourists in Singapore. It has excellent views of the Marina Bay and the City. There were hundreds of people there, and there was a good selection of shops and restaurants if you are hungry. Must see!
We were able to enjoy this park during the day and at night. It was very busy with tourists taking photos. The park is immaculately clean.
You can not go to Singapore without seeing this. You must see it. It is busy but beautiful. Really something special.
The Park, and it's surrounds are ideal, however when it's a busy tourist time, it can be a harrowing experience avoiding all the SELFIE STICKS and thoughtless photographers.
It is free and make sure you get someone/a guide to tell you the history and importance of the place. Not to mention the view while you are walking along the waterfront to the Merlion is amazing!

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool place to visit. Big tourist destination!
REVIEW_BODY: We walked down to this to have a look. Was cool to see but nothing spectacular. Was heaps of people around and you can see this is a big tourist destination. Good views over the whole harbour however and was a pleasant walk for us anyway. We walked down from Clarke Quay.

REVIEW_TITLE: Never leave Singapore without visiting this park
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion Park is one of the most visited park in Singapore. Here, you will see Singapore's icon, The Merlion spewing out water to Marina Bay. The park is accessible from Fullerton Hotel, Esplanade and from the Downtown Core. From this park, you will see the Marina Bay Sands just where the Merlion faces to, the Singapore Flyer, the Helix Bridge going to and from the Marina Bay Sands, the Esplanade Theaters, several high-end hotels around Marina Bay and the Singapore Central Business District. Don't leave Singapore without having to have your photos taken with the Merlion, Marina Bay Sands and skyscrapers at the background. You will also find a smaller version of the Merlion meters away from the back of the bigger statue.

If any person goes to Singapore id will for sure get a photo clicked hear.your Singapore trip is incomplete without visiting hear.Merlion Park is must see landmark & tourist hotspot at all times both day & night.it is one od most popular area of Singapore.you can get clear nice view of Singapore Skyline,Singapore Financial Center.Melion symbolizes Singapore.would recommend to do visit this place.

A visit to Singapore is not complete without a visit to the historic and infamous Merlion (half mermaid/half lion) and surrounding area. Yes it's touristy however I found the Merlion quite fascinating to watch as the water majestically gushes out of his/her mouth into the river.
By visiting this place you feel the real soul of Singapore. The water-jet coming off the statue and the laser show which you get to see is amazing
The Merlion is Singapore's must-see landmark which is not to be missed when visiting. Tourist hotspot at all times during the day.

REVIEW_TITLE: What Came First-The Lion or the Fish!?!
REVIEW_BODY: This iconic symbol of Singapore is a must see, if only from afar. At its current location, it is visible from almost anywhere in the Marina Bay area. But it is worth a visit to Merlion Park for an up close and personal experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit at night...yhen move to the opposite side of the bay
REVIEW_BODY: I feel the splendor of the views at Merlion park achieve its peak at night, so I favor a night visit. I do advice you then move to the other side of the bay to witness the fabulous free-of-charge water and light show displayed in front the Scoppes at Marina Bay Sands.

After visiting the Merlion on Sentosa we expect something more grand in Singapore. It's so much smaller than it's Sentosa counterpart. We didn't realise we'd seen it many times before from various viewing areas around Marina Bay.
My suggestion is if you've seen the Sentosa one don't bother with this one.

REVIEW_TITLE: Small, clean park featuring the Merlion.
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion, a half-fish half-lion hybrid statue overlooks the river. It does not appear to be very big, but it is over 8 meters tall. There is a small clean park surrounding the statue, which is against the river and water squirts from its mouth. Worth a look and a photo, it attracts a lot of visitors but was not too crowded when we were there. We started our sightseeing from this location featuring the symbol of Singapore, the Merlion. Not too far from the Raffles Place Metro Station. Do not remember seeing many signs, so have a map handy.
A crowded area on the waterfront overlooking the Marina Sands. There are lots of restaurants lining the waterfront.

Its another statue like many other statues spraying water into the sea. Nothing else. Go in the evening when the sun is not directly overhead. Location is good for photography. I personally did not find it anything special or extra ordinary. Waste of time.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not much to see or do
REVIEW_BODY: This was listed by many as a must see, so we obeyed. An average sized statue surrounded by over priced vendors. If you're in the area, check it out. Otherwise, this is a definite meh. 😴

REVIEW_TITLE: This is the picture which says Singapore!!
REVIEW_BODY: This Merlion (Head of Lion and Body of Fish) is the symbol which we have been watching since childhood to depict Singapore. This park is small park having this Merlion Fountain and few restaurant. One can spend 30-45 min approx and have the pictures clicked. The place can feel heavy rush on weekends.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice for a stroll at night
REVIEW_BODY: At some point all visitors to Singapore end up here. I recommend going in the evening to see the lights of the city around you

I believe any and everyone visiting Singapore must have Merlion Park in their itinerary.. Just for the namesakes (symbolism) as well as superb view of the marina

The whole view from the pier is breathtaking and unforgettable.. Including Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore Flyer and MBFC

A place which is visited by all just to see the magnificent Merlion.

White ,shiny and attractive statue of Merlion .

Try not to visit during hit days as it's too hot and humid as the place is in oone and does not have shades to take shelter in the hot Sun.
You cannot come to the city and not visit here. The fountains seem to work all the time and all you need to avoid is the crowds of people.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great destination for marina views and happy snaps
REVIEW_BODY: This is a great spot to visit and soak in the atmosphere of people enjoying the vista, with views all around, including city skyscrapers and across the waters to marina bay precinct. Opportunity for some good destination photos, particularly at dusk/sunset.

The area could benefit from things like local food stalls otherwise it's just a statute that spurts out water in what feels like a business district with a nice river view. But as it's symbolic so it's on the itinerary for tourists to take a picture there. Looks nice both at day time and at night time.
Shame they have mover the Merlion from it's original place, but there again the whole of Singapore has and is changing. Worth going to see the statue.

This is a great tourist attraction with many opportunities for fun photos. From certain angles you can make it look like you are drinking from the fountain, or a strategically placed umbrella can look like the fountain is raining on you.
Your tour bus stops on the road and one has a bit of a walk to reach near the site. Worth walking unless one has difficulty in walking.

Seen it a ton of times in pictures, finally saw it for real. Bigger than I expected up close, but there isn't much else around. Lovely Fullerton area, but that was it. 100% tourist spot, can't even get clear picture without any tourist in it, can only see the back of the lion statue

This is one of the busiest places to take pictures of the lion on a nice day, we were able to get some good ones from the cruise, there are 3 statues in Singapore and 2 are located here, the biggest is on Sentosa.

REVIEW_TITLE: To Merlion or not to Merlion? Just do it.
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion is Singapores icon statue. We took a taxi from Shangri-La at Orange Grove near Orchard road to the Merlion Park it was a little over SD8.
We were trying to co-ordinate our visit with the other attraction and also the lazer show later after dark.
As such we took our pictures in daylight. A few hours later we were still nearby and took some more pictures with the dark skies and the city lights and water reflections and the stunning Marina Bay Hotel in some of our shots.
Last year, we visited the Merlion but, the water was not on (most likely for servicing)When we return to Singapore next year we will visit the Merlion again the pictures are always different and the lighting plays a big part of that.

This is a very scenic area to spend an hour or two, especially if the weather is particularly glorious.
It's a busy spot, popular with tourists and locals, but it's a great place for pictures whether it be of the opposing iconic 'Marina Bay Sands' or manipulating the Merlion into whatever position your creativity guides you!
Some nice spots to drink alongside the merlion, too.
Its a symbol of Singapore. Good place to visit. Good place to enjoy. For photography. You can visit it within 30 minutes.

If You are in Singapore and you will not visit Merlion park than your tour is incomplete for sure..
It has much more to offer than just taking photo, U can take river ride of approx 45 min in boat in this park, and u will see many interesting things in your journey.. That one round u will see major tings of Singapore city.. So must visit and take boat ride..
Check out photos for more info..

This is a must do in Singapore. The best view of the bay at ground level. It is always busy! Make sure you take water though as it can get hot on a sunny day and they charge twice as much as anywhere else in the shops close by.

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore visit is incomplete without visit to Merlion park
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion park should be the first place you should visit when you are in Singapore. Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and everyone get Merlion in their mind when they think of Singapore. The park is well maintained. The world famous Merlion is opposite of Marina bay sand. You get beautiful view of Marina bay sands and other Singapore's signature building from this park. A nice place to spend time with your family when you are in Singapore. You will get the real feel of Singapore in this place.
just gone to visit dor curiosity and there it is ended checked now of my bucket list bery busy place.

I found the Merlion itself rather mediocre and the park around it is just concrete walkways. I'm not sure what the attraction of this is. Much better to see it on a boat trip as jsut one of the things to see along the way.

went there an hour before sunset, I think this is the best time to visit, its not that hot and the hue of the sky is magnificent. a lot of tourist taking pictures, locals jogging and cycling, it was a bustling atmosphere
The place was nice for a one time visit. The weather is good due to the place being on sea shore and there are lots of restaurants and cafes to sit and enjoy the park.
There were a lot of tourists here, a very busy area. The merlion was good to see, particularly at night time. Hard to get a photo without lots of people around.

REVIEW_TITLE: Photo Ops and a bit of fun
REVIEW_BODY:
This is amongst most popular photo ops places in the city. Alarmist everybody goes here and Heer some good photos, which they then post on social media.
In my opinion this place is over rated , though good.
Most of the attractions here are paid with ticket and over priced.
A good way to be economical and efficient is avoid paid attraction and just walk around this area. Around 3 hours are enough.

Merlin Park is a very popular destination. Located across the water from the massive Marina Bay Sands, it's probably the destination where the most pictures are taken. Like the rest of Singapore, there's a lot of food around, albeit at inflated prices. I'd suggest going at night because of all the lights on the surrounding buildings. Granted, you may not get a complete snap of the Sands, but you'll have a much nicer overall experience.
You can't stop in Singapore and not see the Merlion on the waterfront. Some great views of the city skyline and the Marina Bay Sands complex!
Merlion park statues is a symbol of SG. And it is a must watch place standing tall in front of sea. It is nearer Marina bay bus stop. It is a good place for tourists
Must do: visit and picture of Merlion. The place is crowded èspecially at night. It shows great view of the Marina bay and the skylines.

It's an outside place a small merlion and a massive merlion at its back which faces the marina bay sands. It's a must see. But bearing in mind it's a very busy place with many holiday makers. It won't take 20 mins of your time to enjoy the views.
The area can be busy with tourist but it worth the walk along the waterfront.There are boat tours from Clarke quay easier than walking. but you then miss the atmosphere
This is the place which symbolizes Singapore. The crowd, the merlion, the water, the shops makes it a fun day. You can also buy sovereigns from here.

Since we were nearing the end of our trip, we didn't have much opportunity to stay very long here, but it should be one of your stops before you leave so that you can see the famed Merlion. It's a beautiful statue and the views of the Marina Bay Sands, the downtown core and Esplanade are gorgeous. Be prepared for the crowds, though, as there are lots of people hanging out and taking pictures. If you want a great picture of the Merlion, you'll have to be patient! Otherwise, a very nice to see...and a fairly quick walk to the Boat Quay if you're wanting to do that as well.

This place is never quiet, so many tourist every time I visit. Far from stations but near to bus stop. Prepare your leg to walk from there to nearest convenience store. Thats around 800m at raffles place station. Quite tiring.

You can not come to Singapore and not see one of the Merlion! This one sits proud on the main harbour front and is lit up at night. Surrounded by bars and restaurants it's a nice place to go both day or night.
Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore. It gets quite busy, so be prepared for the crowds.Cool landmark to visit.great photo opportunity, of the Marina Bay area.Love the merlions!

As expected, tourists and locals are just everywhere but mostly tourists trying to get a good shot of the Merlion. Good luck with getting a nice shot without photobombers. But of course, this one is a must in Sg.

This attraction has a nice legend corresponding to the founding of the city. Its in a slightly difficult location to travel to, but when all is said and done its a statue with water coming out of its mouth and near a very very pleasant view of Singapore itself.
Only a short walk behind the Fullerton Hotel near the water. Great restaurants nearby to enjoy. Make a night of it by visiting Merlion Park, dinner drinks and a boat tour,

Unless you visit in the dead of night or real early in the morning, you can forget about taking a photo with the merlion. Tourist flock there by the bus loads and you can't get a good shot of the merlion. The night view is pretty amazing though but you don't have to enjoy the view from the merlion park. Unless you are a huge fan of crowds, don't bother visiting during peak hours.
One of the more crowded place in Singapore, but the crowds don't detract from the great views, and amazing picture opportunities. It's a beautiful walk during a nice day.
Great place to visit to get a great view of the main architectural showcase of the city. Very popular at sunset. Place to star a walk along the river
This park is just for clicking pics and moving on. Nothing to see here. Merlion pics are the most overrated pics as its just to show people that you were in Singapore.
Great place, sight seeing in this area is amazing,, the views towards the sands sky park is incredible.
Since this is the Epitome of Singapore, picture opportunities abound. Weather was perfect the day we visited so there was a good crowd.
If you are visiting Singapore you need to visit the Merlion... Fun time wandering around with other tourists and taking photos.

As part of our city tour we visited the site of the Merlion.
We were told about the history of this (mythical) beast and how it was a symbol for the local people.
Again, we did not really have long enough here to have a proper look around.

This park is on the Quayside and has food outlets, boat trips, shops and bars around it. The quayside is really beautiful and clean, its very well visited and the Merlion fountain is amazing. Its quite large and shoots water into the quay. There is a miniature Merlion behind the large one.
The statue is a cross between a Mermaid and a Lion hence the name!

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice views any direction you look
REVIEW_BODY: Especially at night this is a beautiful location. Full view over the bay with Marina Bay Sands and of course the beautifully lighted Merlion (and it's littlr brother). A number of fine bars and restaurants.

They say you are not in Singapore if you have not visited The Merlion Park. Lots of tourist here, its hard to get a good photo. We were here at 3pm so it was very hot. The place would have been great to visit at night. I would love to go back here at night time next time I visit SG.

You can never truly visit singapore without visiting the merlion park. This is located outdoors so i suggest wearing something to protect your skin. It was so hot outside. It was fun having taking pictures of the view around as well.

The famous Merlion! This place is amazing and you get a full view of the bay and the MBS. A lot of nice Pubs and Hotels around.

It could get very crowded but I guess if one goes in the morning or before noon it should be fine.Also when you visit Singapore on summer it could get very hot..

but a must see when your there!!!

funny is you must go to see merlion when you are in singapore or otherwise you trip is not complete. But it is super small and i don't why it is here and so many people like it. The view there is stunning though. especially at night! after that you can go to clarke quay for a drink haha.

We visited this place in the afternoon and it was very hot and humid. Nothing exceptional. The place was crowded and did not enjoy the experience. Visit only if you have some extra time in your tour of Singapore.
Since our last visit the Merlion has been relocated and the surroundings improved. There's even a small jetty which makes a great place to take photos.

We had a lovely evening at the merlion park, the light show was great and the view of the marine bay hotel and the bank district was fabulous. Some beautiful photos were taken and happy memories made.

Come here for 10 minutes to take your obligatory picture of Singapore's icon and the Marina Bay and hotel. Then move on. Everyone else will be there so be patient when trying to make it look like there is no one else there in your photographs ! Nothing else to do...
Great site for photographs of the whole of the Marina Bay area.....not much shade around but great for starting a riverside walk

We walked around the bay from Marina Bay Sands to the Fullerton Hotel to see the large Merlion which is so iconic for Singapore - just one of the things you HAVE to get your photo take with in order to say been there , done that! Lots of other people had obviously thought the same thing as the site was very busy. Glad we did it - it was bigger than I had anticipated from pictures I'd seen. There's a viewing platform which you can walk out on to to get photos but if you do the river cruise you also get photos from the boat as it is a pick up point. There 's a smaller merlion too just behind it in the park area.

When I bought my Groovy Map for Singapore while staying in Bangkok I saw the Merlion and thought this was a must see.It actually took a while getting there but once there a great sight in the evening.

REVIEW_TITLE: Getting a phot can be a hassle. But worth it
REVIEW_BODY: OK, everybody gets a photo of the Singapore Merlion, usually with them in it. It is a symbol that instantly say "I've been to Singapore." Don't miss out. Do it. Just be prepared to have to wait in line a bit to get that perfect shot (you know the one where the water is spraying from your mouth.)

REVIEW_TITLE: Wouldn't spend too much time there
REVIEW_BODY: Good view over Marina Bay, the river and all the buildings around. Also good spot to see the night light show. But way too many tourists. There's a better Merlion statue in Sentosa
the lion is the simpology of singapore it hase big meaning to have photo around . close to best hotel in Asia and sea food resturants. also u can visit hanging gardens

Really one of the most popular tourist point in Singapore you will see the giant Merlion (half mermaid & half lion) symbol of Singapura (land of lions) then you have many option there taking walking ride around and having plenty of magnificent photo or riding cruise of Singapore for 40 minutes or dining in many cafe or restaurant situated near by

You will surely have a great unforgettable moment

We walked along the river from Richardson Quay. You can go by boat, bus, train or taxi. The park's main attraction is the mythical Merlion, although the surroundings ate also attractive. The views are very good.
If going to Marina bay than this is a must to see best at nighttime. The outdoor lion fountain is great at night then go catch the outdoor laser light show
Good photo opportunity, we found that we got more information on the statue itself from the boat tour we have done the previous night.

Initially I wasn't sure what the significance of the Merlion was and what the big deal was about. Upon doing further research I found out the Merlion is symbolic because it personifies Singapore. Singapore used to be a fishing city and another name for Singapore is the Lion City so the Merlion is a combined symbol of the city and nation.

I really enjoyed this Merlion, it's close to the river, has great places to eat out and gives a great view of the city. Well worth a visit
Visited the Merlion during the F1 weekend during day light and at night, a must see. Very easily accessible.

If you are in singapore this place is must visit even the walk from raffles MRT E exit to merlion is icon in front of furlton hotel cafe. The place itself has beautiful views and if time and money permits should try the river cruise at S$25.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best to visit evening and wait for the night view of skyline
REVIEW_BODY: Icon of Singapore. Go in evening so it's not so hot. Have a drink and catch the night view of the area. There is light show from MBS which is a lovely sight of the skyline.
Saw this along the bum boat ride then caught the MRT back to have a closer look. Great views at night a real must do.

REVIEW_TITLE: Photo opportunity and not much more
REVIEW_BODY: Since the Merlion is the mascot of Singapore, it's no surprise that tourists of all sorts are brought and/or flock here to take pictures. It's crowded, very crowded so be prepared to share this space with any others.

Take a view across Singapore from Merlion Park, especially at night time. Wonderful architectural structures, beautifully lit. Be careful of taking a beer in that area though - the cost could cause you some concern.
Good view , nice place to take pictures, good place to walk in evening and night,near esplanade great view of Singapore flyer, marina bay sand hotel

This place "must go" list i think.. every peoples go to singapore always go here..is the famous merlion park ever statue of singapore.

The place was awesome. You can spend the day here..i suggest to go here at evening about 18-19 pm to get the ambient of the city.. or you can have a dinner around this park,many resto or cafe provide here..its worthed cause you can see all view of marina bay , singapore flyer,amphitheater and garden by the bay view..all complete view in here.. in the night above 9pm you can see a little show of lighting from marina bay mall..but if yoy wat to see clearly i suggest go there to the mall beside. So its must go list.

REVIEW_TITLE: Epic View and brings back fondest memories of vintage Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Must do activity. we visited it as a part of city tour. Get loads of snaps with merlion in the backdrop. It is the iconic symbol of Singapore.
It's a combination of two animals including lion and another fish which i don't know. You can see this place while you're in a city tour or on a night tour.

REVIEW_TITLE: Free, good photo opportunity and not far from the centre
REVIEW_BODY: well it is Singapore, so it would be rude not to have the classic photo of the Merlion and your subject seemingly drinking from it's spout right ?

Probably the most recognizable landmark of Singapore, something like the Big Ben in London. Worth a visit just to get a pic with the Merlion in the background. Try visiting just before sunset do that you can see it in natural lighting as well as when it gets lit with artificial lights. The view of the Marina Bay at night from here is nice as well.
Really nice view of the Marina Bay from here with a number of bars and restaurants close by. A good 'selfie' spot can be found all over the pier!
This is mostly for photography as this the Singaporean symbol sort fo thing. But avoid going during hot noon.

D Singaporeans described t as deir Taj mahal, though I thought t was kind of an over statement. But d merlion s d pride possession of singapore n one should always see d pride gems. An easily accessible spot, d merlion s located in ts own small Park which s a walk away from d roads. D Park s reasonably maintained. Be prepared for d crowd, especially during weekends.. B careful with d kids too, d railings r quite weak.. Photos n videos r permitted.d walkway to d Park also offers a good photography background.

Verdict : always visit d countries' prides.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see for the view across the bay
REVIEW_BODY: This draws a big crowd so be patient as you will get that photo of the Merlion spurting water and enjoy the view of the impressive Marina Bay Hotel, don't forget sun cream, hat and water
This is a must see place, you get s good photo opportunity and had nice restaurants around. Good photography. Must see.
Nice statue - went based on reviews. It's right by Marina Bay so worth going along if you're there but is only a 5 minute visit. There's a much larger statue on Sentosa
A symbolise you are in Singapore, almost everyone will go there take pictures. You can take mrt stop at Marina Bay. A lot of small hawker around it.
We walked the Park as part of our Singapore City Tour. We enjoyed the panoramic views we had from the Cricket Club all the way to the Merlion LionFish. A must do.
First time in Singapore and didn't know what to expect here. The Merlion was simply stunning. Easy to get to and great views of Marina Bay to boot! I'd also recommend seeing this on a night as well.
Easy to get to and the reward is a bay views of Singapore . There are cafes and shops to get refreshments, Good views of the hotels and the banks

I spent my first evening here, sitting by the water and drinking in the sights and sounds of Singapore' We enjoyed seeing the light show, although that experience is better from across the bay at Marina Bay Sands.
The waterfront restaurants and bars near here were very pricey, but it was a good spot to do some people watching and it was a lovely walk along the esplanade in the cooler temperatures of the evening.

REVIEW_TITLE: Everybody Wants to See the Mrelion
REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the highlights of the city. People everywhere are posing to have it appear that the water coming out of the statue is pouring into their mouths. It is quite a show for people watchers.
This is very attractive but basically the merlion is really just a ornamental water feature, but never less still worth visiting.

This park has a merlion statue. That is trademark for the Singapore. Its located near marina shop, esplanade, and more. We can walk acroos the road to Raffless Landing Site than go to city hall, funan and more.

The symbol of the city is a classic must see attraction thats always busy amd surounded by expensive cafes. Head there early to avoid some of the crowds just a short walk from the MRT Great for people watching too!
Very nice area, and great views, definitely worth hoping over to see this statute while you are in Singapore.
What a must visit tonight the lion had beautiful colours of the rainbow exquisitely executed definitely a must see if you are heading down to Marina Bay

REVIEW_TITLE: A nice view of the Merlion and Marina Bay sands
REVIEW_BODY: The park features the large statue of the Merlion, Singapore's symbol. It is extremely popular and often has a large number of tourists taking photo's of the area. Well worth a visit to take a photo (or two), especially on a fine clear day.

There are two Merlions here, one very large and the other quite small. It is a nice park from which you can stroll over to marina Bay Sands, up to Clarke Quay, or into Raffles Place so quite convenient.
Loved this attraction. It us the national symbol of Singapore, many tourists (if not all) take photo with the Merlion as a statement: I've been to Singapore!

REVIEW_TITLE: Seems everyone tries to take photo with Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is definitely the icon of Singapore, not so surprise why everyone tries to go to Merlion Park and take photo with the half-lion half-mermaid standing on bay shore. The surrounding attractions were very nice too, highly recommend to take time to walk around to enjoy the bay and its beauties.

I think this is both an iconic place and romantic spot for couples.

The iconic Singaporean Marlion statue is located here facing the ocean... Er well it's facing the Garden by the Bay now, with a mini one facing the opposite direction.

Many people take fun selfie or if each other posing in front of the statue. It is an awesome sight in the evening.

The Marina Bay Sands hotel also does it laser show on the bay just in front the Marlion.
Free attraction and popular site for that holiday photo. Did not seem to have much in addition to offer.

First visiting to singapore, I dont have an idea why the merlion is little bit far from marina bay sands, we have to walk from Marina Bay sands, around 2-3 km to get there and but when we arrive, we just realized that how beautiful marina bay sands is looked in front of merlion. Worth it, and So Singapore.
it is just a statue,it worths going there just to see marina bay sands and walk in front of fullerton hotel.
It is nice to visit this area at night and try the restaurants in this area. Also great for taking photos, so don't forget to bring your tripod

REVIEW_TITLE: Great photos only need a little time to visit
REVIEW_BODY: You don't need very long here. Lovely views and the water is peaceful also. great for a walk around not to far from things

You've got it have your pic taken with the Merlion, but so does the rest of Asia. Great view of the harbor and an iconic photo, but be ready for the throngs that will be in front of you and all around.

This is a must see while in Singapore. It is close to the River Cruise which is a good way to while away 40 minutes and learn about the history of Singapore and it is cooler on the river. Not too far from Raffles.
A walk to see the Merlion plenty of places to get photos .so nice to sit and watch. evening lovely as all lit up .
I guess it's the iconic emblem of Singapore, so well worth a look and along with the marina bay complex, you should make the effort!

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion, this is the big one
REVIEW_BODY: We stayed in Singapore for 5 days and visited the Merlion by the bay on a half day coach trip, lots to see and do, so if you want to see Singapore do book a sigh seeing trip, we will def return.

REVIEW_TITLE: Constructions for F1 but didn't hamper visit
REVIEW_BODY: The ultimate symbol of Singapore the MerLion. Great photo ops also for views of Marina Bay Sands and city skyline, very enjoyable

Merlin Park is a Singapore Landmark.This major tourist attraction centre is located near the Central Business District.The Merlin is a mythical creature with lions head and the fish body .Two Merlin statues are located at the park.There is water flowing from the original Merlin structure.We can also have breathtaking view of Marina Bay There is no entry fee for this park.This iconic symbol is regarded as the pride of Singapore.

This is a lively park, and you can see the water coming out from the Merlion's mouth, spilling out into the Bay. The boats and distant islands make this a scenic spot, with lots of restaurants nearby and easy walking distance to the Esplanade. Splurge for some tea or coffee at the Fullerton Hotel and check out the Ferrari's and Lambourgini's that frequent the parking lot. The views are great from here, and kids will enjoy being able to run around a bit, too.

a must visit place for so many people, because you can find merlion here and take a picture together. what i love the most about merlion park is you can get a picture of Esplanade, Singapore Flyer, and Marina Bay in a glance.
Cute lion. Too many people around, hard for personal shooting. Can't you guys take photo faster??? lol

Must visit place not just because is the symbol of the city but because is also very nice and nicely located too.
Is very interesting to get to know what this symbol represents; half fish because was a fishers island and half lion because the king saw a lion when he arrived and Singapura means the city of the lion!

Obviously, the site is a must-see in Singapore and so an extensive analysis seems fairly pointless for this purpose. The park, or should I say esplanade, rather than a real park, stretches along the waterfront opposite the Marina and is a pleasant hour or so of walking slowly to gather in the whole thing. There are great views of the harbour and the city skyline from the other side towards the F1 pit straight.

The restaurants and bars along the walk are overpriced; don't bother paying $20 for a beer there when you can get one for $8 less than ten minutes away - that is just stupid. Other than that, the walkway was rather pleasant on an afternoon and provided a surprisingly calming trip. The Merlion area itself is obviously a lot busier, but stepping away from the viewing platform and down towards the water offers a different viewpoint that most seem to ignore. Don't forget to cool your feet off by dipping them in the water!
Easy walk around the beautiful harbour to see the Merlion up close. Really cute to fi d thdebaby merlion too!

The Merlion is half mermaid, half lion. Nice statue, with a baby merlion monument nearby. Nice pier for viewing monument and Marina Bay area. Small and simple. Only 5-10 minutes needed. Adjacent Fullerton Hotel and Singapore Bumboat River Cruise.

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't go out of your way
REVIEW_BODY: Not quite sure what the fuss is about!!! Ok statue with water coming out!! If your walking by, by all means the view of MBS is amazing in the back drop but nothing to write home about... In my opinion

This One is must visit attraction if you are visiting Singapore. Nice view of Marina Bay and nearaby skyliners. Whether you visit in day time or night time very good place to visit. Its tourist attraction.
Go there for a night walk around the bay ! Take the pedestrian bridge next to the merlion and enjoy the view !

REVIEW_TITLE: You can't go to Singapore without getting a picture with the Merlion!
REVIEW_BODY: I didn't know this at first but then discovered there is more than one Merlion in Singapore so I got pictures with both. Either way it's definitely a must do in Singapore! He is very big and majestic and shoots water out of his mouth! You can see him at Sentosa or around where the Marina Bay Sands is!

Merlion park is where the Singapore signature and symbols of lion are located. The white merlion which is mermaid lion spurts the water from it's mouth. This is one of the most taken pictures in Singapore. Just beside the Marina Bay it gives the spectacular view of the city.

REVIEW_TITLE: Pretty park - great location - a nice detour
REVIEW_BODY: Three days in Singapore - hot - wanted some relief from the crowds - was very busy so no such a change. But worth the visit and some interesting side food restaurants. Go early.
We went at night, and with the lights and crowds it is nice for a picture opportunity. I wouldn't make a point of visiting it, but as we were passing it would have been rude not to have stopped by.
Park is always crowded but very clean and good for taking pictures. Background is also good. You can get more beautiful pictures in night.
You'll see this as you walk down the waterfront. Crowds of people taking selfies. Worth a look but don't make a great plan to visit it.

This isn't a day out. Just a quick look and a walk along the board walk. The view out towards marina bay sands is wicked. Few restaurants and bar around but it's certainly not a day trip. Obligatory snap required.

Not to be missed not only because the sculpture itself is impressive but also because the marina view from this place is absolutely fantastic. Come during the day and at night as well because that's when you can view the Marina Bay Sands lights, music and water show just across the bay (you can barely see the fountains though but the lights are really something).
The Merlion Park is a great photo opportunity and a good place to see the incredible Marina Bay Sands and the rest of the marina bay area.

We were lucky to find the merlion park relatively quiet and could enjoy the whole bay and fantastic cityscape. We had visited SNG before and missed the merlion but were so pleased we made it on this occaision. Lots of resturants near by and boat tours of the bay/river if inclined. Overall a great free activity!

A nice spot to view the Marina Bay Sands and view the giant Merlion sculpture. A great photo spot hence it is always chockers with tourists. It's tall enough though to get some decent pics even with the crowds.
A photo opportunity and fun thing to see. It's Singapore! Located right on a ferry stop which might save the legs on a hot day!!
We were taken to by coach to catch a cable car to Sentosa Island. What an amazing place! Plan to spend a full day there, as there is so much to do!
Was very disappointed to have come all this way to see that the merlion was under renovations. Such is life. Got pics with the miniature one and merlion cordoned off.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: One of the most Iconic tourist attractions in Singapore. It always busy, but a must see when visiting Singapore go at night for some great photos of the city skyline and the Merlion.

Definitely bring a whole lot of patience as well as your camera. This, of course, is on all the tour group's list as well as individuals, so trying to get good pictures can be time consuming. Just wish people were more courteous when walking around.

A landmark of Singapore, is a major tourist attraction at One Fullerton, Singapore, near the Central Business District (CBD). Two structures of the Merlion are located at the park. The original merlion structure measures 8.6 meters tall, whilst a Merlion cub located near the original statue measures 2 metres tall.

Very good. A must see for everyone. Little more of guidance inside the Merlion would hv helped everyone. It's a win-win situation for Singapore govt n visitors, as the former is getting tourism n latter are given a souvenir ( a Merlion coin )

The Merlion Park actually has 2 merlions (our guide called them 'mama' and 'baby', while the 'daddy' was on Sentosa Island.) The area is quite pleasant with everyone taking pictures with the water spurting out. Makes for some interesting photos.

Also a nice place to take a photo with Marina Bays Sands and the Flyer in the background.

Quite a few shops selling ice creams, cake and other eatables around. Some restaurants too in One Fullerton Mall. Makes for a pleasant stroll.

REVIEW_TITLE: Always the most sought after Singapore landmark for photo ops
REVIEW_BODY: Although I had been here in 2007 and 2009; still the need to have a photograph in this Singapore's famous landmark is still an allure as this is my husbands first visit in SingaporeWhen in Singapore this a must. We were accompanied by our friend Siti and we did enjoy several photos here . The Merlion Park is one tourism hub that is very Singapore clean very orderly Here you can see the Marina Bay Sands Hitel that also provide a good background for pictures

This is a beautiful Park at by the marina. If you have to see anywhere in Singapore, this is it. Lots of people are around. Tons of stores to buy souvenirs. Great place for food and snacks to escape the heat under the bridge

REVIEW_TITLE: Photo shoot stop for the tourist
REVIEW_BODY: The typical Merlion is featured in several adverts for Singapore and thus is a busy tourist destination. Where it is located , it provides one with another view of Singapore's coastline .

This is just a spot by the water with a merlion statue. I have no idea what the merlion represents but it must be significant to some as many were having photos taken there. If you want to see tourists behaving weirdly it's a good spot. I walked past it on the way to the botanic gardens/marina bay sands area.
Honestly I was imaging something different, something bigger. When I arrived on site I get little bit disappointed, I think Singapore have much better things to see
The Merloin Park in Singapore is part of the wonderful history of this country. Located on the waterfront and so easy to access by public transport all traveelers should visit this local attraction.
There is no fun, but you should go at least once. You accustomed to feeling that came to Singapore.
The signature merlion will be seen here. However the biggest one in SG is in Sentosa. This is great to be your first stop in SG to ensure that you capture the signature attractions.
Very touristy. Large Tour Groups. But the view and sights are worth making your way to it. Specially seeing the high topped hotel shaped like a ship from Merlion Park

It does get a little crowded there, but what do you expect at one of the most visited icons of Singapore? It could be argued that you can't come to Singapore and not get a shot of their Singaporean emblem. Located right on Marina Bay, there is plenty to do close by.
The merlion is an icon in Singapore, you must go and see him. Take a photo and enjoy the waterfront precinct he is located in. He is very popular but you can manage to get a good shot. Nice area

REVIEW_TITLE: One Picture to Have, Keep and Share
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore. And if a tourist is to make, keep and share one picture of one's visit to the city state, it is a pose infront or by this iconic landmark.

When my wife and I were at the Marina bay Sands we strolled to see that across where we were, outiside the ArtScience Museum, was the Merlion, spewing fire which was just water, and paying homage to it were throngs of tourists, armed with their smartphones and digital cameras, flashing million bucks smiles, solo, tandem or group, trying to dodge the photobombers that scatter all over the place.

But it is a must see place. And when we went there, to ogle at it, truly the hordes were a plenty. This speaks volumes of the significance of doing a pilgrimage to the Merlion.

If you are in Singapore, don't forget to see it and have a snapshot with its national symbol. You will not regret it!
I finally saw it! And learned about Singapore's history and how the country came to be, and why the Merlion.
Its very crowded place, Just a statute there, Although it is very beautiful but if you are going there in day time, the heat will suck all your energy
This Merlion Statue is located on the bay walk, you get a beautiful view of the bay. It is crowded, however it is nice to see it, take pics and walk around.
Opposite Marina bar resorts on the river. Take in this site if you walk the river from the quays. This is what I did
Nice attraction. A icon of Singapore, and tell you about how Singapore discovered. Merlion coin is awesome and good Souvenir.
This landmark is probably worth a one time visit due to historical reasons. It can get crowded during peak hours and hot during the afternoons.

Iconic Singapore mascot, of sorts. But basically it's a big statue that spits out water in the middle of a concrete bridge. It's scorching hot in the sun and no cover if it rains. Bus loads of tourists too, all trying to get the perfect photo of the Merlion spitting into their mouths or something equally as original. The statue is nice enough, but it's just a statue. And best viewed from a nearby rooftop bar not the actual viewing platform.
Relaxing park after a long day of traveling/touring Singapore. Try taking fun photos and take in all the sights near the bay. Try to arrive close the 8:00 pm to see the light show across the bay.

We were here to take the picture with the Merlion statue. It was an iconic landmark of Singapore. This is a good place to take a beautiful photo with the Marina Bay Sands as your background. Definitely worth to come. One can reach here either by stopping at the Raffles Place MRT Station or Promenade MRT Station.
The Merlion is not the only thing to see here. It is a great spot to take some beautiful pictures of Singapore, both during the day and at night. A must to see for first time visits to Singapore!

Well worth the visit but be prepared for large crowds of people vying for that one last photo. There is plenty of room around the Merlion so at least there's more than one vantage point to get a good look. If going by train you need to get off at City Hall station after which it's about a 10 minute further walk. You won't be bored though. You walk past colonial historical buildings which are simply stunning and a credit to the city who maintain them to such a high standard. Well worth the trip.

This iconic symbol of Singapore is a must see and is a compulsory photo shoot when in Singapore. If you are staying in central Singapore, visiting the Merlion is a lovely walk both day or night or grab a water taxi for a different view!

Take the Boardwalk over from the Harbour Front as it's an easy stroll - you can always take the $29 cable car back. Great attractions for all the family although $59 ticket for 5 attractions was enough for a retired couple ! We rode the luge, the cable car, enjoyed the 4D Log Ride, rode a Segway and of visited the fabulous Aquarium. The Aquarium took around two hours to fully appreciate.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice view. Great place for photo taking
REVIEW_BODY:
It's definitely a nice place for photo taking. However, it is a tourist attraction, so there are a lot of people there. Not easy to take a photo without having other people in your photo.

Went there once in the daytime but it rained, so we took photos while holding the umbrella. Also went there in the night time, the view is good but you need a good camera to capture the nice views.

After a long day of sightseeing, we ended our day with a stop at Merlion Park. A very popular spot in Singapore. Plenty of hotels, restaurants, and views of beautiful Singapore. Located right on the bay, you have access to the boat rides, views of the Marina Bay Sands, and plenty of locals and tourist alike in the area. The one thing you must do here is get a picture with the Merlin Fish Statue. One of the signature items of Singapore. The night was a bit muggy (typical Singapore weather), but very nice and calming atmosphere. Whether you are here for a walk, lunch, dinner, jogging, or simply sightseeing, you will enjoy Merlion Park.

The Singapore Lion is on opposite side of the bay to the Bay Sands Hotel, he spouts water from his mouth into the bay all day and night. He has a walkway for photo opportunities. From here you can walk all the way around the bay

After all the hype.... and the merlion being the symbol of Singapore this statue seemed pretty meek. Obviously it's crazy crowded but that doesn't detract from the quick glance that is required. Get your photo and head on to somewhere nice and quiet.

REVIEW_TITLE: Busy free attraction - get there early
REVIEW_BODY:
This attraction must be on every tourists to do list as it certainly appeared to be the case on the day we visited.

Be prepared to battle through a myriad of selfie stick wielding tourists as they all complete for vantage points to photograph their gleaming faces with the Merlion.

Once you take your photo, don't plan on spending more than 5 minutes to take in the views or your patience will be sorely tested.

The Merlion itself is just a device invented by the Singapore tourist board, don't expect any historic value to be obtained by this park. The Merloin is a recognisable feature on many postcards and t-shirts, hence the keen interest from tourists.

Try and get to this free feature as early as possible (and I mean early) so as to avoid the bus loads of excitable tourists arrive for their 15 minute panic indused stop off.

We got off at Raffles Place mrt when we made our brief visit.
This is iconic of Singapore. The magnitude of this & the surrounding area is mind boggling. Though there are smaller replicas in the city, this beats them all. A must see
visited merlion park on 10th june 2016, reached by mrt ,lot of public clicking there pics hardly find gap to click our pics there wonderful experience

REVIEW_TITLE: Part of the Marina Promenade and a scenic spot
REVIEW_BODY: Scenic spot along the Marina. Great view, great photo spot. There are vendors to get a drink or snack.
I took a half day Singapore tour at the Airport they're ofer us to visit some beautiful place for free, only for transit passenger.
Big fountain in the park. A lot of people there especially in the night. Good for pictures and for a nice long walk by Marina bay and downtown.
Good views Merlion Statue at one end and Marina Bay at the other. Best Place for Photography.. Suggestion would be spend atleast 45-60 mins to enjoy the beauty of this sightseeing

Alighted here from boat trip to get back to our hotel. Was amazed how busy it was. So very many people taking pictures of the merlions and the river from here. The merlions are a great sight from the river as you can get a clear view of them.

REVIEW_TITLE: A very popular attraction for Asian visitors to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is selfie stick central! Very crowded on the sunny morning we visited - not so crowded on a wet day!

This is one of the signature tourist attraction in Singapore where you get to see the Merlion. It is a nice tourist spot which is generally pretty crowded all the time. One get also get a good view of the Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore flyer from here. I would suggest going there in the evening or night to enjoy the lightings.
We got there by public bus.It was a lovely evening with lot of people.It's nice in the evening with the weather i's say.The view of the Marina Bay sands hotel from this park is fantastic.

No visit to Singapore is complete until you pop by this park and take some pictures of yourself with the Merlion the iconic symbol of Singapore. Be prepared to pay a lot more for food and drinks in this area.

It's your typical park where you can relax & stroll about the grounds. The shady benches are very inviting and you can people watch while enjoying the view. And of course there's the Merlion and history surrounding the statue that is the big draw here which than points you to marina bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion Park is a Must Do when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: You can't really say you have done Singapore without visiting the famed symbol of Singapore the Merlion. We had a entertaining day at the Park with plenty of things to see and do.

Everyone says if dont visit this place so you are not at singapore! The icon history of Singapore.. I came here when it almost sunset time, so we can see the sun reflection from the Marina Bay Sands..

REVIEW_TITLE: Very busy but worth a visit
REVIEW_BODY: An amazing site and so many photo opportunities. It was great to experience an icon of Singapore. The immediate area is pristine and the Fullerton is exquisite. This is a must when visiting Singapore.

Everyone must visit the Merlion when visiting Singapore, it is the symbol of Singapore. It is a lovely scene the Merlion spewing water out into the sea, it is very pleasant as there are many places to visit near the Merlion.

This place is always packed with tourists getting a glimpse of the famed Merlion. I think it would be ideal to read a bit of Singapore's history to really appreciate the Merlion's significance. Area where it is really awesome, though, with splendid views of the MBS, the Flyer, the ArtScience Museum. Best to go just before the sunset, in my opinion.

REVIEW_TITLE: Love the Merlion, I take visitors here
REVIEW_BODY: I love going here because the Merlion is cool and it's great watching people take selfies and watching the landscape over the bay. I recommend grabbing some food Take-Away and then go sit on the stairs and eat. Or grab a drink and sit and spend a little time there. Just a beautiful place to take in.
And everyone talking selfies with selfie sticks! There are some nice amenities in the area (ice cream, especially welcome in the heat). The two merlions are very cool.
Merlion Park was a great place to visit, however please note that this place gets rammed with tourists. Some great photo opportunities to be had here if you hit on a quieter time of day.

A walk around the bay and you will pass this c7m dragon with water pouring from his mouth. Nice enough as part of a walk on the bay, but very much a tourist trap and a place to get a drink, souvenir or a bay boat trip!
A Singapore landmark and can be added onto other tours. Very busy all day use the viaduct to cross the road, and maybe a drink at the Fullerton a/c!

nice place water coming out from Merlion mouth , big beautifull place can have lots of selfie and can spend a good tile bu walking through the bridge , crossing stadium and theater point, and can enter directly to Marina Sand Bay Mall to enter Casino. Cool,and romantic place for couple if you go at around midnight. very few people and no noise and all.......Cheers Merlion

Like the Eiffel Tower in Paris or Big Ben in London, one of the Worlds iconic tourist destinations and a must see when you are in Singapore. Make sure you bring plenty of water, since it is a healthy walk from the nearest SMRT stop and it is always hot with little shade and plenty of crowds.

every night at 20:00 and 21:45 they hold a laser & light show that is nealry comparable to Hong Kong Harbour. I suggest to get a good spot that places you in front of the Marina bay Sands hotel as this is the epicentre of the display. the sound can be a bit hard to hear if there is a large crowd, but the show is worth watching.
