The merlion itself is beautafully lit at night and if you walk to the park via the Fullerton Hotel path the whole city itself is lit up beautifully, each bridge has its own individual color and the Singapore Eye itself literally pulses as it changes color. Other cities could take note of how Singapore does the light show.
We had fun taking pictures along the river and the bay. Very fun. Spectacular views. Very safe area. I think more safe than the USA.
Merlion park was very exciting and yet you could rest and relax and take in all the sights. It's not to be missed.
A great photo opportunity. Large crowds gather to get their photo taken in front of fountain which brings old and new Singapore together.

It is a 1-2 hour activity, one can reach there thru Metro or bus, should not go there on rainy day. should take a camera to click the memorable pics, the Marina bay sands hotel is also visible from this side of the river. The Merlion statue is symble of Singapore. It is half lion and half mermaid that's why it is titled as merlion. the statue is situated at bank of Singapore river. Its a tourist attractions and a must visit in Singapore. There is a park adjoining the statue where few crystal balls are placed which are shining too much..
Great to see and photograph this well known tourist attraction. Lovely water feature overlooking Marina Bay - has small replica behind it.
Enjoyed to play with Merlion when I surrounded there. Nice view and be the photo point when you visit in Singapore.
The merlions are so iconic, and therefore, constantly surrounded by tourists! It's like selfie central. We took our photos and got outta there!
There are always hordes of people there and this adds to the atmosphere. Plenty of photo opportunities!

We visited on our first day in Singapore, along with all the other hundreds of people. Great views of the Merlion and city surrounds. It’s a “must see” while you are there. Don’t get caught in the tourist trap like we did and buy something to drink from under the bridge, head further along the walkway and you’ll find something cheaper.
Be there in the early morning to get a perfect shot. Otherwise many tourists will be there. Nice place also at night.

One specially in Singapore is Merlion but another important thing is how to reach Merlion. If you choose bus metro its common way. But i will choose underground roads. Whole Singapore and ever building of Singapore has attached by underground roads or you can say walking subways. Singapore is the country in case of war civilians cant be harmed here because they designed there country such a beautiful way in case of road blocks or war or alerts they can go by underground walking subways. Awesome thinkers.

Very touristy but great for pictures. Also within reasonable walking distance to Raffles hotel and other key sights. A number if restaurants and drinking p,aces nearby and you can catch the boat trips just next to the Malion statue
Yes there is a Merlion and another smaller one but it is a small part of a much wider panorama of sights that are a must for any visitor.
A must to visit, beautiful views, and a photo with the Merlin has to be done, so do not miss this must see tourist spot.

This is a lovely area, lots of tourists, great for photo's. We took a Bumboat from Clarke Quay and got off at Merlion Park for a few photo's and a walk around. The Bumboat was a lovely trip, though a little pricey for the time it took.
We visited this during a boat cruise we were doing. Great place to learn about the history and to walk around the waters edge.

I went to singapore in the month of March 2016, so it was quite hot during that time. We went to Merlion Park late night. It was very beautiful and was not even crowded.

Best time to visit this place is at night, you can easily get a place to sit during this time and you can spend hours with your partner.

Perfect spot for your Instagram travel pictures. View of Marina Bay Sands and the famous Merlion itself.

Nice restaurants around and great place to walk about.

Sure thing to do when in Singapore. The weather is usually hot and only a 15 minute entertainment place in case you chose not to eat. Keep your self hydrated.
This is a very nice place to see, I loved it there, it was so crowded and hot, but the place was really clean and worth going.

Visited first as part of a well recommended City Tour with Tour East. Our guide Linda Chan was exceptional. We came back in the evening to watch the laser light show. Bit of a wait and hundreds of people but we got a spot on the steps so we could sit and watch.

I prefer going to this park at night as it is not as hot and the night view is night with all the lightings coming from the financial district behind it and view of the lighted up Marina Bay Sands across the river.

During past visits, being an exsmoker one notices these things, I never saw cigarette butts on the ground. Oh how things have changed. On the promenade there are 100's of cigarette butts, on the walk to Fullerton One, cigarette butts. Near the artificial soccer ground, in front of the stands, cigarette butts. I don't mind people smoking but I think Singapore council? has lost the plot, A real disappointment,

This is a place that we must have camera, because too much view will capture to save your moment. The symbol of Singapore's is here, so if you visit singapore, don't forget go here. No need to pay, all free.... have fun
Great views of Marina Bay Sands, Merlion statue and the Singapore skyline. However the park gets incredibly busy, not really allowing too many good photo opportunities. People everywhere.

Merilon is an odd animal, but it is nice when it is spray water in night lighting. From the park you have great views of the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and the Esplanade. They are all beautiful in evening lighting.
Visited Sentosa Island and Merlion Park is one of the main attractions. One can go up to top and there is a short cinema on Singapore History. It's ok for one time visit.
The symbol of Singapore, surrounded by other attractions like the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer, Helix Bridge, etc.
It can get very busy at Merlion Park especially if it's a weekend but it's worth the visit. The view of Marina Bay Sands is great and it's a nice place to sit and have an ice cream and relax.

Yes, as other reviewers have stated, it is always busy but a must see. The transportation is free and easy to get about. Wonderful photo opportunities. Take either or both of the cable cars for some stunning aerial views of the area. There is a zip wire for the very adventurous!!!!! Take plenty of water as hot and humid most days. Plenty of cafes etc.

The Merlion was once the symbol of Singapore, and my recollection of it from a visit in 1983 is that it was on the limits of the city. No more! But it is still an interesting place to visit with the white lion and the jet of water issuing from its mouth. Also the crowds of tourists! Eats and toilet facilities are nearby.
Nothing much there a Icon which is shown in every where. Take a pic and continue your journey. Flyer, Merlin park all are near by

Overrrated and very crowded. Best view of the Merlion is from the hotel balcony of the pan pacific of from the Ferris wheel, or on a river cruise. On the ground there are 1000's of Chinese taking selfies..
Not much to look at. The merlion is very small compared to the other attractions in Singapore. Best part are the views across the harbour and the surrounding shops. It is easy to access.
A short trip is all that is needed to see the symbol of Singapore. See the Merlion spouting water into the harbour, not a lot to see.
Nice area with many tourists you can also go on boats in the bay to see places around many restaurants and coffee shops.

Singapore icon and mythical creatures the Merlion is a statue that resembles half fish and half Lion. It is well known throughout the world and favorite landmark for visitors to take pictures. The surrounding area also has a great view of Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer, Art and Science Building and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel with huge boat on the top. Go there in the evening is a lot cooler. We went there during the day and it was stinking hot.
Very busy place, try to go early in the morning to avoid crowd. This is a nice place to take pictures of the city and the Bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Merlion and an attractive walk
REVIEW_BODY: The title "The Merlion Park" is a little confusing, as it is not a park of green grass, but a monument to the history of Singapore. It is a site to visit, as well as a good point to start a walk along The Singapore River to Clarke Quay. If you tire on the way you could decide on a river boat trip and see Singapore from the river.

A hive of activity, meeting point for tours, but great to get up close to Merlion. Lots of eateries along the waterfront too with great views of the Marina Bay Sands hotel. Friday evening fireworks spectacular from this vantage point
The whole area around this park is scenic but very crowded by the Merlion spewing water. Our guide told us to see the laser shows but not enough time to visit. I would say a picture here is worth it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Mix Of Mom Merlion And Baby Merlion..
REVIEW_BODY: Going to Singapore And Not Going To See The Merlion Mom And Baby Should Be A Crime. It Is Half Lion And Half Mermaid. Great In The Day Light And Great At Night When It is Light Up... Nice Place For Photography Too..

Going to Singapore and not going to see the Merlion should be a crime. It is half Lion and Half Mermaid.
Great in the day light and great at night when it is lit up.
It gets very busy there and there are lots of people all taking phots, so if you are on your own you can just ask someone to help you out.
If you go at night you can see the laser show over at marina bay. This starts at 20.00
Nice sight to see and get some photos. Right on the bay across from the MBS. Get's very busy during the day so try and get there early for photo's if possible.

Sitting on the edge of Marina Bay opposite the Marina Bay Sands Hotel is the famous Merlion Statue (and a smaller version among flower beds). A water fountain feature coming from it's mouth, fantastic photo ops daytime and nighttime. The areas around the Merlion can get very crowded at times but there will be plenty of places on the steps, on the pier, or behind the Merlion to get your selfies or other gorgeous pics.
Can get bit a crowded with happy snappers, but get in and get your pic too! Went at dusk / night. Was a great experience. Baby cub Merlion is here just behind the big one.
Singapura as they say, People in Singapore have a lot of faith in their Merlion. Evening stroll can be good in this place.

The statue of a sea creature and lion mix is the attraction Not worth the stop unless you need a good photo op or desire to see the bay from another aspect Shopping and eateries along the walk is sparse and lacks appeal
except for the merlion itself. there wasn't much to see anyway. Weather was hot and humid and we constantly have to find a shelter to hide.

I've seen the Merlion for the first time years ago in the video "Where the Hell is Matt?" and once I got to Singapore I wanted to see it with my own eyes (I didn't dance in front of it though, if you know what I'm talking about). This symbol of Singapore dates from 1964, when it was created as a logo for the Singapore Tourism Board. Half-fish and half-lion, the creature is meant to represent Singapore's national spirit, its roots as a fishing village and its designation as "lion city" (Singapura). The current statue was unveiled in 1972 by the Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew and currently it sits in the Merlion Park, on a promontory in front of The Fullerton Hotel and near the mouth of the Singapore River. There is a viewing platform from where you can see the statue. Since this is the most recognized symbol of Singapore we were prepared for crowds. It was crowded when we visited in January but it wasn't as crowded as I expected. We went to see the Merlion both during daytime and at night and it was less crowded at night. The view of the Marina Bay Sands across the bay is also very nice.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We walked the bay to reach the Merlion fountain, It is an attraction to both locals and tourists that the traffic of people was so heavy. It is a must see as it is the symbol of Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Probably qualify as the mascot of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Right in the heart of the Central business district, this apart the iconic half lion half mermaid statue, has a fabulous view of Marina Bay Sands and most of the important towers in CBD. It can be really very crowded on public holidays and weekends.
Local attraction and a must see while in Singapore. Easy walking some great views of the area. lots do do around this area
I wouldn't go out of my way to visit this. If you are near it or it is late at night, go ahead. Really isn't anything spectacular. Mainly a marketing tool and tourists doing the same silly poses.
no direct transportation, not ensough sign or indication for tourist, have to walk a long way, night scene is OK, but just a statue, that is !
Interesting place but be prepared for massive crowds. Lovely views over the river. Every coach seems to stop here!

A small attraction, the Merlion which is Half Mermaid and Half Lion represents Singapore. The Merlion Statues location is what makes this attraction very attractive, the area around it is with high rise apartments and multinational corporation, u really are in the center of Singapore surrounded by its majestic skylines.

REVIEW_TITLE: Now you can see it in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is the symbol of Singapore and is a must see on a visit. There is a smaller merlion behind the one we typically associate with Singapore - be sure and see it.

We often visit the Merlion Park when we visit Singapore and we enjoy it's iconic history and the fusion of new and old in the area with the beautiful old, historic buildings and the classy new hotels. There are heaps of restaurants and cafes to be enjoyed in the area as well.
There isn't much at Merlion park except the two Merlions. We went just for the photo op. Maybe combine it with a trip somewhere else in the vicinity. Not worth the trip just for the statue

REVIEW_TITLE: Always crowded but nice view of the river
REVIEW_BODY:
Except in the early AM or during storms, the Merlion Park is crowded with tourists and locals who live and work nearby and pass through (or grab an ice cream from the vendors).

There's little shelter at this park so it is often hot between the sun and all of the stone/pavement.

At 8 pm each evening, a laser light show emanates from Marina Sands and can be seen at this park. The show is free, can also be seen from nearby buildings, and lasts for approximately 15 minutes.

No visit to Singapore isn't complete without a photo stop at the Merlion. It can be quite crowded during the day but is worth a visit both day and night. It is a pleasant walk around the whole quay also. On one side you have to towering Marina Bay Sands and on the other the quaint colonial Singapore.
Enjoyed our time there got some great photos and the went on a harbour cruise really enjoyed it. Well worth the visit.

Well, you can cover this place the same night you are covering the Marina Bay Fountain show. You have to walk along the sea to cover both the places. Lightening is there to keep the atmosphere live. However, there is nothing much to do but take different kinds of photographs! And if you don't love photography just sit on the stairs along Merlion and may be you can hear the inner voice of Singapore nightlife.

Situated on Sentosa Island.. book your tickets online as you will pay more when booking direct.. you can access sentosa cable car from the Harbour Front and redeem your online tickets at Vivo City.. round trip online to Sentosa and Faber Hill around $29SGD pp

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent Views of Marina Bay and Merlion
REVIEW_BODY:
December 30, 2015 - While visiting Singapore a few days before boarding our Indonesia cruise, we had to visit Marina Bay and Merlion Park. The Park is a short walk from the closest metro stop and is in near the Fullerton Hotel. There is a reasonable size platform to view the Marina Bay hotel, the tour boats on the Mariana Bay, and the famous Singapore icon, Merlion.

It is a must see while visiting Singapore.
There is a reason that this is the national icon of Singapore. An amazing statue/fountain and worth going on your visit - otherwise - have you really been to Singapore?

REVIEW_TITLE: Build a Merlion and they will come
REVIEW_BODY: Very popular and symbolic with Singapore Get there early if you do not want others in your picture Great photos to be had

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice to walk around and snap some photos
REVIEW_BODY: We just enjoyed walking in this area, on a lovely day and enjoying Singapore. Just simple fun. I do not have anymore to say. It was just special to enjoy lovely Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must-do for any first-time tourist to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
The Singapore Merlion is one of those simple architectural attractions that becomes an icon for its host city. I wonder if the designer ever knew how popular their creation would become when they first conjured such an image intended to personify Singapore's traditional fishing-village heritage along with the "Lion City" meaning of it's name.

So popular is the merlion statue that there was absolutely no way we were going to get a photo with the merlion without somebody else's body in our photo, so we made-do with what we got and moved-on, but I am so glad after visiting Singapore so many times that I final got to see for myself this iconic statue.
it was along the park, and we went there early in the morning and the weather was just perfect, the statue was amazing, we have a number of great pictures there, enjoyable experience!

REVIEW_TITLE: Just a fountain statue but you have to go there!
REVIEW_BODY: Not much here bar the iconic statue, which means you have to go there if you are visiting Singapore for the first time! Great views as well across the bay to the Marina Sands and other impressive building. You can also catch the boats for a river cruise. Don't go there hungry though as the food is outrageously expensive.

The area where the Merlion statue is located is lovely for an evening stroll and for taking in the sights. There is a buzz about the place. Disappointed though that we missed the light show, bad timing on our part

One of my main Agenda l purpose in Singapore, was to visit the Famous Merlion Statue. The Majestic Merlion which is a half Lion & Half Fish is Landmark in Singapore.

I have read & Heard a Lot about the story of foundation of Singapore & the role of Lion in it, It was my dream to visit Singapore & to see the majestic Merlion. However when I saw it , it was a white Majestic beauty standing Tall & Proud in the Park. Sight worth travelling & seeing, was delighted to see it.

Though we didn't Plan it, we happen to visit the Park at 6:30 in the dusk & stayed there till about 7:30. Its the best time to see the Merlion. However its also good in the Day light. But the best time according to me at night when all the light is lit up in Singapore its a lovely sight.

This is something that no tourist misses. Of course for a foto session with the Merlion. Apart from that, this point also gives a beatiful view of the bay area and the buildings around. Excellent for photo seekers. Open 24 hours, you can hang around here even at night.

Nearest MRT is Raffles Place. 10minutes of walk from MRT

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't miss the whole waterfront experience
REVIEW_BODY: This is such a nice area to walk and explore...don't miss this area of the financial district of Singapore.
Very nice place to take photos. Crowded place. Nice view with water, Singapore flyer and marina by the bay.
This place is the no one tourist spot in town for those of you looking to take selfies with the Marina Bay towers behind you. Place was packed.

Fell in love with the Merlion. A must see unique site in Singapore. Prepare to jostle for photo positions, having strange people in your shots and being in other peoples selfies. Worth a visit, is crowded.
Nice place to visit, noting except the iconic statue of Singapore lion.Must visit as Singapore is synonymous with the statue
Merlion is a guard of the prosperity and has mythical powers to preserve the land. This is a very touristy place and everybody is making pictures!

You have not been in Singapore if you did not visit the Merlion. Stunning and majestic, the Merlion welcomes all visitors to the bay and is now regarded an icon of Singapore itself. The park is clean and well maintained and is surrounded by open-air cafes and restaurants. Perfect for night strolls!
try to visit on a quite day, that's of Singapore has one, its bedlam, trying to take photos , with out being pushed and shoved, so would not take small kids, amazing sight tho.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the must do's in SIngapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Legendary Merlion, with the little Merlion behind it (or in the picture here, in front of it :) ) - one of merlions in Singapore apparently. A tourist hot spot. You haven't been to Singapore if you haven't had your photo taken here, plenty of taxis to and from as well.

REVIEW_TITLE: It is must if in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: It is the icon of Singapore. Nice place to enjoy and take some lovely photograph. Enjoy the cafe and foodies around,

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit if your in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The icon of Singapore the Merlion is the statue of Singapore great photo opportunity, a must if you're visiting this great city.
Must do when you're in town. However be prepared, it is crowded, quite naturally. 30min is all you need to take some snaps.

REVIEW_TITLE: Its the Merlion - You have too see it
REVIEW_BODY: We went down to take the photo of the Merlion. It is a nice little area day or night with a cafe and ice cream venue.

The merlion itself is fairly unimpressive, but serves as a landmark and focal point along around which the city can be viewed. And the city views are truly stunning! The spot does get quite crowded, with loads of tourists jostling to take photos and selfies.

Worth a visit, as part of a visit to the Marina.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful area to take a stroll
REVIEW_BODY: Merlin Park is a beautiful area to take a stroll and enjoy the vibrant tourist area, the big wheel, the Merliion and it famous fountain or just people watch. Plenty of vendors selling cold drinks, ice cream etc. Or watch the boats as they manoeuvre around the bay, or take a ride on one of the many boats offering trips around the bay.

This tourist attraction is very colse to the Fullerton Hotel and sit sits directly on the waterfront.

There are wide steps around the back of the Merlion and many people sit and watch the world go by - it's a great view and a great place to sit awhile and watch the world go by.
There are lots of eateries nearby and it's a very enjoyable and FREE experience.
It is a nice place to visit during the day. There is a statue of the merlion in the middle of a pond and water flows out from it. The location is very pretty and chilled out.
First evening during our visit to singapore we directly went to merlion park to saw the attractions and captured some photos with my wife A night to rememberd

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the many statues but this one is 'Singapore'
REVIEW_BODY:
Tourist attraction as this is what typifies Singapore..... a mermaid's tail and a lion in a single sculpture. The biggest site of Selfie-Takers in Singapore - and I can't blame them!! Look at the photos on tripadvisor, choose a good one and do your own version.
Mine says "who are you looking at?" albeit in front of the smaller version behind ;)
It is 1 of the most iconic places to be and be seen in the whole of Singapore, and you really shouldn't miss the opportunity to experience the magnificent skyline and atmosphere.

Was great to see, we were on foot exploring the city so when we visited it was super quite and nice, but not long after, bus tour after bus tour visited, so your experience may very, but nice without the crowds

Actually I went to Singapore was on 2014 with my boyfriend. And we don't want to miss to take a picture as a souvenir on this symbol of Singapore. We took a boat from the other side that is Marina bay sands shopping mall. It was cool idea to took a boat to reach a Merlion.

Lots of photo opportunities. As well as walking around one can take a boat. They operate hop on/off service. The whole area looks somewhat different from the water. One can seat on the back in the open and catch some suntan.

We walked to the Merlion Park from our hotel. When we arrived, there were a lot of people and not much space to walk and take your pictures alone. It was very crowded and the heat from the sun was very intense. Good thing there were people selling drinks and snacks under the bridge, but those are quite overpriced.

He is the symbol of Singapore so is a must see. Plus it's pretty easy to get to him as he's at the marina.
The reason I say poor merlion is that the builings and structures around the marina seem to be all trying to outdo each other for showmanship and poor merlion has been left behind.
Merlion park is an important tourist place. You can visit this place any time of the day. You can take a cruise ride from this spot and you can find some fine eating places here.
Fantastic view of the Merlion, Casino & various waterfront structures... great place to have a coffee & chill by the river to watch the world go by...

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and is certainly a must visit. Do not however plan an exclusive outing just for the Merlion, you can visit it en route to many of the attractions - its takes 15 min on average to walk the park and take photos. Very safe area and ample public transport available nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: National Symbol of Singapore a mythical half mermaid half lion!
REVIEW_BODY:
90% of all who visit Singapore, do come here on their first day itself ......
Its an excellent view of business district and bay... mesmerizing at Sun rise time !

has many eateries and tourists can spend good time trying to click the cliché pic which shows water from merlion's mouth falling into mouth of tourists :p
Brilliantly impressive statue which is good for photos of both the that and the backdrop of either the Marina Bay Sands Hotel or the Singapore highrise skyline. Statue illuminated at night.
great statue in marina bay near fullerton hotel. visit early in day as gets very busy in afternoon with tourists taking pictures

The merlion is a great symbol of the cosmopolitan city of Singapore. The statue and fountain itself is dominated and overawed by the high story offices! Still worth going to and always take visitors to see.

REVIEW_TITLE: See the symbol of Singapore and the view of the harbour and Marina Bay Sands
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion fountain is located just in front of the Fullerton Hotel which I understand was the original post office for Singapore. The lion is a large statue and fountain and is visible from many harbour locations. you can board a harbour boat nearby for a tour or visit nearby Clarke Quay.

Singapore's symbol has a perfect spot for real postcard photos! Both the skyline and the Marina Bay Sands can be seen from here. It's always crowded but with a little patience you can snap pictures without other people in it.

It's your typical park where you can relax & stroll about the grounds. The shady benches are very inviting and you can people watch while enjoying the view. And of course there's the Merlion and history surrounding the statue that is the big draw here which than points you to marina bay.
It's interesting to see the Merlion up close and take some pictures, but there's not much else here. Don't go out of your way for it.
Iconic sculpture relocated from the riverside to the freshwater reservoir once the Singapore barage blocked the tidal river. Hordes of tourists with selfie sticks if you time your visit badly.

If you are in Singapore go here, take your picture, and find something more fun to do. You will meet a lot of people doing also taking the one picture to prove you have been in Singapore. So just go for it :)
People say if you're on SG, it's a must to take a picture with the famous Merlion. So crowd when we get there. A lot of tourist and children from school. Glad we get nice spot for picture.
The iconic singapore merlion lights up at night with loads and loads of people coming to see it. Good experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great to know it is back together after being hit by lightning
REVIEW_BODY: Great to know it is back together after being hit by lightning. A place we go back to every trip we make to Singapore. Good views of Marina Bay (not even built on our first trips) and business and waterfront areas.

Beautiful view of the business city..you can see all the tall builds of major banks of the world on one side and other side you see marina bay. The best use of water as lion is drinking the bay water always. Must go with kids and family for beautiful picturs
great place for photgraphy, good views all round, you see financial district, Marina Bay, river , everthing around is so good and of course the Merlion

A beautiful place to stroll around especially in the evening when the sun is just setting. There's a beautiful glow in the sky and also subtle lighting in that area makes it a perfect setting for photographs! Amazing modern architecture as well.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit as it's a Singapore symbol
REVIEW_BODY: Came here with my wife as she came here as a child and wanted to get some photos of this symbolic logo. It is smaller than the Sentosa Merlion but this is the original Merlion. It's packed with people and its hard to get photos sometimes. Was worth it though as you do get some good view across to Marina Bay Sands. It is hot (as expected of Singapore) and humid without much shade around.

The location is very busy and vibrant with hordes of tourists taking photos. Other than that the area is attractive and has shops and restaurants to keep you busy. There is a great view across to the Marina Sands hotel and somewhere to people watch.
You have to visit this area to see the art place sky walk the merloin the city's symbol the fullerton hotel facing this area

Easy to get to as well signposted (went by very friendly bus), and was very busy. What beautiful view across the harbour to the gardens and unusual buildings not forgetting the skyline behind with a mix of old and new. Had to make sure we had a picture of the Merlion and had to wait so that the 'selfie' takers were out of the way. There is a new footbridge to use plus cafes so you can spend a short time relaxing with the view.
Take a trip in the elevator to the top, have your favourite drink and look at a wonderful view over marina Bay and beyond. Enjoy!
Worth a visit to see Singapore’s national icon. Quite cooling with the water spray down wind from it. Nice views across the bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very popular attraction even for the locals.
REVIEW_BODY: I enjoyed this attraction from a bus tour where you had 20 minutes to take excellent photos and also from the "Duck" on the river cruise which paused for you to get photos. A very cute icon.

Merlion is way better than I thought. It's bigger than i guessed and the view at night with Marina Bay Sands was really beautiful. In this park has two Merlion; mommy and kid. Yo should find out where a father Merlion is!
It was good place to take a picture. Everybody needs the picture to remind the tour. So here is nice place for this.
I have no idea why this is an attraction, but it is close to some other sights so you will probably walk by anyway. Dont take a detour though
great spot for seeing the historical merlion, and lovely views , a little difficult to get to so take a map but once there great walks and views of the city

Nice skyline from both sides. You will have nice views from the helix bridge as well as from the Merlion itself. Theaters by the bay area amazing with the lights turned on at night.
Must see.

There is a night spectacle every evening with fire, sound and laser lights from Marina Sands. Probably the best spot is from Marina Sands, in front of the mall next to the water, but the spectacle is not really good, much better the one in the gardens by the bay

REVIEW_TITLE: I don't understand what this place is?
REVIEW_BODY: I get that Merlion Park is a tourist attraction but why? I wouldn't have looked twice unless there was 2000 people standing trying to get a good picture with this. Not the best Singapore has to offer.
All visitors of Singapore come here: nice pictures with the Merlion and the 3 towers of Marina Bay Sands. many people...
A quite touristy place, but good for photos and a nice walk around marina bay. Stop in for an ice-cream nearby to cool down..

Merlion park is a must visit for anyone who visits singapore. Best to come here during the evening time as the sunset would present an excellent and picturesque view of the bay area and marina bay sands. Lot of eating places nearby and easily accessible by the MRT. you can also take a ride on the river cruise to visit other places.

Once at the Marina Bay Area you just walk around past the opera house towards the Merlion spouting water into the river. This area is nearly always crowded during the weekends with tourists and locals trying to take 'forced' perspective shots drinking the water. Best time to visit is later in the evening.

This is a must for all going to Singapore, especially for the first time. One of Singapore's most famous landmarks and of course it is free. Á great backdrop of the Singapore Eye and Marina Bay Sands. There are plenty of cafes nearby if you are feeling hot. Great for photos and then moving on to the bay's other attractions.

REVIEW_TITLE: There's a Merlion spouting water out of its mouth
REVIEW_BODY: And that's about it really. It does make for some cool photos in front of the odd edifice that is the Marina Bay Sands Resort, but that's it.
Nice to visit.. Great spot to get lots of photo. Slow walk along the river bank from raffles place.. Lots of eatery to choose from.. And dont forget some pose infront of the merlion statue..
Merlion Park is really nice place to spend a day. Really enjoyed walking and waterfall is simply amazing, has lot of photography there. One of my favourite places in singapore
Great place to photograph the Marina Bay Sands and the harbour. The merlion the symbol of Singapore stands proudly in the park.
enjoy the surrounding and make brake at your exploration of singapure. Also nice the lobby of Fullerton Hotel

REVIEW_TITLE: The view of the bay is amazing
REVIEW_BODY: To see the Merlion up close is spectacular although this time it wasn't working as it normally has water coming from its mouth. You can get Bumboat rides from here and the area just looks good.
Its just another place to take a few photos really. Not allot going on here just crowds of folks with cameras.

Not only can you get some great photos of the Merlion, the symbol of Singapore, but the photos across the bay to the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands are just as impressive.
We went at night just before 8pm and watched the light show from Marina Bay Sands.
The whole area is great fun, for photos, views, location, restaurants, bars, The Raffles, boat trip across the bay

Wow.. im impressed by the numbers of tourists coming to Merlion Park. As a local, I dont hunt for merlion and somehow this is my first time I purposely find merlion because I go with my foreign friend for photo taking.

Frankly I'm out of words. The scene I see is like all tourists must come to this place if you say you come to Singapore before. Because this kind of scene I see it when I go overseas and I saw many tourists busy taking photos happily to capture the iconic symbol of the country.

Somehow I really like the atmosphere and the Merlion was huge. It is really beautiful spot at the sea and there are nice scenery nearby. I enjoy taking alot photos at Merlion and taking interesting photo spot of holding the water from the merlion.

You will really like here if you enjoy photo-taking. If you are not into photo-taking, maybe this may not be what you like. Because almost all tourist here are taking out their camera and snapping beautiful shots.

Seeing is believing. Hope you all enjoy the trip here.

Cheers
It's representative for Singapore. it's a must place to visit if you go to Singapore! You will really enjoy it.

If this is your first S'pore visit, or if it's your 100th like me - the Merlion is the national symble of Singapore and is a "must see" attraction. There are lots of great photo spots, just check out what everyone else is doing and you can repeat their photo ops. Try to make time to visit twice - once during the daytime and again in the evening.
As you know it was quite normal for us. If I visited night it would have been better experience. Big Merlion was ok but small Merlion was pity...

Singapore Icon (half-mermain(fish), half lion) is very famous! It's a must visti spot. We wnent there during the afternoon..It's quite hot, but after few hours (after walking around and eating dinner ), the scenery is spectacular. You can watch the lightshow at Marina Bay sands!

We went there at around 11.00 pm in the night , there were only a few people, it was quite , calm and soothing experience, unfortunately merilion statue was under maintenance so could not take good pictures with the Singapore Icon
It was very interesting and exciting to walk around the Merlion Park, you will see the modern structures with the old ones.. Downside only is the heat ...

REVIEW_TITLE: Okay if you what a selfie
REVIEW_BODY: Far better places to visit in Singapore . The water spitting statue certainly is over rated and I am not quite sure it's even really worth a photo but I am in a minority as loads of people were posing in front of it. This was actually quite entertaining in itself so perhaps it's worth it to watch this . Prices are expensive around the bay .
Always lots of visitors at this statue. Normal to see wedding couples having their photos taken here too. Beautiful statue worth a quick visit.
How else do you prove that you have been to singapore? Entry is free and the view of marina bay sands hotel/singapore flyer is magnificent
This is a symbol of Singapore. It has its own history and so is worth a visit. Other than that it was just a photo shoot opportunity for tourists.
This was very popular here and you could also get a ride on the bum boats, which is really nice and relaxing and informative on Singapore's history and culture.

REVIEW_TITLE: The best Scenic Place of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Every one will just fall in love with this Place for sure...The Merlion,The fullerton hotel,,the river..the esplande...the marina bay sands ,,the singapore flyer,,,the high rise downtown buildings....everything is visible from this point.U can't get away from this place without 10 or more pics minimum..Everything is so beautiful about the place...You can have a river safari to enjoy more ...it's bit expensive...
Although its Icon of tourism in Singapore, was a little underwhelmed. View around the area was nice though.

REVIEW_TITLE: Apart from the historic value nothing interesting
REVIEW_BODY: If you pass coincidentally it is ok. The best thing about the Merlion is the good view to other attractions of Singapore.

View of the Marina Bay Sands was great, Merlion statue was under construction though, so we didn't get a great view of it and fountain wasn't functional. A stopping point if you're already walking around the bay.
Merlion is part of Singapore's history and accordingly a "must see" which also offers great views of various attractions and buildings.

REVIEW_TITLE: Only Worth Going Because It's Iconic
REVIEW_BODY: All this is is a fountain. Sure, it's the symbol of Singapore, so that is the only reason I would go. This is in the Waterfront Promenade, so you can stroll around and see the architecture and beauty of the city.

REVIEW_TITLE: You are Visiting Singapore so you must see their Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: Yes there are crowds and yes it is just like the pictures, but it is still fun to actually see Singapore's Merlion.

REVIEW_TITLE: The bay is an impressive area
REVIEW_BODY: This reclaimed area of Singapore has very interesting architecture very different from the coastline of forty years ago
This site is on the Singapore River and has great views of the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer. and the concert hall known by locals as the big durian. It's worth checking out.

This destination along the Singapore River and bay is one of the most photograph statues in Singapore. Lots of people and view to highlight any photo taken. But can you find all the Merlions in Singapore? The three we found were, the bay, Mt Faber and the Island.

This should be a must on your list if traveling to Singapore. Ensure that you are there in the evening as the lights around create an ambiance which cannot be missed. If possible take a ferry ride and you will enjoy the mesmerizing views.

Nice place for pictures especially on the evening .... With all the lights on .... Against the backdrop of skypark n the glittering city the pictures come just great and after a small walk from there are the food joints with variety of cuisine .....

REVIEW_TITLE: How can you miss a Merlion?
REVIEW_BODY: You just have to come see the Merlion. The area is not big and you can just take a photo with it and go. Great view of the Marina Bay Sands, too.

Cool but your girlfriend will take to many pictures and other girls doing the same will contently be in the way. The statute itself is pretty cool but the food is overpriced but that's too be expected at a tourist trap. Don't buy the crab chilidog it's not really a chili on it more like a lite ketchup with crab bits in it. It's really easy to get here by bus especially if you go to Chinatown first and eat the chicken rice there

This is a must see at night time as all of the buildings light up at night and the Merlion is also lit up.

There are many people there but everyone is relaxed and getting photos.

The view is great as you have the bay in front of you! You can walk there or get a taxi there.
The Merlion is the Iconic symbol of Singapore and a must take photo when you visit there. The Park is in a perfect place to take in the views around Marina Bay.
Theis is a very good palce for having good photographs..One the most popular attractions in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: I took the river boat to here
REVIEW_BODY:
It was an amazing educational exp. one I would do again. The tour guide was very detailed explaining the impact of the historical events along the river.

It was great to learn about the different times in Singapore history. It was also great to get the story behind the Merlion and by arriving by river boat it gave you a different view.

No visit to Singapore is complete without visiting the Merlion statue in Merlion Park.

Best time to visit is dusk so you get to see it in the daytime and also at night for the nightly Spectre light show. It’s free to visit, however tends to get crowded with everyone jostling for a picture, so be mindful of crowds.

Really nice place to visit, due to its association with Singapore it’s a must visit destination if only for half an hour. Loads of fresh air and good photographs to get. Good and drinks are readily available to near by shops along with souvenirs. Although it is quite busy it is still a lovely place to go for a walk.

The statue itself is very basic and overly crowded by tourists. But said that, the view from the park is worth capturing. You get to the marina bay hotels and the cbd skyline. Just visit for the views around.
Merlion is one of the most notable landmarks from Singapore. Half lion and half mermaid. A beautiful view is Marina Bay.
I know you’ve got to come here when visiting but in reality there’s not a lot to see or do. It always seems to be very busy, not surprisingly, so choose your time carefully.
If you want to avoid the hot sunny weather in the day, come here during the evening to see the Merlion glow.

I walked from my hotel, Marina Bay Sands in 20 minutes over to Merlion Park. I was super busy with large tourist group, so I didn’t get to make too many snapshots, but it was awesome to be there! There’s a full 7-11 under the bridge, snack shops, restaurant, and a great souvenir shop under the bridge too!

REVIEW_TITLE: The experience isn't all that but its cute for a first experience.
REVIEW_BODY: Title says it all and its more of the surrounding places that makes it worth going there. There's hella food and places to go to but definitely a good pit stop if you don't mind a conglomerate of tourists. Okrt

The atmosphere is always electric around the Merlion. There are always masses of people posing for photos. It is easy to get to using the MRT and nice just to soak in the atmosphere once you're done with the photos.

REVIEW_TITLE: The only thing you can’t miss
REVIEW_BODY: An amazing statue-fountain at Singapore’s marina. During the night there is a light show from marina bay sands.

Views across the bay are fabulous, regardless of the statue. Be patient if you want a good photo as there are likely to be lots of people doing the same thing. Plenty of food and drink outlets nearby.

If you go to Singapore, at least you need to take a picture in this place. Its place with many people there even on weekdays in the morning. In the park, there some supermarket to buy some drink or snack. Its also possible to go jogging here
Such a pretty area. Lots of crowds but well worth the visit. Lots of dining options in the area and places to escape from the Singapore heat.

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconic place in Singapore. Never miss it when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Very crowded place. Try to visit this place early in the morning to take good pictures. Too many tourist because it's the Iconic place in Singapore. Never miss it when in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to relax with some good views
REVIEW_BODY: After a long walk in the city, this was the best place where I was able to relax a bit. You can have a good view of the Marina Bay area and the place has many restaurants around for a good meal looking at the Merlion statue.
This is one of the symbols of Singapore. You can't miss it. Surrounded by skyscrapers and the beauty of Marina Bay.
In this park, you can see beautiful view, but in here so full of people and crowded, so far this area nicw

Not exactly a 'must see' destination. With a constant stream of water sprouting from the mouth of the gigantic Merlion (a play on words - mermaid and lion), it attract loads of young tourists taking selfies with the illusion of the water jetting into his/her mouth. Not a historical ornament.
One of the finest and most famous destination in Singapore is the Merlion Park. Enjoyed my time here.
Lovely park but I think night is better as you see all the lights. What's even better is to take a boat tour during the day and one at night I do each time.

REVIEW_TITLE: Under construction but still a pretty area
REVIEW_BODY:
Unfortunately when I visited the larger merlion was under construction so only had the small one to see. The whole area around is beautiful and having researched the photos of the larger fountain it does look spectacular.
Well worth a visit. With lots of cafes around it’s easy to pass the time here

A nice scenic place on the waterfront to see the Merlion and also see the wonderful Marina Bay Sands hotel on the otherside and you can take boat rides on the river, visit nice restaurants nearby & have great photo opportunities.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to run early in the morning!
REVIEW_BODY: I started my run around the gorgeous Fort Canning Park and decided to cap it off running with the Merlion as my background. Such a great run! Definitely the best run of my life! Running the entire stretch end to end with Merlion Statue as the midpoint is insanely awesome! 6:30 am is a great time as it is bright enought to see the Marina Bay Sands from not too far and Merlion already spewing water from its mouth. The area also has very few people enough to take in the gorgeous scenery while enjoying an uninterrupted run!

Merlion park can not water spray
Because merlion underconstruction between Febuary 2019 and May,6 2019
But i visit may, 8-11 2019 and i visit take photo
Day 10 may 2019

I wish i fly to retake merlion again comming soon for water spray at merlion main

By the time I visited Marina Bay the Merlion was under maintenance, surrounded by walls, so it was disappointing I could not watch it, but a small replica is nearby. If you do not know the big one you can imagine it looking at the small one

It was great being at the Merlion park, taking photos and learning the history of the Merlion statue.

The place is nice, well kept and maintained and the views across the Singapore River are good with the Marina Bay Sands hotel in the back ground.

The only draw back for me was just how crowded the place is. You can't take a photo of the statue without somebody being in the way. Very many tourists flock to this place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion Statue sees the daylight again ! 13 May 2019
REVIEW_BODY: Yes we can see the Mother Merlion with its baby cub again. But no water. Guess they didn’t fix the faulty water pump in time. Four stars for no water sprouts.

Too bad it is under construction though there is a small cute merlion on the side. Marina Bay Sands is seen from here. There are restaurants around the stretch. People are helpful to take your photo since I was solo :)

So I only saw the mosaic tile Merlion (tiny one) as the larger one was under renovation (to my disappointment). It's alright. Took a quick picture and then moved along with the rest of my day.
I'd say go check out the Merlion in Sentosa. It's huge and totally worth the trek out to Sentosa (especially in the mornings when you get to take of picture of it/with it all to yourself)

You go to see the Merlion, yay.......the one you see looks a little too small....thoughts of it looks bigger in the movies come to mind. Then you see the big ply board boxed off construction work and you go home.
Shame it was under construction this time so couldn’t see it. Couldn’t see any information on when it will be completed.
Bring your camera here. The Merlion looks great, as does the backdrop, so it's a wonderful photo opportunity. A must do, if one is on a walkabout (see my YouTube) in the Lion City.

This is basically a 10 metre tall lion and fish head statue spewing water out its mouth.
It's a landmark on the waterfront of Singapore, and although fairly impressive to me it was just another photo opportunity but worth seeing as it represents the symbol or mascot of Singapore

Amazing views of Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Singapore Flyer - great for selfies! Or normal photos of course! Singapore icons!

Unfortunately as you can see, Merlion statue is under construction at the time of my visit. The rest of the area was lovely, and whilst the weather cooperated, it made my photos pop.
The area has many eateries, lots of walking, beautiful bright flowers. Not for people who can’t walk or find it difficult.
There is a small Merlion statue that I was happy to have the photo so that my walking excursion wasn’t a waste of time.
View is good. Construction work is ongoing to the merlion, so you cant experience water coming from its mouth till the work is not done.
This is nothing to write home about. Small and overcrowd feature Look at it if your in the area. But would go out your way to see it

I've been to Singapore many times, and I finally made it to the Merlion. Great spot for a photo with this symbol of the Lion City. You'll have to wait your turn to get your photo or selfie. This is very popular! But once you are finished you can have a pleasant walk around the water where you will find many shops and restaurants.

The Merlion is half-fish, half-lion statue near the waterfront at Marina Bay. The Merlion is Singapore’s national icon and it used to occupy the mouth of the Singapore River and it is moved to its current location in 2002. The statue is 8.7 meters tall and has a fountain of water spurting out into the Marina Bay. Singapore’s original name Singapura means Lion City in Malay. It is a very popular photo spot and is a very touristy and crowded area. It is 8 min walk from Boat Quay. You can find gift shops, cafés, restaurants and restrooms nearby. It is open all day and it is free.
Visited the Merlion today and it was covered under netting and surrounded by scaffolding. Not sure how to rate this but still enjoyed the surrounding views of Marina Bay.
Lot of people meeting at that area it’s good viewing and some of graduations Student come to take photos as the merlion of the city there to have luck and strengths .

This locates in Marina Bay Area. Next to Fullerton Hotel. High demand tourist attraction. There is also nice views to Marina Bay Sands Hotel. You can find couple of bars and restaurant on site so if you like to get a snack or some refreshments their are very close. There is also 7 eleven on site.
Definitely a tourist hot spot! If you don’t like crowds this may not be the place for you. Fun place to take pictures and see the landscape of Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing day walk to Merlion Park from Esplanade
REVIEW_BODY: I started my journey from the Esplanade beside Marina Bay and walked to Merlion Park. Along the way, I managed to catch a short band performance at the outdoor esplanade area and jostled a bit with travellers along the Jubilee bridge. The i-lights festival was happening during this period and I was lucky to see the Merlion change colours. Overall a positive trip
You can’t visit Singapore properly without taking a trip to see the Merlion. The park is very tourist heavy but you should be able to find a space with an uninterrupted view of the statue.
This famous park is a landmark attraction for tourists visiting Singapore. The views of the bay are spectacular, of course depending on the weather, so it's important to check that out!
I liked the view better at night than in the afternoon. I found it hard to get a spot for a photo without others around, so be prepared because there are a lot of people.

This is a must visit park to see the world famous symbol for Singapore. The size of the statue was not huge but the ambience is whay you get you. And obviously lots of photo ops with the lion cum mermaid statue and the water coming out of its mouth - some people are pretending to drink , some taking in hand, some on head...it's a fun place and the park itself is a good time to spend at least 1 hr.

I walked over here on a Saturday late morning. Was a good stop, however, as I was Ata peak time there were many tourists. Probably better to see during a weekday or evening. Nevertheless Tyger are some good picture spots.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gorgeous view and scenic spot to take pictures
REVIEW_BODY: There are pros and cons for being there early. It's hard to take a pic of the Marina Sands Hotel because of the direct sunlight but there are fewer tourists taking selfies. For nighttime: Becomes crowded but the lights are just too pretty
Nice walk for a little green break from the Esplanade across the Jubilee bridge to the Merlion Park. A photo of the Durian if you like.
The merlion is the icon of Singapore. Transportation to Merlion park is convenient. But it is full of tourists.

This is undoubtedly the only place one can recognize while speaking about singapore. The locations is easily accessible through public transport. Was a 10 min cab drive from the place I was staying in Katong. Being the tourist place it is mostly crowded but worth a visit. Try visiting during dawn or evening hours to experience both sunset/sunrise & night lights. Has a good view of Marina bay & singpore flyer. A couple of hawker centers nearby makes it economical to grab a quick bite as the onboard restaurants can be a bit pricey. But a great place to spend the evening enjoying the breeze & admiring the beauty.

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconic but rammed wirh selfie tourists
REVIEW_BODY: Iconic symbol of Singapore. Swamped by hordes of tourists weilding selfie sticks. Flying visit recommend.
U can spent hours around the Bay to look around or sit next to Merlion. They have some free performance but make sure to check the schedule first.
Great for resting and capturing. Open and welcomed every time you wish without restrictions. Good air condition because of wind
Really nice park with lion sculpture/fountain, nice place to just sit under the trees and relax and take in the spectacular views of the city.
Hi! i was here on January 2018 ! but sadly underreconstruction but still very happy with the view around.. really love to hangout to this place! i went here by walk from my hostel..
The park itself it's ok, it offers good views of the bay. And of course, Don leave without your photo drinking from the Merlion.
This is my go-to place to watch the sun rise from the horizon, and depending on the time of the year it might right behind MBS.
I came across Merlion park when walking. The Merlion, yes mermaid lion, is a continuous water fountain. If walking it’s worth stop but would not drive there as special trip.

Beautiful view of marina bay sands, the water, and lots of beautiful buildings. There are cute boat rides next to this location. I went with a gf and we took tons of pics. They have coffee, water, and icecream close by also for a snack.

Crowded, bustling, and claustrophobia inducing was my experience at Merlion.

It is quite a small park existing of a circular stoned walkway surrounded by overpriced restaurants and a small pier so that you could get a frontal view of the lion. If you’re wanting a view with the lion and Marina Bay Sands in the background, you will get the back of the lion with a plethora of selfie taking individuals in the foreground.

I think they should aptly rename this park ‘Selfie Park’.

I am still glad to have gone, though, because Singapore is full of Merlion paraphernalia and now I feel a bit more Singaporean.
was here this january.. so clean, fresh and many people.. i love the situation here.. i went in the morning for jogging and really a good place to hangout..

I'll get straight to the point. The Merlion is just a statue.

But it is so iconic and synonymous with Singapore that a trip to Singapore without seeing the Merlion would feel incomplete. So, go!

The closest MRT station is Raffles Park. It is a 8-10min walk from there.

There is no entrance fee.

You can see Marina bay and it's a good place to view the Marina Bay Skypark Casino (surfboard) building.

This Merlion is the icon of Singapore. It overlook Marina bay sands and is connected to Esplanade theaters by Esplanade bridge. Visit this once when you are in Singapore. It is at the heart of Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great walk from Helix Bridge to Merlion Park
REVIEW_BODY: The park it self felt overrated. It was small and crowded. But the walk from Helix Bridge to Merlion Park was great. The walk had great view, wind and places to relax here and there.

It is a symbol of Singapore without doubt. Every tourist visiting Singapore comes to this park and take a picture, and so do I. If you have time, I recommend you to walk to Marina Bay Sands, which is on the other side of the bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: Laser show .. dont go there for it . Go there only for the nice breeze
REVIEW_BODY: Laser show .. dont go there for it . Go there only for the nice breeze. Its the sitting area n organized shore side . Let the nice cool breeze n rain splash you.. Laser show is absolutely useless.. dont wait for it..

REVIEW_TITLE: Take an evening walk to get a great experience...
REVIEW_BODY: One of the best things you can do in Singapore is to take an evening walk around Marina Bay. Cross pedestrian bridges and walk with a view to the magnificent Marina Bay Sands and enjoy the 26 foot high Merlion fountain
Merlion Park should be your first stop in Singapore. Very popular place for a Kodak moment. A nice view of the sands casino. And at night with the lights and the skyline in the background is amazing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Please carry good hat and umbrell
REVIEW_BODY:
Awesome place if visited in eveningd ..day time tend to be too hot. But the walk from MRT station ..downtown is great....there are good cafe and eating places around the place. Its a fantastic landscae and panoramic view to click. Just ensure you are well covered up if you visit in day tome and are wel hydrated. One can take a strol and wlk upto singapore flyer and also to marina bay mall. Pretty expensive but worth visiting (with canals abd great decor and brands)
Its a 3.5 km walk if you mske the complete circle.
Great picture spot in the city to catch the Merlion, Marina Bay and the Science Art museum. A little bit too busy with selfie sticks, but what can you expect.

They have installed a magnificent light show at the Merlion which is really awesome. You should go there after it gets dark. Also you can see over the bay towards the fountain show of the Marina sands hotel across from the Merlion.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and the statue/ fountain is something to admire and Merlion Park also gives a fab view of Marina Sands Bay and the Art and Science Museum. I got to the Merlion at about 9am and it was bustling with tourists and I had to fight to take my obligatory photo and selfie, but it was worth it. To fi d Merlion Park get off at Raffles Place MRT take the OUE link and it will pop you onto the side where the park is- then just follow the signs and the other tourists.
this place is simply amazing and it will leave you completely mesmerized I would personally recommend this place to be visited along with friends and family
Yes sure, you must visit here if you travel to SG. And off course take a selfie. Its always crowded day and night

Tourist spot. Can see marina sands tower from here. Crowded most of the time with the amount of tourist. Take note of the weather when visiting. Can be pretty hot during afternoon time due to its surrounded by sea water. Typical tourist attraction area that you wouldn't to miss.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very touristy and crowded but a must as a symbol of Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: No matter when you go, it's busy unless super early in the morning. You will struggle to get a clear shot. Tourists all trying to do photos for their FB or instagram! Nicer at night. Do a boat cruise which takes you near it and you get a better photo from there. Lot's of shops and restaurants, cafe bars near by

Although this is an iconic statute of the merlion, it is nothing too special or unmissable. If you are in the area, it might worth dropping by to get a couple of photos or selfies with a nice backdrop of the river. Otherwise, there is just a bunch of overpriced restaurants and cafes nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: Photograph spot best for cityscape photography
REVIEW_BODY: In a day time this place will be full of tourists crowd to visit the symbol statue of Singapore. But in early morning and before sunset this place are good spot to take the cityscape photos. I meet many photographers that visit this place in the early morning and take lots time to get photos around Merlion, because this place are surround by the modern exterior buildings. So for the photograph and architecture lovers. You must come.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Most Iconic Image of This Southeast Asian City State
REVIEW_BODY:
Without a doubt, the most identifiable image of the country, and commonly seen in brochures, ads, and even on fighter jets (as seen at the Air Force Museum).

Set right on the waterfront, this little showcase is a must see when visiting, and this was only my second trip to it since I first saw it way back in November of 2009.

However, this time, I got wonderful night shots (and with a much better camera than the last time).

This installation is cool to see too, because the downtown area of the city creates and awesome backdrop (although I think I'd say it looks cooler at just before sundown with just enough light in the sky plus the statue, plus the lights from the buildings in the background).

However, as previously mentioned by many others, yes, as this IS probably the most emblematic landmark in the country, it's going to attract quite a crowd and thus, there will most likely be many many people there all taking their selfies and group pictures in both the day or night.
However, it's not like you can't get good pictures in between as most were very considerate of others who are also trying to get their own memorable snapshots.

Also, if one gets off at the City Hall MRT, follow maps, and even street signs, you can easily reach the Merlion, is a great place for a photo shoot and admission is completely free!

A must go to if visiting the Republic of Singapore.
I walked from my hotel so got there about 10am and there were hundreds and hundreds of people. It’s symbol of Singapore and everyone wanted photos. You have to go see it.

I went there couple of times. It is a nice walk from Marina Bay hotel towards it. Plenty of people there by evening. I guess because you can see the night time light show displayed by Marina Bay. Take some nice photos and take your time. You will love it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Time to chill at iconic Merlion of Singapore on Marina bay
REVIEW_BODY:
Iconic Merluon of Singapore is combination of lion's head and a piscian body. This Merlion is said to be the copy or a large Merlion at sentosa island. However, even this is huge.

There is a large waterfront in front of the Merlion, coming from the Singapore river. Arround are small foot paths and some shops for food and sovineer purchasing. In this area a lot of sculptures are seen. Many iconic Singapore land marks including theatre, gardens and museums are around this area.
If you bump into it fine but going there for a selfy do not waste the time Lovely statue fun place etc

The Merlion statue is a must see while in Singapore. It’s fairly easy to find. The statue is fairly decent sized. This area seems to always be busy with people. The nearby Fullerton Hotel and other buildings, along with the waterfront, make this area a favorite to visit.
The Merlion is icon of Singapore tourism. It is a landmark and must-see attraction. The attraction is crowded but the statue is quite good.
Merlin Park overlooks the Singapore river and Marina Bay Sands. I by passed this on my way to The Singapore Flyer. Great views and at night there is a light show off Marina Bay Sands.

REVIEW_TITLE: Wow what a place to be !!!
REVIEW_BODY: Superb feeling, just going there is an amazing experience seeing all the people from different parts of the would simply clicking the merlion wow,,,

REVIEW_TITLE: Spectacular views at the Merlion Park
REVIEW_BODY:
It was a hot and humid day on my first day in Singapore. I was on a long weekend primarily to see Arsenal FC on their preseason tour so I'd done little to no research on the city before arriving. I was searching for a good view of the Marina Bay hotel with its ship atop when I arrived at the waterfront and the view hit me. Beautiful view across the water, dozens of people posing for photos and the Merlion stood majestically spouting water into the harbour.

A great walk in the sunshine, views of the harbour and city skyline plus the Fullerton Hotel in one direction and the Marina Bay Sands in the above - breathtaking.

REVIEW_TITLE: Take some photos of the Merlions
REVIEW_BODY:
This attraction is right on the harbour, standing on reclaimed land. The big Merlion; named Mama Merlion, is the original one which stood on the waterfront (before the big land reclamation project), standing behind her is The Cub (a female, they say) and the only Merlion facing away from the sea. This is a fun place to take photos, and there are plentiful near-by places where you can get a cool drink.
In reply to the Trip Advisor questions about fees and dress standard: there are no fees to pay at any Merlion venue. Common sense dictates that you dress reasonably wherever you go in Singapore... the locals don't particularly want to see visitors in grubby / skimpy outfits.
What next?! Now that you've met Mama Merlion and The Cub, you should walk up to the top of Mt Faber to meet Elder Brother Merlion... and of course you'll take a trip to Sentosa Island; the ideal opportunity to meet one more member of the family; Papa Merlion.
There's another, rather diminutive, Merlion at the Tourist Info Centre.
If you have an inquiring mind, you can do the research on the computer and find two unofficial Merlions guarding the carpark at Ang Mo Kio Grove, and three unofficial Merlions in Woodlands; two are in front of a garden shop / plant nursery, where you can meet the gent who created them! And one more just around the corner in a sort of Merlion shrine.
Having done all that, you'll want to visit the Mustafa Centre; the discount department store near MRT Bugis which is open 24 hr / day. That's where you can stock up on Merlion keyrings at $2 a piece!
Early in the morning on my runs was the best time for this. Hardly anyone there around 7am. Just beautiful Singapore at its best.

REVIEW_TITLE: One Of The Most Photographed Place In Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is not an understatement or overstatement. Every day, you can see scores of visitors flocking this iconic monument to take pictures, selfies and also wefies. It is a must photograph place in Singapore. It's clean, beautiful and very well managed. There are lots of nice restaurants and coffee shops where you can stop by and enjoy.

Merlion Park is Singapore symbol or landmark, a must visit attraction. Merlion means, lion's head and the body of a fish which spouts water from its mouth through the day. Merlion statue is located at the bank of back waters and surrounded by tall buildings. It is always crowded with tourists. Marina Bay, Marina Bay Sands Skypark, Gardens by the Bay, Cloud forest are near by important tourist attractions to visit along with Merlion park.

I went there when i had a stop over going to Bangalore india. Merlion is not hard to reach out! Went by train from Changi to city i walked 10 minutes from the train station to merlion and then back. People are very helpful specially indians.

Merlion is the first thing that comes to my mind, when I think about Singapore. This the most publicised tourist attraction. You can actually visit this after spending your afternoon at gardens by the bay. The attraction is free to visit and is very clean. It is very interesting to see the Merlion closely and observing it's intricate details. There are enough food eateries near this for refreshment.

Everybody is here, everybody is taking their picture drinking from the MerLions spouting mouth! A great place to meet up with your lost traveling companions or just people watch. A must see for any traveller.

REVIEW_TITLE: Too many tourists but worth a watch
REVIEW_BODY: MerLion - Body of a Mermaid with the head of a Lion. Try going early in the evening, there will a lot of people so make sure your photo angles and cropping skills are pretty good. It is a good 20-30 mins walk from Clark Quay but it's a pretty nice walk. You also get a good view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel.
Nothing much to talk about as it is the landmark of Singapore. It is the must visit place in Singapore. The Merlion park is what defines Singapore.
Recommending everyone to visit it during the night! You can watch beautiful dancing fountain and also take beautiful pictures. You can also ride the boat along the harbor.
The Merlion overlooks the mighty Marina Bay Sands So Just look for that and you will find the Merlion opposite the river! There is also a Starbucks right near it to.
One of must go place in Singapore, especially for first time travelling to Singapore. Location access still make me confuse from MRT location. Please make more guide for tourist.

An impressive statue with a great history attached. Recommend early or late in day as it was super busy with tour groups. Also don’t be silly and try climb underneath it I watched a women fall in the water trying
There’s have so many restaurants and looking to city 🌃 you have to take so many pictures there I recommend to visiting there!

Went here one very hot afternoon yet tourists were still swarming the place to take pictures with the majestic Merlion. The Merlion park is just a small area where the 2 Merlions are found. People stay by the trees to cool off while some food joints offer refreshing treats to visitors.

A must if you are visiting SG. It is right by the waterfront. From here you can see the SG flyer, MBS and Durian-shaped esplanade. There are bars and restaurants right next to the Merlion. I was lucky to be here during the light festival. This place was packed at night.

I crossed this place on one of my early morning runs and was surprised to see a lot of tourists clicking pictures. The sunrise pictures around that area are beautiful, especially with the Marina bay sands building in the shot.
Visit during late evening... the lights, the fountain show, the boat ride, the ambiance, the calmness,,, you will just be lost in it. must visit.
There are two merlions..one here and one in Sentosa,good for those tourist posed photos ..nice walkway for walking too

There is a sense of mystique about the Merlion however the truth is it was designed in 1964 by a member of the Singapore Souvenir Committee as the logo of the Singapore Tourism Board. So rather than being a historic representation of the City it’s a glorified souvenir. In saying that the 8.5m high statute, erected in 1972, is one of the most recognised statues in the world.
It seems that everybody who visits Singapore ends up with a least one photo of the Merlion. Located at Merlion Park on Marina Bay, in front of the Fullerton Hotel, there is a pier extending alongside allowing you to take photos of it from all angles. There tends to be a crowd no matter what time during the day that you visit. If you take a bumboat tour you can even take photos of it from the water. There is also a smaller 2m high statue standing behind the main statue, commonly referred to as the “Merlion cub”.
Good to walk around and enjoy the lovely Vistas of Singapore. From there head up past the Restaurants on the left bank of the River. You can also take a Ferry ride at Fullerton Hotel.
Be sure to be here to get a photo of the Merlion in front of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Especially when the water show is running. Only negative is that the restaurants here is very pricy.

I wasn’t WOWed by Merlion Park but I am glad I saw it. It was very overcrowded with little regard for the masses of people trying to take photos and get a good view. However, the view is quite lovely. The restaurants nearby look great, but Clarke Quay has much more variety and a better atmosphere if you’re looking for a place to eat near the water. Only need 10 minutes at this place!

The merlion is Singapore’s icon and visit to park is almost a certainty for all tourists. Park is often crowded but there’s also a quieter spot near the bridge away from the merlion. There’s a small mall next to it.
One of the most Iconic View in Singapore in front of Marina Bay Sands Hotel, 🖐 star for this amazing memorable place 💪🏻

REVIEW_TITLE: Good to spend an evening there
REVIEW_BODY: A good place to go and enjoy the evening breez. The lisght of high rise buildings, the boat floating in the river, the marina bay hotel and the reflaction of the lights on the river water is just amazing. Donno about others but enjoyed the moment myself a lot.

REVIEW_TITLE: It’s a stop , not a destination.
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion, while cool to see, is not a destination. It’s one of several places around the bay for photo ops or bay viewing. There are restaurant near by and an an underpass to cross the road.

I arrived early in Singapore around 8 am with nothing to do until my hotel check in time. I decided to spend my time strolling around the Merlion Park. The park is very nice and beautiful but very crowded with tourist. I prefer to enjoy the view from the Esplanade Park. Its not very crowded and you can still view the Merlion statue.

This place really crowded, a lot of tourist taking photos here. The statue itself is not impressive in my opinion just small statue near marina area. You can visit this place, helix bridge and garden by the bay just by walking.

Merlion is so well know in Singapore but not worthwhile taking time to go. Of course the view of Marina Bay and Marina Bay Sands hotel is outstanding so it may be worthwhile to go there just to take your photo with that view.
You can walk from Raffles Plaza MRT station but the signs are insufficient and you have to ask several times to get there.
In the same area, there are National Gallery Singapore and Raffles Hotel etc so may be you want to visit that area anyways.
Love the view! Singapore has a very beautiful statue as their trademark. I could also take some photos with Marina Bay Sands as the background. Stunning :)

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful photo opportunities with the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: The symbol of Singapore, the Merlions found in the park, provide wonderful photo opportunities. The park is always crowded but you can get great pics of the Merlin and Manila bay.
It's a foundation on the promenade another photo opportunity. Nothing else really to say. Around this you get good pictures of marina bay and marina sands
Nice peaceful place to spend hours idling around even post midnight Landscape photographers paradise
When i visited this place i expected this place to be iconic & beautiful but was disappointed seeing it beacuse the merlion statue was dilapidated.. It needs Renovation & to be repainted.
True phenomenal landmark of Singapore. Very easy to be reached. Tidy and clean. Nice place for selfie and enjoying Strait of Singapore.

The park is definitely a must visit when you are in Singapore - as it features a great statue of a mythical creature called Merlion - half lion, half fish right at the bay. The view of the Marina Sands Bay hotel and all other surrounding tall buildings here are also excellent!
Merlion is a great land mark however it is very busy and full of tourists. Unfortunately you are not able to get a photo with no one else in the back ground

You can just read its story online and look at the photos. I regret walking there under the sun. A very small statue, looks like it is made of plastic. Very touristic area. You could better skip the park and go to the Marina Bay directly.
Awesome park. Merlion is right there and huge with water gushing from its mouth. Seems to attract alot of people was busy when I went at around 2 pm. Must see
What can i say? If u never been in singapore this is the place for you. U can take a cool picture in here or take a boat from here. Or u can take bus tour from suntec mall

The place takes a while to explore. Many high rises and a cool looking statue. You can check out the light show at night which kicks off around 8pm and 9pm respectively from my understanding. Lasts about 15 minutes or so.
Everything is very organize. This is my favorite city among South east asian countrys, Merlion park it symbolizes singapore. And a great view to look the city as well..
