Calling it a park is stretching it. It's just a small tourist trap area to take pictures of the merlion by the water. There's a mini replica of it too next to it, not sure why

I have visited Singapore many times but this is the first trip I have gone to see the Merlion. It is a VERY popular attraction so be prepared for large bus fulls of people at various times during the day. If you have some time though, you can wait and have it less crowded. It is definitely worth seeing and I am glad I made the effort this time. I called in to see it while I was doing a self guided tour on one of the Neuron Electric Scooters you can see around Singapore. It’s one of the quintessential things to do in Singapore.
Great statue but best viewed from a bumboat on the river to get clear views away from tourists. An iconic symbol of Singapore.

It was raining when I made that Day 1 Tour! Picture taking was not easy with the Flimsy Raincoat,provided by the Tour Guide. However it was quite enjoyable climbing the Highest Point! I would recommend this Tour To Other Tourist like myself and perhaps when I come back to Singapore as a Tourist again, I will Revisit it along with the Other places that I Missed out on, due to limited time!
Go there to see the Merlion which is the symbol of Singapore, just to take pictures, there is a nice view from there

Merlion Park, whether if it’s day or night, is one of must see destination in SINGAPORE. it is no surprising that even when you wish to take a perfect photo or a selfie, it will be a challenge as this place is packed day & night. don’t forget to take an evening stroll as the sky fell into darkness along the promenade for a cool
breeze.

The Merlion is bigger than I thought. It's highly accessible --- basically in the urban center so it can be part of the city tour.

I went at night, and the lighting made the Statue even more stylish. I used only my mobile phone for photo but that was good enough!
Of all the times I visited the Merlion, the sunset moment is the best. Set against the backdrop of the cityscape, it is such a relaxing sight!
Taking a photo with the Merlion is one of the top attractions in Singapore. A very scenic view to relax and enjoy :)

This is an iconic and historical place for Singapore. It is one of the most photographed places in Singapore and it has lots of nice coffee shops and restaurants around this area. If you have not taken any picture from Merlion Park, that means you have not visited Singapore. This attraction is also very near to many other attractions such as the Esplanade theater, MBS and also the Singapore flyer.

REVIEW_TITLE: There is one best way to see the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: I know this is a must see one time for travelers but be prepared. It’s crowded with tour groups and everyone is trying to get a Picture. Doesn’t live up to the hype this way. Later I took a water cruise and this is how everyone (but not too crowded) should see the Merlion. From the front front side and lit up it is beautiful and deserving of it symbolizing Singapore.
Totally worthwhile trekking to find this iconic Singapore landmark. Difficult to find at first, but once you do, it's amazing! Take the right exit out of the MRT and you'll be right

Walk along Esplanade and you will be able to find Merlion! Recommended to visit in the morning or evening as the weather is much more cooling and do check it out when you pass by at night too as there will be some nice lights along the way and you can see Marina Bay Sands from here! Good for family to take a walk for some sightseeing and get your camera ready and remember to "drink" the water from Merlion!

The Merlion Park is a must-see spot in Singapore! The famous Merlion is there, and one can get a great view of the three-building structure from this side of the bay! The Durian looking theatre is always within reach. It’s like one stone three birds kind of deal; one will check off some major sightseeing spots from here.

Do note that there is always a ton of tourists at the park. Try to come early if you can to avoid extreme crowd. Recommend time spent is between 30 minutes and 1 hour. One can always extend their stay in this area, going along the bay. It is such a nice walk! Bike renting option is also available. One can bike around the bay and city center if preferred!

If you want to see the statue and get a great photo. Do it on the bum boat ride from Clarke Quay. You'll get a great shot and get to laugh at the people trying to get a selfie, which is equally accomplished off the boat. If you want to get photos with a Merlin, go to the one at Sentosa as it's a better view and attraction all up.

It is the logo of Singapore, you must go there for picture. Note that it is easily get lost in Singapore. The road are complex. After get off from MRT Raffles Place, ask people and turn on GPS. Singapore is hot, the water there is expensive, so prepare plenty of water is recommended. Take a picture that use your mouth to catch the water from Merlion, it represents catch the money :)
This is really popular! Don't forget to come with your camera to snap some shots with the Merlion fountain! Also, you might get a little sprayed on.
Nice place. Many tourists come here to relax and take iconic photos with the statue. Walking distance from other attractions.
Merlion is Singapore symbol, it's a must when visiting the country, very good views from there. It's not necessary to spend that much time on it if you're short on time.
My friend guided me for this tour in Singapore iconic Merlion Statue. This area are having so much tourist which is to take a photo with the Merlion.

Merlion park is a definite must see .. this area alwsys has lots of people taking pic and is right by the water ..with of course the Merlion in all its beauty spouting water.

This area has lots of restaurants and you can even enjoy a ferry out and get a better view of the Merlion and the entire area.

This place is so called one of 3 most disappointing places.

But, if you don’t expect too much, I think this is a fine place.
The Merlion statue is after all famous.
Water is refreshing especially when heat is there.

Also, I watched the night laser light show in the bay from this park.
There is some distance to the main venue, but it looks the whole bay is the venue.
Nice show it was.

Spent an afternoon walking around here.
It’s great if you want to get 10,000 steps in.
A huge variety of eating places but all catering mainly to Western culinary.
From the entrance you can take the boardwalk all the way around to Marina Sands shopping mall - this is well worth a look through.
There is not much shelter so be sure to wear a hat and take an umbrella - especially on a hot day!
Taxis from the main entrance take a while - there is a long line, but plenty of other transport modes into and out of the park.

REVIEW_TITLE: A little crowded and overly commercialized
REVIEW_BODY: I think the statue doesn't present much, but a place to take pictures on. It's iconic really, but should give out more details as to their essence in Singapore culture.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlions, Tigers, and Bears, Oh My!
REVIEW_BODY: One can't visit Singapore without a pilgrimage to the Merlion (mermaid lion). I took a long walk along the river to arrive; remember it's usually very hot and humid, so bring your water. It is definitely crowded with tourists, but it is, after all, the symbol of the city, and worth a visit for sure. It has good views of other parts of the city, too.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views and photo opportunities at one spot
REVIEW_BODY: Capture the Singapore waterfront skyline from this spot - the Merlion, the Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands. Plan your onward journey from this spot: where will you be heading to next: the National Gallery, the Gardens by the Bay, the malls at Marina Square, a concert at the Esplanade...?

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't go home without a picture here.
REVIEW_BODY: Better to go here early morning to catch the sunrise and only few people at this hour. Other attractions are near in this area like the Helix bridge, marina bay sands and the gardens by the bay.
Nice area. But very crowded. You must go there night. And you must watch laser show. Awesome show. Nice.
An awesome creation worth a quick stop. The park was packed on the Sunday I visited. It’s a beautiful structure.
You can't come to Singapore without having you photo taken with the Merlion. Very clean and well maintained, and some great photo opportunities. Make sure you visit by day and at night.
Always nice to come back to the Singapore Lion, which has changed place since I first visited Singapore. An icon in Singapore!

Singapore has the word Singa which means lion. So, one feels it's a must to visit the Merlion Park and take selfies or pictures. Many films feature a scene at this area and taking a picture with the Merlion as the background is kind of a ritual when visiting Singapore. Explore also the areas surrounding the Merlion Park or the Central Business District.

This is one of those things that you must see but is not as impressive as it seems. Don't get me wrong it is a great sight and well worth visiting as is a famous part of the Singapore Bay area but as far as parks go, it is not something to jump at. The great part about this venue is that you can get a fantastic view across the harbour back to the Marina Bay Sands area which is a great view.
Worth the visit but don't expect a traditional park in the sense of open space and greenery. Just my opinion.
This is a wonderful place to watch the sunset over the bay. it does get a little crowed and understandably it comes clear why when you start to take the views of the Sun going down.

This is a popular tourist attraction and is one of the THE landmarks of of this city state. The lights at night are incredible Great place to take photographsOverlooks the marina Bay Sands and Marina Bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: A nice stroll by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion statue sits in this park and it's the selfie Mecca for many. The Merlion is Singapores lucky mascot and it's a nice statue in a lovely location by the bay near the financial district. It's very popular so if you want to get that selfie you will need to be patient.

The place is always crowded and so if you wanna do photography you need to be very patient with people. There is a boat ride next to eat which is quiet good as it takes you to the river which passes by the old city.

REVIEW_TITLE: The official 'mascot' of Singapore not to be missed
REVIEW_BODY: You've seen the pictures, if you spent even one day only in Singapore. It is the lion head on a fish body, or a mermaid's tail, to make it sound more romantic. Just kidding;) It's very close to the Raffles City MRT station. Right next to the Esplanade bridge on the Fullerton promenade. You will walk by, I'm sure, and see it, maybe even take a selfie next to it, as pretty much 99.99% of all passing by tourists do, including myself... 5 minutes is enough here before you get tired of the masses and swinging selfie sticks. Watch out!!!
Timing may be everything as the fountain when busy is so crowded it detracts from the history of the monument. Early morning better.
This is the last place I visit in Singapore. The view from here is amazing. Unfortunately the merlion was not working due to maintenance.

The Merlion Park is a staple tourist attraction and you should include it on your itenerary. The famous Merlion Park lived to my expectation and it is impressive how they managed to maintain the orderliness and clealiness of it. Not to mention that it's very accessible via MRT Raffles station.

This is a popular spot to get the iconic "funny" photo with the Merlion as well as the combo with Marina Bay Sands. The Merlion, half fish and lion is iconic in Singapore. Nearby the statue is a smaller version known as the Merlion cub.

It is definitely worth visiting at least once, but be prepared to fight with other tourists who all want to get the best shot. It is ideally located and near the Fullerton Hotel and provides some amazing views of the Bay. The nearest MRT is Raffles Place Interchange which is a 8-10 minute walk from the park.
Merlion is the icon of singapore so this is the landmark place of singapore! At night it gets really crowded but personally it is more beautiful at night because of the illumination.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit but don't go out of your way
REVIEW_BODY: Well worth visiting to see the Lion spraying water (Singapore is the Lion City after all) but I wouldn't necessarily go out of your way to visit. It's always very busy, day or night, so you need to be patient to get your photo(s)

REVIEW_TITLE: awesome place at marina bay merlion
REVIEW_BODY: very nice place neet and clean. if you what to go to this place by MRT getoff at ESPLANADE, take exit and it will be walking distance.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must Take a Selfie for Tourists
REVIEW_BODY: Review by Dr Sim. The Merlion is just a statue but recognised around the world. It is a must for Tourists to take a selfie. Take a ten minute stop to take a photo to show that you are in Singapore. Regards Dr Sim

Merlion park is one of the landmarks on must visits list in Singapore. It's symbol of lion with fish body just on the harbour facing marina bay and Singapore flyer. Just adjacent to it is the jetty where we can buy tickets and board boats for river tour of Singapore bay. At evening it's very pleasant here with amazing views of the Singapore skyline and bay in front. Best way to reach it is via esplanade mrt as it's just walking distance from there . It's nice to sit at evening with good breeze and sit for some time with beautifully Singapore skyline views lightening up in the evenings. Also just near by lots of high end and stylish harbour front restaurants near by if that is your area of interest.
Definitely come here to take photos of the iconic Marina Bay Sands hotels. It's refreshing to feel some of the mist from Merlion Fountain!

I took the MRT to Raffles Place station and then walked along the river past the Fullerton Hotel. I then crossed a busy road at the lights and walked straight ahead and found myself in Merlion Park.

It was very crowded, but had a nice, friendly atmosphere. A young couple was having their wedding photos taken and lots of people were cheering and congratulating them. There were also quite a few tour groups.

It was very hot but there were a few places to buy drinks and food if required. As there's not much shade I recommend that you wear a hat or take an umbrella.

After having a look at the Merlion I continued my walk around the river to Promenade MRT station where I took a train back to my hotel.

The view from Merlion Park is amazing and next time I'll go at night to get a different perspective. Definitely a 'must see'.
Not only is this one of the most recognisable landmarks - but iTs in a very nice area with lots of other interesting places and parks to see. Perfect area to people watch!

Well, it is a pretty new and small statue of a lion and fish spitting water from its mouth. it is supposed to represent the symbol of Singapore but the city is much more beautiful than this. To be frank... it doesn't worth the visiti and if u are in town only for a short transit, you can skip it.

I've always thought about how the merlion looks like in person and I wasn't disappointed when I saw it right before my naked eye. It is not that special but hey did you ever go to Singapore without your photo being taken here?

Strike that merlion pose!
Great spot and view of the water. Great place to wander around for hours. Good at night time or early evening.

The Merlion is recognized by Singapore Tourism as a well known marketing icon, as a mascot and national personification of Singapore. In the statue of Merlion at Merlion Park it is depicted as mythological structure having a head of Lion and body of the fish. It is most similar to heraldic Sea Lion. The original Merlion statue was installed at Merlion Park during Year 1972. The statue is about 8.6 metre tall at Merlion Park, The water fountain flow from the mouth of statue continuously. This is must visit location while in Singapore, as it is considered a icon of Singapore.

We took our time going the park and the gardens and taking photos there are a lot of attractions within the Merlion Park and its a must see visit when you come to Singapore.

Take a bottle of water with you as you will be doing alot of walking
It's was great night before leaving Singapore.one point you can see all the extremely beautiful architectural beauty of Singapore. Night with the lights make the place more beautiful.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for a walk or run
REVIEW_BODY: Well designed for a stroll or run. Many couples and families out enjoying the park. You could spend 30 minutes or a few hours if you explored the entire area.

REVIEW_TITLE: Popular landmark of Singapore must visit
REVIEW_BODY: if you are tourist in Singapore don't mis to visit this one of the popular landmark of Singapore, this place is accessible in transportation from airport, you can use the MRT they have, and this place when i stop over in Singapore i always visit this...

Clean. Crowded. Family friendly. Just like much of Singapore, the park is an attraction and public space folded into one. It seems to attract locals as much as it does tourists, though the area surrounding the park is packed with expensive hotels, restaurants, and a highway.

Would not recommend walking over to the Marina Bay from here: too far.
just a small park with a fountain. Hard to find 100 words to describe it ;) But it is a symbol of Sg so it is a must have

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice walk from Marina Bay Sands
REVIEW_BODY: Takes about 30 mins to leisurely stroll here from the Marina Bay Sands Hotel around the edge of the bay - when I did it there was dragon boat racing going on to enjoy too. The Merlion wasn't as big as I thought once I got there though.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great to visit but disappointed with some tourist behaviour
REVIEW_BODY: Packed with tourist day and night, especially tour groups only care about them self, but this is a must see if visiting Singapore.

Lovely to walk round the bay. Take in the views and stop by the merlion for a picture. There are bay tours too. Lots of nice places for lunch or a drink. You can easily walk round the bay and across some impressive bridges for more views.

A cool big Merlion and an adorable baby Merlion rest against an impressive backdrop, with Marina Bay Sands across the bay and the financial district not far away. Sure, you won't spend a ton of time here, but it's free and beautiful and -- at least in my opinion -- the Merlion is a fantastic city mascot.

This park is fun - great people watching, crowded with people from all over the world, taking selfies and family pictures. You have to be in a zen space if this sort of thing bothers you. But it's worth it. The views of Marina Bay Sands and downtown are amazing. I stopped by here in late afternoon and then in the dark and it's beautiful at both times. The Merlion itself is a neat story/legend. Definitely not to be missed.
Despite the Merlion is famous as the icon of Singapore, there isn't much to expect from a statue. Only worth taking a photo, as you need to force yourself through large groups of China tourists.

I hopped of a river boat to take a closer look at this Singapore icon. It is almost compulsory, as it is featured on almost every item of tourist paraphernalia in the city. It is nice enough, but viewing it from afar is probably sufficient.

While in this neighborhood, stroll across to the classic Fullerton Hotel, and enjoy a coffee in the ambiance of yesteryear in the lobby.

REVIEW_TITLE: Everyone goes here, but its boring.
REVIEW_BODY: Its got a great view of the bay and downtown, but a sculpture spitting out water is a bit boring. nonetheless, go see, you won't feel you have been here otherwise.

The place is very small and really just the Merlion statue there worth seeing. It's right at the Marina Bay so it is worth a visit when you are already in that area. Nice views all around to the Sands building, downtown financial core of buildings and the beautiful bay.

It was a good place to hangout, taking photograps especially during late evening and sunset till night. Many shops and cafes around if you want to avoid crowds at the pier. You can take boat tour from here to see Singapore from its river

Located just east of the Fullerton Hotel is this iconic Singapore landmark that is a must-see for all visitors. When you first cross the Esplanade Drive road and go down the stairs to get to the concrete park, you will be greeted by the Merlion fountain (first photo in this profile).

When I went on a cloudy, rainy day I first saw this fountain and small Merlion and I said, "That's it?! It's so small!" Surprise. Hidden by the tree branches and the gloomy weather was the BIG one - the real one. OK, that's more like it.

The big one is really large, and definitely worth visiting and taking pictures of. Depending on where you stand you can take photos with the Marina Bay Sands in the background or with the Fullerton Hotel in the background.

The closest MRT station is Raffles Place (both EW and NS lines); walking distance.

REVIEW_TITLE: Do Not Miss the Smaller One
REVIEW_BODY: First thing first. I checked the Merlion. Do not forget to check the smaller one behind the larger and famous one. Actually there are five official Merlions in Singapore recognized by the Singapore Tourism Board, who owns the copyright of the Merlion. You can find two of them here.

The Merlion, a cross between a lion and a fish. Quite symbolic of Singapore. This giant sculpture shoots a water jet from its mouth into Marina Bay. Very popular with tourists especially those with a bent to form poses in front of the pouring spout. Similar to the leaning tower. It is fun to watch them. Very popular and once done you can take in the Esplanade walk and other tourist vantage points.
It's very clean and there are lots of spots for tourists... though I was disappointed it didn't light up at night- unlike the one at sentona which did and looked amazing!

We know that this is the most iconic landmark in Singapore.

So as it's name this is of course the most must visit place in singapore, if at least for the first time. Though this place is only sight viewing and taking picture, there's is a boat you can pay to have a tour nearby but i didn't try that.

As the most popular place in Singapore, i can say this place is always full of tourist.

But, i can give you tips, that is, you better to visit this at sunrise. Beside there is only few almost no one at this hour, this is also the best place to have a sunrise view at singapore. Most iconic landmark + sunrise = is just stunning

The Singapore Merlion is the national personification of Singapore. So it is basically a must go see... but... I advise not to go during the day... too hot... and way too many tourists... at night everything is beautifully lit and no tourists... best time between 11pm and midnight...

Well worth a visit even if just for the views and photographs. The views of the corporate buildings in the background make for a nice photo at night. A lot of people were attempting the 'water into my mouth' pose which was fairly entertaining in itself.

If you continue walking over the bridge you end up at the Escalade where at the weekends there are free music shows. There are also bars and restaurants there.

There are also seafront restaurants/bars along the park area (behind the Merlion statue) with great views of the Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer.
From this spot, you can see a brilliant view of the city with a lot of great buildings including Marina bay sands hotel.

This was one place I wanted to go and when I first went the actual Merlion was 'closed' for cleaning but was reopening about a week later. The rest of the area was fine however and a great place to meet people from all around the world. There was free entertainment and plenty of spots for good views. When I returned about a week later the Merlion was open and it really seemed to add an even better atmosphere to the area. One person I spoke to actually said it was 'magical' in what it added and I thought that was a good summary.

A must see when in Singapore. A popular tourist destination where you can take a picture. Its also near to other tourist destination such as Gardens by the bay, Makansutra Glutton, DNA helix bridge, Botanic Garden, Marina Bay etc :) Accesible to all types of transportation. Just be ready with your comfortable footwear because you will do a lot of walking :)

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing Place and Awesome Food Nearby
REVIEW_BODY: Went With Expecting best and found that. Place is incredibly amazing bit busy and crowded but seems vey magnetic with attractions. .liked it and suggest to all friends

It's more than a statue of a lion, it's the symbol of Singapore. Half lion, half fish, 100% Singapore. The surrounding sights are pretty nice at night and you really get your first feel that you're in Singapore when you walk around the park at night. Seeing all of the lights, performances, and locals/tourists alike just taking photos and taking an evening stroll. When you vacation, this is the sort of mood that you want to be in. In the presence of just taking your time to absorb the atmosphere and the smell of food with the lights of skyscrapers and the sounds of people genuinely having a good time.

A business hub. well maintained area. the best place to visit the green and very clean city of Singapore. very well organized city and places. safe place for tourist. taxi drivers are very friendly. a lot of easy transport facility to move around. excellent place.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Famous Merlion - Still a Sight to See
REVIEW_BODY: Nothing says Singapore like the Merlion statue. I was delighted to find it still spewing water and in very well maintained. It is a must see when in Singapore. Pair the visit with a walk around the bay to take in the great skyline.

I would come here in the morning to run around the esplanade and incidentally get here at the Merlin. At night, this landmark makes for a signature Singapore photo-op because of the lights on and around the Marina Bay Sands. Worth a stroll. But if you want to avoid the tourists and to enjoy the landscape in peace, come here in the morning!
This is the place to take a picture because it is a symbol of Singapore country. It is very popular for tourist that why many people there. Please try your best to take selfies for nice photo.
Lovely stroll around Marina Bay and visit to Merlion, half fish/half lion famous statue. Very nicely laid out walkways to take in the Marina Bay area.

After I visit Asian Civilization Museum, I see that the park was near the museum, so I decide to walk across the road to see and take the picture of the Merlion (I will post the picture of the place I visit later) and walk around the place a bit before heading back.

You have not visit Singapore if you have not visit Merlion Park and take the picture in the Merlion Statue. This is very popular place. You can going here by bus, taxi, MRT or other transportation. By MRT you can turn down in Raflles interchange then walking. You can take a picture with some phoses mainstream either non mainstream. You can take picture as like drink from the water that come out from the merlion. Here, you can enjoy to walk and also sitting and enjoy eating because so many bar and restourant here with view singapore river and Marina bay sands.
This park has some of the best views in Singapore. It was a pretty busy place. Lots of tourist and locals just enjoying the area. Nice place to walk around.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see but very crowded
REVIEW_BODY: It's nice to see this Singapore icon, but so crowded and people taking photos everywhere. Interesting to see once as you walk past.

This place was particularly busy the day I went, because it was a weekend. Lots of locals coming up to take pictures with the Merlion. It's an icon. It has lovely views out to Marina Bay Sands and the like, and shops nearby.
Tourists love this place..just outside Fullerton Hotel overlooking the bay..had a nice evening walk n lots of photos!
Should come to this place to complete your visit to singapore . If you like walking and see nice view you can exit from clark quake station then just walk along the river to merlion

The place where we should go when you go to Singapore. It is always crowded with people. Good for taking picture, relaxing, and walking around. you will see the baby merlion behind the big one. very cute.

The Merlion is very cute and an icon of Singapore, but I haven't seen such pushy and deep crowds since I was at the Mona Lisa in the Louvre! There is a good view across all of Marina Bay and over towards the Esplanade theatres as well.

Merlion Park is centrally-located; you find yourself passing it again & again during your wanders. I crossed the bridge, took some good photos, and then spotted & took a river cruise, too - just because I was passing through the park!

I came on a short free tour while on a stop over in Singapore. This is the one thing I think of since a child when I think of Singapore and I was so much better up close and in person. Very nice spot in city down on the water but is a very busy spot with tourists.
Worth to visit after visiting other attractions.. The weather was not cooperative though but it's worth it..
No visit to singapore is complete without a visit to the merlion park. It was extra special to go there after the F1 GP, with all the lights and bustling activity!

REVIEW_TITLE: Light show and lots of walking
REVIEW_BODY:
It's on the sentosa island. There is a 10 minutes light show in evening which is great.
The merlion statue is huge and there is ample area of relaxed walking.
It is a great cool natural oasis in the hustle bustle of the city.
Perfect relaxing destination.
Actually its a little bit hard to catch a private picture when you capture a selfie ehhe. There so many of people that come in, so be patient its gonna be the evidence when you are in Singapore :)

A tour in Singapore without seeing the Merlion, this is my favorite spot in Singapore, cause it made me feel and say I've finally been there. Nothing really special about it but it really has an appeal to me. I would like to visit it again.

Calling this a park is misleading. It's basically a fifteen foot tall statue outside a swanky shopping area.

The lion wasn't spitting water when I was there.

The view is nice, but no better than dozens of other places along the waterfront.

All in all, I was annoyed that I made the long walk here, as Singapore cabs are useless and all.
This is a must if this is your first visit to Singapore. Not only for the statue but also for the view! You are able to take the very nice River Cruise from here, S$25 p.pers, 40min.

REVIEW_TITLE: What a fun place to be and a must visit
REVIEW_BODY: Seeing those attractions in real life versus just in pictures was amazing. Traveled by myself on business with a free weekend and felt safe the entire time. Lots of places to sit, eat, walk.

Easy to access by metro, you also catch the skyline of Singapore and Marina Bay Sands. Great photo opportunities and nice for a relaxed walk. It can get hot in the Singapore outdoors so stay hydrated!

Easily reached by MRT, stopping at Raffles MRT Station, walk to the park about +/- 500 metres. Do not miss to enjoy your time here for sightseeing and taking photographs with the Merlion Statue and Marina Bay Sands Hotel as the main background

Singapore has many beautiful sights and the best place to see the fantastic skyline is from Merlion Park. The Merlion is the icon that represents Singapore; it has to be seen close-up as it rises from the water overseeing the vast bay and the fantastic architecture of the surrounding buildings.

Typical tourist thing to do, I walked round that side of the bay and came across it, so busy I couldn't even take a proper picture there but it was ok. Stand further away either side and you stand more chance of taking the cheesy picture and then keep walking over the helix bridge to the marina bay sands and the promenade and that's much better.

REVIEW_TITLE: A fun place to visit on the river to take photos
REVIEW_BODY: This is the iconic Singapore tourist place. Try and line up the water in the mouth photo of course. On the river, tour boats available, easy walking bridge and esplanade with restaurants. Off course go
It's just a must visit in Singapore. A very beautiful statue at the waterfront and in front of the skyline. You can take nice pictures there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice but can be very crowded
REVIEW_BODY: My favorite spot next to Marina Bay. Can be really overrun by tourists so I'd suggest visiting early in the morning. There is a couple of good restaurants nearby and a food stall near the Esplanade.
walking along the river on a beautiful day. Amazing city view. However I do not accept a small bottle of Tiger beer costing SG 16.5 at a riverside joint. Rip off.
Has lots of fun activities mostly for children. Families and children bustling. Many food courts, movies, aquarium. Getting there by cable car is big attraction.

REVIEW_TITLE: Grab your camera and join the crowd
REVIEW_BODY:
How amazing that a concrete lion that was never intended to be anything more than a statue of national symbolism has come to be so representative of the city. And of course infamy was never created without popular support. People have voted with their feet and more importantly, with their cameras.

A trip to Singapore would be complete without a selfie here. But a warning to the wise. You will not be alone.

Don't expect any fanfare and "Wow" moment. Expect to see a lion. A concrete lion. That spouts water.

And enjoy the moment for a few seconds.

This is a busy spot filled with travellers photographing the iconic Merlion, but it's also a great place to view the architecturally unique Marina Bay Sands Complex. I did a round trip to Clarke Quay on a bumboat from here. Definitely a must see !

A Picture is must with the Merlion behind you in different poses when you visit Singapore. When I visited it was pretty crowded. Loads of tourists ...

One need not spend a lot of time here. its easily reachable from the major touristy areas just a quick visit for a couple of good photographs and then move on for the next attraction !!!
This is certainly a must visit place.. Good to take pictures.. A part of the marina bay walk.. must visit in day as well as evening for different experience..

I accompanied other tourists and our tour guide to the Merlion Park where we had a brief photo session. I took photos of the giant white Merlion and bought a sourvenior of the Merlion in the tour bus. I love the song playing in the sourvenior which captures the spirit and beauty of Singapore city.

Excellent place to visit especially at early morning, when there is just few photographers and early bird tourists.

I really recommend to visit before sunrise and stay there until sun is up. Best time is arrive there around 6.30, as sun will rise around 7 am --> and stay until the Merlion starts to "spit" water :D

It is even more beautiful than any photos can describe! And you just have to see it by yourself :) it is worth of traveling from little further, I traveled all they way from East Region of Singapore - took approximately 50min.

Nearest MRT station is Raffles Place, however it can be hard to find your way if you are first time in Singapore, so I recommend to check from map beforehand, and maybe upload offline map :)

--> anyhow, Singaporeans are willing to help, so just ask from anyone if you can't find your way.

©Katri --> for the photo

Location is excellent..nice time can be spend over merlion park..food court available also anyone can enjoy boating on the fresh drinking water..This park is neat and clean, absolutely free from dust.
Singapore visit is not complete with the visit to the location ,one can have boat ride from the place .
The Merlion is certainly smaller than I thought it would be. It's a must see though and to be honest a nice walk around Marina Bay to see tge Merlion.

You'll find a lot of tourist here taking pictures and sitting next to the Merlion. It is a good place to take a rest and enjoying the view. You can smell the sea and feel the wind with a clear water in front of you. Get yourself ready to take unique pose with the Merlion.

I had to be patient before taking my selfies here! There are many tourists wanting to have their pictures taken in front of this attraction. Note that there are 3 statues, the biggest and most photographed is the one spewing water!

It is situated at the heart of The Central Business District. There are many cafes, pubs and eateries along the stretch of the board walk. It is easily accessible by MRT train. I suggest that you get "lost" exploring The Central Business District where tall buildings of famous banks stands. There are many Hawker centres around the CBD too. Hawker Centres are places where you can get local food and many other famous cuisines at affordable prices. The nearest one would be Market Street Food Centre. It is located across the street. You can get across by the connecting bridge to change alley where you get the best exchange rates. Fullerton Hotel is also nearby. I highly recommend you to go and try out the local fare for a song! There is this Singapore culture where one would reserve a place to seat by placing a piece of name card if a pack of tissue paper! You should experience it during the lunch crowd period between 11.30am to about 2pm. Happy discovering!

I had to see the Merlion. I've seen pictures of it but never in person...soooo, walked from Orchard Street where I was staying and made it to the waterfront...and all of a sudden, there it was...The Merlion....tall, white and spraying water. Pretty cool...well worth the hike.

If the Big Ben Tower (Elizabeth II Tower) is to London, MERLION is to Singapore. This Park is ideal for picture taking , walking, jogging and biking.

You may also walk to various malls and other attractions nearby.

Note: There are several Merlions in Singapore, one is in Sentosa - so take your pick.
Cute lion thingy. Nice bridges, walkways, views. Lot of food and bev places nearby. Lots of space to sit down, relax, and take in the view. Tickets for boat cruise nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit when you're in spore
REVIEW_BODY: One of landmark in spore, near esplanade & easily reach by bus/mrt. Clean & free of entrance. Nice place to get photos of light show from marina bay (show start on 8pm).
Its just another hyped Landmark to get picture clicked . Yippeee I visited Singapore but apart from that nothing to be amazed

The good news? It's free and easy to find (right next to One Fullerton). Additionally, it's got a great view of the bay. It's a pretty symbolic statue here and there is a neat dock that goes into the water so that you can try and get a good picture. It was kind of funny to watch people get pictures of the Merlion filling their water bottle, etc.

I find this is just an ordinary sculpture. Whats important is the legend behind it and not the sculpture itself. The sculpture is not made of marble but cement, painted in white emulsion. It is still worth the visit because of the marina bay backdrop.

From herbal stores to restaurants Chinatown is alway happening. Trending seems to be Crab Hot Pots and Dim Sum. Didnt have much luck finding Duck dishes = ( which i enjoy. The herbal stores always are a trip. Shark fin, bird's nest, dried seahorses & sea slugs.
Nice relocation of the Merlion, with platform for visitors extending over the river. Lets you get close now vs. the old days.
A great location looking out over the water. This location gets very busy even relatively early especially on the weekend. Great to wander around the water and stop by the Merlion.
A small area on the water front with 3 statues of the Merlions (lion heads and fish bodies), good or taking photo's but not much else there.

MerLion (half mermaid half Lion) is the mascot for the city of Singapore whose name is derived from Sanskrit for Lion (Singha) City (Pura).
The area is well kept and you can find it very neat and clean despite it being very crowded.
The lighting all around the waterfront makes the ambience very soothing. You can walk around here and dine at one of the many outlets which offer a wide range of options for food and drinks.
Didn't expect it to be this big. One of the things that you should see in Singapore, nice restaurants around. Make a day of it. So much to do in the area.
Had the chance to discover more about the history of Singapore and the story behind the Merlion. Very nice area to walk around and several attractions within walking distance.
Merlion Park is a must see while in the Lion City. The Merlion is the main attraction here. Its nice but I will say there is a far more impressive Merlion on Sentosa Island.
The iconic statue of Singapore. So crowded even when in the weekday morning. Near with Marina Bay Sands and Fullerton Hotel. Just for photostop.

REVIEW_TITLE: A place to be at in the morning & evening
REVIEW_BODY: I was there for my morning walk after coming back to Singapore from vacation. Bright sunny day as usual with lots of tourists. A place that I bring my overseas visitors to in the early evening to see the Merlion and MBS, follow by drinks and dinner along One Fullerton or Fullerton Bay Hotel.

This waterfront is an ideal place for pictures, either of the Symbol of Singapore - the lion, either of the incredible skyline. Both river and the marina at once are greatly reachable from this very well placed spot to people that has not much time to stay in Singapore. Easy to reach with the train from the airport (Raffles Place station). Shopping and restaurants well represented.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Merlion, Esplanade and Marina Bay Sands in one place
REVIEW_BODY:
The view is a wonder. You can view the esplanade, the marina bay sands and the central business district in one place. However, the place is very popular for tourists. Even on weekdays, the park is too crowded. It would be difficult to have a solo shot because everyone wants to take a picture.
It is better to go there at night. The hawker stalls open, you can try the chilli crabs and other local foods at cheaper prices. At 9pm, the marina bay sands light show starts. You can watch it at the jubilee bridge or at the viewing deck of the esplanade. It is also less crowded and better for photo opps.
It is the orginal merlion in Singapore, so you must go there. There are many tourist, but you don't stay there for long.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful backdrop- Go early before the crowd
REVIEW_BODY:
First visit to SIN, and my first stop was at 8am. Amazing backdrop since it is across from the Marina Bay Hotel and the Science Museum also close to many different restaurants and other scenic views. Lovely spot to watch the night show across the water.
*** BY 9am the place is crowded with tourist groups, by the statue grab your pics quickly and go.
I came to SG many years ago when the Merlion status was not surrounded by beautiful waterfront parks like it is today. This is amazing transformation!

A really nice setting, especially in the evenings when you have a panoramic view of Singapore's nighttime glitter. Lots of good restaurants and cocktail lounges nearby. The Merlion sculpture is fun to see as well. Accessible to several other attractions and close to the MRT (subway).

Top tourist spot, not only for the Merlion but also as across the bay is the Marina Bay Sands. Top spot to take some great tourist photos of everything, including the city skyscrapers in the background

REVIEW_TITLE: View of the bayfront and the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: The promenade along the marina bay waterfront offers unhindered sweeping view of the Marina Bay Sands, Flyer, Arts Science Museum and other skyscrapers.the statue of merlion is the face of Singapore and a selfie zone.Its always crowded with scores of tourists, locals. Esplanade Bridge leads from the Theatres on the Bay and can be reached by the boat also. The Laser Show in the evening is a must watch.
Visiting the Merlion, a must for Singapore, you should pay attention to small Merlion as well. Cute and loved by kids :)

This is an amazing place to relax. Suggest to visit in the evening to avoid the burning sun.

Closest MRT is Raffles place and from there it is within walking distance. Got some great food and juice outlets and the view from the park is mind blowing.

MUST VISIT.
You can choose either MRT or the Cable car to visit this place. From harbour front station, you can choose them. You can climb up to the Merlion Statue if you get a ticket.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice views and very historic place.
REVIEW_BODY: Been there many times on my travels to Singapore. the site has a lot of history and the merlion is very symbolic to the Singaporean's.
When walking around the quay you cannot miss the Lion by the Fullerton hotel the old post office and the bridge at the same time do the canal trip and a great historical talk will quite informative

REVIEW_TITLE: You can't miss the Singapore landmark!
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion park is the most emblematic Singapore land mark. The bay landscape is amazing...you can see in scene the teather, the Merlion and the Marina Sand Bay hotel..the sun set pictures are unforgettable memory.

When people speak of Singapore, the Merlion statue comes to mind. Indeed, the park is a great place to be at night, full of visitors. Can't leave Singapore without taking a picture with the lion!

P.S There is a small lion statue in the park as well :)

REVIEW_TITLE: Good Place, fresh air whole day
REVIEW_BODY: walking from city hall to Merlion Park, accross River. many old building in the side and many tall building in another side. we can walk and sport and see beautiful surrounding there

REVIEW_TITLE: The Merlion lends it's history to Singapore - the Lion City.
REVIEW_BODY:
First time I have seen the Merlion - enjoyed a river cruise that passed by the Merlion in Marina Bay - there were many tourists taking photo opportunities around the park.

Took a few shots from the water - worth a look from the land or water when you are in Singapore.

Specially Ordinary place. Not special, but icon of this country is here. If you planning to come here, you should prepare any hat, or umbrella because it's a hot place to visit.

I recommend you to come here on evening, to avoid your blooming skin because of sun.

Visit with child on afternoon is not recommended.
Good to see in the night.. as the symbol of SG, it is a must see place.. the place is flooded with tourists due it's popularity..

REVIEW_TITLE: Popular Place for Photos of the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY:
This is one of the popular place for tourists to have photos of the Merlion statue in Singapore.

The place is usually crowded with tourists taking photos. Just be aware that this place is not sheltered. So you will have to bear with the natural elements (hot weather and humidity) when you're there during the day time.

This Merlion has water fountain coming out of it's mouth! A highlight of the area in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit spot in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: A statue that symbolise for the city, hence you should visit the place to have some snap shots that can leave in your memories. You can find SMRT which my cost less than 2 SGD or you may find taxi that may not cost more that 22 SGD at Max if you stay longer.

A great place to visit and take pictures. Better at night in my opinion. Lots of great restaurants in the area. Great for people watching. No visit to Singapore is complete without a visit and pictures here!
Merlion is symbol of Singapore . One of the best place to visit in Singapore . Place is so awesome !!!!!

it is twice i came to see the merlion statue on the merlion park. it was the 1st time when i came here with my ngee yan politechnic on 2004 then i came second just now september 2016.

the tourists is still coming to take a photo here. the merlion statue is the main object. i came here from batam. i took the ferry from batam center to harbour front singapore the i continued to take MRT twice.

it took not more than 45 minutes from the harbour front ferry terminal to the merlion if you know well the route. just see the map of the MRT route to stop on the raffles then take a walk to merlion park accross the station
Worth a stop but not much to see. This is the symbol of the city. Odd area but there are a few eateries and nice view. Again this is nothing amazing but worth a visit
when you visit singapore you must go there for its historic importance. you have a nice view over the river and the sculpture is great for picture taking, for the rest it is not much

Do make the effort to go and see the Merlion, it's in a great location for a photo-shoot, that's if you can find a free space to take a photo ... needless to say it gets insanely busy here. Nice little gift shop nearby too.
A walk that makes you sense glory of Singapore with their signature Merlion, a hybrid of fish and lion marking rule on sea and land.

So sad that I wasn't able to have the iconic pose for this landmark (drinking water from the merlion) because it is under maintenance during my 4days of stay in Singapore.
But this is where you can have the best view of Marina Bay Sands and the awesome Singapore City Skyline.
There are some nearby establishment.

REVIEW_TITLE: Just sightseeing, take picture in outside and then go
REVIEW_BODY: Location : Merlion Park Entry Fee : Free by walking Recommended time : Anytime, expect wet season Condition : Amazing

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to take a photograph with a iconic statue
REVIEW_BODY: I like the whole place. I always feed good to take aphotigraph with a iconic statue. but nothing excited here.
Very crowded with Chinese tourists trying to take selfies. It is the symbol of Singapore and a nice venue to kill a few hours. Close to the Flyer and Marina Bay Sands.
Personally I can't see the attraction. Sculpture itself is impressive but beware hoards of coach parties wielding the "selfish stick"!

As Merlion Park is one of the imagine of Singapore, you can easily access here by cross the bridge from Esplanade theater. It's always full of people surrounded and taking photos so the best time to come here is at night. After 9PM there will be less people and you can take as many photos as you wish without cameos. Enjoy the wind and look at the light show on the bay is also a plus.

Merlion in Sentosa Island is nicer for picture taking (you can also go inside it!). The area around the Merlion park is bleak, especially on weekends. Although there is a pretty nice cake shop (Lady M) and a Starbucks just around the corner.

Photo geeks should note that the Merlion's best side is his left side. Also, with better equipment, you can get a pretty fancy shot of Marina Bay Sands from there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Under Renovation Means A Unique Photography Opportunity
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is currently undergoing maintenance. That means it is a unique photography opportunity to see the statue from another perspective.
just a park in the city, nicely done and well maintained, ideal to have your morning coffee break discussion
This is one of the best place to move around. You can't miss the beauty of Merlion while in Singapore. Don't forget to bring your camera.

Been here for about 5yrs back and its always facinating! This month when i visited its just simply awesome!! As Marina Bay Sands added to its unique landscape as well as the newly built linking bridge to esplane. It continued to amazed tourists! Going to singapore dont you dare missed this iconic park!
The merlion is a must see when your in singapore. This is a free attraction. It is quite busy. Its in a great location, it is located straight across from Marina Bay sands hotel

It's very easy to reach the park. Ride MRT then go down at Raffles Place. Few walks and then you're already there. There were a lot of tourists. At the Merlion Park you have a great view of Marina Bay Sands. It's cool! A must-see!
This is just a photostop , located near other interesting places. Nighttime is better for a lot of spots in Singapur. You get the beautiful Skyline of Singapur all lightened up.

Every time I am in transit in Singapore, I always go to the Merlion Park to enjoy the scenic view of the city. It's better to visit in the late afternoon though because it tends to get very hot in mid afternoon. Facing the Merlion Park is the Marina Sands Bay and Singapore Flyer to the left separated only by the Marina River. I just enjoy the bliss in that area.

Although this park is midway between two SMRT stations it is definitely worth the walk!
The Merlion is a must see! The view across to the Flyer and hotels is quite nice.
There are many places to stop and get a bite to eat or something to drink.
Be sure to wear sunscreen and take a hat or umbrella-the sun is quite powerful.

In SG! Mama's and child's located at Merlion Park near Raffles Place MRT and one in Sentosa. Love being here as i can take silly posed with Merlion Background. Every tourist to SG should check on this

This is a must see and a very good spot for photos especially with the spectacular backgrounds of the Marina Bay Sands and the Eye! Because of this it's always crowded but then its all worth it and your visit to Singapore can never be complete without a pic of yourself with the Merlion spouting water into your mouth - that is if you are good enough to capture the scene!
You can't tell people that you have been to Singapore if you didn't see the lion. That said, go at night and bring a tripod for your camera for some amazing photos. You will not regret it.

Merlion Park is located at the Heart of the City. It is one of the icon of the City but except for taking a photo with it, I did not find the place worth anything.

The place always remains very crowded. The food and beverages available there are to much costly. There is one souvenir shop which also sells stuffs at 5 times price.

It's very easily accessible by Public transport. By MRT, you have to take the Green Line (East-West) or Red Line (North-South) and get down at Raffles place. Then take exit H and after coming out, move towards right. You will have the Singapore river left to you. You have to walk straight and after some time you will get Fullerton Hotel. Then you have to cross the main road and you will find Marina Bay Sands from a distnace. After crossing the road, walk towards left and you will encounter Merlion from a Distance after some time(3-4minutes).

To put it bluntly, its a sculpture that spits out water with an awesome backdrop.
Yes its a nice place to observe the bayside district but every selfie loving self indulgent social media junky is there trying to get themselves into perfect self portrait of what i am not sure - its not a tho Singapore has a shortage of Merlion statues.
One and only Merlion or the Goodluck charm for locals is this historic spot. Place is hot and best time would be during low sun.

I visited this attraction with a tour group, there were about 12 of us. We visited a total of 5 tourist attractions & the Merlion Park was the second on the list.The Merlion Park is considered the Landmark of Singapore. According to our tour guide the first two syllables from the word Singapore which is "Singa" means Lion. That's why they consider the Merlion statue as a landmark. The Merlion statue has an open mouth spewing out water from its mouth like a fountain into the lake surrounding it. The statue is facing the water on the lake, and the area is surrounded with many tall buildings . The Marina Bay Sands hotel complex, stands out among the tall buildings & I was able to take a photo with the Merlion statue & the Marina Bay Sands hotel on the background. I will always cherish this souvenir from this place with very nice view all around , an addition to my precious memories.

REVIEW_TITLE: Admittedly touristy but still a must-see part of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The first thing you will see at Merlion Park is the swarms of tourists trying to get a snapshot of the giant merlion spewing water. Once you get past the crowds of people, though, and start to explore the area, you will realize there is so much more to see. On my visit, there was a wind symphony performing nearby as well as several street performers. There are various stores in which to shop or eat. There is always something to do in this area of town, and if you like the backdrop of skyscrapers, you will love the photo opportunities here.

REVIEW_TITLE: That's the second biggest Merlion I've ever seen!
REVIEW_BODY: To get to Merlion Park just take the MRT subway to Raffles Place and it's just a ten minute walk to get there. This area also offers nice views of the harbour area. Definitely worth visiting but it will only take up about 20 to 30 minutes of your day so have some other activities planned!

REVIEW_TITLE: Free Singapore Day Tours for transit passengers
REVIEW_BODY: Our free 2hr Singapore Day Tour visited this pleasant waterside area for a 20minute stop. Good views over the water to the amazing Helix Bridge. Very hot, crowds of people, but air-conditioned inside Starbucks near the bus drop-off point!
who ever visit Singapore must visit this place ,it is place that make your visit a complete one.view of marina bay in the distance make it a memorable one .

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for the quintessential tourist photo
REVIEW_BODY: Although I've visited Singapore several times, this is the first time I made it over the the Merlion Park. It's a fun place to go to get the quintessential tourist photo...the water coming out of the Merlion's mouth going into your mouth. Definitely worth a quick visit ;)

I was on a hop on hop off bus tour when I stopped at the Fullerton Hotel. It was a 5min walk on the exact Picture Location of the Merlion park. It was around 10 in the morning and the sun was scorching hot and the humidity made everything worse.
It was very touristy. So the picture spots were like first come first serve!

I was alone so I had to ask the other tourists to snap a photo of me. ;)

Merlion park is the best place to have a look around the cityscape of Singapore. Easily accessible by metro. There are heaps of people around though. A modern architectural masterpiece, Marina Bay Sands is just in front of the park which gives amazing views at night. Most of all, Singapore is extremely safe at anytime of the day. People roam around at midnight without any trouble.

The merlion is the symbol of Singapore, and, as such, is featured in a prominent display in the Marina Bay area.

The statue itself spews water into the bay, but never fear - the ingenious Singaporeans who built this added a viewing deck off to one side, so you can still take that selfie with the lion in the background. It's a must see, though it's not the only Merlion in Singapore!
I like this place. This place is awesome. Clean, good atmosphere and so many great people. But i don't like when chineese people in grup go to there. They are so noisy and disturbing.

It's a merlion that spits out water. Not sure how else to pretty up the description. It's going to be a zoo at the park with so many tourists taking selfies ... I would advise you taking the DUKW boat tour that will get you a better picture of your own selfie with the statue.

Not so special as expected! The mother Merlion was not big, just water shower from her mouth. But I thought "This is Singapore"! Worth visit. Also the street is good to walk. Nice view, sunny weather(hot though), you can feel early summer!

This is a must visit place when you go to Singapore. In this place you can take magnificent photos of Singapore famous landmark such as Marina Bay Sand, Esplanade Theater (Durian-shape building), or make a creative photograph using the Merlion statue. Just ignore everyone else when you doing your creativity.

REVIEW_TITLE: Observe the rites of the cult of the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: It is an interesting statue/fountain in a nice position by the harbour, but it's still quite bizarre that it gets surrounded by hundreds of tourists gawking at it and snapping away. Perhaps there is some true power in this modern god.
View! View! View! Though this place does not offer anything more than view but it is much go. Food and drinks are pretty bad just near Merlion Park.

Everyone must get there photo taken in front of the Merlion. It is like going to Paris and not getting a photo of the Eiffel Tower, you just don't do it.

And it is not just the photo op you go for, it is the stunning view of so many iconic spots and sights of Singapore. Just be patient getting your photo as every man and his dog (chicken) has the same idea as you do :D

One of my top priorities during my short visit to Singapore was to see the city's iconic statue. Great for photos and located with near the water with Marina Bay in the background. Can be a bit crowded with tourists so may want to avoid peak hours.

This is one place I like to stroll near my office to ease off the stress. No doubt, this place is always filled with tourists. But it's a place where you can immense yourself in the atmosphere, enjoying the moment, which is right next door to the cbd.

Bring a cold drink along and sit under the bridge to cool off and this is another way to enjoy this site!

Perhaos there was a time when this seemed a special place and it may have greater significance to the local people. However its fairly basic and simple memorials in a pretty waterfront location. the pretty waterfront views would exist if Merlion Park was not there.
Don't miss the iconic landmark on your Singapore visit plus a 360 degree view of the bay including Gardens by the Bay, Marina Bay Sands, and more.
We went to the park at night and it was well lit. There was a light show which was quite a treat to see.
the trademark of sg that everyone is longing to see, and nice to see this place, a very good experience to date!

A trip to SG would be incomplete without visiting the popular iconic symbol of Singapore Merlion ,it's the central attraction Venue that attracts thousands of international visitors to enjoy the scenic Maria bay and the the majestic view of skyscrapers and the Luxurious Marina Sands Bay Hotel ,another iconic structure three pillared and boat on top design..The bay has a plesant walkway around it.The water gushing out from the Merlion mouth grasps the attention of the visitors...at day as well as during night hours...I visited Merlion park at the morning hours and at night hours when the colourful lights were lit and city bay glittering..The Merlion park is free open to public and can be easily reached by MRT and bu public SBS bus ..I took bicycle for rent from my hotel to explore the scenic beauty of SG.

This is one of the famous places in Singapore, as you've seen photos many times before. You can walk from the train station. I got off the train at Raffles Place and walked about 5min to there. Food shop and some cafe are in there as well.
Not many things to see, but if you visit Singapore, you can't miss this place.

REVIEW_TITLE: To see the Merlion Park is to have seen Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion is a symbol that represents Singapore - it's a figure of a Lion sitting on the tail of a mermaid.

As to why and the historical background of all these, do visit the Merlion Park and read up on the historical background of Singapura - the Lion City!

Remember to visit the Merlion Park when you come to Singapore!

Happy Vacation at the Lion City!

Merlion is a refreshing site for me considering it blows water from its mouth. Go there by early morning because tourists flock in mid morning till afternoon. It is one of the major attractions in Singapore. You must bring water and umbrella to refresh yourself against heat. I recommend this place for the whole family.

Was having a quick walk around singapore and walk till the MErlion.... wow... it great to see it from near because i always see it from far like through TAXi or on AIR when arrive singapore. Great Expreience

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to sit for a while.
REVIEW_BODY: Using the MRT day pass I was able to get within walking distance to the Merlion Park. It was a hot day, aren't they all in Singapore, but being by the water and having the spray from the fountain blowing around made it a nice place to spend a while sitting on the steps people watching.

Go check out Merlion either day or night. During the day this place offers great views of marina bay/Marina Bay Sands hotel/Singapore flier etc. I like this Merlion more than the Sentosa Merlion as it squirts water, has a baby Merlion and is free to visit. :)

Hard to visit Singapore without going to Merlion. Not the most impressive sight but it iconic and distinctively Singapore. Great location in the waterfront with plenty of other sights within walking distance.

REVIEW_TITLE: It's SO freaking clean, it's unreal...
REVIEW_BODY: Visiting this park is nice because you'll most likely run into a tour. You can listen in to the history of the Merlion - half mermaid, half lion, and what it means to the history of Singapore starting off as a small fishing village. The surrounding buildings and park are so clean. Even the public toilets are clean and modern. The food shops in the food court are a bit pricey, but it's to be expected in this touristy, downtown, popular area. You can get a great view of the casino from here, and the ferris wheel. I was lucky and was able to get great photos without a lot of people in them, even though there were many people walking around. I'm not sure if it was the timing or season or what, but it was great.

I was not planning on visiting the Merlion at all, since it's just a token landmark and actually not a park at all. However, I did want to walk around the harbour from the riverside, over the Helix Bridge and back towards the city. This park is at the start of that route, and has some great views across the harbour towards Marina Bay, day and night. Include it in your itinerary as a place to go past, but not to spend time.
merlion park is "must visit" place if you come to singapore. this is landmark of ths country. you can see nice view surrounding. i love this place
This would be rated higher but for the number of people using selfie sticks.Very difficult to take photographs without sticks appearing in the shot.

It is very much a tourist spot for one photo with the Merlion but after that you have done it. The area around is nice with the Fullerton at the back and fantastic views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel but ultimately once you have seen it, thats it.
located in the marina bay. very iconic SG statue. easy to locate and nice place to take a cool snap.

This is the most photographed place in Singapore I guess and it must visiting. It's a crowded place of course however it is not so difficult to wait for the best picture. I recommend to visit this place in the morning (less people) or evening.
Many people and almost all of them agree, you already visit Singapore when you visit Merlion as Singapore Icon. Nice place with the view of Marina Bay.
Great vantage point for taking pictures of Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Most people don't know it has been there longer than the hotel. It achieved its goal of a tourist icon.
The Merlion is a beautiful monument of a great city. Nice to walk around the area and to enjoy the view. Great place for taking photos.

The Merlion is located on Sentosa Island. It was extremely crowded on the day I went, both day and night. The site itself is extraordinary, but it truly a site to behold at night. The statue and the water lights up in various colors, making for a wonderful culmination of a day well spent at Sentosa. Definitely visit the Merlion when in Singapore.
please go there early morning or after 3 pm cause is quit hot if in afternoon.a lot of people taking picture so better go early

The Merlion may be an iconic symbol for Singapore, but it falls short of expectation once you arrive. If you go, get there before the throngs of selfie picture taking tourists push you out of the way and the sweltering heat of the city swells into a pool of sweat. Visit but don't have huge expectations of grandeur.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good Landmark, Not Much Around It
REVIEW_BODY:
It's a great photo-op for you and/or friends/family. It's the iconic symbol of Singapore which you shouldn't miss it especially if you're a first time visitor.

However, beyond the photo taking there really isn't much to do. During daytime it can get crowded. You don't need to spend too much time here.

Merlion is the earliest landmark of Singapore while Marina Bay Sand is the latest. To get the best view without going to the top of Marina Bay Sands hotel, go Merlion Park and Esplanade. The night view is awesome.
The lights play up very well at this side of the city. There's also a baby merlion at the banks. Place is kept clean and seems safe to roam around. Lots of tourists at night.
It is a really nice view along the river, you can see the financial district and Marina Bay. If you go on a cruise in the evening, you can see the highlighted merlion fountain.

Probably the best known landmark in Singapore. This park is free to enter and a great vantage point to view the stunning Singapore skyline. Everyone takes a photograph by the stunning MerlionYou can hop on a water taxi close by and head up the river to boat quay and Clark quay and enjoy an astonishing selection of multi ethnic restaurants, cafe's and bars.
Any visitor to Singapore must visit Merlion Park to see the iconic merlion and admire the views of downtown, Marina Bay, the Singapore Flyer and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.
Great location for pictures of the Merlion. Another good location is at Sentosa Island but this one can be combined with a walk along the water.

I was slightly disappointed when I saw the Merlion Park from up close. It was much smaller than I thought and the water was not coming out of the Merlion Lion. In addition, the entire area was closed off. Nothing to see.

Great spot to see the Singapore Skyline. Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and you have to see it on your visit. Totally different in day and night, both offers great views. Attraction is free. Watch out for hordes of people who come in busses as part of their city tour.

You can't go to Singapore without seeing the Merlion, the iconic emblem of the country. You can see this statue in the distance as soon as you walk over Helix bridge towards Marina Bay Sands but I would recommend taking the time to walk round to this area 10-15 mins walk) and taking the obligatory magic eye photo trying to catch the water stream in your mouth like the hoards of other tourists!! From there you can easily walk to Fullerton Bay Hotel for a refreshing drink on the balcony which makes a nice pit stop after walking in the sun, enjoy :-)

There are always lots of tourists flocking around this area. They all want to take pictures, mainly selfies and welfies.

The area is very spacious, so the crowds rarely will bother you. The views at MBS and around the bay are beautiful, you can watch the daily night light-suns-water shows from here or board for a river-cruise.
This is the landmark of Singapore, smacked right in the heart of the Singapore Central Business District, the surroundings were great... no wonder the place is so crowded all the time.....
Nice views, I forgot to look after the Merlion. Very touristy, but I guess there is a reason why everyone wants to see it.
Not really a park but rather a part of the waterfront. However, it is an interesting statue-fountain worth seeing and take pictures of.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best views in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park boasts one of the greatest views in Singapore. To the front you have the Marina Bay Sands hotel, and behind you is the grand Singapore skyline. The view at sunset is great. The park itself is fairly small, and it can get crowded, but it's a great place to relax and enjoy the view.
With marina bay sands and the waterfront, it has added value to the Merlion. The crowds are crazy a lot of people, tourist with selfie stick. Come on a day good sunshine to get a nice picture.
This is a magical place, with the Merlion. You can see Marina Bay Sands hotel in the background, and there is a long and beautiful walk way to reach this place. The Raffles Hotel is also nearby.
A scenic place within busy city. One can have a look of different attractive spots by boat from this park. Evening is the best time for visit.

If there is a one place that will definitely reminds or tells you that your are in Singapore is definitely the Merlion Park. This is one of the most visited and famous spot in Singapore that no traveler could miss this and selfie or picture with it is on everybody's bucket list when in Singapore. The place has a good looking view fronting the famous Marina Bay Sands and Singapore river/harbor and on its side are restaurants and hotels. Best Place to visit during the afternoon or at night.
Nothing too special to look at here unless you like the idea of a Merlion with water shooting out of its mouth.

The lion in Merlion Park is a symbol of Singapore or Singapura -'lion city'. If you take a walk around the inner harbour, you will come to the park. A popular place for tourists to take photos. Worth a visit.
This park is a great place to relax in the middle of your day. It is not too crowded, the marina Bay view adds to the atmosphere. It is very clear and wide. Very recommend.
Another area to visit for the Merlion statue and the Panoramic of the Sands park area and skyline. Never a bad sight during sun rise and sunset.
You can't go to Singapore without getting a picture with the merlion but this makes the place extremely busy and you'd be lucky not to have a few unintentional photobombers in your picture

The water-spewing lion-fish freak is arguably Singapore's best known kitschy gimmick. Lions never existed on Singapore, by the way. But love it or loathe it, the Merlion has somehow become a national symbol of sorts, even entering into the local lexicon as a euphemism for vomitting.

A towering replica exists on Sentosa Island.

REVIEW_TITLE: Start your trip at the most famous landmark of the city
REVIEW_BODY:
Your visit to the Land of the Lion is incomplete without having seen the most famous icon of the city - the Merlion. Sure enough, it was the first on my list of things to see when I landed in this country. Easily accessible by public transportation (I cannot stress enough about how easy it was to travel here and how well-connected the buses in Singapore are. You might have to change 2-3 buses depending on where you are staying, but it's worth it. I was blown away!)

You can view the Esplanade, the Flyer, the ArtScience Museum and Marina Bay Sands from here and it is an amazing photo op!
(Tip: try to take a photo of the Merlion Park from the other side, i.e., from either the top of the Singapore Flyer or the roof of Marina Bay Sands. You can look at other humans flitting about like little ants!)

The only downside I can think of is that the place is going to be crowded no matter what time you go. But do not miss this one for anything.

P.S: Just make sure you carry an umbrella or a raincoat with you. The weather here is unpredictable and the unexpected showers drenched us thoroughly. You may not mind it at first, but if you're travelling back to your accommodation in either the airconditioned bus or the Metro?! Prepare to look like a drowned rat and shiver miserably!

As it's namesake - the Merlion Park is undoubtedly a place of abundance - rich with beautiful sights to see and memories to keep!

The park is famous for the Merlion statue but it must likewise be recognized for its striking gardens, well paved walkways and amazing architecture.

Best part is that you can walk for hours without feeling the least bit tired due to the neverending sights to enjoy.

Had a great run from the hotel I was staying at to Marina Bay Sands and the Merlion. At the Merlion I noticed the light show and fountain show that was a great show to watch and had a chill on the steps by the Merlion. A definite must do on your Singapore to do list.
It’s a monument of half lion/half mermaid that spits water into river. Nice to look at for a few minutes but nothing more than that. I have not been impressed with Singapore

The Merlion moved from its location since I last visited it in 2008. A lot has changed, and the new location provides a close up view of the Merlion and the surrounding Marina Bay where you can see the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the opera house.

This area is very crowded. And people seem to love it. It’s a statue of a lion with a fish body and it sprays a lot of water out of its mouth. It’s tough to get a picture because there are so many people. This is a hot spot for selfie sticks. I found it just ok. It looks exactly like all the pictures.
I always travel to Singapore along with Group Leading them but it was my first Visit to Merlin Park this September. Enjoyed it thoroughly with 30 min river Cruise and Scenic walk.
The place is nice. View to Marina Bay Sands is wonderful. Nice fountain but not much more than that. I would come only if I am in the area

Visited the merlion park and we saw the small merlion but the main one is currently under wraps so cannot be seen. The view from the platform is still good as you can see the Marina Bay complex and the main skyline
Just a picture with the merlion head statue and your done with this place. At might a good spot to watch the marina bay sans fountain and lights show

The park itself is nothing special, nor is the Merlion. But it provides one of the best and most iconic photo opportunities in Singapore. You can take pics with the lion, Marina Bay Sands and the skyline in the background.

The Merlion Park is not actually a park, but a statue of the Merlion with a constant jet of water coming out of it's mouth. It offers a good view of the Marina Bay Sands and surrounding Singapore attractions.
A famous destination of Singapore. It's in the Menila Bay and near Manila Bay Sand Hotel. Go to the destination and take a photo with Merlion nơ....

How can you go to Singapore and not get a photo of the Merlion. Best viewed as part of a walk around Marina Bay to take in all the sights of the Singapore skyline. Better still early evening to avoid the heat of the sun and catch the white Merlion against a darkening backdrop.

It's Singapore, so you have to see the Singa a.k.a the Lion. I visit right at noon. It's quite hot but the view is great. There's the big and also small lion statues, with the river/sea and buildings as the background. Not so many people at noon, so the queue to take photo is not that much.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best view on Marina Bay sands
REVIEW_BODY: Come here early morning for run or biking snd make pictures. Almost nobody before 9 am . Can have a coffee with amazing view and sunrise. Evening is great too. Singpore skyline and MBS lights.
The only amazing part of this is the fact you can look across to the marina Bay Sands which is such a impressive building

People are expecting too much from a lion statue that spews water 24/7?

This place symbolizes Singapore. What good about the place is that they have kept it clean and a lot of spaces to walk by and take great pictures.

Visitors should definitely see this place both during the day and at night.
