The Merlion Park offers a good view of the Singapore skyline, Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the Esplanade area. There are a lot of restaurants nearby. This area is best seen in the late afternoon/early evening so that you get a view when there is still sunlight and when the lights all around get turned on. There is also a light show on the Merlion statue itself which is a sight to see.

This is one of Singapore's highlights. Take your time to explore the area and enjoy the sites the sounds and the views from different angles of the park. It gets crowded but well worth the stop. To many photo opportunities to take advantage of. Enjoy.

This place is located at a prime location however you need to know how to reach there...Best time to be there is at the evening when lights are on...it looks really great in the evening with lights...

It had been perhaps 10 years since I had visited this tourist spot, but the development surrounding the Merlion and its forecourt has transformed the area into a real lifestyle precinct. A great spot!
Ideal Park to walk around after an exhausting day at Singapore. Be prepare with the right garment, as showers or high temperature are very often.

What a story: lion or tiger, or big cat...

the merlion and its legend is nice to see and taking a 5mn walk from Raffles city through the underpass is rather convenient : no excuse for not doing it ;)

What YOU want to check is the light and laser show every day at 8pm that goes on in MBS: watching it from Merlion side is really nice

Enjoy!

Well planned by the town planners as the Merlion is part of the river walk which connects you to also the Fullerton Hotel/Gallery and with plenty of scenery for breathtaking photos. Can talk endless but be there to enjoy.....
This is my 3rd time to Singapore and i always take picture at there with different friend also Lot of tourist but its fun to go there You need to walk little bit far around 800m from MRT
Merlion Park is a typical selfie-point of Singapore. The location is quite nice which is across Marina Bay. There are many good restaurants and pub joints nearby.

It's a great place o visit as photo's are nice to be taken. The night view from the park is awesome. Its a great place for people to walk around and have a peace of mind. Good parking service are available.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing fountain and statue on the bay
REVIEW_BODY: To see the city Merlion, the symbol of Singapore- wow! It’s so majestic on the edge of the bay and a wonderful photo spot - near the bay and Singapore river. Must see day or night!
A selfi with Merlion is a must for Singapore. Nice place fully surrounded by tourists. A good view is offered from Frolino hotel.
Although it is a very traditional attraction in Singapore but you will never miss this signature of Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Perhaps the most important landmark in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: I first visited the merlion park was back on 2010. I still remembered taking photos with my brother. It's definitely the most important landmark in Singapore despite the existence of the huge Marina Bay Sands building.

REVIEW_TITLE: a must visit this iconic place
REVIEW_BODY: this place is a must visit if you go to Singapore. In addition to its location is very easy to reach, this place is a free tourist destination of course

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots in the area to do
REVIEW_BODY: This area has changed so much and there is so much to just walk around and see. The development in the last 5 years blows my mind. Also a definite need to selfie with the famous Merlion statue. Lots of places to grab a bite or drink. Not far from the temples and downtown type area when out touring but plan for HOT.
I have been in singapore meeting lynch friend and as i have observed his work him and his wife looked great. Merlion park indeed is excellent.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to start a visit to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
This is the symbol of the City with good reason. It sits now in Marina Bay after having been moved there about 20 years ago. Half lion, half fish. I went in late afternoon and then hung around at the Starbucks a block from there so as to see it again lit up in the Harbor.

There are some great view points in front and around the side of the symbol. There are loads and loads of tourists all wanting the same photo you want too. It works out ok if you are patient, you can always get your favorite shot.

The Park is easy to get to walking or by other transpo, to me it was fun to explore that whole area, including the nearby very well noted hotels. I also tied this visit with a trip to tour the Singapore River, there is a river tour stop within 100 meters of Merlion.

Also, this is a decent viewpoint to watch the light show, it will be crowded but the light show is really across the Bay at the Sands. Fun to see it though from this perspective too.

Definitely worth seeing, no cost.

After a days work an evening stroll around the park and surrounds is a must. The light shows on the various buildings, the Merlion and other sites keep you interested. Stop by the hawker market for some dinner. If you enjoy night photography there is no limit to the shots that be taken.
Came in blistering heat so didn't like the experience , limited food options, very expensive for soverners .Get a compulsory picture & move on
This was the only really crowded place I experienced in July. Tons of people were there taking their photos.

Been there for two times but I couldn't stop lovin' the sight of Merlion Park. So many people there with different activities and for my 2nd time, I enjoyed the sunset from that place. I'd like to say Singapore is one of the best places for street photography. Merlion Park, the iconic place in Singapore, proves me about that!
When you're in Singapore, don't ever miss this place. Even though you're not a fan of selfie (just like me hehe) you can enjoy every details of this most popular spot in Singapore. Ride the boat, buy some coffee, listen to the sound of water fountain or just sightseeing. Can't wait to go back here!

REVIEW_TITLE: Not to missed when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park is located on One Fullerton road and considered as one of the famous landmarks you shouldn't miss when in Singapore. The ambiance is very nice and the park is well organized. I would surely bring my family on my next future visit in Singapore.
Kids love it!! One it has an interesting shape and other it is so distinctive that it would stay etched in your memory. Had last seen it about 12 years back and it was good to visit the place again.

This park is really more of a viewing patio for the statue and a promenade of shops. The Merlion is fun to see up close, but there is not much else to see. It is very hot, as there is limited shade. I would stop by, if in the area, but not worth a separate trip.

This place is going to be filled full of tourist as this is where the iconic Merlion is. You dong have to spend a ton of time but a must if you come to Singapore. Come in the evening and after getting a selfie hit up one of the many bar/restaurants for a drink and a snack.

REVIEW_TITLE: great place to enjoy sunny days
REVIEW_BODY: with a lot of tourists merlion park is quite a perfect place to enjoy and chill out and get a cruise trough the river to enjoy the view.

When one is on business sometimes it is nice to just wander. I walked to Merlion Park after 9 pm and it was a perfect night. Beautiful clear evening with the various restaurants and bars offering their wares. Such a great little walk after dinner, feeling very safe wandering by myself. Definitely a nice spot to check out.
Nice view from the spot Was crowded in the evening Many people wanting to take pics with the Merlion
It's OK, there wasn't much there, but it's worth seeing the Merlion as it's the symbol of Singapore.
I went in the evening and found this place is very lively with cheerful crowd. You can get a nice photo location to cover Marina Bay from here

This is such an icon in Singapore you ha e to go and see it. There are great views over the river to the hotel that has a 'boat' on the roof and the park with the flowers. It's very busy but a must see
This is an iconic Singapore landmark. On a hot day, if you are lucky, you can get a little spray of cooling water from the mouth of the MerLion. Usually crowded - but great photo spot.
What more you can ask for if you get to see all the main tourist attractions in one go. Flyer's Eye,Marina Bay Sans,Merlion Park and the Business centre. It is the best place to click photos.
It is very beautiflul when you visit Merlion Park at night. It is quiet and not so crowded compared with other place of interest.
A good view to visit. A place to stroll in the evening. Lot of places around for some good photographs / selfies as well. Respect the place...

The Merlion Park is conveniently located near the Central Business district. It is a major landmark. The Merlion is a mythical creature with the head of a lion and body of a fish. No trip to Singapore is complete without a stop and a photo.
Overall satisfied in the service during our conference workshop. Food is overwhelming. Various cuisine to choose from.

The light that projected into the merlion is really special and nice. Not sure if this happen in march due to special event or its permanent, but definitely worth a visit at night, you can take great photo of merlion and marina hotel
can take a lot of photos backing merlion and marina bay sands.must visit place in singapore.don't forget to take your selfi stick if u r solo.
This is the Smaller version of Sentosa merlion which is right infront of the Fullerton hotel, near the creek.
Nice and best place to spend evening or early morning time. Nice views and Photo place for every age people.
This is a must stop if you are in Sinapore. Grab your camera, jostle for a good spot and get your picture taken with the iconic Merlion.
The Merlion was under renovation when the visit was made in February. Many uptrend cafes in the complex.
Mer lion was being renovated so nothing to see, loads of tourists made it very crowded. Unrecognisable from my 1986 visit.
A trip to Singapore would not be complete with out seeing one of the Merlions! Or why not see them all... think there are 5-6 official ones to look at across Singapore!
Merlion where all tourists will be going to. The history of Singapore & further the less if u never visited the Merlion it's mean that u have not yet reach Singapore 🇸🇬
The lion is the national symbol of Singapore. It is a very pretty place and overlooks the bay. A must visit place if you visit Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Too Hyped for those who have seen other overseas destinations
REVIEW_BODY: Just a Memoir picture to have visited Singapore. Nothing great for tourists . They should add more affordable eateries around the bay
You only need to go here once. It's like a must visit for the first timer, but not for the second time. You won't have that willingness to come again

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing Surrounding. A must visit place!!
REVIEW_BODY: You will be able to see all skylines around Merlion. Amazing view. Nearby many nice restaurants. Loved the locality. A must visit place.

The Merlion (Mer + Lion), a half-fish half-lion hybrid statue is Singapore's must-see landmark & tourist hotspot at all times both day and night. One of the most popular area of Singapore where tourists gather abundantly. One can have very definite and clear view of Singapore skyline from here as it is surrounded with skyscrapers. Merlion symbolizes Singapore. It is easily visible from almost any place at Marina Bay area. More nicely it is cost free attraction. From here very significant attractions and monuments like Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer, Water floating stadium, big Lotus and Durian structure are so nicely visible. So this is a very good spot for taking photographs. In Sentosa Island there is another Merlion which is huge in size. There is a small park surrounding the statue. Water squirts from its mouth to the river at a commendable volume and speed. Color of the statue and squirting water are changed after dusk. So it is recommended to visit there both at day and night time to have different feelings.
Visited on December 2016

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit place if you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: A very lively place with people from many nationalities hanging around.. busy in taking pics, enjoying their moments and keeping memories for life. Multistorey buildings, bay and water bodies add on to the attraction of place. Although a bit crowded in evening but If one is going to Singapore for first time than it is a must visit place...

REVIEW_TITLE: Must See when you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Very busy and crowded area with nice views. The Merlion is directly accessible. It's a good starting point for a longer stroll around the area.
This was the first place we visited after setting foot in Singapore. It's nice and worth one visit. It was my first impression.

REVIEW_TITLE: You should not leave Singapore without a picture here.
REVIEW_BODY: The iconic Merlion is the one true picture that tell everyone that they've been to Singapore. But watch out, there's just too much tourist trying to take that souneir shot.
Nice place facing to sea and showing one side entire skyline of the city. Always full of tourists and enthusiasts
Good space/place for take a picture with merlion and marina bay. Night will be good to take a photo, coz of

Still wondering why tourist should come here, it is a nice walk, if weather not too hot pleasant as well, you can see Marina Bay building and the statue of the Merlion you always saw in documentaries and postcards .. but at the end it is just a walk on a normal promenade made not even too many years ago, with nothing historical or too fascinating to see. Good fro Asian tourists but for European - used to history and culture and much more, it is a 30 minutes break among one mall and the other
You simply can't miss this as this is the symbol of Singapore. There is the original Merlion and a new baby Merlion in the park. Lots of people doing the "water drinking" shots!

REVIEW_TITLE: The Symbol of Singapore and must visit.
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and a great place to catch up with the locals and see the fantastic 360 degree views of Singapore. Catch the laser show from the Marina Bay Sands at 20.00 and 21.30, a must see whilst in Singapore.
this is a perfect place for nightout in Singapore. The leger light show from opposite site of the Merlion statue at night is spectacular! dont miss the night river cruise as well

If you visit singapore there is not completed if you not visit this statu or park. Yes merlion park, there was 2 statu small and the big one. At that time our bus was parking around 15 minute from park. So you has to walk..but worthed because you can take many picture of singapore view..
Original Name of this country and city is "Singapura" means head of the Lion of course now it's became of logo of Singapore . A must watch tourist in Singapore
I stayed around the marina area so I saw this, it would be an interesting site to see while you're visiting Singapore.
Icon of Singapore with best city view. you have to take a picture when you visit this country. Strategic location , very easy to found it.
A visit to Singapore is only complete after taking in the sights in and around the Merlion Park. The history of Singapore unfolds from this very river.
I visited here during the night time. The view was breath taking so I visited again on the next night.

When in Singapore, it's one of those mandatory picture spot. It's absolutely crowded as well, whenever you go, so need to have some patience to get that opportunity. You can take a walk through the quay, have a sight of MBS from the other side and in cover Merlion as well.

REVIEW_TITLE: perfect scenic shot at the Merlion Park.
REVIEW_BODY: The Park is located right opposite Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer, and the Esplanade Theatre. All these landmarks come together, gives you a perfect scenic shot at the Merlion Park.

I wonder what drive people here, maybe the marketing. Over a period of time, this lion fountain has become synonymous with Singapore. If you google Singapore this image will pop up for sure, once you get here a feeling of ïs this all"will hit you for sure. It's right next to the lake but so is Marina Bay. There is nothing special about this place, they do light it up in the evening. If the boredom won't kill you then the heat will surely get you. There are no shades in the vicinity no place to sit down and relax for a while because it's always too crowded. My honest suggestion will be to skip this and head over to Clarke Quay , its much more lively there.
If you want to go to a place to take a picture this is a good place, not much attractions other than the view.

If you have time it's worth dropping by there to have a walk. The place is very tranquil and there's no entrance fee. You can get great shots of the Marina Bay Sands hotel and the financial area behind one of the Merlion statue.
A must to see overlooking the Marina Sands Hotel especially at nighttime is the best to be here with a lights display and many more to enjoy

You must go to this spot to take your selfie with the Famous Merlion. Once there you have an amazing view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, the Flyer and The Esplanade. There are High-end eateries and quick reasonable meals along this stretch of the park. From there you can walk to the Esplanade to experience some great local music, plays, and art work.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Place Where Use To be No. 1 for Singapore Icon
REVIEW_BODY: Believed it yourself and give it a try on Singapore River Boat Ride. Very nice scenery with Marina Sands Hotel on the background is so beautiful.
Good spot. Quite far from the MRT though , unsure about the bus station though. The view is amazing. It's not just the merlion.

We visit the park so that we can finally see the icon of Singapore. Luckily the water already function back to normal after undergo some renovation 2 days ago.

I didn't take the Merlion, because of the heat. I just wait for my guests under the tree and took whatever interest me.
This is an open air (and very little shade) park by the harbour. There is the larger Merlion statue and a smaller one just behind it. Best not to go in the middle of the day as it is extremely hot.

The Merlion Park is:
1) A stone statue sprouting water.
2) A statue of a creature that has never existed.
3) A spot to take beautiful photos.
4) An icon of Singapore that no visitors to the island state should missed.

Ans: All of the above! :)

Tip:
- Best to visit at twilight with the Merlion sprouting water towards the golden sunset.

- Stand on the left of the Merlion for the commanding view of Marina Bay Sands.

- Stand on the right of the Merlion for the glorious of the city skyscrapers and the Singapore Flyer.
Come here to have a good view of the morden Singapore. Good photo frame. Very near other attractions just by walking....
Merlion is under whelming. View is ok. Not worth sweating too much to see it live in person. View of marina bay better from Clark quay.
Great place to take memorable photos. Not only the Merlion is there, you can have the Marina Bay Sands photo shots as well. But behold, lots of tourists hang around this place.

Well visited their just to see the landmark, nothing to brag about. But it seems to be very popular with the newly weds and there is always some photoshoot happening. But the view is nice from here, specially at afternoon.

REVIEW_TITLE: Stop by to see the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: If you're a tourist or to your first time to Singapore it's worth a visit to he Merlion park to see the national figure and to just people watch. It's a friendly clean area with many restaurants and bars around the perimeter. We had a few drink and walked around to take some photos then headed out. A short but worthwhile visit.
Totally overrun with tourists all pretending to catch water out of the Merlion's mouth but a real symbol of Singapore.

you haven't been to singapore if you have not visited merlion park. crowded with tourists, you need to find and save your spot to get a good angle for capturing fotos. plus a backdrop of marina bay sands.
truly an iconic structure ,need to be explored in day light to have good pics of it , beautifully maintained !!!
Take a boat trip around the river to receive a detailed historical lesson on the Merlion. A wonderful experience. Be warned, organisation of boat tours can be chaotic but it's worth it in the end.

To be completely frank, there's not much to do at merlion Park except take some selfies and admire the view, but because of the world the merlion built around itself (or maybe the merlion was built around it?), there's plenty to do just around the merlion. As the main landmark of Singapore, every tourist needs to come here at least once. The night view isn't bad either, to catch the marina Bay laser/water show

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore visit is incomplete without being here!!
REVIEW_BODY: No body will believe that you visited Singapore, if you wouldn't click your photo in front of Merlion. Its more not clicking your pic in front of Taj Mahal, while you visit Agra in India. Jokes apart, this is the Symbol of Singapore, so its must visit place. I would suggest to visit in Night when all the light of the tall building forms its back ground. It gives an awesome view. You will not be spending too much time here, as nothing else is to be done here. Unless you just want to sit there and relax, looking around.
Must visit once. It is a symbol of Singapore. if you want to take home something as a memory of Singapore, you may have a memento of Merlion
This landmark should be on every tourist to do list just to see it and take time to reflect away from the hustle and bustle of shopping.

REVIEW_TITLE: another land mark of nation in world class and many more
REVIEW_BODY: The merilion land mark and surrounded park pictorious and show up modern cities proud to the world.when you turn youre camera to four corners you will capture major portin of Singapore city easily.Its clean and tidy always tourist crowded place, muat see when you visit Singapore at least one.

REVIEW_TITLE: Famous landmark that every visitor should check out once
REVIEW_BODY: This is a famous statue water fountain, with great views all around of the city, bay and Marina Bay Sands. Nothing super exciting to see, but one of the icons of Singapore. Coming in the morning means less people, as it can get packed in the viewing area later in the day.

REVIEW_TITLE: You need to see the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: I didn't make it to the Merlion until my third trip to Singapore, but you need to see what all the fuss is about. Taxi in and out with ease from a taxi stand near the Starbucks. Not a ton to do, but a great photo and views of the rest of the park.

While on Sentosa island do take out time to visit all locations. Merlion park is one such location which should not be missed. Named after the mythological character this place holds special attraction in Singapore.
this is one of the very first tourist locations ever built, but still very popular with visitors, its location is stunning and worth a visit
Visit to Singapore without Merlion is not complete. It is like getting a signature of Singapore before going to more interesting places to see.
The merloin is iconic for Singapore so at least one time into singapore you must visit. it does allow a good view to the marina bay sans hotel and around the harbour

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Location to Visit on your Walk
REVIEW_BODY: Excellent spot to stop and take a photo Buy an ice cream or a cold drink any time Wear comfortable footwear and take a water bottle. Many choices to continue your walk
Great place for pictures, but as expected a lot of people which makes pictures doable but difficult.
I do not understand why for Singapore, this is considered as a tourist spot. There is hardly much to "like" about Merlion Park, anyways tourists do come here in hundreds !
Great view, but overcrowded with tourist. Can just spend some time there to take photos, no need to spend too long
Must do night activity. Take the River Cruise for a special lighting extravaganza view from the river. Makesure your camera has a Night Photo Option

arive RafflesPlace MRT station~walk by the river battery Rd, and cross over Fullerton Rd, you may see those beautiful river view, and enjoy the sunlight with the boat on rivers glint surface. and you'll get to the Merlion ~ the great signature of Singapore, you can take photo and mark yourself in this trip. When you stand by the Merlion, you can see the sky park opposite the Marina Bay, also a great photo spot for the architecture!
it is surrounded by a spacious platform, which one can use to take memorable photos. marina bay at the backdrops adds to its beauty.
Bring your camera and you can get great shots of the Esplanade, Merlion and the skyline. Very hot during the day. Many tourists around.

This seems to be a spot that attracts many people for photo opportunities of the Sands resort across the bay. The Merlion is a delightful sculpture that defines this part of the Singapore Bay Area! Amusing for sure!

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice Place and Visitors Attraction Place
REVIEW_BODY: Nice Location with attractive Statue. Its very unique place and Its Must Visit Place if its in Singapore.

The Merlion is a must see in Singapore. I went there at night so the lights added to the drama and beauty of the place. Bonus for the area are the nightspots and restaurants where business and pleasure combined.
This place symbolises Singapore...and hence you cant miss it. It is an amazing place to click pics...pics come out great from all the angles...
Another must do if in Singapore, just to say you've been there. Some interesting history to be learned. Worth a few minutes stop and of course on way to the promenade restaurants anyway

This is a must visit since the Merlion at one point was the only symbol that identified Singapore. We were on a business conference trip with a tight schedule. So not much time left to ourselves. We stayed at the MBS hotel. Its a nice walk around the bay to the Merlion and back. We went there close to midnight. So got a night time and lighted view of the Merlion. Also, there were not many people around. Its a nice place to just hang around. The steps next to the statue is a good place to just hang around and admire the statue.

It is the location where the identity of Singapore stays. Generally the Merlion statue is the key symbol of Singapore. The location is so beautiful with lovely view of many other attractions. An ideal location for photography and selfies.

REVIEW_TITLE: a lovely place for a picture
REVIEW_BODY: a lovely place for a short stay and a picture. Expected to get a little bit wet due to the splash from the Merlion. A short walk from the Esplanade only, so it's worth going between the shows.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful in the Morning, Wonderful in the evening.
REVIEW_BODY:
We went here very early in the morning to stroll, watch and take photos of the sunrise rising behind MBS and shining towards the soon to be removed Merlion Statue. People here are either taking photos, strolling and jogging. The place affords a great view of Singapore’s Marina Bay Sands, Art Museum and business skyline. People can come here, take photos even with a tripod and will not get harassed by security personnels (which is very common in my home country Philippines) you can photograph anything in Singapore.

The park is free.
Great pleces. But so very hot air if came at bright day. A lot of people came and so many restaurant to go if you hungry.
Go in the evening to see the magnificent skyline and the amazing area. Take a stroll around the river taking in views of the beautiful skyscrapers around the Marina Bay Sands area.

Merlion Park is the place of the mythical Singapore lion. Quite an impressive white figure of stone. From it's mouth stream of gushing water keeps coming, falling on the lagoon below. Surrounded by steps & a garden, a crowd of people sitting, staring, taking pictures. Beautifully lighted. A must-see in Singapore.
This is the iconic statue of Singapore. We came at the night and there was a light show from the marina bay hotel. Excellent views
Merlion, lion amd fish combination. Juat a place for memorable pictures taking. Everything as per the title.
This is one of the iconic images of Singapore and provides great photo opportunities. The waterfront location is close to other attractions.

The Merlion is a must visit when in Singapore and is at its best at night. The white lion statues (don't forget the baby one!) are pristine. They are on the Marina Bay and look beautiful surrounded by the tall CBD skyscrapers and hotels.
Close to the Merlion are lots of bars and restaurants so you can enjoy a drink or dinner in the location.
still the crowded place as it used to be since its the iconic place to take picture to show that your really in Singapore. just my second time and still the same.

Visited this place plus other interesting sites around it. It was an okay place nothing spectacular or more than ordinary.

To others it is more than enough but to me, it is fine.

I will surely visit again but this around I will take time to explore better

REVIEW_TITLE: It was beautiful place to visit with icon being symbol of Singapore and always a tourism symbol.
REVIEW_BODY: One of the most icon structures in Singapore, surrounded by restaurants and cafe. Nice locatian to make foto. Crowded but awesome Better to visit on a Monday or Tuesday.
It was a very good evening spent there with the vibe really amazing and had a very beautiful evening at the raffles bay

We visited the merlion during the evening and the view is simply breathtaking.This place could easily be accessed through the Singapore Bus or Raffels place mrt.Its ideal if you could stay for the marina bay sands lights show if you visit the merlion park during a evening.

Best time to visit is around 7.45 or 8.45 , then you can watch the light show at other part of the river near Merina bay sand . You can enjoy the show but don’t get to hear the music . Those who are fling to see the merlion can visit the place any time and it takes around 15 minutes to see it. .
Nothing majorly spectacular in this location. The Lion isn't that big or anything special to see. But if you're in the area then walk around and take in some of the views like marina bay sands
Everything is here! Clean,vibrant, fresh,safe and accessible. There are shades for picnic grounds. Stores and souvenir shops nearby are incredible and with good price. Street foods are one of a kind.
You must include this in your itinerary when visiting Singapore some absolutely fantastic photo opportunities

There are usually always lots of tourists walking around, taking pictures, enjoying the view. You get a great view towards the Marina Bay Sands. There are also lots of restaurants and bars to just relax and enjoy a good time.
The statue is bright white and very well lighted. This spot is one of the highlights of Singapore and definitely worth a visit.

Ive been in Merlion so many times but everytime i went in Singapore i make it a point to go back and look it. I feel so relaxing while watching the blowing of water in Merkion. I know Merlion is the trademark of Singapore. I really recommended it in all travellers..
this is the symbol of singapore so it is a must see. the tourists get in line just to take quick pictures and it is very nice to see the enthusiasm

A place that must be visited when visiting Singapore because it is also a symbol of this country. The statue in the shape of a lion's head and fish body is now surrounded by an amazing view, different from the past conditions where there are no supporting facilities. There are Marina Bay Sands, Fullerton Hotels, Hellix Bridge and others. The sea which was dammed in front of the monument was also made a boating tourism recreation facility and in the afternoon especially on weekends there is a laser show and live music stage.
we really have a good and fun trip in singapore especially after seeing this statue of lion / fish maybe.

REVIEW_TITLE: Just statue in a park by the water
REVIEW_BODY: The statue of Merlion itself is not spectacular. Those want better grip should go to Santosa. By having said that, it’s a nice area to stroll around the water extending from Marina Bay. I really enjoyed walking around the area.
This was my third visit to Merlion but first after sunset. It has just gone amazing in last few years. Landmark icon in Singapore. Scenic and a selfie spot in Singapore

Every first timer's must-visit Singapore landmark for that Merlion picture. Unfortunately its hard to get that perfect photo with the Merlion since there are many tourists who are also aiming for that same photo with you. Expect photo bombers and a queue. If you have the patience and a good photographer its a good site to start your Singapore instaworthy photos. Will try to perfect my Merlion photo on my next visit.

Like Copenhagen's Little Mermaid unmissable - but a tad more impressive. Try to go at night too as there is a free Son et Lumiere from 8 p.m. Lots of good-natured but unoppressive crowds trying to take photos - especially standing in front of the Merlion making the water jet seem to come out of their open mouths. The area is relaxing and full of good but expensive restaurants and bars.

The water area is nice to see, it’s just like in the brochures; what they don’t show is the bus after bus of tourist all wanting to take a photo of the statue.
It’s easy to find and within walking distance of MRT. If you have never been to Singapore, then this is like the thing to pop along to see, next to Marina Bay Sands.

Merlion the symbol of Singapore. Has been moved from it original position. Bigger area for more tourists and getting crowded. Judge your run to miss the crowds. Still a great sight. Easy to find and get to. View from the river or on land.

Merlion park is one of the favourite tourist attraction.
Clicking selfies with the Merlion is a must.
I did the same. But getting that perfect selfie is a bit difficult since it's too crowded
Nothing much to do here, but just chill around and enjoy the water and view.
One of the most iconic structures in Singapore. I love taking photos of this cityscape. I love looking at this structure.

The main feature is the National symbol of our country the Majestic Merlion. One should never miss this spot if u r a traveller or visitors here. A must go for a snapshot.
Then there is the River where u can take a bumboat cruise and relive the legendary ride along the river n reliving the history of the nation. Be mesmerised by the magnificent colonial structures on either side of the river and take pictures of the grandeur of the Fullerton Hotel, the once General Post Office n the former HQ of the Japanese era.
The scene is especially beautiful n mesmerising when the sun sets and the buildings are all lited up.
After the cruise head on to Clarke Quay for some live music at the bars there or go a sumptuous seafood dinner at some of the fine dining restaurants located next to the River.
A 5-stars experience u will not forget.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to take photos of the amazing Singapore skyline
REVIEW_BODY: Probably one of the most visited places in Singapore and can be very crowded with tourists. Excellent people watching and very close to Marina Bay and all the must see sites. Take your camera.
There were quite a lot of people but it is not like we have to push our around. But, the view and sound and light presentation is worth the crowd.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth stopping by, day or night
REVIEW_BODY: Some nice views of the bay and downtown, walking distance to quite a few other places worth visiting in that area.

A visit to Singapore is never complete without visiting the Merlion Park and clicking a post card picture in front of the Merlion, which is the face of Singapore.

Visit here during sunset time, to beat the heat. I suggest a walk from Clarke Quay, along the Singapore river, where you can catch a glimpse of Boat Quay, Asian civilization museum.

REVIEW_TITLE: A good view of the reservoir
REVIEW_BODY: It’s been some time since I last visited this part of Singapore. Truly a fantastic location to view how far singapore has progress over the years with MBS over the other side of the reservoir. Truly a very scenic place at night with the lightings.

I had holiday last year for 4 days , first day i went to marina bay ,second day i went to universal studio and for our last day i went to merlion park that time its raining but its okay beacause its worth it ...
Shame you are unable to see this and then forced to see the one on Sentosa. Be great once it is reopened but unsure when this will be?
Yup, all sheeted up, Like a number of other 'attractions' In Singapore. Very modern city , but sadly lacking info about this.b see also art museum and Chinatown Complex

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Mascot with Lions Head and Fish Body
REVIEW_BODY: This mythical creature signifies the personified history of Singapore and the Strength of the country. It is located near Fullerton, easiest way is to take a Cab or if using MRT Rafaels Street is the closest (not very sure). This area is sublime, get yourself clicked then take a boat ride for 25 Singaporean Dollar and enjoy the ride.
You never visit singapore is never visit here. This is the first icon of singapore, you must go to here, take a mrt and heading to raffles place station.

REVIEW_TITLE: Merlion is THE SIGNATURE Landmark Of Singapore--CURRENTLY CLOSED
REVIEW_BODY:
PLEASE NOTE: Unfortunately, Merlion is all covered up with tarps and scaffolding and is undergoing renovations for an unknown period of time.

Merlion is the iconic symbol and mascot of Singapore & the country and is located at the Marina Bay across the street from the Fullerton Hotel. This is one of THE most popular sites in Singapore that everyone wants a photo & selfie with so expect crowds day or night! Merlion I was told is a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish. You will see it on all travel brochures and advertisements.

BOTTOM LINE: No trip to Singapore is complete without a visit here. The amount of water coming out of Merlion's mouth is like a large high pressure fire-hose. Depending on the wind direction, you might get wet! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!! MY RATION: 10/10.

This location is also excellent for taking photos of the Marina Sands Hotel and the skyline. A zoom lens is helpful. Parking is limited close by the park. Taxis can drop you off and come back in 10 minutes or so. A must stop to get a photo here!
It is located right next to Singapore river.you can see beautiful Singapore sky at night time .you get too see beautiful view of marine by the sands from here.
Go to Merlion Park, enjoy views, take some photos and later on you can board to take s cruise on the Singapore Pear. One can also walk over to many nearby eateries for food and drink.

Located right in the city center, the place is surrounded by other very typical monuments for Singapore. This makes the spot very attractive for making photos and it's also very crowded. Anyway, I wouldn't say that the visit of Singapore would be completed without Merlion Park.
Must visit the merlion park when in Singapore. Lots of tourist, hardly can take picture. Beautiful view.
It's a must visit place. It is always a happening place there. Tried the ice cream with waffle which selling on a bike was delicious.

Here is the place that I believe everyone who enters Singapore must visit as this is where the iconic statue of Singapore is located (the half fish & half lion). Bear in mind that this is an open area that is crowded with visitor and tourist from Asian country mostly.

Entrance is free. You can see Esplanade Bridge, Theatres on the bay, Mirror Balls and so many other statues.

Depends on your transportation, you will have to walk through a garden or something like that but fill with art statues, gallery, building and so on. Approximately you will spend 1 to 1.2 hours depends on your luck to get the perfect selfies with the statues and memories to be captured here.

Bring a bottle of drinking water for yourself as the weather in Singapore mostly heat. There's 7-Eleven nearby. I am not sure about public washroom.

There's a lot of smoking area provided, but please don't smoke near people and kids. Don't litter too.
Because this is the Landmark of Singapore so many people come here everyday. I think if you want to avoid others be in your frame, you should arrive at7am.
This place always crowd, tourist from all over the world will come to this place if they come to singapore. This place is the most must go place if you are in singapore. Beautiful place......😀
Is a must to visit the merlion park if you landed in singapore. Attract lots of tourist. Hardly can take picture if visit during weekend or holiday season.

One of the most famous iconic place of Singapore with no entry fee and with lots of photo spots. Try to go during 5 or 5.30 pm when you can see merlion as well as may have a walk till helix bridge and at night enjoy the free light show.
When in Singapore this is a must see. It’s easily accessible and it’s free to visit. Grab an ice cream from the nearby stall and take in the views.

We visited the Merlion Park, mostly because we were in Singapore, and it was relatively close to get to from the Marina Bay Sands (MBS). To its credit, the park actually offers beautiful views of the MBS. You can also catch pretty cool views of it from the other side of the water from the MBS. For a cheap touristy thing to do - and since it is free, why not! I was otherwise not super impressed with it. While running for cover from the sun, we did find a nice adjacent souvenir shop just a short walk away underneath the bridge overpass.

One good look at the MerLion and you will be elevated to a transcendent plane of tourist bliss, having walked miles to see a statue of a mermaid+lion spitting water. Such a statue must necessarily defy our comprehension.

This is an excellent place to spend your time, especially when you are with your family or your dear friends in your vacation..
The sea lion sitting gigantically with eater falling out from its mouth is an excellent view..
Many people spend their time taking photos with their family and friends here..
Don't ever miss this place..
In my view, an excellent place to take photos and have a good walk..

Wasn’t sure where this was then saw it from the Singapore flyer so went to see it close up. It’s very busy as when we arrived it was raining but that didn’t deter people there were people of all ages jostling to get a shot. Nearby are take always, ice cream stands, restaurants and of course a Starbucks. Shame there is no bench seating.

This is a small concrete-floor park with a total area of 0.25 hectare. It is home to two Merlion statues. They are legendary statues (and symbols of Singapore) with the head of a lion and the scaly body and typical tail of a fish. The statues spout water from their mouth. The larger of the two spouts water into Marina Bay and is especially beautiful to watch at night when it is lit up in changing and rotating colours and enhanced with musical sounds. It is also a good location from which to view the city’s night skyline. Unlike most parks, this has little grass. Most of the ground area is covered with concrete.
Merlion Park - Overseeing Singapore River. Merlion - Mermaid tail & Lion head. Mystic animal. Icon of Singapore. Singapura - Lion City in Malay language.
This is probably the most well known landmarks in Singapore. You can walk here from Marina Bay Sands or from the Gardens by the Bay.

If you choose ONE place to visit in Singapore, this is it as you will see the national symbol (the Merlion lion) and some nice spots for pictures. It is crowded, hot and muggy (like everywhere else) but safe and clean and you will leave with good memories. Definitely a must-see.

If you go in the evenings, this is a great place to relax. In the afternoons, it's mostly scorching hot around here and you might just want to run and find shelter. It's been crowded but really beautiful every time I have been there. If you can find a spot to sit, you can enjoy the breeze and just wind down. I would surely visit again soon!
This place is so packed it's so difficult to get a nice picture but It's cute though. Must go there again.

REVIEW_TITLE: Get ready to take lots of pictures
REVIEW_BODY: Dont miss! Such a lovely area along the waterfront. Iconic Merlion will fill your scrapbook with pictures

When thinking of Singapore, you automatically associate it with these lions. Great place for a selfie or that staged shot, however everyone else thinks same. Always tour groups and crowds. Get in, get your photos of the lions and surrounds, then get out.

Not too much to say about the Merlion, it is the symbol, the icon in Singapore, if you go to Singapore you have to visit the merlion. It is in Marina Bay, you have an amazing view of the Marina bay sands from there. Very interesting to visit.
We went to see this Outdoor Activity and the Surroundings sights of the Buildings and the Water. It was very crowded.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to sit and having conversations.
REVIEW_BODY: I think this is a good place to visit at night because this place is so relaxing and calm. We can see the laser show from here, but not the fountain show in Marina bay sands. If you want to take a photo its better to go here in the morning or afternoon. From here you can walk to Clarke Quay and it's just takes around 15 minutes.

I guess this is a must see attraction for tourist to take the obligatory Merlion spouting water into your mouth. There is no shade and the place is full of tourist taking selfies. Very crowded, so expected unobstructed photos without a lot of patience.
The Merlion at the park is like the heart of Marina Bay attracting huge crowds everyday... vibrant Singapura!
Get ready with your camera and poses, a must visit and most visited tourist site in Singapore. Visit Merlion park during the day and during night time, and compare it for yourself.
I visit Merlion at Friday and it's so crowded as usual. And i remembered there's a lot of China tourists there omg and it makes merlion more crowded and louder than usual lol

Well the merlion park is the icon where every person visiting Singapore goes to. Well, I don't know much of history of that place so not aware of it's importance. However, it's a nice place. You can buy an ice cream and chill. We had walked from the Marina Bay Sands through the helix bridge to Merlion Park. It's a beautiful walk by the Marina Bay. It's well lit up at night. The place is bustling with people even at night. We had then taken a river cruise through marina bay which starts from Merlion park. It was amazing.

Restaurants near by the statue. The huge merlion statue is in Sentosa Island. But this one is the iconic one. It at the opposite side of Marina Bay Sands and it it a great place to take photos as well. Take the MRT or walk from MBS depends on you.
This is a famous icon & most visit tourist place at Singapore. Many good views for taking selfie by visitors
First time in Singapore, lots of high building and modern mixed with Chinese culture, Food was great and night Life was fun.
This is a good place for dinning out lots of international cuisine restaurant along by the water with night light show across marina bay sands
Didn't stay long since I was with a tour group, but this is a great location for pictures of the Singapore harbor area. You can see the Skybar for here as well. Lots of tourist.
Nice promenade along this part of Singapore. Not very attractive for a tourist but it is a nice stroll in the centre of Singapore. The statue of the Lion takes a lot of attention from the locals.

With all the mega sized sculptures among the mega scrapers I expected Merlion to be on the Mega scale. He probably was back in the day. Compared to the Mega Lotus across the bay Merlion is a modest 20-25’, cute fountain pouring into the bay. Worthy of a look see for photos. No shade so its difficult to stay longer than a few minutes on the white concrete decks when the sun is high. There are vendors of cold water & ice cream close by and a sidewalk cafe under the over pass.
This is a great place to go to see the evening laser show at Marina Bay Sands. I was there last night and there has a great atmosphere and view. Lots of eateries too.

I been to Singapore like 5 times now and this was the first time I went to visit the Merlion. I suppose staying at Marina Bay Sands just across the bay has made it sort of harder since when things are so close we tend to put off visiting them. I think this statue is pretty cool and cute.

It of course represents history for Singapore but it’s also a pretty amazing statues and pretty large if I might add. It tends to hold a type of majestic almost superiority of over Singapore.

So please visit this place and see for yourself.

welcome to singapore. Almost everyone who visits Singapore wants to take pictures and travel in this place. Merlion park is one of Singapore's mainstay tours that can be visited 24 hours and free of charge.

First off, it's not that big.
Then, it kinda looks like it's vomiting in the bay. And never stops.
And even if you did find it impressive or beautiful, then good luck getting a picture because there's like a million people trying to take selfies in front of the stupid thing.

REVIEW_TITLE: The night view from sidewalk is the best
REVIEW_BODY: I recommend the night view of both MerLion and Marina Bay Sands from sidewalk, Jubilee Bridge. At night, MerLion is lightened with various colors by projection mapping minutes by minutes. I like every colored MerLion.

It's so over the top - crowded but spectacular. The photos you can take from here are insane - you get the whole city practically in one shot (panoramic of course). I could have spent hours here - it was a hot day and if you stand close enough you get a little shower from the Merlion - it's perfect.

A tourist or a visitor of Singapore can’t say he’s been here if he doesn’t have a photo of the papa Merlion , that’s what my guide said.

And it’s true, the Merlion Park is packed with all kinds of people from all walks of life, country or nationality.

You can walk along the Junille Bridge to cross where the unique building that has a top that looks like a durian, they call the Esplanade Theater. A lot to absorb and observe in this park it’s worth stopping by and stroll ‍♀️
Merlion Park is one of the best tourist attraction in Singapore , it's like you find your peace when you visited here. It is also an IG perfect location if you are an IG artist or even a blogger
The Merlion is very cool and it has a littler version only a few metres away. Definitely worth a visit. It’s very popular with tourists, but not unbearably crowded.

Whilst visiting Singapore for the first time stopped off here for the obligatory photo with the Merlion. As well as the main one spouting water there is also a smaller one in the same area.

The location is also a great location in which to take a photo with Marina Bay Sands in the background.

Must do for every first time visitor to Singapore
The place is very touristy. I recommend to go there at a night time to take beautiful pictures. Nothing special in the area but still yet if you are in Singapore it is a must do thing

Frankly it is not very accurate calling it a park. It's rather a little square overlooking the Marina Bay with a fountain statue (actually 2 statues since there is a smaller statue in the back) right in the middle. The fountain statue though represents the symbol of Singapore, the Merlion, combining the ties between the island and its people to the sea, as well as the historic name the "Lion city" in malayan that is ironically the old name given to a place where lions never existed!
This Merlion was allocated in the mouth of the Singapore river but it was relocated here in 2002 and it sprays the water right back to the bay
As usual in Singapore, you better visit by night to enjoy the lights and the atmosphere and definitely this place is on your way while visiting the Marina Bay, and for sure it is a great idea to get some photos with the fountain in the background sending its water right over your head or directly in your mouth ;)

My friend and I came here almost midnight. We thought that it will not crowd, but still many tourists there. We enjoyed the light of downtown and Merlion in the night. Such an exotic memorable to spend time here in the midnight. Lucky us that this merlion park is close from our hotel that we stayed. It has Bar and Resto surrounding the Fullerton Area. You can reach it by MRT too. Many choices and easy to reach Merlion. I fully enjoyed in this place and recommended to visit during in Singapore.
Certainly impressive sight from the cable car or walking into Sentosa Island. Fascinating to see & probably best time to go would be morning or late afternoon when weather is cooler.
With thousands of tourists mulling around in the heat, the Merlion Park is nothing to rave about. The view of the Bay and MBS is quite alright.
To go to merlion park just stop at redline mrt and stop at raffles place exit B and walk to fullerton bay hotel. At the junction cross the road to one fullerton and down the stairs to merlion park.

I loved this area... especially at night. With the lights its so pretty. A gorgeous stroll along the marina with many restaurants to stop at or just watch the light show for free of marina bay sands...100% recommend
This is my second time i go here. And i am still amaze, i feel its my first time again coming in Merlion Park Highly recommendable if your first time going to Singapore
Who wouldn’t want to have an iconic selfie with the merlion? Must visit late afternoon for a stroll, have a drink and take a boat ride to the Clark Quay for much fun!!!
Merlin the landmark of Singapore is amazing, situated near the waterfront it adds to its charm . A must photo stop.
I really love the Merlion, I think it is resllyw cute. But the area is very crowded and it is hard to get a decent photo so better to see it from the water.
Tour group having a walk to see the monument. Worth the visit but not a great attraction. Food outlets available.
Average park near the Singapore river. Enjoyable specially in the evening when you see lights around.
You will found it near the fullerton hotel. The nearest MRT station is Orchard Place. I prever going there at night since i can see Marina and all the lighting of the surrounding area of this place.
This is the symbol of Singapore. I konw in place that imitates this symbol in Vietnam. Go to singapore you must come here
You’ve never been to Singapore if you never visited Merlion Park.Merlion is a statue of fish with the head of a lion,which is widely used as the symbol of Singapore.

Not a lot to see but just to say you have been there and got pictures....Much better by night with merlon lit up and spouting water.....never get tired of seeing it from river.... A special part of Singapore... for me anyway....

Amazing Merlion Statue where you can take iconic pictures to memorialize your trip to Singapore. Or you can people watch as they make their poses as well as relax and watch the boats in the bay or have a snack. From here you can see the Marina Bay Sands Spectra show, but it will be backward since it is facing the rear of the show.

Hope you catch this place not under maintenance. Hahaha. You needed to see this to be if you want a leisurely walk. There are many restaurants and bars around here since there are tons of high end hotels around. We got ice cream while strolling aroung the park.

I've been photographer for many people here, not the pro but those people who says "can you take a picture of us?". So many tourists dropby here but I am to see them happy especially the families. I'll be sure to go here with my own family

Whether you're familiar with the past history of Singapore and what the Merlion symbolises or if you're just passing through this is a lovely area of the city to visit. Grab a J cone and walk around the bay.

The Merlion Park is located in Singapore between the Fullerton Hotel and Marina Bay. From there you have a wonderful view on the skyline of Singapore. basically disease the financial district and all the parts of the Marina Sands Bay Hotel which looks like a Surfboard resting on three pillars. There are a lot of bars and restaurants around so you can spend your day and your money there easily.

The image of Singapore, the Merlion is a wonderful fountain of a half lion half mermaid that shoots water out of its mouth into the bay. This is probably one of the biggest tourist attractions of Singapore as it is the symbol of the city. It’s very easy to get to with tons of restaurants and shops surrounding it. The Merlion always has many visitors no matter the time of day, but go there in the morning to get a nice sunrise photo with the statue! You will get to see all kinds of tourists doing many different poses, and this alone can be entertaining.

Easy to get to from raffles place MRT station (Red or green line) and the Bayfront station (Yellow or Blue) if you wanted to walk around the bay to it! Fun to visit and a great view of the city from all around the Bay Area!

You must take a picture with merlion statue, this is most famous landmark at singapore. You can also see another landmark of singapore here . If you visit at sunny day dont forget to bring hat or umberella and sunglasess, its very hot here.

REVIEW_TITLE: RECLAMATION AND URBAN PLANNING PAR EXCELLENCE!
REVIEW_BODY: Last month I visited Singapore for the second time. My last visit was in 1998. I was very impressed with the many projects that resulted from land reclamation. The Gardens by the bay, with the artificial trees is a MUST SEE, especially at night. The Esplanade, Merlion Park and ArtScience Museum were beautifully done. Level 33 bar, where we went to quench our thirst, offered breathtaking views of the area! Do not miss this area!

The statue of half lion half fish that becomes icon of Singapore is right on the water, with the great view of Marina Bay Sands, the flyer, Esplanade and Art Science museum. Definitely a nice place for a Instagram worthy kind of photo. Great view day and night. Don’t miss the light show!
One and only, the most famous Singaporean symbol. Must hang around and see the statue, and of course, the view of Marina Sands Bay hotel from Merlion park is also amazing.

Well, the park was nice & clean. There are restaurants & cafes with views to the water and Marina Bay Sands across. The entrance is free.
Sooo many people around the statue. Maybe if you come around 7 or 8 AM the place will be less crowded.

I came here at 12am midnight so it was easier for me to take a picture. Im not too sure how it is during the day time but nighttime was beautiful, seeing the merlion shining and the sparkles of Marina Bay Sands from afar. And not to mention away from the crowds. It was quite peaceful. There are multiple Merlions in Singapore, but to get that "ICONIC" Merlion, Marina Bay Sands & Lotus in one photo, the easiest way to get there is to
1. Get off at Raffles Place MRT.
2. Exit door G of Raffles Place MRT
3. Turn right and you will see the Fullerton Hotel and walk towards it
4. Once you get to the Fullerton Hotel, walk to the front of the hotel till you see "One Fullerton".
5. Cross the road to the other side and you will see the Merlion.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful place, too many people, overcrowded
REVIEW_BODY: As promised, the Merlion is beautiful. Lots of great photos can be taken here but the crowd is too much. Not sure when a good time to visit is but definitely not at noon. People were standing in the way most of the time. Great experience nonetheless.

We all know what this is. In every advertisement of Singapore, we have noticed the majestic half lion- half mermaid icon roaring fountain from its mouth. Singapore is incomplete without this masterpiece. The Mythical Merlion has a tale to tell the tourists. The body represents Singapore’s ancient business, fishing and the head represents Singapore’s original name, Singapura, meaning “the Lion City”.

REVIEW_TITLE: Perfect location for taking photo of Singapore’s landscape!
REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion Park is located near The Fullerton Hotel and The Fullerton Bay Hotel. You can take great photos here of the Singapore Landscape and Marina Bay Sands.

For dining options, you may find PS Cafe a suitable choice for lunch and dinner too. There is a few Starbucks outlets near Merlion Park - one at Waterboat House and another near The Fullerton Bay.

It is advisable for you to go at night as it will be pretty crowded in the day and scorching hot and humid too.
Merlion Park is definitely a must place when you visit Singapore. There are a lot of great photo backgrounds and cool iconic places. I want to visit again!

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place to view Singapore skyline and the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY:
I often bring friends who are first time visitors here as it has a splendid view of the bay encircled by the Marina Bay Sands hotel, the Singapore Flyer and the Business District. It is also the closest where you get to the Merlion. Instagram worthy but also rather crowded. Light shows on the bay every night - a bit touristy but they love it nonetheless.

I usually take them for dinner at Palm beach Seafood restaurant to enjoy chili crab and pretty good food. A bit more pricey than usual but food is good and it has a great view outside. It’s usually packed. so book in advance to sit outside to enjoy the view.

In the day, nice place to enjoy beer, coffee etc at the many al fresco cafes and take in all the activities in the bay - sports, river boat cruise etc. If it gets too warm or too wet, sit inside the air-conditioned areas. I like the Ps Cafe on Level 2. To get there, take a cab to One Fullerton or walk from the nearest train station or bus stop. It’s also a nice walk from the Marina Bay Shoppes (where the hotel is) to One Fullerton (just follow the Merlin spouting water at the opposite end) - a scenic 15 minute walk.

From One Fullerton you can also take the basement travellator to the Fullerton Hotel - which used to be the General post office, a relic left from the British which was conserved and converted to a spectacular hotel. Around that district, wander around and you find more conserved properties beautifully restored and maintained which are now museums, concert halls and galleries. Bring along a bottle of water and a small towel and wear comfortable shoes. It is hot and humid over in Singapore.

Merlin park is such an institution of Singapore-just have to tock it off your list. There are a lot of fast food places there now,so not as open as it used to be. Probably best to see it from the water
Worth a visit for some touristy pictures. Some resteraunts and bars in this area to. Free entry, nice in the warm weather.

It’s a must visit landmark whenever travelling to Singapore

Hmm…Why named as Merlion❓⁉
Reason being it’s a lion with its mermaid ‍♀️ alike body pillar. Always very crowded with its visitors

Ohh ya…There are baby Merlion & mummy Merlion , so don’t forget to capture your selfie , photo , boomerang or video with both ya

Do enjoy her full travel blogging ‍& more lifestyle sharing, blog link at profile ☺️

We started close by for a business trip, so walked down after dinner one night. There roads can be tricky, so it might make sense to take some of the mall sky was to cross busy roads. Around 8:45 you experience the light show at the marina Bay sands resort from Merlion park. Lots of fun walking jogging trails by the water to stroll.

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore landmark and major tourist attraction!
REVIEW_BODY:
Hello guys, we travel from Aljunied MRT to Raffles Place MRT and walk 10minutes to Merlion Park. Train service is so convenient in Singapore..

This place was flooded with people as this is the major tourist attractions. Nothing much here just some pictures. Get your sunglasses ready because it is real sunny and hot !
It was ok. Nothing special. Merlion is something Singapore only so it has made three place to be as a tourist. Lots of walking from MRT, less walk if you choose bus.

Singapore is known for its icon of lion-headed creature and legged fish. The Merlion legend has become synonymous and it is a must for tourists to record memories if visiting here. Do not forget to make it as a souvenir to your loved ones.

Visited the Merlion as part of a city tour on our first day in Singapore. Our visit was the first stop on our tour and it seems to be a popular time to see it in the morning. We were there around 0930 and there were large groups of tourists all clammering to take photos of the statue and also of MBS which is on the other side of the bay. Looking back at the statue in the afternoon, the crowds had pretty much gone so it might be a good idea to schedule your visit for later in the day. It's definitely worth a visit though as one of the iconic sites of the City.

REVIEW_TITLE: Have to go for a pic
REVIEW_BODY: As a tourist u have to come here. Vast view of the Singapore river and marina bay sands. N the icon of Singapore, the merlion. U will see all the tourists here trying to get a pic with the merlion. Take a walk (or run) around the water. Passing by Fullerton bay hotel (not the old Fullerton hotel), go up to rooftop bar (called lantern) for a drink (v exp) and absorb the amazing view From there, then mbs, the helix bridge etc... nice walk here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Go on a boat cruise with family and friends and see something different
REVIEW_BODY: This place shows you something different, go on a boat cruise with your family and friends. take nice photos

REVIEW_TITLE: When we embarked on a visit to the Universal studio and trying to get to explore the place, we ended up at this park too
REVIEW_BODY: The place is quite expansive, you need like a month to visit every corner. It is a must visit for all the visitors.
great place to take picture , you will get the MBS in full view , some skyscraper surrounding Singapore
One of Singapore’s iconic sight seeing spot with many picture and video taking opportunities. Sun sets here are amazing with the super sky scrapers in the horizon!

The picture of Singapore’s Merlion is iconic and you’ll see photos of it everywhere. There is another Merlion on Sentosa Island but the original one stands by the edge of Marina Bay and is easily accessible from all three sides, with the statue itself facing out over the water. There is no charge to view it and you can spend as long as you like, mingling with all the other tourists, getting your photo shots. We sat on the steps by the water just by the side of the Merlion and drank in the views across the bay towards the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The statue is a must see of course but there are plenty more sights to see in Singapore which are more creative and inspiring. As a starting point to a walk around the Bay however it’s certainly worth seeing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Glad we went but very crowded
REVIEW_BODY:
Went as part of a city tour. Its iconic... so had to been seen. Ok for a quick photo .... but there are other things in Singapore that were more interesting for me.
There is another Merlion on Sentosa island too... you can climb up that one and ring a bell for good luck.

Singapore icon that you should visit when come to Singapore. I came here when there's Ilight festival, so it very crowded here. But the Merlion was soooo beautiful, coloured with laser light with many kind of theme. Beautiful at night, it looks like the merlion have fashion show.

REVIEW_TITLE: A place not to be missed from your itinerary.
REVIEW_BODY:
Visiting this place both in the day and in the night gives you a sense of accomplishment.
In the day you can walk along the waterfront and snap some nice souvenir pictures of the Singapore Icon, The White Merlion overflowing water splashing into the sea. Along the waterfront are food joints and drinks cafes. There are quite a nice selection of food and drinks including Seafood.
In the night, you will see a variety of beautiful colourful Merlion depicting various Singapore Places Of interest in the form of light rays shining on the Beautiful Merlion. It is definitely cooler walking along the waterfront and enjoying the night scenes around it, including getting ready your camera for some nice shots of the surrounding sceneries from the Waterfront.
Hope you have A great time there.
Ad.
Try taking weird photos with the Merlion. If you do not want to have too many ppl in your photos. Go in the early morning

The statue is part of the Bay area. We walked through the underpass from the Fullerton Hotel, to the waterside. Just a few minutes along, past a collection of restaurants with outside areas, you come to the statue. It's fun to go there and have your picture taken, especially on a sunny day!
As expected, too many people around the famous lion, and it was Sunday when we visit, but it amazed me how people are so polite, waiting for each and everyone’s turn.
Its a landmark of Singapore. So many people and the weather was hot but we managed to get some nice pics.
Walking in this town is a great experience. The park is very beautiful and the statue is "strange". It's iconic, for sure but not special in any way. The place was quite crowded.
Really enjoyed walking around and viewing beautifully decorated landscape. Merlion statue (there are 2, one small and one very big) are gorgeous.

They said if you don’t yet visit Merlion mean that you never been in Singapore. This park is good for taking picture, you can take pictures with the merlion, the marina bay, Singapore flyer, and ArtScience museum.
It’s quite hard actually to find this park, i’ve lost my way before find this. The nearest MRT station is Raffles Place, and then you need to walk pass the Fullerton Hotel.
Singapore famous statue. Lots of tourists and local people gather around here. You can also view from merlion the marina bay sands and the dome across. Great for photos and taking videos as well.
Here is the symbol of Singapore - Rio-Lion and has a nice view of Marina Bay. From here you can take great pictures and board the Singapore River cruise.

REVIEW_TITLE: Can't see what the fuss is about
REVIEW_BODY:
I read this is a great top tourist spot. Well, it's on the waterfront, have to walk past if travelling from MBS to city by foot or train
It is a fountain from lion mouth
Is lit at night
On its own

I viewed night & day
Only my viewpoint, but I just found this uneventful
The symbol of Singapore, the icon. Well, visiting Singapore and not see it is a big miss. Always crowded place with tourists seeking for taking pics and selfies
it’s actually worth walking around this park most especially at night . lights of multiple buildings are very fascinating with show and fireworks i think every weekend

The Merlion statue in this park is the best placed statue in Singapore since the backdrop would be the best scene to capture the heart of Singapore. The park is created purely for taking great pictures.

Merlion is head of lion and body of mermaid. Mascot of Singapore, first used as a symbol by Singapore for tourism. A popular spot for tourists to visit, if you don't have a plan to visit sentosa then this is the only place you will get to see Merlion.
From here you get the scenic view of Singapore river, marina bay all in one frame.

The symbol of Singapore, nobody would ever miss visting the country's emblem,not only that you could see the Merlion but also in the background a glimpse of the marina bay and the opera can also be seen here. Sights here is a wonder to behold. But this is not the only merlion that you can see. You can also see the tallest merlion in sentosa

You got to visit the iconic Merlion when you are in singapore. I was there at midnight so managed to avoid all the usual crowd. I liked it in general, you get a really nice view of the city skyline and of the garden by bays including the famous marina hotel. I would say 30 mins max is more than sufficient. If you fancy you could find the fullerton hotel just opposite the road and walk down to clark quay which looked more happening at night. Its about 15 mins walk.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing sight of Merlion overlooking the river.
REVIEW_BODY: Good place to visit suitable for couples and families. Plenty food outlets and bars. Good vibe and interesting site.
Twice I see this Merlion Park in different month and different year but it is always close. Its just annoying. Why it is always under renovation?
This is my second time to visit merlion park. You should visit here in day time and night time. Oh,yes. If you can take the ferry it will be fantastic.

The merlion is the symbol of Singapore. 'Mer' is the French word for 'sea'. It exists as well in words like 'mermaid' or 'merman'. But who is a lion from the sea? - Singapore itself! The name 'Singapore' comes from the Sanskrit 'singha': lion, and 'puri': town or city. Singapore is hence the lion city and, because it is surrounded by the sea, we can even talk of a 'merlion city'!

The place looked really great!! It was very clean although there were a lot of tourists, and the statue was really nice. The only reason why I'm giving this a 4 is because it was overcrowded. We went there twice and it was the same situation. Just shows how good a place it is. Really worth a visit.
This place is picturesque during the evening. It gets real hot and crowded during the weekends. Its really for people who needs some Facebook photo updating.

Apparently there are 5 Merlion's we sadly only visited two of them the one on the bay and the one at Santosa. Entry to the Santosa Merlion was included in our Santosa multi pass but I think single entry was about $20. Loved sitting in our Mandarin Oriental Marina Bay room watching the Merlion change colours. The display went till about 11pm each night. Nice to stroll around the bay in the cool of the evening.

It a worth a little stop here while in Singapore as it is their symbol...the Merlion. It had been covered with scaffolding and netting when we arrived (repairs?) but now is unveiled, likely timed for their new year. Very pretty in the marina area.

REVIEW_TITLE: Pleasant Little Park by the Merlion Statue
REVIEW_BODY: We stopped here for lunch at one of many lovely outdoor restaurants. In the park is a working miniature replica of the Merlion with the actual statue just beyond.
I had seen it a few years back, this time it was covered for Repairs. Spent some time on the river front. It was to open in a few days time

REVIEW_TITLE: I love the Merlion - but try to go early when it is quieter.
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion has sat in several different locations, & the area around it now is nice if very touristy.
Do go & see as part of a stroll along the Bayfront, but expect the coffees etc to be costly.
The Merlion represents Singapore & as such pretty much every tourist goes there - so choose your time carefully.

From the Flower Dome, we came to see the Merlion. As usual, it has a lot of people around trying to have the perfect shot of the water coming from the mouth of the Merlion. Really fantastic and enjoyable.
The place is full of touring coming to see Merlion. However to restaurants with beautifull see view is worth to try.
no visit is complete without visiting Merlion park. The view of marina bay is amazing. try to visit around dusk to view day and night effects around merlion.

The Merlion (half lion, half fish) is a mythical creature and the statue is one of the places to visit whilst in Singapore.
Ultra clean park looking out towards the Marina Bay Hotel.
The park gets very busy with visitors and gets very hot - not many places to shelter - take an umbrella to 'hide' under.

REVIEW_TITLE: not to be missed during ur trip
REVIEW_BODY:
this merlion park is an iconic attraction in singapore. take MRT and stop at raffles place. the view is amazing with marina bay sands, singapore flyers, the esplanade and the artscience museum all in place. the crowd is huge, so you got to have some skills to take great photos. tourist spending their time here and even picnicking by the river. there are cafes, starbucks, 7 eleven to get some snacks or drinks. we had instant noodle! the park is well maintained and good for 1 or 2-hour stroll by the waterfront.
tips: take panaroma shot to cover all attractions in one frame

Merlion Park is one of those places which you either love or detest ! Although children seem to be entertained by the figures and statues at the corner of the bridge, many people find them somewhat ugly and even grotesque.

The merlion on its own, may not be much, but add the surrounding backdrops and views, and it makes it a place not to be missed for a good photo opp.

Nice restaurants too. We visited the Pelican which had a delish menu and a nice ambience.
Great place for a nice walk and photo op. There are souvenir shops and casual eating places around the area.
One best place to take pictures as part of your memories. You can see the happy faces of people while taking their shots.

I visited this famous statue from the water while on a tour. It was extremely crowded and everyone was looking to get a photo with the Merlion, a symbol of Singapore. It was beautiful but touristy. Pics from the water looked better than others pics from the land.

This is the national icon of Singapore, located in the Merilon park in the Marina Bay. The status is Half-fish and half-lion statue. The fish part resembles Singapore's humble beginning as a fishing village and the lion head resembles the actual name of Singapore (as Singapura in Malay). The statue is facing east which is believed to bring prosperity.

The statue looks amazing at night when its glittered with light. The lights from the Singapore skyscrapers near by and marina Bay Sand hotel adds a different charm to it. You can spend hours here sitting on the park arena or on the banks of Singapore River enjoying the amazing view. The nearest metro station to Merilon Park is Raffles Place. You can take exit G and walk all the way to the park. The walk is bit long but offers some amazing views as well.

Located nearby Marina Bay Sands, this place is really worth visiting. This attraction is good for photography. The place is quite crowded with tourist and it is more advisable to visit this place in the evening as it is not so hot. There are also delicious restaurants located nearby the Merlion Park.

Located by the waterfront, we walked here after taking in the sights from across the bay at Marina Bay Sands. Iconic Merlion fountain spouting water made for a great photo opportunity, though the park did get pretty busy as others had the same idea. Good thing there is a little Merlion fountain within the park nearby, for a smaller photo op. Good for a quick visit, easily accessible, though watch the midday crowds if you want a quieter visit.
Merlion Park of Singapore is iconic city and Country of Singapore where many people gathered here mostly to taken pictures with the Merlion Statue as background.?
Symbol of singapore... i never boring to come and took photo with the lion statue.. Such amazing place with singapore icon and its free !!!
Falls in love with the night view at this park. It a must visit place for everyone who visiting Singapore.
