For all tourist, there is no fee to visit this place but its really beautiful in the night ..and there are nearby building you can see along with the park.
Best picture os across the water, from the stage. You c capture all the skycrappers together with the merlion

It’s my second time to visit this park.. and always always and always crowded.. try so hard to get the good picture without stranger join the photo Lots of people was taking picture, or just meet up with friends

Merlion as name suggests is a artificially built structure of a lions head and fish body. It keeps throwing water from its mouth which joins back the river on whose bank the structure is being built. It's a favourite among the tourists. Best time is to go early in the morning when it's not very crowded and you can click infinite pictures as people do try different postures to capture it. In the evening it's well lit and nice to watch.

When the first time i see the Merlion statue, i talk to my friends "are you sure, this is the MERLION ?" because when i see people taking a picture of this merlion, it's really look like REALLY BIG, but when you see it, it's not that BIG, i mean it's big but not as big as i think. But still you can enjoy the cafe near merlion.
The statue is on the Singapore River and open park area. Plenty of photo opportunities here. Worthwhile seeing the Merlion.

Very busy tourist attraction, but quite beautiful at night. I believe that these are not the original statues (please correct me if I'm incorrect) but it's better to see them if you know the legend behind them.
Merlion park very pretty at night. You can get great selfies here. The coolest photos in Singapore come from Merlion park.

REVIEW_TITLE: Simple and fun to take artistic photos
REVIEW_BODY: This place is just for taking photos. People creativity are at their highest here to take interesting snaps with the merlion. I would also recommend, that if you have not done the ferry in Singapore, this is a good place to take a ferry ride also and use the ferry to drop you to the other stop, so to use your time in the best manner. We used it to go to gardens by the bay, which was on the other side of the river for 6 SGD .

The emblem of Singapore-The Merlion stands out. A must Visit and a selfie is a must do with it in the background. A view of the Maria bay sands in front and teh city sky line behind makes it a favorite with photography enthusiasts. Take a walk around the park and teh old river bridges.

The Merlion is a symbol of Singapore like the Opera House to Sydney.
Every tourist must visit for a good photoshoot. It is fronting the iconic submarine above the cloud(Marina Bay Sands)
On a nice not too hot day, one can spend hours just chatting or have a drink or meal at the various Cafes, Restaurants and Bars looking at the beautiful sight of Spore's concrete jungle.
This was simply awsome at night lights amazing must see We spent ages there just Singapore we could go back another hol so much see do

Probably the main attraction of Singapore, then again, why not? The MerLion posses a great history and is a beauty of a sculpture. Don't visit Singapore and not make it to visit this attraction. You will not regret a selfie or two here. 👌

Loved everything about it. Easy to get to as we were staying in the Marina Bay Area. The park was not very crowded as it was cloudy and also because it was a weekday. Ample restaurants line the area and you can take a river taxi or bumboat for an enjoyable 45 minute ride that covers the marina bay sands hotel area, the city, Clarke quay, boat quay areas. It started to rain on our cruise but otherwise this was a perfect outing.

REVIEW_TITLE: An Icon not to be missed!
REVIEW_BODY:
There has been significant changes in Singapore landscape from the first time that I have been there 10 years ago. Too many attractions were put up and to many places worth visiting. However, for those who are first timers even those frequent goers, I think Merlion Park is something that should not be missed.

It may be an old structure there but this means a lot to Singapore as it symbolizes the lion economy of the said country!
I walked from my hotel to this attraction on a typical humid day in Singapore. Was disappointed that water was overpriced & a shaded place to sit & take in the view was unavailable.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must to see in Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY:
Just a few days with my friends in Singapore! Good city, very organize, clean and a lot of activities to do at daytime and nighttime as well.

It is worth it to see the key attraction of Merlion if you prefer walking or by boat. This is one of the icon symbols that Singapore has and from this point, you will be able to take a lot of pictures from the high buildings, the famous hotel casino Marina Sands and the other main buildings including the opera!

REVIEW_TITLE: Went there coz I just should do it (?)
REVIEW_BODY: They say you don't go to Singapore if you don't take a pic at Merlion lol. So I did. I went there around 9pm and it was better coz the Marina Bay Hotel just started its Lighting Show. Looked wonderful yet so many people there. can take bus or MRT and going by foot to reach there.
We have been here because a tour boat dropped us of here. Its nice, great view on the bay but very touristic and busy. Nice for a pic and a close look on the Merlion and than move on.

The Merlion attracts a lot of tourists, so it might be a little hard to get photos without other people in them. The view from this attraction is good, you can see the bay and the Marina Bay light show from here
Nice place, went during the day. Not to crowded, but nice. A family activity. Places to sit and eat a lunch or sit and people watch. A few restaurants along the way.

REVIEW_TITLE: A good spot to shoot some interesting pictures
REVIEW_BODY: I have been here many times and I still like to go again. A nice spot to shoot interesting pictures of Singapore city

I have been here over and over but never feel bored. This is the Singapore icon statue, crowded with visitor over all times. Hard to find spot to get clear picture of your own due to population. Well, enjoy the moments here are very nice

It's a must to get ur photo taken here when in Singapore but don't take too long as the crowd of tourists can get thick at times. Hope for a cloudy day because it can get real hot with all the bare pavement around.
We enjoy the santosa island very much We visit the beach for some beer and came with cable car to there with amazing view on Singapore ports Take a visit

I came here with my friends around 4pm, and yeah it was crowded there but there still some space to take a picture and sit comfortably on the stair... we were sitting and watching the building in front of us until they turn on the light and become very beautiful, i think it was one of the best city sunset
Bit late to take a Photo Group when we visit. But's ok. One icon from Singapore that should visit when you come to Singapore

ok, it's a large water-spitting white lion... not over-impressive but altogether ok. however, difficult to take nice side-view pix of it due to the lighting. and, of course, lots of tourists around the area. if followed by hi-tea in the nearby fullerton hotel, worth a visit nevertheless
A must visit when you go to Singapore. We went at night to see it with lights show. Many are doing photo ops but it has enough space to accommodate everyone.

This is one of the prominent places in Singapore. So expect to encounter many people here. But, there'll be no problem taking a good picture here and be sure to go to the deck (at the middle) above water to get a great picture with Merlion (from its front).
There is a big merlion and a couple of small merlions in the park. Always packed with tourists. Nice if you can walk around the area as there are special bridges nearby and a small mall.
A must do ... didn't take long but we'll worth the effort. Good views and photo opportunities. Take a river cruise too
Merlion Park will give you a view of marina bay, flyer and banks/offices. The area has lots of eatery and nice seating facility. Jus grab a place at any of these joints and enjoy the view.
The place is fun for taking pics. Generally had a great time taking pics. Area is mostly crowded with people enjoying the view as well. Great for pics.

It is Singapore's icon, the Merlion! Usually if you bring someone that never been in Singapore this is a place that they must visit to make the visit complete.

When I brought friends last February the Merlion was underworked , but they prepared the smaller Merlion on the other side.

But in general, from this place you can take all iconic pictures of Singapore like the Singapore national museum which is pretty elegant , the Fullerton hotel building, Art Science museum, OCBC center, Marina Sands hotel, etc. Because this is a huge open spaces that you can take every angle of iconic buildings in Singapore.

So if you are rush, come to this place and take all of Singapore iconic buildings !

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Stretch if Waterfront With Iconic Merlion
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion is the emblem of Singapore and this monument makes for a great photo stop. It is a very pretty fountain on perhaps one of the most picturesque stretches of waterfrontbin the city.
It has always thronged with people but don't let that put you off, it really is a very pleasant boardwalk.
It is very close to the Gardens on the Bay and Marina Bay Sands as well as the stop for the Singapore Rover Boat Cruise.
Really crowded and hot. But can a good view of all the architectures/buildings around eg. Esplanade, MBS, CBD area.
From the Merlion Park can see the floating platform, Marina Bay Sand, Singapore Flyer, Esplanade and city view. Short walking distance from Raffles Place MRT.

For the first time I come to Singapore, I have no time to see this Singapore Icon. No regret in my mind, because I know, someday I will back to Singapore and take a picture there. And..yes right! I come to Singapore again and take a many picture here. I think this place have its own charm that make you draw back there.

The Merlion is not a mythical creature entwined with local folk tales or culture. It is a cynical trademarked marketing tool of the Singapore Tourism Board first created in 1964. The best part about it may be that you are expecting it to be quite large, but in reality is no bigger than it deserves to be, and does little to block the view of the marina itself.

Many Singaporeans are quite critical of this inauthentic, artificial attempt at patriotic myth making. Personally, I think it would be best left as an understudy mascot for the Commonwealth games, in the case that one of the Bishan Otters are ill one day.

Bishan Otters. Now there is real SG symbol I can get behind.
I think it is very big but not. It takes about 15 Mins to visit. Nothing special, but the view from here is stunning.

I have been to Singapore a couple of times but last year I finally visited the fame Merlion at Merlion Park instead of crusing passed it. Nothing much to be expected except for photographic memories of visiting the Lion City. But beware the heat and huge crowd! I escaped to the souvenir store nwarby and got myself a fridge magnet for remembrance. Visit it at least once, and that would be enough. Cheers!
one of the symbols of singapore. nothing special. crowded with people. a nice place to take a photo of singapore's sky line. if you are short in time - skip it.

Know what .. you get a feeling of deja vu when you reach here .. one stands still & takes in the whole view.. Backdrop of Marina Sands.. The setting ☀️.. then the twinkling lights.. & your best friends.. what more can one ask for..walking down the street.. too.. then eating & ..
Too good to be true..
A very easy to spot place that's located near to MRT. Would advise to visit on weekday as it wont be so crowded with people.
Go at night to catch the beautiful lights that this park has to offer. Simply beautiful! Nice dining areas around as well. A must visit!

The Lion head with the mermaid body is well represented of Singapore for many years.

A touristy place and many out there to take pics of the merlion overlooking the singapore river.

Go in the evening or early morning to take pics. Less hot and more enjoyable

REVIEW_TITLE: SG trip is incomplete without the Merlion visit!
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion is a must visit, iconic fountain in the unique shape of a Merlion, flanked by awesome skyscrapers, bayside, and amazing cityscapes!

Gets super crowded with various tourist groups in the evenings, but it's supercool to be here. The area is surrounded by restaurants n Starbucks too, is a few steps away for coffee lovers
Visited Merlion Park during the day and enjoyed wonderful views of Merlion and Marina Bay Sand Hotel. This is the Singapore's mascot and it must be on your list.

Tourists everywhere with one goal! Get a cool picture or selfie with the Merlion. How can you not do this? From here you can book a bumboat river ride and that was worth it! The best thing about this park, besides the photo opp, was the toilets! There seemed to be only one, but there was never a line and it was always clean (went twice).

REVIEW_TITLE: One day travel to accompany friend's job interview
REVIEW_BODY: The weather was pretty dull that day . Our day started with rainy and by the time we were heading for sight seeing , everything was suddenly turned out perfect ! Lots of tourists mostly vietnamese and indonesians but everybody had a great day

The Merlion is a symbol of Singapore as Singapore is known as the Lion City. Although it is just a sculpture you should visit it because the area has great view of the sea and there is also a smaller Merlion and lots of restaurants nearby too. Basically you can take lots of pictures there, including the floating platform where Singapore sometimes holds its National Day there on the 9th August every year. You can also see Marina Bay Sands hotel in the background. Good place for taking pictures
We visit Merlion at Marina bay during the night because not so hot and the view look great more than day time!! No entry free! We took Mrt. get off at raffles place then walk direct to Merlion park.

REVIEW_TITLE: Wouldn't be a trip to Singapore without seeing the Merlion
REVIEW_BODY: You can take a lovely walk right along the bank to see the Merlion. Particularly nice to see as the sun sets! You don't need long here, but it is a must see!

This is jewel in the crown for Singapore success story. You need to be there to feel it. Go on, and if you 're lucky to have not so dry humid day, you will love it. Glitzy skyscrapers all around, merlion lit up.
We went to merlion park in March, unfotunately merlion statue was under construction. We came at noon so we could see the beautifull scenary of lights.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the most polular spot in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The symbol of Singapore, already moved to a new place, the original Merlion still draws a lot of people as its is around some of the best surrounding in Singapore.
The symbol of the city. You should visit the place. From here you have a nice view of Marina Sands Bay Hotel.

This is a tourist must see spot. What you see on tv or pics doesn't do justice. You must be there to see and experience the merlion. People gather around and such a festive atmosphere. No age difference all are kids at heart. Don't forget your selfie stick
It's easy to find, sitting right on Marina Bay Promenade. It's a fountain. Not much more to say than that.
i have visited this place during my tour to singapore and i have visited along with other places also. without looking this your singapore trip is not finished.
The symbol of the city! I guess that makes it a must, even though it's a funny looking little guy! Take a pic catching the water!
The best view of Marina Bay Sands.buy beer in 7/11 and just come and admire. The best before sunset and stay after sunset.

The good thing when your a tourist in singapore is you get a privilege to avail the singapore tourist pass which is consumbale for 3 days so the choice of place to visit is yours. and with this place i suggest is a must too. no merlion no singapore! the view is breathtaking! thank you for this one singapore!
With a good view, a water fountain and a few shops nearby can easily spend a couple of hours. Very clean and open. Great place for selfie photos.

We went past here by bus and by boat. Catching the boat around the harbour really gives you the best views and photos of the Merlion as the area around it seems packed with people at all times of the day
Greet place to hang out during the day ,great for taking pictures and some lovely hotels close by where you can go for a beer or tea, worth a visit in your Singapore
Nice view. Lovely place to be. A lot of tourist. Mustsee of Singapore. Hot in the summer. Enjoy the view.
Things you have to do in spore. Take so many pictures. Better to go there in the morning. Dont forget to buy ice cream sandwich singaporean classic

Must visit on a trip to Singapore. Amazing view of the skyline of Singapore with Marina Bay Sands on one end. Gets crowded during weekends. Preferably better to visit on the evening when the sun is about to set. Picturesque spot
Tourists favourite place and I think this icon is on the list of most tourists who come to Singapore as their must to visit place in Singapore.

Merlion park is mostly crowded with peoples trying to click pics in different poses.its close to flyer and marina bay so you can visit this place quickly for some pics and if you want you sit and relax in nearby restaurnets. there are also boat rides available.

Such a great spot with the Merlion sitting proudly in front of the city buildings, a great combination of views with Marina Bay Sands opposite. A great place to be for the light show at Marina Bay Sands and also see the Merlion lit up at night.

REVIEW_TITLE: Picture perfect view – The Merlion Park
REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the most visited among the tourist places in Singapore. If you are visiting, you need to take an obligatory photo in this park, for it is the most known landmark in Singapore. They create most of the souvenir items based on the merlion image, making it uniquely Singapore. Best time to go is before the sun sets, around 5-7pm. From Esplanade’s Durian shaped theatre and concert hall, there is a bridge solely constructed for the tourists to take pictures.

Did this on a guided tour, but it is somewhere that you can come and do at your own pace. And if we where to return, that is what I would do. There is lots to see and do here and we only scraped the tip. A visit to the aquarium was lovely. But as I had an elderly person with me, a few extra seats about the place would be wonderful. The Restuurant in the Aquarium gave us the opportunity to have a lovely "cup of tea". Thank you for that.

The Merlion is the icon and ideal post-card spot for anyone in Singapore. Apart from being a tourist attraction, it doesn't offer much. It's hot, humid and eateries around are over-priced. The view is great but otherwise there's nothing else it offers. Not worth a visit other than from a tourist perspective as a must do on the regimental list of attractions.
I recommend that you visit there during night time. The view is surreal because of the show. It has music with matching lights.

REVIEW_TITLE: The famous sight of the city !
REVIEW_BODY: The white lion of Singapore, which now pulls out water for the renewal of the sea, which is quite dirty. Famous shooting point for every tourist in the city, beautiful and impressive area, relatively easy access to nearby metro station ...
When you go to Singapore, it won't be valid if you didn't go here and take some pics with the half-lion-half-seahorse.

REVIEW_TITLE: Take a gondola ride to an island of adventures
REVIEW_BODY:
Take a gondola ride across the harbour and enjoy the scenery and sunshine. Merlion Park is home to many varied exhibitions to delight and mystify every member of the family. From butterflies, insects, exotic birds, 4D cinemas, arts, crafts, restaurants, the Merlion statue lookout and an aquarium that must be seen to be believed.
Every turn delivers new opportunities for fabulous selfies or group photos to build a memorable holiday album that will leave friends envious.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must see during day and/or night
REVIEW_BODY:
I like to walk here during day and night. Its cool for taking pictures and also take a look around. From here you have also a very good view to Marina Bay Sands and the bay.

Some good ideas for pictures you will find also in the internet...

REVIEW_TITLE: Packed. But worth going for some pictures
REVIEW_BODY: This place is always packed with tourists taking pictures. Best time to go is early morning. This place, and anywhere around the bay, offer great views of the marina Bay sands or the Bay.
As a landmark of Singapore, you must visit this place ,nearly with others tourist activity and recommended for a romantic trip on night view
The landmark of Singapore and one shouldn't miss it! There's a big merlion and a small one now. This place is always crowded so it's hard to get a good photo spot...

We visited this in April, lovely views across the lake , you access the merlion water feature across the jubilee bridge , it get very busy as this is a major visitor attraction, there are shops and food outlets to the right, parking is a is limited from what we could see. It was mainly coaches who dropped off and parked elsewhere. Temperatures were in the 30's so take some water.
Definitely worth a visit if you stand at the end of the landing ,take picture inline and it looks like the merlion fountain is giving you a drink, bit of fun for you photos.

The symbol of Singapore - it's a total must see when you come here. Despite the crowds, of you are patient enough, you can get a good photo. But more than that it's a great way to learn the beginnings of Singapore as a fishing village.
The famous Merlion - the symbol for Singapore tourism...it offers a good pictorial background. Do visit when around.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Place but not a must see
REVIEW_BODY: We stopped here from the Hop On Hop Off bus to see it. It is a cool thing to see but would not say a must do. Statue with water shooting out if it's mouth.
Here you can take a pict with singapore icon and spend free and relax time, they have a couples of convenience stores and fast food restaurants. But thats it 😁

This place is huge and attracts a lot of tourists. You can see people coming for evening walks/jogs. It is lovely to walk by the water with such beautiful architectures around. The picture with the Merlion is mandatory here :D

Here is the symbol of Singapore. It's referred to often, signs depict it in many places & there are even chocolates made to represent it, so it was an experiences to see it in the "Flesh". A tall statue spouting water & surrounded by crowds of people. Put it on your Bucket List. Lots of other interesting things to see within walking distance.
Visited during night time. Good Food options in vicinity Wow...Glows at Night...Good Picturesque opportunity. Night Boat Ride is good.
If you have visited Singapore but you have not visited this place, I think you are not considered as having visited Singapore.

An excellent spot for photos of the Marina Bay the Merlion in its new location looks over the Bay and is a popular stopping place for organised tours and the independent visitor.The Merlion is well looked after and looks very good in its gleaming white paint finish. There are food and drink outlets nearby and toilet facilities. Less mobile visitors need to be aware of the steps which although fairly easy to negotiate can be tricky to see the step edges. The river boat cruises also stop here and a river cruise can be started from here. The Merlion Park is generally very busy but well worth a visit. The new Jubilee Bridge (pedestrian) links with Theatres on the Bay.

Good view from the Merlion the skyline of Marina Bay..with MBS facing it.
The Fullerton Hotel is just around the corner.

Also, you can walk to the old Parliament house and Empress Place all just within walking distance. Good place to spend the morning or even the whole day. Plenty of food and shopping within walking distance and transport available...bus, mrt or just walk.
Big Merion is under contruction :( when l visit and many tourists took the pictures with small Merion. I took this time to walk around Mariona Bay, that is ok.
Another icon of Singapore.. But my advise don;t go here at sunny day (afternoon), because it's totally nice HOT.. visit it at 3 pm / night.. to prevent headache because sunny
No matter what time of day, there is always a crowd round the Merlion - it's a selfie paradise. Be prepared to be trampled under foot - but, that said, do not miss this lovely fountain.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. So, if you are visiting the city and don't see a merlion then it is not fulfilled. There nothing much there except a huge waterbody, Merlion statue and a little greenery. It is part of the city tour and you can go and get some very nice pictures with the Merlion.
My recommendation is must see.
Total difference between the day and night scenery here. The merlion is so colourful under the light at night. It worths travellers' visit.

I was there with my friend last weekend and indeed its a touristy place fully loaded with tourist with every five step you ll be blocking someone taking pictures which is quiet annoying for me in a way. Overall its a 10mins place for sight seeing and taking picture no big deal instead do spend some time looking for a skybar for night city view while sipping on margarita which is more worthy to me.

REVIEW_TITLE: Tiny statue lits up at night , entertaining
REVIEW_BODY:
They say if you haven't seen Merlion you haven't been to Singapore... Just for this reason we made sure we've come back to this small ( it can be missed easily ) statue to take photos pretending drinking water from it with a gorgeous background of Marina Sands Bay hotel ....
first we saw this half fish half lion mythical creature by the river from the boat trip we took at night . Made a mental note to walk back to it after the tour . Which we did . We walked from Clarke Quay to Merlion.... It was too busy even late at night so don't expect a photo alone with it . It's fun and entertaining to watch people trying to get a good shot of themselves trying to pretend drink from the fountain... We did the same and it was a very cool shot actually....
You're in Singapore and this is the city's symbol so you should come and take a few photos at least . There are some beautiful places to drink / eat nearby . The walk from the Clarke Quay was a lovely one too ... As it was a Saturday night it was heaving ....
we've enjoyed it and definitely recommend it...
Nice little park on the river/downtown. Great place for pics and a walk around the downtown area. Worth the time.
on May 2016, I went to Singapore, on Last day of trip, i go to Maribay to take photo with Merlion, Everyone come to take photo and share experience at there , Good view

Maybe because it was a Sunday or because it was a the last night of the iLight festival, the Merlion Park was crowed. You had to wait a few minutes to get to a spot to where you could even get a glimpse to take a photo. As it is just a photo opportunity to add to your Singapore memories, the wait was ok. There is lots to see and do along the walk around the bay. It was an enjoyable way to spend a balmy Sunday night.
It is Very Colourfull during night time..nice view,Absolutly Lovely place,defenitly will be back again..
One of THE places to see in Singapore. A must see. Great views of the Marina. Go earlier in the morning. It gets hot!

Mermaid and Lion. Thts the iconic symbol of Singapore. The experience was good. The place is not difficult to find. Raffles Place MRT Station and walk 5mins down. Theres a show where d Merlion became colourful and i enjoyed it very much. The splashes of water makes this place cooler as it most the atmosphere. Do come over and take lots of pictures. You can shoot Marina Bay sand from here too.
Merlion park is very colorful during night time and you can take a very nice view of fullerton hotel , marina bay sands and also esplanade.
it is worth to walk along the Bayside from the Merlion till Lau Pa Sat, where you can have very nice food
its the place where realize you are in singapore as its the symbol of singapore must go if you are travelling first time to singapore
If I was to pick out one photo that signifies Singapore, other than the front of Raffle Hotel, it would be Merlion Park.

Last Sunday evening, we visited Merlion, the one that near Marina Bay / Fullerton Hotel. They put three projectors that accurately projecting video at the Merlion body. So, there are some the visual effects that we can enjoy also with the back sound. It started with the visual effect that makes the Merlion hair waving. This is a good attraction after they day is started going to go dark.
Lots of festivals in the area when we were there. Very crowded. The best pictures of it were from the water taxi to escape the crowd.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the most beautiful attraction of Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: No matter what u do and where you go , Marlion is a must see during your visit in Singapore. Is the best place to enjoy the beauty of Singaporean Skyline and sea.
A must see when visiting Singapore but it's quite a short lived attraction. It's definitely for pictures only and you must arrive early or it will be filled with tourists (for that perfect photo).

When ever you visit Singgapore it's not perfect if you're not visit Merlion Park. Where you can take signature Singapore holiday picture with Marina Bay Sands in the background. With recent renovation there's a spectacular lights show on the evening and make this iconic statue more magnificent than ever!!!
You need to be quick in an atempt to snap the water from the lion appearing to come from you. There are lot of tourists, so just be patient Photo is a must
If you have been go to singapore but you didn't visit merlion you will be said that you never been go to singapore. Merlion Park is the iconic for singapore tourism

The Merlion Park is connected to public transportation (MRT, cableway, buses etc). The park is colorful and picturesque. There's a huge variety of fun activities. Joyful, colorful and a lot of fun. Alone, with friends or with family and children!
Merlion, the iconic of Singapore is here. You can see very nice view of Melina bay. There is laser and light show at night.

Nice place, easy to access and the view is magnificent when night. Near bus station, MRT station and near many famous place like garden by the bay, national galery of singapore and many more. The acces go this place is free. Thats why i like singapore, we can enjoy how beautifully singapore with free.
Renovation is ok - but if nobody works on it and it is only covered. That's not nice. But the area is still worth going and maybe the renovation was the reason for very small traffic there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cannot miss this place if you are in singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is like the icon of Singapore. Visit this place at night. The view is beautiful. The place is usually filled with tourists and locals usually. The famous Marina Bay sands is opposite to this place. Practice night photography before you visit. You can take some really nice pictures from here
You can't go to Singapore without seeing the famous Merlion fountain. This is a symbol for Singapore that represents the Lion City and connections to the sea. Beautiful park area!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view of the iconic sculpture!
REVIEW_BODY: We were in Singapore for a 10 day business trip from Houston and knew we had to see the Merlion (half lion / half mermaid) before we headed home. After taking the MRT to Raffles Place, we walked toward the Fullerton Hotel to Merlion Park and got lots of great shots of the Merlion. Highly recommend for a quick visit as you get to see the Merlion and many other landmarks at the same time, such as the Marina Bay Sands Hotel (the top looks like a ship from this vantage point). After walking around the bay, we went to the nearby mall for drinks, then took the elevator up in the Marina Bay Sands hotel to the 57th floor observation deck (see my other review).

GUTTED, the merlio was having a clean. All covered up in scafolding and sheets, so nothing to see. There is a baby merlion, but not the same. Nice views of the bay hotel from here, and nice walk into teh CBD along the waters edge. Can also get a boat ride from here, 40 mins long, but you cannot hop on hop off sadly, so we did not bother.

What a bummer, this lovely lion on its bath time, well there's nothing we can do, so my friend and I just snap some pictures around, and it's nice too, around the Lion Statue, you can find many cool and nice place to sit around, staring and admiring the river, the scenery, do some pictures taking, and we're visiting this place like 3 times in 2 days ^^ my feet kinda want to give up.

You can find the little lion in the back of the bigger one, it's not far.

At night, when we arrived, there's mini concert, well we don't know about it, but it really lift up our tired feet, thank you. we take the pictures of magnificent sparkling building, bridge, and river, so cool.

REVIEW_TITLE: A nice place to visit when in Sentosa
REVIEW_BODY: It's the alternative to the Merlion statue in the Marina Bay area. It's a nice place to check out and relax when you're in Sentosa. A nice place for sure.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great to be here at the end of Chinese New Year
REVIEW_BODY: One of many great parks around the harbour , such a picturesque setting We were inundated with Japanese tourists whilst there , who all seemed to be enjoying the park .

There is not much to see or do here but if you treat this as your starting point then walk along the waterfront to the Marina Bay Sands and visit the Art Science Museum, it is a more interesting combination. There are more food options at the bayfront and do catch the free outdoor musical laser lightshow at the bayfront boulevard steps...the skyline view is great at sunset.

REVIEW_TITLE: lions being cleaned so it can not take pictures
REVIEW_BODY: I singapore actually want to photograph in front of a statue of a lion's, but unfortunately at the moment it is in the process cleared. So I worked with friends failed to photograph in front of a statue of a lion's. but one day when I was to Singapore again, I will photograph there.
I was very much looking forward to seeing the Merlion statue, but arrived to find it shrouded in scaffolding and wrapping with signs that said "I'm taking a shower!" Nice views of the river, however.

It is the mostly visited place in Singapore, as it was known to be its icon. The place is impressive and clean. Though be careful to take a picture so near the Merlion, you might get wet as the waters go long distance especially if the weather is windy.
An icon of singapore merlion , very famous . Nice and interesting to see and also the scenery also very nice
was nice to see this in person. had an opportunity to take great photos by the structures. I felt the area was quite serene

Been visiting Singapore since young. After 40 years of visiting and finally the first time I had a close distance with Merlion :D Have a stroll from Merlion, Fullerton, National Gallery Museum to City Hall, you will discover a nice Singapore story.
Nice view of the location. But now the merlion is want to be maintanance. Somewhere in monument blackness is looking clearly.

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore landmark and popular tourist spot
REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion Park is in the Central Business District of Singapore. This is one of the most photographed landmarks in Singapore.

Located close to the Esplanade Theatre, a premier art centre and another iconic landmark of Singapore, you can get some great views of Singapore and the skyline.

The Marina Bay Sands integrated resort can be clearly seen and photographed along the Jubilee Bridge.

Whilst at the Merlion Park, do keep a look out for the little Merlion as well.

You could visit this area on your own and just explore the interesting surroundings. Many picturesque opportunities abound.

Make use of your creative imagination and snap pictures of the Merlion spouting water into your mouth or being a super man holding up the Marina Bay Sands building.

A short walk away is the 100th Starbucks store in Singapore at the Fullerton Waterboat House. It seems that this is a special store that carries certain mug designs that others do not.
It was fun to see. Actually very crowded. The mascot/symbol of Singapore. If you have time it's worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit for 1st time visit
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion park is a must visit if you are 1st time in singapore. Merlion is a half fish half lion statue. If you are in a group of 4 i am suggesting ride a taxi much cheaper than mrt.
Merlion Park is on Marina Bay and it features a number of restaurants and some of the best gardens imaginable. Take a cruise on the river; it's well worth it.

Since it is one of the tourist attractions in Singapore, the park becomes too crowded that you can't take a photo without photobombers!! LOL!! Better to visit at night so it's not very hot! Must wear comfortable clothing as this is an open area and have direct sunlight!! I thought that we will be amazed coz it is very famous that we can see in tv but will be bit disappointed because it's just like a simple park with waterfalls coming from the mouth of Merlion!!

Stopped at the merlion after getting off the hop on bus as the stop is just across a busy road. Lots of people obviously had the same idea as it was extremely busy, but a place that most people will want to see. Quite a few eating places round here too.
You need a photo here or your Singapore trip is incomplete. Other than that, nothing special. Check it out while completing the circuit of things to do at Marina Bay.

Way too many tourist, but great photop for the Marina Bay Sands background and the Esplanade. Many tourist attempt the clichè photo of Merlion spurting into their mouth. Probably the most instagram site in Singapore.
Just did a quick walk thru the area to see what was around. This is more of a tourist spot to have pictures with merlion and catch a water ferry. Nothing to special but something cool to go and see
Very popular site seeing among world tourist. In my oppinion better goes to merlion park in night time, sometimes we able to see laser dance show on marina bay from merlion park

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for photo opp but too crowded during weekends
REVIEW_BODY: Came to take photo with friends at the Merlion and marina bay sands. We came during Christmas day and it was a Sunday. Manage to take some great pics without 'extra props'. There is a Starbucks nearby to chill out after taking photos in the hot sun.

This I a great place to start a tourist day as you are in the centre of the heart of culture and attractions with the f1 track just around the corner and musiums and theatre you will need a while day to fully appreciate.
We visit this area so interesting the Merlion and sorroundings, very well conservated and they also have a duck that goes from land to water and we take nice pictures .
I always wanted to pose in front of merlion view of marina sands was amazing building behind merlion were looking great

The first thing that people relate to Singapore is the Merlion. Hence it is a must visit place if you are in Singapore. Nothing much to do other than just clicking pictures. The view is amazing at night.
Very scenic place, with a beautiful skyline of the riverfront. Marina Bay Sands, esplanade and the whole stretch of buildings can be viewed from here. A nice place for Instagram worthy kind of photo!
Traditional place to visit in Singapore. Popular attraction in SIngapore. Park was clean and good for photo shoot.

REVIEW_TITLE: Does what it says on the tin
REVIEW_BODY: Literally a lion spewing water. Great for cliche photo opportunities but not much else to do really ...

We cheered with joy when she reached the complex of the Merlion statue.
Never imagined, we can get going on a holiday in Singapore.
Clean air, comfortable city and is also the perfect place to take pictures at any angle.
Do not forget to bring tools to take pictures with the camera, enjoy your time
If you visit Singapore, you must visit the Merlion Park as this iconic Sigapore. Its very easy to get here and just take a quick picture with this in the background to share with your friends.
It was really my dream to see the lion amd mbs shopping plaza markete and flyer of singapore it os very good place to visit
One of main destination for tourists 😀😀 Spent an hour here taking pics and enjoying the view of the city. So crowded even on Monday!

You get a great touristy pic here and also nice pics of the surrounding buildings.
Unfortunately, it was a pic cloudy when we went there, but it was still beautiful.
It's full of tourists so it might take a few tries to get the perfect shot.

Just in front of Fullerton and a walk away from the Raffles station or the Marina Bay station. Lots of tourists take picture of this famous land mark. There is a lot of restaurants around if you get hungry. In front you get to see the Marina Bay sands. Very nice in the afternoon and night.

REVIEW_TITLE: The most iconic place to visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: At night, the view there is spectacular. I love it 😍.... Many tourists and even locals are there, taking beautiful photos.📸
Visiting singapore is uncomplete without seeing merlion, merlion is so big, a very good place to take a picture

It was our first night in Singapore so we just headed to the Merlion Park. I was speechless when we got there. It was amazing. Beautiful buildings and the whole park is breath taking. Has a really nice view.

Merlion,is a symbol of Singapore. Almost think of Singapore, Merlion is the first image in our mind. The Merlion does not really an animal. According to ancient records about the Merlion, it is a Imagine legendary animal. Merlion Park is the most popular place that visitors must come to see the Merlion. I remember the tour guide tell me, there are two poses people will use to take photo. First is the action look like you drink the Merlion water, it means you open your mouth and the Merlion is falling such as you are drink. Second is you holding your hand like you get the water. In Singapore, people think the Merlion’s water is golden water, if you drink and receive it , it will bring good luck for you. Do in Rome as Rome does. Try to know more other different country culture, you can enhance your knowledge.

This is a symbol in Singapore. You never told other people visit Singapore if you never visit the Merlion park. The Merlion is a head of lion and body of fish. It is strange structure but this is a symbol in Singapore. The body of fish represent Temasek. The head of lion represents the king find lion in Singapore. I recommend that you visit Merlion part around 30 minutes. The mouth of Merlion spout water. You can find a special position to take a photo. I recommend that you come to Merlion park in the night. It is because light make the Merlion become brightly. The light make the Merlion have different image. The music is pleasant. You can sit near Merlion and enjoy music. The Merlion park have a lot of restaurant. You can buy some foods or drinks. You enjoy the Merlion Park and eat some foods. It is nice experience.
I found this better at night when the Merlion and the Bay skyline are all lit up. Great place to people watch as well.

The Merlion park is along the bay and a photographers heaven. Panoramic views of the great architecture which are breathtaking. Crowded as everyone is trying to take photos of the Merlion. Be patient and you will get your chance. The restaurants along the bay are pricey. Ate at the Starbucks on the bay which was really good and in budget. Be sure to place Merlion park on your things to do in Singapore list.
A 15 minute spot to have a picture with merlion lion on your back. Took some funny pictures and enjoyed a lot with my friends.

REVIEW_TITLE: Looks big in pics. But not that big actually
REVIEW_BODY: This merlion statue looks gigantic in pics. But when I actually visited this place, I found it to be small. And not that attractive as well.
This is a great photo opportunity and the photos deliver.. However had the most tourists I've seen on this trip here..
This was also part of our morning tour to Sentosa. I'm so glad to have experienced this trip, I leave with some nice memories

Hahaha because i did the usual pose of what others used to do. We went here during daytime and nightime. Because the time has something to do with the view. Because for some they like the night view but for me i like both.
You have to be there if you got a chance to visit singapore..there are a restaurants around there in case you are hungry or tired

REVIEW_TITLE: Great spot to see the bay
REVIEW_BODY: This is where the famous Merlion is. One of Singapore's emblem. Also a great place where to sightsee Marina Bay and where to take one of the boats for a ride around the river.

Yes, this place is fully the iconic of City State Singapore. The statue is quite big and directly facing the ocean. Many tourists come and quite crowded. But to be honest its fully worth. Recommended One.
Great atmosphere, bustling with tourists taking pictures of the surrounding buildings and of course the famous Merlion statue.

REVIEW_TITLE: Have to visit the city's mascot
REVIEW_BODY: This is just a quick visit, take a photo with the lion and the great view in the back. It's central location makes it easy to then walk to Marina Bay or to stop somewhere nearby for a drink or something to eat with the lion in the background.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very touristy but the area buzzes with excitement
REVIEW_BODY: Having been during the day and evening, I think it's more dramatic going after dark. The whole waterfront area is alive with lights and people buzzing around. The Merlion statue is pretty impressive but honestly only takes a few minutes to see and appreciate before moving on to the next thing.

I went there in the night, and guess what? the view was really amazing, a lot of people sitting there and also taking picture at the same time. we can also sit near the riverside and relax either. The tower across the river makes me fall in love with the place.

The park crowded of tourists and everybody took photos of the Merlion and the spectacular views of the bay and buildings. The Merlion, spouting water into the sea, is a symbol of Singapore, and a "must see" when visiting Singapore.
Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Merlion is a Must See!
REVIEW_BODY: One of the most iconic sights in Singapore, the merlion is a must-see attraction! Lots of tourists are there all day but its a great place to see the Marina Bay area as well as the city skyline. So many selfies take here - I was even asked a few times by some groups to help take photos! Haha! Really fun place!
Singapore Icon which you have to visit when you come to Singapore. From this site you also may see other iconic place in Singapore. Nice place.

The only really great thing about Merlion Park is some pretty sweet skyline views and its proximity to 'big-city' architecture. The Merlion himself is not very big, and a little kitschy, even. Food stalls and shops near the Merlion are very expensive. If I only had less than a few days in Singapore I wouldn't go out of my way to visit him.

When it's your first time in Singapore, don't miss going to Merlion Park. The Merlion is the landmark that symbolizes Singapore. The views in this area are very nice because one can see and walk through the Esplanade Theater and the Marina Bay Sands. Would be nice to visit on a daytime and nigh time.

I'm visit the Merlion during my first trip to Singapore. Its very beautiful place to visit. This is symbolic place (Icon) of Singapore. Its very nice place from where you can view the Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Good Stop-by Choice After Dinner
REVIEW_BODY:
If you are new to Singapore, and you want to enjoy a 30-60 minutes breeze, pls consider this Merlion Park. Best in the evening to enjoy the cool breeze and city lightings.
This would be an excellent place to take very nice landmark photos of the city. Beautiful water, bridges, Singapore Flyer, skylines of the financial district, MBS & Skypark, Esplanade, and....most important of all The Merlion.
There are F&B outlets nearby too.

A nice little park in the business district. Walkable from esplanade MRT. A nice photo opportunity of marina bay Sands and of course 1 of the 7 Merlions placed around Singapore. Not am essential trip but a nice one if you have time.
If you want to see the view of Singapore, Merlion park is the best place to go. Good for picture taking. Lots of restaurants and food place to sat while enjoying the view.
ITS THE most recognized landmark of Singapore. very beautiful place. a lot of tourist posing for pics. we took a long walk around that area.

My friend and I went on our final day in Singapore to Merlion Park and I felt it was nice and something different to do, but very busy with lots of people. If you aren't good in a crowd, I don't recommend it, but if you are ok with people, then all good
If you went to Singapore and didn't see Merlion you just didn't visit Singapore. Always packed with people from all over the world and everyone waiting for the right moment for the perfect picture.

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconic Singapore must see but crowded!
REVIEW_BODY: You have to do it but go early to beat the crowds. A great photo that a lot of people take for fun is to position one of your party in the photo as if they are drinking from the fountain. It makes for a fun picture much like holding up the Pisa Tower.
It is the best place to take some photos in Singapore. Or you can walk along the river to enjoy the pure air.
I love taking pictures here specially at night. The view from if very nice. The place is self look so good .

I've been to Singapore twice but this was my first time actually visiting Merlion Park. The location was pretty and spacious, but it got pretty crowded when I visited (it was weekend). Nevertheless, the view of the Merlion was clear enough to take a photo and sightseeing. There were lots of stores and food stalls around the area too.

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome monument the symbol of singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlin is truly the symbol of Singapore , most touristy place , it a place to get photos in Singapore , awesome must visit place.
On your first visit to Singapore, Merlion park is certainly can't be missed. Come in during daytime to get a bright and clear photos, don't forget to bring your hat & sunglasses.

REVIEW_TITLE: Really cool and the views wow
REVIEW_BODY: This is a nice park. Gets very crowed! But the views from here are amazing! This is not to be missed!!

It was a nice park. I enjoyed seeing the iconic Merlion statue for the first time. There weren't as many tourists when I visited, so it wasn't very crowded. The park also has a nice view of the Marina Bay Sands and the High Flyer. I definitely recommend it.
it is like getting your photo taken outside of the White House, not all that exiting but a must do, it is the iconic Singapore photo along with standing outside of Raffles

REVIEW_TITLE: Day or night time, must see
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and he's very photogenic, both day & night. Walk here from your hotel along the river or take an organized tour.
Very nice place. Peaceful and restful walk, everything interlinks to each other. You will need comfy shoes.

The Merlion statue is in a good location around the bay, you can see it from a distance and is easy to get to. Wasn't very busy when I visited so made for some great photo opportunities.

In Summary:
When in Singapore, visit the Merlion statue!

REVIEW_TITLE: Views and food by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Iconic mystical lion head and a mermaid body feature on the edge of the river. It's symbolic of Singapore. Around the area are great restaurants and local food . A short visit is all you need.

first of all I am glad to be back at the Merlion Park the last time I came here it was under construction but today and as a further notice it is completely fixed and renovated and it's a spectacular view you get to see the weird looking Marina Bay hotel as well as the district's downtown business buildings and of course the land itself which spits out water. Definitely a must-see perfect for the early morning when it's not crowded!

REVIEW_TITLE: This is the land mark of Singapore city
REVIEW_BODY: This is the land mark of Singapore city. A beautiful and clean park. A good place to take photo and everyone knows where you are.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. The lion head and the fish fin. Every tourist who come to Singapore. Is a must to take a picture with the star.to reach there. You can take a train and alight esplanade or look out for fullerton hotel.
i love singapore and the place are super clean and perfect for holiday. so many resturant all the area and so many taxi available. we will be back in singapore soon

The Merlion, part lion and part fish, is the artificially created national icon of Singapore, and its use as a logo adorns many Singaporean products.

Merlion Park is on a small promontory in Marina Bay and Features a tall white Merlion fountain, spewing water from its mouth into the bay.

It is a popular spot for tourists to have their photograph taken as it readily identifies them as being in Singapore.

All the Singapore Pictures have this as part of the pic and not a true replica of the city.. it has so much more to offer from culture, people , food and places to visit then to just get a shot with the statue...
Cool spot there is the must visit once to have chance to visit Singapore but it was so many people and may not be able to got the nice picture at night it will be better to visit because of the heat.
Not too impressive, a lot of tourists but the view is nice. When you are in the Marina Bay Area you will see probably the most things within short time.
Merlion statue a symbols singapore,, Merlion Park is a great place, wide views there are merlion statue, big bianglala's, and MBS (marina bay sands). Recommended place for take selfie. Hehe..
We visited here for the must-see photoshoot of the iconic merlion of Singapore. The sight is also nice, with Marina Bay looming at the background. There is a nearby food stands nearby.
A walk at the Merlion Park is must for every visitor. The place is surrounded by many skyline and walk around the bay is must. The place is really beautiful.
You should go here if you travel Singapore. Take a picture with the lion! I recommend to visit at night. Do not forget to bring your umbrella if it is raining.
beautiful views Merlion worth seeing,love walk to be hac here or jusr sit and take in the views and people watch
I really enjoyed my trip to singapore, first I went to Merlion park I saw a beautiful place with beautiful view. The statue of a lion is so big, thats the icon of singapore. You shoul be there btw!
It was fun seeing the merlion near the bay. After taking pics and walking around we went to one restaurant and relax. Not bad to chill in the afternoon.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best spot to relax and enjoy the view
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park is kinda most visited place by travellers since you can see the famous Merlion statue, Marina Bay Skyway, Esplanade, and Art and Science Museum in one view. The best time to enjoy the view is before sunset, it's magic hour to take a photo and the temperature is not to hot to chill out too. And at 18.45 you will get to see a laser show there.
A true National Heritage of Singapore, well maintained, cleaned n awesome view! Once you are there it means you are in Singapore yeah!

Well it's the iconic place of singapore so undoubtedly people will go there. But I think it's just for taking photos and that's all. Nothing special other than that and it was crowded during the time I got there. I'll say its just average
This is the iconic Land Mark of Singapore. U must go to this Landmark and ist free just 10 min walk from MRT
The area is perfect for walking early in the morning or late in the afternoon. There were quite a lot of tourists taking photos, but it was still worth the visit.
You'll probably see this place while walking around the bay. One of the icons of Singapore. it's worth a brief visit.
Merlion is of course the famous statue, symbolizing Singapore, and a famous character to be photographed.
It is located in the center of town! You have nice buildings all around, and a great view for pictures! A must! if you go to Singapore!
Caught up with a friend near here recently for a coffee. It was a beautiful clear day so we took the opportunity to admire the Merlion forr a moment. Not too many people on a weekday afternoon.

If you are in Singapore, a visit to this Merlion is a must. You will get to know and see to believe. A walk along this long stretch by the Singapore Riverside and a boat ride costing around &12/- or $15/- to take in the sights in the evening will be nice (half hour ride). The financial city is thereabout including the Marina Bay areas will be good and food and transportation are easily available. Along the Riverside of this Merlion are eateries & restaurants. Lots of choices. Gourmet selection to suit your taste.

REVIEW_TITLE: Something to visit on a walk by rather than visit especially
REVIEW_BODY: Nothing more to say. It is what it is, interesting as a land mark set in an architecturally very interesting part of Singapore.

Well, it's a must visit place when travelling to Singapore. It's their #1 landmark. Although, expect to sweat a lot if you visit in the morning and afternoon. Located in an open space with nearby restos and coffee shop.
An amazing place to visit. Me and my family enjoyed the time there. The merlions sight was beautiful! :)
All time crowded with the tourist. If you are coming to Singapore, you must have a picture with it. Early morning will be less crowded.
Well, it's the town's landmark and mascot of the town. A funny looking mythical creature. a most see if you visit singapore!
It is good place to visit and the view is very beautiful of the marina bay sands hotel. The pictures clicked are very good. Good place.

REVIEW_TITLE: The views of the Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Skyline are awesome from here
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion park was nice but the views of the areas especially Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Skyline are awesome in the evening. This is a free attraction and is worth visiting but I enjoyed the views around this area more than the Merlion Park itself. Depending on how much time you have, I would say 1 hour is enough unless you want to sit by the water in the youth Olympic park near the Merlion.
Merlion Park is good place to take a good picture. The Park is very clean and there is a mini food stall

This place are hectic with tourists! It a free attraction with a nice walk around near the water. Just take your time, when you get a chance to visit then go for it but be ready with it being busy with everyone wanting to take photos of the Lion.

Remember to wear a hat/ bring an umbrella and wear sunscreen as it is hard to walk on a sunny day.
The most known place of Singapore... a must for taking ur DP.. take d photo from the Jubilee bridge to avoid d crowd..
It's been there for a long time but still draws a huge crowd all the time. Singapore's iconic Merlion is a must see as it's in the Marina bay area.
Recommend to visit this place at night (especially for tourist with jet lag), it is not hot, amazing city lights. Perfect for romantic walk.

Nobody ever should come to Singapore and completely miss, skip this monument. So much history and legendary stories attached to it. Especially the story behind the founding of Singapore, the REAL founding of Singapore (not the one where some foreign business ship come make money in Singapore in 1819). This is one for the history books, way way back in time.

Legend, true or not, this is the monument to take a photo with. All tourists must come here. It is a definitely not-to-be-skipped spot for even the locals.

And if it spits water at you, you'll be lucky for eternity.

A very romantic place. Go there at night and do not forget your camera. It is a beautiful sea view. It is becoming a singapore icon. A good place to relax and propose your heart. During august it will come alive. So do not miss it out

REVIEW_TITLE: See the Merlion...snap a pic...and move on
REVIEW_BODY: This little guy is quite popular for folks to visit when looking for an icon representing the city/state/country. The Merlion is at the end of the pier at Merlion Park...near the Fullerton hotel and across the bay from the Marina Bay Sands hotel. There are several shops and restaurants nearby for a quick bite. Good for a 5-minute stop on a walk around the bay and along boat quay.
We went on an organised tour with our friends. The view from the top of the lion was very good. However, the structure was a bit tired.
The most important place you have to be when you visit Singapore, only that, there are really a lot of tourist in this area.

I would say, this is Singapore's national attraction where one would want to visit. History of Singapore starts from here and one will also be able to learn the transformation Singapore has made dated back from the 1960s or even earlier! ✌😉

If you been to singapore; U must need to visit unless people won't believe you were in Singapore :P Its the history of the Singapore you must go there while you are in City Tour or you go personally. (city tour includes this free attraction).

A sight to see with the marina Bay and Helix bridge on the background. So many tourist even if its in the evening, late night.

While others take the MRT or taxi towards the park, we walked all the way from Marina Bay sands (after the Light show), pass thru the beautiful Helix Bridge, have a glimps of the Youth Olympic Park, walk along The Float @ Marina Bay Grand stand, pass by the Makasuntra Gluttons Bay, see the Esplanade Theatre, walk along the Jubilee Bridge to reach the Merlion Park. We did it in the evening. Go there early in the morning or evening so it wouldnt be that hot.

The Merlion Cub is just at the back of the bigger statue.
The park is located very centrally and gives you a great view over the Bay. It was quite crowded and obviously a tourist attraction.
Singapore's most iconic landmark. It was great for a photo and a good thing to see while we were there. The view of MBS is fantastic from this point. Plenty of tourists to dodge though.
This is the place is you wanna get instagram worthy pictures. Really good view and everyone takes the cliche photo of drinking the Merlion's water.

Lovely views of Singapore's lucky merlion, the Singapore flyer, financial district and the marina bay sands. There are a couple of food stands and some washrooms located behind them tucked away in the corner behind the staircase.

We were looking right and left from the hop on hop off bus but didn't see the famous scoupture, so we walked beside it. Lovely tourist attraction. I would recommend it to every visitor to go down to see it not only for the Merlion but for the whole view, and if you are there take a walk to the Anderson bridge to see something different.
A nice little stop to get coffee while coming or going to Clarke Quay and enjoying the water front..

This is probably the most seen images of Singapore’s national icon, the legendary & mythical Merlion with a body of a fish and a head of a lion. You can enjoy its full beauty of this legend at Merlion Park. Spouting sea water from its mouth, the Merlion statue stands proud at about 8.6 metres.
A trip to Singapore is never complete without trying to compose a picture of water coming out of your mouth at this tourist site.

Lovely setting around Marina Bay, Boardwalk from Marina Bay side to Merlion Park. Plenty of Cafes plus fine dining restaurants. See the large lion spouting water. You can either walk or catch a water ferry from one side to the other.
It is such a lovely walk along the riverside to the park. Also, Merlion is an iconic for tourist. It is the place to take a good photo with Marina bay building as well.

Just a stunning area of Singapore to visit! Clean, beautiful, creative. Picture perfect wherever you look. I wish we'd had more time to stroll around, but if you're short of time in Singapore (we only had a day while on a cruise), this area allows you to see quite a lot of Singapores beautiful attractions. Hope to return one day when I have more time!

if you wish to enjoy the beauty of the "mermaidlion" you have to be there early in the morning or late in the afternoon because of the heat of the sun. there are 2 statues, one is spitting water and the smaller one is not.

Nothing much but you are in Singapore, at least you've got to see the Merlion once. Take a photo with the Merlion, enjoy your casual walk on a beautiful pavement, sightseeing or simply chilling. I do enjoy casual walk here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Hot like hell during day time
REVIEW_BODY:
This area is always crowded with people all around the world. Most of them ecspecially Chinese from China come in group and always walk together in group.
It's difficult to walk when everybody want to stay near to their group member and don't give us space to walk. Traffic jammed everywhere. Crazily hot weather made me tension. I should go again during night next time !

Merlion Park is one of the most famous place in Singapore. We went to this place because wanted to take a picture of it. We were there for 2 hours from 17.00 to 19.00. Taking picture when the sun is setting is the best.

This place is always crowded with people, so prepare your self.

REVIEW_TITLE: Our first time at Merlion Park.
REVIEW_BODY: Such a busy place with tours all the time. It is a very clean area (as is all of Singapore). Have to wait to get the perfect shot of the Merlion. Or a selfie with the Merlion. There is also baby Merlion in this area. There are eateries around this spot. Also gift shop.
U should go here if come to sin, this is the icon. But poor me when im comin to merlion its rainy and to many people around, hard to take a good pose with the lion ,, lol
The Merlion Park, the land mark of Singapore, is so amazing even though the weather is so hot in the daytime. But in the nighttime it's so beautiful. i love it !
Every people come to Singapore will visit this Merlion Park. Located in the CBD near Fullerton Hotel, Merlion Park is easy access by MRT Raffles Place. From MRT, just follow the direction.
One of the best places in Singapore .. because here we can take pictures with a variety of backgrounds, from Marina Bay, the Singapore Flyer, Esplanade, and much more ..
Visited the merlion and seen the views. at sentosa island. you will see many merlions around singapore
Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and all visitors end up here to take photos with the city as a backdrop.

REVIEW_TITLE: Curious to see what the Merlion is all about...
REVIEW_BODY: The area at Marina Bay and 1 Fullerton is lovely, and I visited the bay because of the captivating night lights and high rise buildings surrounding the bay. When at 1 Fullerton, one is bound to see Singapore's symbol- the Merlion located beautifully by the promenade and spitting water into the bay. Other than this- there's nothing special to the Merlion in particular, however it's worth seeing the symbol of Singapore just to put that tick in one's own "to do" book!
Merlion means Singapore! Truely amazing place. Almost all travel agencies display this in add or magazine. Actually its smaller than expected from photos.

A must to go take photo if you are first time in Singapore. Take with the Merlion and your backdrop will be the iconic Marina Bay Sand Casino.... If evening time, bring a good camera... Sometime you will see beautiful firework or laser show from MBS.

Lots and lots of pubs and restaurants... Spend your tire day there with your friends. After dinner, go drinking... No need to waste time hop around...
You never been to Singapore if you never come here. An iconic place to take some good photos. View from here is excellent and the night view is awsome.
It is the symbol of Singapore and for sure that many tourists came here to check in they are in Singapore already. Nothing special, just a statue. I didn't even take any photos at this place.
Fantastic place to visit very much a big historic land mark. A must to visit seems allways very busy with people takeing pictures. Lovely walk at the side of the water and over the bridge.
Absolutely beautiful-especially at the sunrise. Be there in the early morning to get a perfect shot. It has great choices for places of interest.
What's a Merlion? Half mermaid, half lion... Pretty pointless park. There are way better natural parks all around Singapore without these stupid statues.
The big lion statue has a waterfall and light on its, all day before 8pm. So check your time to visit to get the best photo
It's a nice place where you can see all symbols of Singapore at the harbour including the most beautiful Merlion statue, Marina, Esplanade theatre, Singapore flyer.
the most city attraction that have to visit when you are in singapore for the first time. wajib banget punya foto di the merlion ini. the symbol of Singapore

Singapore's famous city emblem is a tourist hot spot - worth seeing, but not worth lingering long - take your photo, then go and explore somewhere else. If part of a tour expect chaotic disembarkation/reboarding with a very limited time slot at the Starbucks across the highway.
Nothing Speacial, yea its of of Singapore's icon so just stop here - take a photo and go somewhere after that....

REVIEW_TITLE: I love that half a mermaid is the official symbol of Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: Easy to access via MRT. You've got to see this up close. Half mermaid, half lion; merlion. It sprays water out its mouth and it's apparently a thing to try appear to be drinking the merlion fountain in photos so you get heaps of people posing awkwardly with their mouths open. It's almost more entertaining than the merlion itself!

REVIEW_TITLE: With amazing view of Marina Bay Sands
REVIEW_BODY: A little bit crowded especially at night but still worth the visit. You can watch from here the light show in the promenade. We did not walk from the Marina Bay Sands because our legs were really tired but you can take a taxi, just a few minutes ride.

Its a long walk from marina bay sands but once you decide to walk you will pass by few more tourist attraction on the way place is crowded during weekend especially for tourist. Nice view this is one if the famous land mark of Singapore

Despite the hype, I would not say it is a place so awesome to visit. Yes, it is an iconic statue of Singapore tourism, and the scenery is great, but when you are there, it would likely be: "Oh, is that it? Okay... what's next?"
Quite a walk from any MRT to get there, especially if it is a hot day. Nonetheless, it is not as if it is a BAD place. It is just that, you don't have to be overly excited about it.

It was a quick visit in this Singapore Merlion ,we had great time taking photos and just happen there we met a newly friend my countrypeople from Philippines we had a great share of talking feels like a an old friend indeed we just met there.. Merlion Singapore reminds me of my very good friend in Cagayan Philippines...
I used to live here for many years so seeing the Merlion again was like seeing an old friend. I love the area they have built up around it now. It makes it fun for both old and young.
It is only a short walk from Fullerton Hotel but the sights of important landmarks fill me with awe. The place was full of merrymakers and activity.

This is iconic of Singapore, a place for all tourist and I do think that this is one of the best place to represent Singapore. So I will bring my guest here to at least visit this Merlion, with that in photos, everyone will definitely know where you are

No visit to Singapore is complete without visiting the Merlion and taking a photograph with the face of Singapore Tourism.

Always crowded. The best place to visit in during sunset. The view of Marina Bay Sands from the Merlion is amazing. Lots of places to eat around the Merlion Park

This is a significant part of Singapore. It is easily accessible by MRT or public transport. A lovely place for an early morning or evening walk. If possible, try to avoid noon time due to the scorching heat.

Too many people come here, so a litlle bit difficult to take a personal photo. But there are many other attractions can be reached from here. There are raffles site, the asian civilisation museum, and many other. Do not forget to bring hat or umbrella, it is always hot here.

Quite filled with tourists but worth a walk through, we did so as we were walking to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and The Gardens by the Bay. We missed the Light show, which we've heard is worth a look, I'd say to visit at night time when everywhere is lit up, far more pretty!
A visit to Singapore is not complete without taking a picture with the Merlion statue. There are many uncles selling ice cream on a hot day. Some cafes nearby also can be relaxing.

Marlin Park
is situated in the business district of Singapore.
This is generally part of Singapore city tour, you can directly come here as this is the main and only attraction of the city tour.

This is a picture perfect place with lots of skyscrapers at the background you can click some beautiful pictures.

Nearby is Orchard road, which is a shoppers paradise.

This place would not take much of your time and is in the must see category
The landmark! Should visit if you have time. Lots of tourists, though. Pretty sunny because it is an outdoor spot. Don't forget your sunglasses and sun screen cream.

We did not make it over to the Merlion Park on our first visit a year ago. I must say after being sure to include it on our second visit, we missed nothing but tourist hype!

Stop by if in the area, but don't go out of the way.
Only thing to see there is a statue, there's nothing fancy about it. Tourists come here only because its a known place in Singapore.
Great place to visit when in Singapore - plenty to see and do .. The Merlion is spectacular... a good day out

I came to Merlion Park as of the first day of my visit (ever) to Singapore. I was very impressed. It was a Saturday, but still not too crowded, just enough to feel you're in the right place. The views over Marina Bay Sands and the neighborhood is spectacular. The walk by the riverside is truly amazing and peaceful and you will want to stop many times to enjoy the different views of the Marina.
Tip: at 11 p.m. (maybe other times to) there is a light show from Marina Bay Sands which is beautiful to watch.

REVIEW_TITLE: landmark of Singapore, but not special
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion park is mostly very crowded as it is considered a landmark of Singapore. Therefore the only thing you can find there are busy tourists taking a lot of photos. Not so special at all.
This is Singapore.The symbol.A nice area to hang around.Lots of people.Good to come here in the evenings.A photo to say in Singapore.

Beware. There are lots of people taking pictures here. It's quite difficult to get a nice spot .

But if you do, it's one of those postcard-perfect places aside from The Marina Bay Sands.

It's better to be here at night as it can get quite hot in Singapore even when the weather is cloudy.
Just one word ... Felt like a kid again when I visited Candyland and then not to mention Universal studios ..one of a kind and Amazing ... Will let the photos do the talking 😄
Everybody recognize this! Merlion Park with sculpture is very popular. You have to take a photo with it.

Went there in groups. It sure gives spectacular view. Overcrowd of tourists and sure is hot af and there is limited place to chill. But overall it is good place for sightseeing and take beautiful photos. Basically it represents Singapore, a small country but neat, beautiful and well planned. Every directions from Merlion Park you can see beautiful skyscrapers from perfect angles. It really shows how Singapore tourism has grown into one of Singapore biggest turf.
One of the places you should come to. A bit crowded with tourists but it's ok. Have many cafe surround it. Also you can take ferry by the river.
Nothing to see but the merlion statue spitting water. There are much better things to see in singapore than this statue.

REVIEW_TITLE: Can we change our city icon?
REVIEW_BODY: Paris has the Eiffel Tower, New York has the Statue of Liberty, San Francisco has the Golden Gate Bridge, and Singapore's icon is the Merlion? Can't we have something better? It is an icon created by the Tourism Board, and told as though the Merlion is one of Singapore's legends (it is not). I feel strange whenever I see tourists trying to get their pictures taken with the Merlion. I doubt it is because they find it beautiful, but they've got to show their friends they've been to Singapore. While the Merlion is nothing special, the little park offers amazing views of the city skyline. Whether in the daytime or at night when the lights are all turned on (I prefer the night view), the scenery is beautiful. Singapore is indeed a very beautiful city.

For this place you need atleast one whole day as many attractions are available. The cable car ride with luge is a great attraction. The Merlion looks so majestic. Free train and bus is available to visit other attraction like dolphin show and aquarium.

the best place to see Singapore . the heart of singapore i guess . this plase is always crowd usually for the tourist to have a best photo to bring back their country and Singapore believe the water that come out from the merlion mouth its bring luck and long life . night view is more romantic . but for me i prefer on the day time even its hot , but we still enjoy it .

Before I know Singapore, I have already learned about the Merlion. A mythical creature with a lion's head and a body of a fish. Since, I was young I have dreamed of visiting it. Fast forward to last January 2016, my dream finally came true. I walk for almost half hour to see it face to face. It did not disappoint me. It is well taken cared of. Still so white. Many tourist like me flock to the merlion for a selfie. Located in front of Marina bay Sands. You will have a beautiful sight of the bay, the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. It is very clean. Accessible through SMRT Marina Bay Sands Line. You just need to have a long walk to arrive at the very place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing park and views in the middle of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Go for the views and the photo opportunities, but make sure to walk the bridges on either side of the reservoir for one wow vantage point after another.
Who ever come to Singapore if not going to see the Merlion is feelings not been to Singapore. The legend symbol of Singapore so cute and lovely. And can walking along the river, so windy, so fresh.

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting because of the historical significance but way too touristy and crowded!!
