REVIEW_BODY: Interesting because of the historical significance but way too touristy and crowded!! Just packed with tourists taking pics ... I know the Merlion is a symbol of Singapore but it is just not that impressive looking ... especially not with the crowd around it.
Nice place to relax and take photos, Very touristy area. Enjoyed the couple of hours that we had in this area
a great statue of Lion, the symbol of singapore, great place for taking some photos here, and you can visit here 24 hours. a day for great photos and night for great city landscape views.

If you go to singapore you have to go here. I think its not valid if you dont take your picture here ..hahahaaa Its nice .. the view of marina bay sands, singapore flyer, esplanade. Everyone went here 😊

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit the iconic Merlion statue
REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore and not gone to Merlion park, than probably you will get the feeling that your Singapore tour is incomplete. The Singapore always has been represented by the iconic Merlion statue and it is everybody's fantasy to go to Merlion whenever they go to Singapore. So when i visited Singapore my first spot was Merlion. Located near the financial hotspot and Fullerton hotel, the iconic statue overlooks the Marina bay and attracts almost every tourist visiting Singapore. You can see people taking photographs from almost every corner to capture this emblem representing Singapore. Visiting the place will surely give you the feeling that yes you are in Singapore. During the afternoon time when i had visited the spot, it was so hot, so i will probably suggest people to visit either early morning or in the evening. But a must go spot.

I will say you should paid a short visit to this place to view this magnificent structure at night time as all the lighting effect really are wonderful to watch. you be able to take photos and sit near to the sea side to enjoy the view of part of Singapore.
Be prepare if you go there during summer or a sunny day. Outdoor place to catch fresh air and relax your day.

Bar none the most crowded spot in Singapore. The Iconic Merlion draws immense crowds at all hours of the day and night, each with aspirations to snap a shot of themselves with either the beast or the amazing skylines. That being said you really need to stop by - this is one of those spots that earns it's stripes!
Too crowded for great photo. But it is a must-visit in Singapore. Food is very much overpriced thro :( I spent 15SGD for a hot dog and soda.
I think it is made for people with kids.. It is like an amusementpark but nothing happens? Everything is fake and plastic and it just feels like nothing..? Or maybe i just dont get it?

We visited this place on 11th February 2016. Its a very nice and a lovely place. We could spend about 30 minutes here. The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore.

The Merlion Park is located in front of The Fullerton Hotel. The Merlion is a combination of Fish boday and Lion Head. The fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village when it was called as "sea town" . The lion head represents Singapore's original name—Singapura—meaning "lion city. The Merlion is female.

Merlion Park, a Landmark of Singapore is a major Tourist attraction at One Fullerton, Singapore. Its a must visit place for all the tourists.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cute, but dont go out of your way
REVIEW_BODY: U can seet his from a cross the bay or up close. Nothing g special about it except that it's an iconic symbol of Singapore. The small, mosaic statue nearby is more interesting. Expect lots of people crowding it

REVIEW_TITLE: Main sight to see in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The merlion has become the iconic symbol of Singapore. Great views from there of the Marina Bay area.
They've moved this from the mouth of the river because they built a casino. They have spoilt it all I'm afraid

If you visit SG, Merlion is a must. One of the great landmarks in Singapore. The park itself is very clean and has nice view. Needless to say lot of pictures with Merlion are a must. Expect lot of crowd always, so you will need to find a good place for taking pics.
Great place for you to relax. With the view of Marina Bay San and Merlion, it is a great combination. You can enjoy nice weather and nice view from here.
A must thing to do when you are in singapore... Best time to visit in evening... Take a boat ride in the singapore river and see the view of Merlion park..
The skyline is beautiful esp with the bay against the backdrop.. Really ideal for pictures or just relaxing, and as usual, like any place in SG, very meticulously kept
This statue is a iconic of singapore and if you go to singapore..everybody always go there.well..it's just as usual statue..nothing special but it's always crowded here
If your in Singapore this is an absolute must. Great place to see the city all around you as well as take some life memory shots. You will love the view.

I came in the morning and it crowded already lol. everyone wanna take a snapshot of merlion. so it's just automatically queueing. to the merlion i took bus from boonkeng bus stop since my hostel is located in lavender. over all this iconic place is very good. near every famous places just like esplanade and marina bay.
You can't skip this place if this is your first trip in Singapore. Merlion statue is icon of Singapore. You can take a photo with Merlion park and Marina Bay Sands in the background.

A must see for any visitor to Singapore. It is of historical significance and also interesting for the obvious tourist attraction. The photo opportunities in this area abound and are almost unlimited.
This is beautiful place to spend evening in Singapore. It is such a nice and peace full place where you can spend full evening and can enjoy laser show of marina bay at 08:00 hrs.

Ambience is awesome, laser show and music is too good. River boat is value for money.
Merlion statue is also OK, nothing much special. But, place is full of tourists so, it makes it a happening place. Street food or food chain restaurants should be there.
it is very nice to come here specially during sunset. because you will see the beautiful scenery of the merlion with the marina bay and lights.these view is enhance by the color of the setting sun.

REVIEW_TITLE: good experience and explore singapore is the place i go because of the cleanliness organize honest people good service
REVIEW_BODY: good experience to explore Singapore is the best part of our travel with my friends organize and honest people.

Your SG visit won't be complete without taking a picture of/with the Merlion. There will be lot's of people who have the same goal as you so make sure to strike a pose and click the button really fast so no one will photobomb you :)

The Merlion is a art piece in itself, without even counting the location in which it looks over. The Merlion sits comfortably overlooking the Marina Bay, the Sands in the foreground and city scrappers in the background. As the keeper of the city's wealth, the Merlion is a wonderful sculpture to check out. It looks so beautiful also in the night light.
Great area to sit and relax, have lunch or go for a walk and take in sights of singapore. All connected to the marina bay walk, so you can do the flyer, marina bay and merlion all together :)

Definitely a must-see as you walk along the Marina. But keep in mind all the other tourists are there too, so it is very crowded. Try to go early, or at night as it is really nice with the city all lit-up in the background.

Merlion park is a cool little area of the city. It is congested with tourists however and the shops and restaurants in the vicinity are overpriced. We visited on a pleasant day and the statue makes for a good photo opportunity, but that is about it. Seems like one of those things you do while in Singapore- but don't be heartbroken if you miss it.

Set overlooking Marina Bay, the Merlion is a must see for all visitors to Singapore. The statue was relocated to its current position sometime ago so that visitors could see it more readily. There is plenty of viewpoints nearby. While you are there visit Singapore's 100th Starbucks store which is located near the Fullarton Hotel. Recommended.

This merlion park is good. When we come here we can make a picture like we drink a water. Many people do this with happiness. If you are here, you can see marina bay sands and also singapore flying too

REVIEW_TITLE: The place you need to go when you come to Singapore :)
REVIEW_BODY: It was a great place to visit, but there'll be lots of tourists there. It may be a bit hard to find the right angle to take a photo without them, you just need to be real quick. lol
Looks really nice but don't imagine that you will be able to spend more then 30min here, it's basically a statue surrounded by hotels.
You can never leave singapore before visiting this! Merlion is located at the downtown area. enjoy a peaceful walk from merlion to esplanade to marina bay sands!

This should be part of any walkabout itineraries in Singapore for first timers. In this general area, one gets a feel of the city as a business hub that is also an Asian tourist attraction. The Merlion is an iconic figure, depicted in countless souvenirs and imageries related to Singapore, and at least you can say you've visited at least one (of the two) Merlion statues.

But you can give it a miss if pressed for time, or if it's not your first time in the garden city.
It's the iconc symbol of Singapore, many tourist struggle for a picture nearby, but it worths a visit only if you consider it as a stop over during the 3.2 km walk around the Marina Bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: See the city waterfront both in the day and at night
REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion Park is a must-see for all first-time visitors. A popular attraction for locals and visitors, it is near the Marina Bay Sands Resort, Fullerton Hotel, Esplanade, making it very accessible. One can chill out with a good but relatively expensive afternoon tea in the hotels nearby, and check out the various restaurants for dinner and take a stroll along the entire stretch and even check out the Waterfront Promenade.
When you come to Singapore, where is the 1st place you want to go??? That's is Merlion, this connection with the legend of Singapore. Free place and nice view.
One of must visit attractions in Singapore since it is represent Singapore: Lion sea. Recommended to go there between 7.00pm - 10.00pm. Because they got laser and music show at 8.00pm and 9.30pm.

This Merlion represent Singapore, best time to visit this place is in evening, You can witness the beauty of Singapore coming into lights, couple of hours in the evening in this place can take off all the tiredness.....
In this area, this spot had the most tourist and people taking pictures nonstop. If you are travelling from afar why not stop by here as well. Personally I felt okok only
Brought my German friend who has never been to Singapore before here at night and to our disappointment there was scaffolding around the Merlion. So the pictures he took were not very nice.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit after all its one of the symbol of Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: Evening is the best time to visit. The crowd is awesome all the running groups were around and you will feel health conscious by just having a look at them.
Please visit this place in the evening. Not so hot. Singapore skyline is beautiful especially at night time.
Mandatory shot happens here. Try to take shots during the afternoon and at night; the overall effect differs.
good place to visit as there's a beautiful view of the bay and marina bay sands. but unfortunately its always very crowded so be prepared for that and it will be pretty hard to take pictures there.

This iconic merlion is very famous and well known for every tourists. You can take the picture at this iconic merlion. Specially if u hang around at night, it has beautiful view with lights from the buildings around
good place clean singapore is very good place ti self lion stachu of singapore is it self good plce must go and see all city with this stachu

This is the iconic place of Singapore. If you come to singapore and don't have yourself clicked with the Merlion then no one would believe that you had seen all of singapore. This place is a one time visit. Only good for clicking pictures nothing great here. According to me, it's the most hyped place in Singapore to attract the tourists. Nice place to watch Marina Bay Sands and Singapore skyline at night.
The Merlion is a small statue, but with lots of tourists. Easy access by bus. After seeing the Merlion, you may walk to visit some historical buildings nearby this park.

Very nice park with a large viewing platform to observe the Merlion. Within walking distance from CBD and Chinatown. We walked there along the river front - one can also view the park from a river cruise boat.
Cheers Niels & Mary, Humpty Doo, NT, Australia, Down Under
